baron denbigh knight moſt noble order garter saint michaell one hir maiesties moste honourable priuie counſell maiſter hir horſſe good acceptatiō summarie dedicated lordſhip fiue yeares ſince right honorable ſingular good lord hathe ſo emboldened treatiſe growne greater volume preſumeth aſſured hope like acceptance preſent ſelfe honor vnder protectiō therof venture world viewe men boldly historical diſcourſe oure natiue countrie ſetting eye instruction profite incredible inconſtancie continuall alteration tranſitorie world wyth worthie exploites king gouernors haue performed herein common commoditie ſearching truth varietie worthy matter haue recouered ſmall coste care graue obliuion wherein haue laine buried referre honorable cenſure indifferent reader doubting lordſhip whiche hath gotten grounded experience administration weighty affaire furniſhed wiſedome wyth diligent reading ſundrie history bothe vouche ſafe accepte monument affectionate minde wonted curteſie ſhield vnder autoritie name thoſe whiche age requite honest endeuours vnhonest ſpeeches almighty god preſerue honor continual encreaſe benefit glory aduauncement lordſhips moſt humble commaund iohn stow ¶ gentle reader amongst bookes learned age publiſhed great number eyther honestie matter commoditie bring common wealth pleaſantneſſe ſtudie reading preferred chronicle hystories example men deſeruing immortalitie exploites worthy great renowne vertuous liuing posteritie embraced wiſe handling weighty affaire diligently marked aptly applied incouragement nobilitie noble feates diſcouragement vnnaturall ſubiects wicked treaſons pernitious rebellion damnable doctrine conclude perſwaſion honestie godlyneſſe vertue ſorts diſſuaſions contrary plentifully found hard matter reader chronicle fanſie paſſe without ſome colour wiſedome inuitements vertue loathing naughtie factes welfauoured man walke vp downe hot parching sunne therewith ſunburned therefore long ſtudie earneſt good great costes charge haue brought hidden history duskie darkeneſſe ſight world haue bin diligent obſeruers common wealthes noted posteritie fleeting manner people accident time deſerue leaſt thankes paine miſreported none ſeeing haue laboured fornote backebiter ſlayeth three himſelf ovvne malice hym crediteth hys falſe tale backebiteth write complayne ſome men ingratitude towardes although iustly might ſhewe commodity enſue reading history ſeeing ſo great ſo many men would ought imploy diligence honeſt fruitefull delectable peruſing ſame ſo accompt author men carefull countrey confeſſe neede require whome haue taken profite ſeuentene yeres ſince ſeing confuſe order late engliſh chronicle ignorant handling auntient affaire leauing myne owne peculiar gaines conſecrated ſelfe ſearch famous antiquity haue done time former edition summarie chronicle maye wel testifie howe farre ſpoken without arrogancie haue laboured truth thā ſome laſt edition wil euidently declare wherein differ inordinate vnskilful collection men maruel ſeeing doe fully agree ſelfe ſome malitious perſons haue fondely charged lette conſidered nothing perfect first incident mankinde erre ſlippe ſometime onelye point fantasticall fooles perſeuer continue error wherfore ſeeing peruſing auncient record best approued history time without great difficultie obteined doe onely moue aucthoritie driue acknowledge mine men error acknowledging correct truste obtaine thus muche handes leaste wil call remembraunce moste gentle wiſe lawe politike perſians wherein enacted man accuſed bee lawes trespaſſer founde guiltie crime ſhould ſtraight waye bee condemned diligent enquirie ſearche whole life conuerſation ſlaunder imputed vnto importaunce number laudable factes didde counteruaile contrarie full quit trespaſſe ſame lawe wiſhe reader theſe chronicle put vre error ſo plentiful history truely alleadged wil beare promiſed ſo haue tried matter worthie immortalitie certaine touchstone best allowed historiographer yet notwithstanding ſome fault misprinting haue eſcaped correction whiche eaſily may ſeene amended diligent reader ❧ briefe deſcription englande scotlande vvales cornvvall britaine brutanne two name called england scotland ilande ocean sea ſcituate right ouer againſt france one parte iſle engliſhmen inhabite another parte scottes thirde parte walſhmē fourth part corniſhmen eyther language condition lawes differ among themſelues england ſo called engliſhmen whiche winne ſame greateſt parte diuided xl countiesxl county shire call shire whereof ten ſay kent suſſex surrey southampton barkeſhire wiltſhire dorſetſhire somerſetſhire deuonſhire cornwal doe conteyne ye firſt part iland part bounding toward south ſtandeth betwéene thames sea thence riuer trent paſſeth middeſt england xvj ſhyres wherof firſt ſixe ſtā ding eaſtward eſſex middleſex hartfordſhire suffolk northfolke cambridgeſhire ten whiche ſtande middle country theſe bedforde huntingdon buckingham oxforde northampton rutland leiceſter notingham warwike lincolne theſe vj border weſtwarde vppon wale glouceſter hereford worceſter shropſhire stafford cheſter monmouth middle region lie darbiſhire yorkſhire lancaſhire cumberlande left hand toward weſt weſtmerland againſt ſame biſhoppricke durham northumberlande whiche boundeth vpon north march scotland theſe ſhyres diuided xxij biſhoprikes gréeke worke called dioceſes whiche dioceſes canterburie hath kent rocheſter hath part kent london hath eſſex middleſex part hartford chicheſter hath suſſex wincheſter hath hampſhire surrey iſle wight saliſburie hath barkeſhire wiltſhire exceter hath deuonſhire cornwal bath welles hath sommerſetſhire worceſter hathe worceſterſhire parte warwickſhire glouceſter hath glouceſterſhire hereforde hath part shropſhyre herefordſhyre couentrie lichfield hath staffordſhyre darbiſhire part warwickſhyre part shropſhyre lincolne greteſt lying betwéene thames humbre hath lincolne leyceſter huntington bedforde buckingham reſidue hartfordſhire ely hath cantabridgeſhire iſle ely norwich hath suffolke▪ northfolke part cantabridgeſhyre oxforde hath oxfordeſhire peterborow hath northamptonſhire rutlande briſtowe hath dorſetſhire prouince archbiſhop canterburie whych primate england wyth wale archbiſhop yorke hath yorkeſhire notinghamſhire piece lancaſhire biſhop durhā hath biſhoprike ſo commonly called northumberlande cheſter hath cheſſhire moſt part lancaſhire richmonde part flintſhire part denbighſhire carlile conteyneth cumberlande weſtmerlande thys prouince archbiſhoppe yorke whiche another primate england long time alſo primate al scotland theſe dioceſes take name city thoſe sea placed chiefe whereof london▪ beginning archbiſhops sea afterwards tranſpoſed canterbury cittie kente placed ſoyle amiable pleaſaunt london ſtandeth middleſex northe ſide thames moſt excellent goodly riuer hath firſt name iſe beginneth coteſwolde gloceſterſhire mile titbery much high waye called froſſe taketh firſte name tamiſ • néere dorceſter bridge riuer tame forſayde iſe méete ſo maruellous quiet courſe paſſeth london breaketh french ocean maine tydes whiche twice xxiiij houres ſpace doeth ebbe flow lx myles great commoditie trauellers whiche kindes marchandice eaſilye conueyed london principal ſtore ſtaple al cōmodities within realm upō ye ſame riuer placed ſtonelōdon bridge bridge work rare maruellous bridge hath reckning ye draw bridge xx arch made fourſquare ſtone height lx foote bredth xxx foote diſtant one frō another xx foote compacte ioyned togither vault cellers uppon ſides houſes builded ſéemeth rather continual ſtréete bridge oceā ſea doth bound england firſt part brytaine eaſt south wale cornwal weſt riuer twede deuideth england scotland north length iland beginneth portſmouth ye south parte endeth twede north contayning 320 myles thys realme aboue moſte fruitefull thys ſyde humbre beyonde fuller mountaines althoughe beholder countrey farre maye ſéeme playne yet full manye hilles thoſe moſte parte voyde trées valleyes whereof verye delectable inhabited moſte part noble men according auntiente old order▪ deſire dwel city neare vnto valleyes riuers ſeuerall village auoyding vehement windes bicauſe iland naturally ſtormie humbre hath beginning little ſide yorke runneth southward holdeth courſe eaſtward ſo maine sea greatlye encreaſed riuers dune trent trent beginneth little stafforde running darbiſhyre leiceſterſhire paſſing litchfielde notingham ye right hand dune left hād ſo thoſe riuers make ileland whiche called auxolme ioyning togither ſide kingſtone vpon hul goodly marchaunt towne fall humbre whiche riuer may ariue fraunce germanie denmarke england fruitefull beaſtes aboundeth cattel wherby inhabitant rather moſt part graſiers plowman bycauſe giue themſelues féeding tillage almoſte third part countrey employed cattell déere red fallowe gotes wherof ſtore north part cony euery iolly maintenaunce thoſe kindes beaſtes bycauſe full great wood ryſeth paſtime hunting gretly exerciſed ſpecially nobilitie gentleman andrew bourd ſayth moeandrevv bord parkes england europe beſide scotland part brytain wherof place iscotland haue thought good treate large mentiō ſituation therof might made hereafter began ſometime hill called grampius nowe called grantſbeyn ſtretching furtheſt coaſte northwarde ouerthrowe pictes began riuer twede▪ ſometimes riuer tyne fortune warres altering ſame doth al thing therfore length scotland twede furtheſt coaſte eſtéemed 480 mile scotland longer englande ſo narrowe endeth like wedge mountayne grampius euil fauoured craggie tacitus thecornelius tacitus life iulius agricola doth remember pearcing throughe bowel scotland coaſt germaine ſea ſay mouth ye riuer dee iriſhe ſea euen laake lomunde whiche lyeth betwéene countrey ſame hil riuer twede ſpringeth little hyl far beyond roxborough mingled germaine ocean ioyning southward countrey whiche called march eaſt bound betwéen england scotland ſaid riuer twede ſeparateth ye march northumberland furtheſt countrey englande hauing proſpect germaine sea chiefe town wherof barwicke nowe poſſeſſion engliſh weſterne limit scotlande whilom cumberlande whiche riuer solue deuideth annandale betwéen theſe two region cheuiot hils appere next march pictlande bordereth nowe tearmed loughdean bounding vpō eaſt hillie countrey barren almoſt trées moſt famous townes ſame dunbar hadington leith northberwik edenborough king ſeate alſo caſtel maydens ſtrong defenſible place ſame citie riuer forthea commōly called frith doth water paſſe whiche caried germaine ocean maketh greate armes mere commonly called scottiſh ſea wherein beſides iland saint columbe name called aemonia ſame riuer agayne deuideth loughdean countrey adioyning aboundant thing called ye fife whych country many townes donfermile cupre notable town saint andrewe ſpeciallye famous uniuerſitie beautified ſea archbiſhoppe primate scotlande ſide towardes iriſhe ſide northwarde nidiſdalia ſo called riuer paſſeth therby bee ſtrong townes douglaſſe donfrieſe upon south adioyneth galloway aboundaunte fodder cattel wheate wher towne candida caſa called whitherne auntient tē ple saint ninian adourned alſo epiſcopal sea thoſe part beſides towne wighton laake wonderfull nature bycauſe one ſide winter doeth fréeſe ſtandeth countrey caricta renoumed wyth towne caricton whereof perchaunce tooke name aboue caricta towardes weſt elgonia name ptolome calleth countrey bordering vppon ocean wherein laake lomunde whiche brode large contayning manye ilandes ſituate foote mountaine granteſbeyn eyght myles caſtell donbriton beſides riuer bodotria named leuinus entring riuer glota clude ſome contende name bodotria well applyed leuinus bycauſe appeareth cornel tacitus bodotria glota haue ſundry paſſages ye ſea clearely dirempte one leuinus glota wherfore iudge rather riuer nowe called frith olde time name bodotria proue ſame adde manye reaſons whiche omitte good ſpace thys ſide grampius riſeth riuer tau greateſt scotland taking name laake whence ſpringeth whiche falleth atholia calidonia many place chiefly perthum called saint iohns towne laſtlye dunde time paſt called alectum breaketh germaine ſea mouth forceth great eſtuars armes ſea whereof tacitus maketh mention againſte tau anguiſe whiche meanes riuer fertile proſperous deuided fife y• ſame vpō north adioyneth athels barrē neſt countrey well water plentie ſoyle ſide arguile ſheweth ſelfe whyche full laakes yéeldeth greater plentie fodder fruite whoſe vttermoſt bound ſtretch ſo farre ireland diſtante paſt xvj mile promontorie foreland called land hed ſtandeth coaſt whilom silures inhabite polidor gathereth theſe wordes plinie hys 4 booke 16 chapter ireland ſituate ouer againſt brytain diſtant frō nation silures ſhorteſt cut xx myles howbeit ſome manifeſt ſame plinie yt ſame chapter alſo writer brytaine hys tyme well knowen ſo farre north ſuppoſe mente silures ſhoulde inhabite arguile rather southwales whence paſſage ouer better known mighte haue vnderſtanding ſhorteſt wher alſo wel tacitus antoninus ſéeme place people betwéene argile olgouia weſtwarde lyeth countrey sterling ſo called towne foreſt calydonia began left ſide within ſtretcheth farre broade forreſt ſometimes bred white bulles long maned like lion whiche ſo wilde coulde tamed bycauſe fleſh pleaſant daintie mouth whole race almoſte extinguiſhed likewiſe caſtel calydone ſituate tau called doucheldine little hil forreſt ryſeth glota cluid brode chanel falleth iriſhe ocean ſtayed manner bankes mountaine grampius ſlydeth ſea greate tydes ſo witneſſeth tacitus romaine thought another ilande riuer dale called glotevale whyche countrey riuer runneth ſame citie glaſco goodlye uniuerſitie agayne towardes eaſte ioyned countrey aſ anguiſh merne vppon sea coaſte wherein fordune ſituation verye ſtrong reliques palladius scottiſh apoſtle famous ſame ſyde scotlande countrey marre garniſhed citie called aberdone ſtanding betwéene two riuers dona dea schole alſo adorned followeth morrey whiche two notable riuers doe compaſſe aboute called neſſa spea mouthe thys laſt riuer ſtandeth towne elgis aboute banckes whereof huge wood repleniſhed wyth ſortes wilde beaſtes laake alſo called spina ſtoared plentie swannes middle part ſtandeth broad countrey roſſia called beane rozen ſtretching vttermoſt angle euen sea goeth eaſtwarde better inhabited ſame boſome sea nowe ſo conuenient sailers cōmonly called port health hauen safetie towne thana breadth iland ſhort falling ye forme wedge ſcant xxx mile ouer defended thrée promontory like tower repelleth greate waues ſurges sea inuironed two gulfes whiche thoſe promontory doe incloſe entry quiet calme water peaceable ſtraite lande day called cathanes coaſting vpon sea deucalidon thus muche particular scotlande y• ſame euery place ful good hauens nauigable entryes laakes marſhes flouds fountaines full fiſhe mountaines vpon top wherof pleaſant plaines yéelding great ſtore graſſe plentie fodder cattel wooddes likewiſe full wilde beaſtes part land well ſuſtained commodity therefore people harde vanquiſhed anye time reaſon wood marſhes hande refuge hunger eaſed wyth ueneſon fiſh scotlande iriſhe sea xl ilandes plinie tearmed brytanniae call meuania hebrides manye theſe length leaſte thirty mile breadth aboue xij amongeſt thē iona beautified tombes scottiſh king ilanders generally ſpeake iriſhe whiche declareth take originall iriſhe nation beyonde scotlande towarde northe iles orchades whiche ptolome ſaith xxx number ſome lying ducalidon sea ſome germaine ocean principall whiche ilandes pamonia bycauſe byſhops ſea vnder gouernement scotlande ilanders vſe gothes ſpéeche whiche argueth procéede germaines tall ſtature verie helthie luſtie body minde liuing long although chiefeſt foode fiſhe lande almoſt continually beſet colde many place able bear corne generally almoſt without trée buſhe beyonde orchades ſtandeth thule froſen ſea nowe called iſelande marchauntes repaire fiſhing euery yeare sommer thus much haue ſay ſcite scotlande nowe nature maners people scottes whiche inhabite southern parte bée wel nurtured liue good ciuility moſt ciuile vſe engliſh ſpéech wood geaſon ſcant common fewel blacke ſtone whiche dig earth part northern ful mountaines rude homely kinde people doth inhabite called redſhankes wilde scottes clothed mantel ſhyrte ſaffroned iriſhe manner going bare legged knée weapon bowes dartes verie brode ſword dagger ſharp one ſide ſpeake iriſh féeding fiſhe milke chéeſe fleſhe hauing great number cattell scottes differ engliſhe lawes cuſtomes bicauſe vſe ciuill lawe almoſt countryes doe engliſh haue theyr law edict certain condition farre vnlike language one habite complexion like one corage battel nobilitie one deſire pregnancie hunting countrey houſes narrow couered ſtraw réede wherein people beaſts lodge togither theyr town beſides iohns towne vnwalled aſcribed animoſitie hardineſſe fixing ſuccor helpe alway valiancie body scot verye wiſe learning declareth whatſoeuer art apply themſelues eaſily profite ſame ydle • louthful ſuch chiefly ſhun auoyde labour liue great pouertie yet wil ſticke boaſt nobilitie gentrie though ſéemely honeſt lacke comely exerciſe ſome honeſt arte get liuing scot generally deuoute obſeruers religion thus muche scotlande wale third parte brytaine lyeth vppon leftevvales hande whiche like promontorie foreland iſle euery ſide compaſſed maine sea except ye southeaſt part riuer sabrine commonly called seuern diuideth wale england although ſome late writer affyrme hereford bound betwéene wale england ſay wale beginneth chepſtow riuer wey augmented anthis arme sea • udge novve called auſt vvhere paſſage betvveene village auſt chepſto •• riuer called lugge▪ paſſing hereforde doth runne sea whiche riuer ryſeth middle wale hil vncertayne whether oute spring sabrine doth euen place goeth great arme sea paſſing land weſtward right hand leaueth cornwal left wale whiche topographie deſcription althoughe newe yet thought good follow therefore wale extended town chepſtow beginneth almoſt ſtraight line little aboue shrowſburie euen weſtcheſter northward part ſo many brytaines remayned aliue ſlaughter loſſe countrey length driuen ſhiftes repayre auntient writing report partly refuge mountaines partly wooddes mariſhes remained ſafetie part enioy euen day land afterwards engliſh men cal wale giraldus cambrenſis brytaines inhabitant ſame walſhmen amongs germaines walſhman ſignifieth ſtranger alien outborne ſtrange man ſuche one hath cōtrarie lāguage wal tongue called ſtranger borne italian frenchman differ ſpéech germaine man ſignifieth homo man engliſhe therefore engliſhmen people germanie wonne brytaine called brytaines whiche eſcaped deſtruction theyr country country maner walſhmen bicauſe tongue ſpeach beſides lād inhabited wale name afterward people country remaine meane brytaines kingdome loſte name affirme name deriued kyng quéene without doubt deceyued countrey ſoyle towardes sea coaſt place valley playnes moſte fertile whiche yéeldeth bothe man beaſt great plenty fruite graſſe place moſt part barraine leſſe fruitful▪ bicauſe lacketh tillage whych cauſe huſbandmen doe liue hardly eating oten cake drinking milke mixt water bée many town ſtrong caſtels foure biſhoprickes thefoure bishope vvales biſhopricke hereford counted england late wryters declare firſte biſhopricke meneue ſo called meneua day call saint dauids citie auntient ſcituated vppon sea coaſt boundeth weſtwarde towarde irelande landaffe thirde bangor fourth saint aſaph vnder ye archbiſhop canterbury welſhmē haue language frō engliſhmen ſay yt fetch pedigrée frō ye troians doth partly ſounde troian antiquitie partly gréeke hewſoeuer walſhemen doe pronounce ſpeache ſo pleaſauntlye gently engliſhmen doe bicauſe ſpeake throate contrariwiſe engliſhmen rightly following latines expreſſe voice ſomewhat within lip whiche hearer ſéemeth pleaſaunt ſwéete thus much wale thirde part brytaine nowe followeth fourth laſt part brytaine named cornwal part beginneth ſide ſtandeth towarde spaine weſtward toward eaſte bredth foure ſcore ten mile extending little beyond germains famous village ſituate ye right hand vppon sea coaſte greateſt bredth countrey xx mile parcel land right hande compaſſed coaſt maine sea left hand arme ſea declared parteth land runneth vp chepſtow wher coūtry forme horne ye firſt narrow groweth broder little beyonde ſayd town germain eaſtward bordreth vpō englād weſt south north ye main ſea roūd barren ſoile yéelding fruite trauel ye tiller huſbādmē goodneſſe ground greate plentie lead tin mining digging wherof doth ſpecially conſiſt liuing ſuſtentation inhabitāts tong far diſſonant engliſh much like walſh tong bicauſe haue many word cōmon tongs yet difference betwéen walſh man ſpeaketh corniſh mā rather vnderſtandeth manie word ſpoken walſhman whole tale telleth whereby manifeſt thoſe thrée people doe vnderſtand one another like maner ye southern scot doe perceiue vnderſtand northern thing rare maruellous one iland ſhould ſuch varietie ſpéeches cornwal dioceſſe exceter whiche worthy counted fourthe parte iland contrariety language afterwards normās conſtituted kingdome al thoſe thrée part reckened cornwal one county ſhires countrey thus much particular deſcription brytaine whole bodie realme member maye better knowne ſome peraduenture neuer heard ſame forme ilande triquetra thrée corneredstrab • lib 4 hauing thrée corner thrée ſides two whereof ſaye corner toward eaſte toward weaſt extending northwardes longeſt thirde ſide whiche south ſide farre ſhorter ilande greater length bredth two partes conteyned length euen ſo ye laſt bredth place bredth beginneth ſo continuing southe parte north narrowe firſt right corner iland eaſtwarde kent douer sandwich frō whence callais boloigne fraunce diſtance xxx myles angle againſt france thirde angle northe scotlande maine wherof boundeth vpon germanie land ſéene iland like vnto wedge euen verye angle lande scotlande lengthe ſeauen hundred myles againe followyng yeares chryſte hys byrth placed brute ſonne siluius ſonne aſcanius 1108 gaufrid • ſonne aeneas death hys father baniſhed gréece deliuered remnāt troiās ye long captiuitie wherin deteined whyche called albion place nowe called totnes deuonſhire yeare world 2855 yere chriſts natiuitie 1108 wherein firſt began raigne named brytaine ſome write rather owne name brutaine aethicus aethicus reduced ſame one monarchie mvlmutius dunwallo ſon cloten duke cornwall442 firſt king vvare crovvn gold vvho builded blackvvell hall ſeconde lavves vvere mulmutius lavves flores hiſtoriarū reduced realme one monarchie ciuil warres diſſention ſeuered broughte diuers dominion firſte ware crown golde conſtituted good lawes whyche long called mulmutius lawes theſe lawes holy gildas wrote oute britiſh ſpéech latine gaue priniledges vnto temple ploughes beganne make foure notable wayes brytaine newe troy builded greate temple called templum pacis ſome ſuppoſe saint paules ſome blackwell hall wythoute doubte olde worke blackwel hall remayning jewes synagogue raigned xl yeares leauing two ſonnes belinus brennus buryed temple peace whiche builded belinus brennus ſons mulmutius cornouenna 401 diuided whole iſle brytaine betwene unto beline elder brother appointed englande wale cornwall unto north parte beyond humber brennus yong man deſirous gloryflores hiſtoriarū leiland • • fride dominion rayſed warre againſte beline concluſion ye mean mother accorded brennus wholly giuē ye ſtudy war left hys coūtry yt gouernāce brother wēt frāce amō geſt ye galles excellēt quality greatly eſtéemed made theyr ſoueraigne captaine whō paſſed italie ſacked rome expelling tuſcanes builded millain breſcia como bergamo vincenza trent verona whiche called owne name brenona afteriuſtine writeth trogus pompeius abridged iuſtine hée raiſed hoſte 150000 footemen 15000 horſemen inuaded macedone againe soſthenes ſawe waſted countrey village mette hys hoſt macedones well appointed reaſon fewe enemy manye ſoone put worſer wherefore macedones beaten kept within walles city brennus like conquerour againſt man durſt ſhew head make reſiſtaunce foraged al iles macedone thence though thoſe booty ſpoyles ſéemed baſe ſimple eye tourned minde temple goddes immortall malapertlye ſcoffing goddes riche ought departe liberally men therfore toke iourney towards delphos ſetting ye gain gold ben offered goddes theyr diſpleaſure temple apollo delphos ſituate ye mount parnaſſus vppon cliffe euerye ſide falling ſtéepe downe confluence men hath made populous cittie moreouer temple towne encloſed ſtéepeneſſe rocke middle part rocke inwarde faſhion like theatre meanes whereof men make ſhouting trumpet ſounded ſame breaketh redoundeth ſuch wiſe vpon ſtones one another echo herd double treble noyce reſounding farre lowder wente forth whyche cauſeth ignoraunt ſtande feare thinking preſence godheade winding rocke almoſt midway toppe hil little playne ſame déepe hole ground ſerueth giue oracle certaine colde breath aſcending vpwarde ſtirreth mindes prophetes madneſſe ſo compelleth giue aunſweare ſuch come counſayle ſame place therefore ſéene many riche gift kyngs people wherefore brutus came within view temple doubt greate whyle whether hée wer better attempt matter forthwith giue ſouldiours night reſpite reſt euridanus theſſalonus conetouſneſſe praye hadde ioyned themſelues willed cut al delay theyr enimies vnprouided giuing night reſpite theyr enimies ſhould perchance get courage ſuccour common ſouldiours frenchman long penurie founde countrey repleniſhed wine kind victual diſperſed themſelues field making hauock al thing like conguerours meanes delphians reſpit lay themſelues manned towne helpe theyr neyghbours euer frenchman coulde called wyne fat ſtandarde brennus thréeſcore fiue thouſand choſen footemen beſt al hoſte delphians al 4000 fighting men diſdayne whiche ſmall handful brennus entente ſharpen mindes men ſhewed riche plentiful pray ſhoulde haue frenchman vouching captaine rather theyr owne beholding ſtirred vp alſo wounded wine poured day without reſpite dā ger ran • long encounter contrarie part delphians putting truſte god owne ſtrength reſiſted theyr enemyes ſtones weapon threw frenchman ſcaled headlong top mountain two partes thus ſtriuing one another ſodainely prieſtes al temple prophetes wyth theyr haire aboute eares c like men ſtraught wittes came running forefront battaile cry al making ſupplications god ayde met yong mā beautie perſonage far excelling mortal creature companie two uirgins armour wherefore beſought ſéeing god garde ſtandarde ſhoulde ſticke diſpatch enimies forthwith perceyued god preſent ſide piece mountaine broken ſodaine earthquake ouerwhelmed french hoſte thickeſt theyr enimies without gret ſlaughter opened put flight necke whereof enſued tempeſte hayle thunder lightning conſuming manye anye thing ſore wounded captaine brennus himſelfe able abyde ſmarte woundes brennus killeth himſelfe toke • ſworde killed himſelfe thus farre abridged iuſtrne beline meane time bothe ciuill iuſtice alſo religion greatly encreaſed realm made thrée archflamines whoſe sea new troy kayrbranke kayrlegion archflames foure notable vvayes finiſhed foure greate wayes begon father ſubdued made tributarie vnto denmarke newe troy made hauen whiche day retayneth belines gate builded iohn leland tovver lō dō firſt builded name hym called belines gate iohn lelande wryteth builded towre newe troy maryed hys daughter cambria vnto prince almaine called antenor whome theſe people called cymbri sycambri finally raigned brother alone xxvj yeares dyed pagan manner great pompe burned aſhes veſſell braſſe ſet hygh pynacle ouer belines gate builded carlheon whiche inhabited ſame lawes cuſtomes kinde gouernemente vſed yet hauens able receyue number ſhips ſent caius voluſenus galley diſcouer muche hée coulde concerning thoſe matter within fiue dayes retourned caeſar declaring ſuch thing learned coaſting alongſt ſhore durſte feare brytaines ſtirre galley meane ſpace came embaſſadours many city iſle deliuered hoſtages ſent comius arras charging faſt elſe throughe beating one againſt another force tempeſt deſtroyed ſo xl loſt muche labour ſaued meane ſpace saeua one caeſars ſoldiourseutropius foure others ſmall veſſel conueyed rocke neare foughte againſt many wearie woū ded loſt helmet ſhielde two light harneſſes ranne caeſars tent aſked pardō emperor ouerboldneſſe onely forgaue honored office centurion upon land caeſars horſſemen firſt encounter vanquiſhed laberius durus tribune ſlaine place called chestō wood neare vnto rochester ſaith chronicle wygmorecro wigmore ſecond conflict wtout great daunger men put brytaines fight thence went vnto riuer thamis ye ſide wherof caſsibelanus great multitude people kéeping bank ſet ſayde bankes al ſhallow place vnder caſars comen water ſharpe ſtakes euery one big mās thighe bounde aboute leade driuen ſo faſt bottom riuer neuer remoued ſo ſaithbede aſſer bede aſſer affirme time ſayde ſtakes eaſilye perceiued remaine aforeſayd caſsibelanus brytains able reſiſt violence force appointed lieutenant died within ye firſt yere gouernmēt ſaying y• would haue ſubdued prouinces ſuruiued ij yeares time great ſlaughter romaine svetonius paulinus thē ſent hither arriual purpoſing ſubdue angleſey whither many brytains had62 drawne thēſelues inveſſels wt flat kéeles ferried ouer footmē bringing ouer horſemē ſome fourdes wher ye ſhores ſtood cloſely togither great nūbers brytās among thē woman gadding vp frantickly mourning wéedes haire hanging ear ſhaking firebrāds ye druydes alſo caſting vp hāds toward heauē thundred cruel execration wt vncomely ſightes ye romaine firſt ſtoode diſmayed encouraged y• dion caſstus general perſwaſion▪ bruſt among thē made greate ſlaughter got ye poſſeſſion ye ile felled ye woods▪ cō ſecrated ſuperſticious vſes two citties belōging y• romains wer takē 80▪000 people ſlaine whole ilād reuolted romanes reproch ſlaughter cō mitted womā foretold thē many ſtrange ſignes tokēs y• court heard noiſe wt much ſlaughter theatre greate tumulte muche wondering man ther either ſpake mourned beſides riuer thames certaine houſes building ſéen image goddeſſe victoria temple camulodunum tourned hir backe though ſhe yéelded hyr enimies woman ranne madde ſaying ſinging deſtruction hande finally betwixt iland fraunce ocean ſea appeared flowed bloud occaſiō war cōfiſcation brytains good remitted claudius emperoure decianus catus procurator ile ſaide ought haue bene renued cauſe added wheras againſt theyr wils seneca lent fourtie sestercies vpon great vſurie wyth greate force kinde violence compelled paye whole ſumme one payment alſo perſuaded make warre romaine bunduica brytaine woman noble byrth onely wyth muche honour ruled amongſt alſo ſoueraigne theyr war déed ſtomack mā ly womanlike hauing gotten togyther armye 120000 men gotte hir vpon hyr ſeate made marriſhe turues manner romaine tall woman comely ſhape ſeuere countenāce ſharp voice yealowe haire hanging downe hyr ſkyrtes ponticus virunius ſaith hir thyghes ſhe ware great chayne ofponticus virunius golde hadde hyr backe coate ſundrye colour playted kirtle whē ſhe thus apparelled hir hand gret ſpeare ſhe ſpake vnto effect firſt ſhe commended libertie ſhewing pouertie wyth libertie farre better great rich miſerie bondage ſide wyth great eloquence ſhée declared miſchiefes calamity ſuffered handes romaine exactyng tribute paymentes ſo oppreſſed muche better dye long lyue ſuche extreame ſlauerie secondly ſhe reproued expelling enimies forefather done iulius caeſar claudius caligula againe ſhe praiſed preſent readineſſe helpe hir recouer auntient ſtate thirdly ſhe diſabled romaine fewe combred armoure ſo faint courage rather fight far encounter hand ſtrokes ſhe cōmended brytaines nū ber greater valor farre able abide hunger colde thirſte raine winde heate c ſhée added vantage place home wooddes ryuers lake thing well knowne euery one laſtly ſhe exhorted ſhewe themſelues dog wolues among fearefull hare fox wherewithall ſhe let hir lap quicke hare thereby learn euent hir enterprice hare hauing proſperous paſſage multitude gaue greate ſhowte bunduica clapping hir handes gaue thankes hir god ſhe ruled romaine nero though hée man yet déede woman ſangvvhat brytaines vveregiuen playde harpe brytans eſtéemed better warriours plowman thing common ſo wiues child hauing kingdome amongeſt ſuche kinde people ſhe prayed deuine aydes agaynſte ſpitefull wicked kinde men called men vſedniceneſſe romaine • hote bathe dainty fare wine ointmentes laye ſofte bed vaſſalles ſuch wanton minſtrel emperor nero bunduica hauing ſpoken theſe ſuche like amongſt hir people hir hoſte ſhe ſette forward agaynſte romains time without head gouernor paulinus gone army angleſey reherſed iland nere brytaine meanes whereof bunduica tooke two city committed notable ſlaughter remembred exerciſed kinde crueltie ſuche men ſhée tooke noble woman ſhe gat ſhe hanged vppe cutte pap ſewed mouthes beſides ſhe ſtretching body oute length thruſte ſharpe ſtakes cleane throughe al thing done deſpighte ſacrificed feaſted templas ſpecially woodde called andates paulinus ſubdued angleſey hearyng foreſaide ſlaughter returned brytaine yet woulde hée aduenture fortune battaile fearing theyr number wanted victual enimies approched compelled abide battell bunduica▪ hir army 230000 men hir ſelfe placed chariot ordered hir men length paulinus coulde ſtretche company ſo long ſuche number length deuided army thrée partes ſo one time mighte fighte ſundry place exhorting abaſhed multitude enimies bothe forefather hadde wyth leſſe number atchieued greater matter gotten greater victory adding time play men enioy quiet aunceſtours woon recouer whiche loſte elſe liue euer miſery ſhame againe ſhewed crueltie eye ſéene thoſe barbarous people ſuche ouercome exhorting reuenge thereof fighte manfully doubte god alwayes fauourable ſuch ſuffered crueltie woulde helpe better die fighting valiantly reproche taken die enimies handes like dogges finally ſayeth whether liue dye brytaine ſhal though romaine loſe yet ſhall bone continually kéep hadde thus ſpoken ſigne battel giuen ech part prepareth himſelfe brytaines great ſtrange noiſe romaine ſilence came neare might throwe dartes perceiuing enimies approche greate violence ruſhed amongeſt brake āraye compaſſed multitude enimies battel waxed doubtfull lighte harneſſed men beganne ſmite eache thoſe heauy armoure togither horſemen encountred romaine archer foughte againſte britiſhe chariot whiche foughte withoute breaſtplates ſlaine dartes encounter made thrée ſeueral place foughte greate courage bothe ſides laſte romaine departed conquerours many ſlaine battaile many taken greate number whych eſcaped prepared fight againe meane ſpace bunduica died diſſeaſe ſhe mourned buried hir verye honorablye thoſe remayned eaſily ouercome diſperſed tacitus ſaith praſutagus king iceni princecorneli •• tacitu • greate wealth appointed caeſar owne twoo daughter ſhoulde inherite landes hereby thinking life quiet deceaſſed wife daughter ſhoulde ſafer meanes ſuch protection fell oute farre otherwiſe centurion gat realme theyr ſeruauntes ſpoyled hys houſe beat hys wife deflowred daughter beſides chiefeſt men lande diſplaced inheritaunces handled extremely reuenge whereof bunduica rayſed warre committed ſlaughter remembred laſte hir army ouerthrowne paulinus afraid fall hir enimies hand ſhe poiſoned hir ſelfe policletus ſeruannt nero ſente hither ſuruey ſtate brytaine diſcharged paulinus suetonius gouernement petronius turpilianus ſent brytaine manne64 petronius turpilianus eaſie entreated altogither acquainted offence enimies readier receiue thē grace ſetting matter former ſtaye attempting deliuered prouince vnto trebellius maximus trebellius faintharted ſluggiſhe alſo vtterly vnacquainted experimentes armes ruled prouince▪ certaine mildeneſſe gouernement nowe barbarous people alſo learned wincke inticing vice ciuil warres romaine happening cloake cowardiſe preſentlye aroſe diſcorde betwéene roſcius caelius legate xx legion ſouldiors accuſtomed employed expedition gaue themſelues laſciuiouſneſſe wherevppon trebellius tooke flighte hid hys head auoyde furie army moſte baſe beaſtly maner gouerned entreatie ſo mighte ſéeme haue compounded ſouldiours ſhoulde liue libertie generall hys ſafetie time yeare halfe deadly ciuil war amōg romaine empire betwéen galba otho vitelius vectius volanus ſent hither vitelius did69 vectius volanus vſe diſcipline correctiō brytaine ſo continued like ſlouth cowardiſe ſouldioures toward enimyes campe ſtill full wantonneſſe ſauing volanus good milde man thereby made himſelfe beloued hée ſhoulde haue béene feared time vitelius aduaunced many souldioures brytaine legion herdonius flaccus broughte vnto hym 80000 choſen men warre oute oftacitus brytaine brytans ſéeing ye romaine thus encombred ciuil war began trouble wherefore volanus would ſend ſuccour vitelius commaundement veſpaſian warred againſte empire brytaines fauored veſpaſian reſt world veſpaſian recouered70 brytaine thē placed great captaines notable army enemyes hope abated petilius cerealis broughte greate feare vppon brytaines thepetilius cerealis citie brigantes accounted one greateſt lande beyng hym aſſayled hadde manye encountres ſome withoute ſlaughter whereby hée eyther conquered aſſayled greate part country iulius frontinus man worthye valiaunt wasiulius frontinus poſſible tooke charge vpon ſubdued nation silures valiant warlike notwithſtanding valor enemy difficulty place ſtate brytaine courſe warres whych agricola found arriuing middeſt sommeriulius agricola souldiors euen beginning retire ſtrengthes enimye ſearching moſt aduantage citie ordouices fewe dayes hys arriuall almoſte wholly defeated company lying vppon bordures beginning ſtirred vp prouince ſeruing example coueted warres yet deſired ſée newe gouernor agricola although sommer nowe well ſpent bandes diſperſed aboute prouince ſouldiours determined reſte yeare time late incommodious commence warre thinking woulde better manne péeces moſte ſuſpected yet determined neuertheleſſe preuent daunger gathering togither standard legion forraine aide ordouices durſt take field marched foorth agaynſte hymſelfe vauwarde armye others might take like courage ſame danger put almoſte whole nation ſworde followyng hys good ſucceſſe inuaded angleſey whiche suetonius attempted cauſing certaine brytaines ſerued knewe ſhallows maner ſwimming wyth horſe harneſſe paſſe ouer iſle ſodaine wherewith inhabitauntes ſo amazed whotacitus feared nothing bycauſe ſawe nauie ſubmitted ile vnto immediately nowe hauing ſome quietneſſe perceyuing warre would little preuaile againſte brytaines iniuriouſlye handled purpoſed cut al cauſes quarrel firſt reforming owne familie nothing partially onely reſpected vertue men looſened tribute behaued himſefe moſte honourably thus muche firſte yeare sommer beganne aſſembled army trayned ſouldioures forrayed enimies country ſodaine inuaſions greate feare yet ſo fauorably many country willingly yéelded vnto ſuffered caſtelles builte among winter following ſpente ciuill adminiſtration counſayling people priuately helping publikely builde houſes temple courte houſes procured noble men child ſtudy liberall science beganne brytaines conforme themſelues romaine faſhions attyre thirde yeare diſcouered people northe hitherto vnknowne euen farre tau terrifying people placing fortreſſes moſte wiſely annoyaunce enimie fourth sommer employed getting thoſe country whiche hitherto paſſed throughe euen edenborough frith cluid narrowe ſpace betwéene whych water fortified fifth yeare sea diſcouered vanquiſhed nation north placed garriſons coaſt towarde irelande wherevnto alſo aſpired end reteyned iriſh prince driuen oute country ciuil diſſention sommer whiche beganne ſixt yere hys gouernement ſearched hauens nauie purpoſe ſent sea fearing leaſte thoſe nation beyonde vnited themſelues kept paſſages land afterward marched forward nauie coaſting army land ſo ſometime ſame campe horſemen footemen seaman lodged togither reported ſuche taken priſoners ſighte nauie much aſtonied brytaines men refuge cutte ſecrets sea diſcouered wherefore determining trie hand blowes inhabitantes calidonia greate preparation although reporte thereof greater often hapneth vnknowne matter accorde aſſayled ſome caſtelles ſéeyng themſelues rather bée aſſaylantes defendauntes putte romaine ſome doubte wherevpon • owards pretending pollicie aduiſed retire ſide bodotria rather driuen thereto force meane agricola knowing enimye woulde charge hym ſeuerall troupe companyes fearing bée ouermatched couped wyth number deceyued ignoraunce place diuided army thrée battailes ſo marched forwarde whiche order marked hys enimyes made alter purpoſe night killing watch brake vpon ninth legion halfe aſléepe halfe afrighted tooke weakeſt ſo fighte continued within camp til day light time romaine began gather courage brytaines diſcomfited ſo hadde bene woodes bogges victorie ended whole ſtrife battaile romain ſouldiors grew hautie corage cry pierce country calidonia might finde oute vttermoſte porte boundes brytaine romaynes ſide aſcribing prayſe victorie proweſſe romaine ſouldioure fortune wilineſſe capitaine vſed al meanes poſſible hearten vppe arme youth beſtowing wiues child place • ſafegarde ſacrifices holy aſſemblyes vnite city togither vpon theſe reſolutions remoued beginning next sommer y• viij yere charge agricola ſeding fléet often put land ſpoyled countreys thereby cauſing great vncertaine feare himſelfe picked army whervnto added valianteſt brytains came y• mountain grampius whereon enimies encamped brytaines nothing quailed ſucceſſe former encounter expecting nothyng reuenge bondage learning length common daunger reſiſted common conſent league embaſſages hadde ſtirred vppe mindes city aboute nowe ſéene armes thirtie thouſande vpwarde vnto whiche number youth ſuch ſtrong luſtie yeares euery man bearing token prayſe continually repayred al ſides amongeſt manye capitaines calgacus man bothe nobilitie valor aboue reſt ſpake aſſembly manner often behold cauſes warre oure neceſſitie minde gyueth greate hope day youre mutuall conſent ſhal beginning libertie brytaine euerye one hauing tryed ſeruitude hauing land ſea whiche ſaue v romaine nauie elbowes verye warre weapon whyche honoure worthy muſte onelye ſafetie faintharted theſe manye ſuche reaſons drawne calamitie future ſeruitude pride tirā ny gouernoures fickle friendſhip ſtrangers ſeruing enimies campe ready change vpon anye highe occaſion preſente remedye miſery whyche ſayde beginning onely valiancie ſo ſtirred vp men mindes applauded oration theyr manner ſongs diuers kinde noyſes oration ended alſo agricola hys ſpéeche hys souldioures twoo army beganne encounte • ▪ agricola placed hys battayles order made mayne battayle ſtraungers aydes whiche number▪ viij thouſand eche ſide wherof wing placed hys horſſemen number thrée thouſande legion cauſed guard trench campe poſſible victorie mighte gained without ſheading romaine bloude maine battel broken might gathered againe fighte reſtored hys legion battaile brytaines terrify enimies alſo make braueſt ſhew ſtode higher ground ſo vawarde beyng come vppon playne reſte foote hill chariot meane tyme galloping vp downe fielde making greate ſhowtes cry agricola perceyuing number enimes bée greater owne fearing charged bothe face • lanke battayle one time manye thoughte neceſſary haue legion aduannced forwarde remayned notwythſtanding firme firſte reſolution cauſing battaile ſomewhat drawn lengthe himſelfe alighted horſe ſtoode foote standerdes firſt fighte ſhotte arrowes dar • e whiche time brytaines ſkilfully couragiouſlye huge swordes ſmall buckler eyther bare brake romaine ſhotte anſwered infinite number like vntill agricola perſwaded bandes holanders brabanders matter mighte broughte ſwordes handſtrokes whiche kinde fight •• acquainted withall long haunting warres ſame incommodious enjuries bearing ſmall ſhieldes vnmeaſurable swordes pointleſſe sword brytaynes vnfi • te throng wanted roomth wherefore holanders ſtrake thicke togither thruſt ouer buckler wounding face hauyng broken battell paſſed forward towarde whiche kepte hill whiche ſéene reſte romaine bandes partelye moued enuye others glorye partelye heat • owne courage cutte péeces thoſe firſte encountred leauing notwythſtanding ſome halfe deade others touched haſte obtaine perfecte victorie meane whyle troupe brytaine horſemenne dydde take flighte chariot putte themſelues péecemeale among foote bandes whyche kinde fighte firſte ſéemed ſomewhat terrible enimies long ſerued tournes aſſayled wyth thicke preaſe ennimyes grounde commodious chariot ryders beſte laſte theyr chariot horſes courſing vppe downe field without guiders ouerran manye owne company fled feare one place another brytaines whiche al kepte hill came ye fight making little reconing ſmal number romaine beganne little little deſcend entending hem middeſt conqueſt ſurely done agricola ſuſpecting ſame hadde diſpatched foure company horſemen whiche kept ſodaines encounter fiercely aſſayled ſo much ſharply repulſed ſent flight wherevpon deuiſe brytaines turned owne harme moreouer agricola cōmandement wing horſemen taken front battel made charge vpon battel enimies ſtanding ouer againſt might beholde open field gréeuous lamentable ſpectacle ſome folowed chace ſome tooke priſoners killed take others enimies euery one thoughte beſte fledde ſome heapes armed fledde ſmaller number thoughe vnarmed tarryed ſlaine euery laye weapon •• rcaſſes lymmes ground bloudy ſometime vanquiſhed approching neare woodes woulde make hed entrap héedleſſe follower ſo agricola hadde cauſed certayne luſty bandes manner ſearch alſo diuers horſemen▪ leauing horſe wooddes thicke horſebacke wóoddes would ſuffer raunge aboute might haue béen ſome detriment receiued much hardineſſe▪ brytaines ſawe themſelues purſued order battaile tooke againe flight company tarrying one euen men glad eſcape ſought long wayes night wearineſſe ſlaughter ended chaſe ſlaine brytaines tenne thouſand romaine army thrée hundred fortie among whome aulus atticus capitaine aband heat youth corage horſe broughte hand enimies night victor made mery wyth ſpoyle brytaines wandering vppe downe men woman lamenting togither reléeued fetcht awaye hurte men aſſembled togither whole forſooke houſes anger ſette fire chooſing themſelues lurking place ſtraite forſooke againe▪ ſometime▪ conceyuing good hope whyche ſtraighte waye quayled agayne ſome knowen kyll theyr wyues chyldren thoughe hadde therein taken compaſſion vppon them▪ nexte daye made victorie manifeſt nothing ſilence hilles forſaken alſo houſes ſmoking far agricola ſendyng abroade eſpialles coulde finde ennimye make • ed wherefore sommer farre ſpente procéede warre hadde whych ſo endured ſpace 400 yeres vnto comming saint auguſtine ioſeline fornes booke wrote brytiſhioſeline furneys biſhops ſaith thean firſt archbiſhop lō time lucius builded ſaid church peter vodinus ſlain sarons came firſt lande lucius raigned 12 yere buryed gloucester comodus father antonius philoſophus ſucceded181 dion empire moſt cruel tyranny time northerne britain burſt wall forrayed ruled vnder comodus appointedlampidi •• ▪ dion certaine men baſe eſtate gouerne romain enemy wherewith ſouldiours gréeued ſent 1500 choſen men theyr number rome accuſing hym comodus compaſſe empire ſonne deliuered vnto immediatelye mangled hym ſlew wife two ſonnes comodus thē ſent holnius pertinax brytain ſurnamedlampridi •• ▪ himſelfe brytanicus thervnto perſwaded flatterer brytaines ſo euill affected toward woulde haue nominated ſome emperour againſtcapitolinus namely pertinax theſe tumult appeaſed wiſdome pertinax great danger welnere ſlaine tumulte left among dead whiche iniurie ſeuerallye reuenged ſued diſcharge afterwarde preferred empire clodius albinus ſente hyther comodus▪ whocapitolinus firſt ſo greatlye eſtéemed honored hym y• title caeſar▪ clodius refuſed afterwards falſe rumor diſperſed yt comodus ſlain made oratiō legion brytain impeaching yt gouernement emperours preferring senate whervpon commodus ſharpned againſte hym ſente iunius seuerus rule héere ſhortly comodus ſlaine ſlaine pertinax choſen emperour within iij months194 ſlaine throughe per • wations didius iulianus enioyed empire two monthes practice clodius albinus returned brytain ſéemeth recouered former gouernement seuerus death pertinax ſaluted emperor194 immediately ſlewe didius iulianus bycauſe feared clodius albinus brytain legion created caeſar partaker empire ſente heraclitus gouerne ile ſubdued niger alſo vſurped empire moued warre againſt albinus paſſing hence fraunce brytiſh army encountered seuerus neare lion ſlaine henceforthe seuerus quietly enioyed romaine empire made ſharp war eaſterne partes world great glorie returning rome vnderſtoode war rayſed in209 brytaine wherefore haſted hyther two ſonnes baſsianus geta • arriuall peace offered whithe refuſed leauing yonger ſonne geta gouerne prouince hyther part ile baſſianus hys eldeſt ſonne entred northe paſſed y• parte thys ilande without reſiſtaunce yet ambuſhes difficultie way inconueniences loſt 50000 men returned enforcing enemy conclude league yéelde ſome parte theyr countrey concluſion league ſonne rid treate caledontans northern brytains baſsianus ſonne drawing ſworde ſighte enemie ready haue ſlaine done ſome company made outcry yet fault remitted league brytaines north reſorted emperours courte wher iulia seuerus wife obiected womā brytaine wife argentorix caledonian brytiſh woman accompanyed wyth men diſhoneſtlye ye • quoth brytiſhe woman ſatiſfy naturall luſte better ſorte romaynes accompanye ſelues openly wyth beſte menne committe adulterie cloſely wyth moſte vyle perſons league generall reuolte brytaynes againſte romaine yet pacifyed great ſlaughter builte wall turfe inhibite • uerus vvall northern brytaines whence retourned nexte lodging blacke moore ſerued notable ſcoffer mette wyth crowne cypre hée moued colour man cypre whiche vſed burial ſignes euill lucke commaunded manne ſente awaye wherewyth cryed thou haſte bene haſt banquiſhed couquerour thou god commyng citie yorke ſuppoſed byspartia ••• miſtaking brought temple bellona blacke beaſts alſo ordayned▪ ſacrifice followed home hys pallace thing theſe dyd accōpt ominons shortly departed▪ life yorke partly ſickneſſe partly griefe conceiued hys ſonnes euill demeanoure laſt gaſpe vttered theſe word found ſtate troubleſome euery leaue quiet euen brytaines herodian writeth theſe war seuerus againſt ye herodian north brytains founde country full watry mariſhes thoſe mariſhes britain ſwim ſkirmiſh enemy couered water vp vnto nauell caring men ſaw priuie partes theyr naked bodyes neyther dyd knowe vſe apparel accuſtomed compaſſe theyr bellyes neckes onely wt iron eſtéemed ornament token rich barbarous people ſuppoſed gold paynted bodyes diuerſe picture formes beaſtes therefore ware garmente leaſte painting ſhould hidden nation valiaunt warlyke gréedy ſlaughter content ſmall target ſpeare ſkayne hanging naked ſides ignoraunt vſe ſhyrtes mayle helmet reckned ye ſame comberous vnto ſhoulde ſwimme ouer lake c gréetious diſeaſe came vpon seuerus ſore appalled age ſo conſtrained kéepe chamber ſende antonius vnto warres antonie regarding buſineſſe brytaine endeauoured meanes coulde winne harte ſouldiours vnto hym deprauing hys brother intente ſhoulde aide attayning ſoueraintie long maladie father cauſed perſwade phiſitions rid olde man worlde vntil seuerus conſumed ended life moſte famous emperours war like affayres none obtayned ſo many victory conqueſts either ciuil againſt aduerſaries rayne againſt barbarous nation thus deceaſed gouerned empire ſpace xviij yeares leauing ſonnes ſucceſſours ſame vnto left alſo greate aboundaunce rich none previceſſours hym done antony gotten ſupreme authoritie put death phiſitiōs bycauſe obeyed commaundemente haſtnyng hys father deathe ſlewe owne brother bringers vp inſtructers wente reconcile leauing none aliue eyther dignity reuerenced father captaines army enticed perſwade ſouldiours proclayme emperour imagining dayly manifold miſchiefes againſt brother could win ſouldiours good willes wherefore antony hauing taken truce britans remoued towardes mother brother mother laboured bring agréement wherein alſo manye prudente counſellours earneſtly trauelled antony thereby enduced rather force good counterfaite loue done two brother gouerning y• empire equal honour launched brytaine ſayled reliques theyr father toward rome burned bodye cuſtome romaine carryed aſhes intermedled pleaſaunt odour boxe alabaſter rome mighte ther enterred amongſt monument prince themſelues led thus army conqueror brytain paſſed ouer ye ocean vnto next coaſte fraunce ſo haſted towards rome entred rome people crowned laurel receyued senate welcomed formoſt roade emperor themſelues clothed emperial purple nexte vnto followed conſuls bearing veſſel seuerus reliques whiche veſſel people ſaluted newe emperour reuerently worſhippe emperours conſuls thus accompanyed wyth princely pompe • aryed ſaine temple deuine monument marcus▪ emperor ſéene finiſhed ſolemne ſacrifiſe according ye auntient vſage celebrated funerall ceremony brethrē departed emperiall palace deuided betwéene cloſed vp backe dores priuie poſterns mette togither y• outter gate choſe beſides eyther thē vnto himſelfe ſoundry guarde neuer came togyther vnleſſe ſometime little whyle ſéene people neuertheleſſe firſte accompliſhed due funeral father romaine accuſtome conſecrate immortalitie ſuch emperours theyr death lea •• e eyther child ſucceſſoures empire behinde thoſe endued honor canonize ••• ongſt god cittie certaine▪ dolefull lamentation mixed fearefull • vſe enterre dead corpſe ſumptuouſly haue image made like deade emperour may ſame within porche emperial pallace lay gret high bed iuorie couered ouer cloth gold ſame image looketh pale like diſeaſed patient bed eyther ſide great part day certayne perſons ſit wit left ſide senate clothed blacke garment right ſide many matrones none theſe ſéene weare ouches chaynes golde clad wyth thinne white veſtures ſhew countenaunce mourner thus doe continue ſpace ſeauen dayes euery daye emperours phiſitions repayre vnto bed though felt patiēts pulſes declare waxeth ſicke finally ſéemeth deceaſed certain moſt noble worthye yong men order knightes senator doe take vp bedde theyr ſhoulders cary ſtréete called sacrum via vnto olde market place romain magiſtrats accuſtomed render vp office ſides certaine ſtages made ſteppes vppon whiche one ſide queare boyes noble men ſonnes ſide many beautiful woman ſinging himnes ballade prayſe deade emperour meaſured diuerſe lamentable verſes theſe finiſhed yong men take vp bedde againe beare citie fielde called campus martius broadeſt part whereof erected towre foure ſquare ſides equall height builded great timber like vnto tabernacle ſame within forthe filled wyth drye chippes réedes outter ſide hanged wyth arras clothes golde decked with▪ image iuorie ſundry painted picture within alſo another leſſe towre like forme doores portal opened ouer third fourth many roomes aſcebdubg continually vntill retche vnto higheſt leſſe man maye compare thys building vnto towres whyche ſette hauens wyth fire toppes directe ſhippes whiche ſayle nighte sea theyr perfecte porte ſame commonly called phani nowe haue putte bed ſeconde tabernacle gather kyndes ſpices perfume wyth diuerſe odoriferous fruites hearbes iuyces whyche throwe heapes tabernacle neyther anye nation citie perſon whyche excelleth honoure dignytie tyme wyll vttermoſte hys power moſt honorablye celebrate laſte funeralles emperour haue couched greate heape spice togither ſtuffed building therewyth romayne knightes doe ride aboute towre iuſte courſe order fro chariot alſo drawne aboute wherein manye doe ſitte clothed purple repreſentyng perſons noble men magiſtrates captaines rome ceremony throughly ended ſucceſſour empire taketh brande fire hande fireth therewith tabernacle whome preſent doe throwe fire likewiſe ſame immediately building filled thoſe drye ſtickes ſpices beginneth burne vehementlye higheſt leaſte towre hygh ſtéeple let forth eagle beléeue doeth beare emperours ſoule heauen thencefoorthe emperour worſhipped god time raigne time bonefus brytaine 277 borne brought vppe spaine fearing leaſt ſhold executed bycauſe germaines burnte certaine veſſels rhene whereof charge vſurped empire proculus colen▪ woulde haue exempted whiche cauſer trouble thys probus permitted brytaines others might haue vine make wine raigned fine yeares ſlaine ſouldiours caius ſuccéeded two ſonnes numerianus 282 vopiſens carinus whiche carinus aſſigned brytaine gaule called fraunce illiricum italie spaine thrée within thrée yeares ſpace loſt liues valerius diocleſianus choſen emperour284 adioyned maximianus vnto hym lyke gouernement aboute thys tyme holy alban profeſſing chriſt beingvita albani ledde cittie verolamium vnto holmehurst nowe towne saint albans builded ſuffered martyrdome ſpecified firſt martyre brytaine ſhortly number one franckes saxon oftentimes apprehended pirate neyther reſerued prize wasreſerued accountable neyther emperours deputy ſuſpected ſet purpoſe permitted theſe rouers haue recourſe thoſe sea ende hée mighte rifle inrich himſelf maximianus therfore ſent part armye ſuppreſſe manye thebane legion thys iourney ſlayne commaundemente made martyres bycauſe profeſſed chriſt carauſius vnderſtanding preparatiō made againſt paſſed gaule brytaine bringing countrey hys obeyſaunce vſurped roabe emperour wherevppon whiche ſente ſurpriſe retourned maximianus encombered newe warre gaule agaynſte peaſantes meane time carauſius built ſhippes brytayn intercepted certayn cōpanyes ſouldiours aſſembled gret number barbarous people ſpoyle hope whō purpoſed trouble ſea coaſtes gallia spaine holland alſo holden certayne frankes reuolted carauſius purpoſed maximianus ſeconde tyme make288 warre agaynſte carauſius ſtormye weather wante pilotes hée enforced deferre hys purpoſe leauyng gouernement hollander whiche reuolted carauſius ſtaying conuenient winde houered ſea coaſte meane tyme carauſius traytorouſly ſlayne alectus familiar friende albertus vſurped empire brytayne292 agaynſte whome conſtantine wyth hys former preparation made readye warre launched haſte thoughe winde contrarie whyche hys ſouldiours vnderſtoode ſette alſo wyth ſide windes seyne port ſuche foggie myſtieseyne weather paſſed alectus nauie honering aboute ile wighte ſéeing one romaine ſoone landed burnte theyr ſhippes determining either winne loſe liues allectus vnderſtoode left ſhore prepared himſelfe battaile mercenarie barbarous ſouldiours ſlaine aſclepiodatus lorde greate maiſter emperours houſe thys fight none romaynes periſhed al fielde ouerſpred deade bodyes enimies among lay alectus himſelfe without imperiall ornamentes ſcantly knowen romaine ſouldiours alſo whiche loſte theyr companye myſte arriued london ſlewe citie greate number barbarous people whyche eſcaped battaile purpoſed haue ſacked london conſtantius came lande brytains wiues child flocked vnto ſubmitted themſelues ioyfully nowe deliuered long thraldome thys expedition conſtantius brytain aſcribed ſome maximianus error falſe inſcription panegirike hath led asclepiodatus▪ touched recouered brytaine290 galfridu • belayde citie london ſtrong ſiege wherein liuius gallus romaine captaine ere wer • long knightly force violence entred citie ſlew forenamed gallus neare vnto brooke daye running whiche brooke threwe reaſon wherof called brytiſh nant gallon ſince saxon tongue gallus wallus brooke thys daye ſtréete ſometime brooke ranne called walbrooke coill aſclepiodatus toke kingdome of301 brytaine conſtantius begā empire gallerius empire305 deuided betwéen ſo conſtantius ſhoulde poſſeſſe affrica italie fraunce brytaine gallerius ſhoulde haue illirica aſia eaſt partes whiche done ſubſtituted vnder two caeſars cōſtantius holding himſelfe content dignitie auguſtus refuſed ſuſtaine trouble whiche ſhoulde haue endured adminiſtration affaire italie affricke hée ſought meanes howe mighte enriche people empire aboliſhed ſuperſtition gentile dominion ſo afterwarde brytaine felt perſecutions yeare following paſſed fraunce hyther againſt pictes whiche time ſonne conſtantine ſerued galerius perceyuing deſtructien compaſſed poſted father al haſte howghing killing poſt horſſes whych way ſo euer paſſed mighte purſued came father verye houre wente aboorde come brytaine conſtantius aspanegiricus ſoone came yorke ſodainely ſickned perceyuing daye drawe neare aſked whome hée woulde leaue empire aunſwered conſtantine ſhortly departed conſtantine ſurnamed great ſonne conſtantius by306 helena firſt conſecrated hys father nowe deade ſo great ſorrowe ſheading teares ſolempnized burial ſouldiours hoping would reſemble hys father ſaluted emperour yorke againſt wil romaine senate confirmed hys election theyr conſent willingly accepted yere folowing ſetting affayres brytaine order paſſed hence wyth manye brytaines firſte agaynſte frankes whome vanquiſhed agaynſte maxentius uſurper whome ſlewe afterwarde agaynſte licinus named hymſelfe emperour whome alſo ſubdued many barbarous nation alſo hym diſcomfited eſtablyſhed goſpell hys empyre hym emperoures chriſtians firſte beginnyng hys raygne hée worthye haue bene compared wyth beſte chiefeſt prince romaine euer ende thereof reſembled ſuch meaner ſort much giuen purchaſe prayſe fame feates cheualrie hée good fortune battaile yet ſo good induſtrye excelled farre repreſſed ciuill warres vanquiſhed gothes diuerſe place wanne greate memorie prayſe among barbarian applyed himſelfe wholly ſtudye liberal artes endeauored gayne loue people well deſeruings ſéeking ſame great liberalitie cittie whiche builte made able compare manner rome ſelfeconſtantinople made prepation battaile againſt parthian died nicomedia euſebius writeth conſtantine baptiſed firſte ineuſebius laſt dayes life gracia cittie nicomedia biſhoppe alſo sozomenus mother conſtantine great ieruſalem foūd croſſe chriſt ſuffered paſſion ſhe repaired citie ieruſalem adorned manye fayre church builded walles aboute london colchester time octauius conſtantine left gouernour▪ octauius simon dunelmenſis ilande rebelled againſt conſtantine ſent traherne wyth legion romaine diuerſe conflictes ſlaine gratianus ſurnamed funarius time gouernour romaine legion conſtantinus beganne empire raigne ouer brytain 337 wt father conſtantine appointed laſte hys two brother conſtans conſtantius ſhoulde participate haue theyr portion empyre long conſtantinus attempted warre agaynſte hys brother aquileia demeaned hymſelfe vnaduiſedlye therein ſlayne empire reduced vnder gouernement two brethrē conſtans ruled brytain adminiſtred with340 greate iuſtice fayled hys health aſſociated vnto ſtéede friendes euil deſpoſed perſōs aſſiſt throughe whoſe euill counſell declyned horrible vice meane whereof waxing ſcant tollerable inhabitantes prouinces ſlaine magnentius vſurped empire france spaine brytaine alſo ſome write conſtantius regiment brytaine ſent353 hither spaniarde called paule notarie profeſſion bring certaine men warre whiche conſpired wythamianus magnentius vpon falſe ſurmiſes grieuouſly moleſted guiltleſſe fettering manacling whome hée pleaſedmartinus wherevpon▪ martinus lieuetenant brytaine moued compaſſion deſired hym forbeare harmeleſſe ſo rigorous alſo charged martinus himſelfe conſpiracie magnentius earneſt bring emperour wherevppon martinus drawing ſword ſ • bycauſe coulde ſlaye ſodainely ſlewe himſelfe paule embrued bloud haled gret company linked chaynes emperours preſence eyther baniſhed executed attainted conſtantius appointed iulianus gouerneamianus marcellinus gaule fraunce whiche time greate ſpoyle made brytaine scottes pictes wherefore iulianus buſied warre againſt almains ſente lupcinus hyther armye whoſe abſence iulianus vſurped empyre whereof conſtantius hearde retourned warre againſt parthian againſt iulianus dyed way ivlianus called apostata began raign ouer brytain362 empire mā ſéen paſſing wel liberal ſciēces earneſt aduerſarie chriſtian religion baniſhedammian •• marcellinus palladius gret honorable perſon brytain vpon ſuſpition ſent alipius bin lieuetenaunt brytaine repaire ieruſalem terrible flaſhes fire iſſuing earth layde foundation enforced leaue theyr purpoſe iulian great preparation made war vpon parthian ſpoyled aſſiria retournyng thence conqueror ſlaine hys enimies preaſed vnaduiſedly battels ſuccéeded empire ieninian held ix monthes valentinian choſen emperor ſouldiours365 pictes scottes attacots saxon grieuouſly moleſted brytaines nectaridius charge seamarcellinus coaſtes ſlaine bulchobandes greate captain encloſed wherfore diuerſe captaines theodoſius ſent hither diſcomfiting •• nimie recouering ſpoyle entred triumphantlye london next yeare wēt north ſuppreſſed enemy recouered prouince repaired city fortreſſes hée oppreſſed valentinus hungarian baniſhed hither practiſed new tumult deliuering dulcitus dulcitus executed without enquirie confederats bycauſe would renew tumult whiche done returned rome shortly valentinian ſente hither fraomarins ordayned king buccenobats germanie marſhall almaines whiche ſerued brytain long valentinian dyed gratian brother valentinian created375 emporour entent might better repaire decayed ſtate empire made theodotius copartener maximus valiaunt worthy man ſhortly forced383 brytain take empire vpon paſſed fraunce immediately al germaine legion romaine ſouldiours reuolted vnto hym gratian ſo hée deſtitute men warre fledde lyon ſlayne treaſon maximus gaue gratians wife comming hir huſbande whiche gratian intierly louing hys wife lightlye credited therfore accompanyed wyth wente forthe méete hyr coache ſuppoſed haue founde hys wife andragatius deſperate man leaping coache killed gratian maximus created ſonne victor caeſar andzozimu • vſed ſome crueltie againſt gratians captaines valentinian herewith terrifyed ſent ambroſe vnto treate peace accepted theodotius permitted vſe title auguſtus ſetled himſelfe trier insige • ertus germanie empoueriſhed countryes rounde hym executed certaine hereticks nation scottes pictes ye circuite britaine deuided lande britaine two armes sea running betwixt one eaſt sea weaſt runneth farre wide land though may one reake middle eaſt créeke citie builded called guidi aboue weaſt créeke toward right hand ſtandeth citie called alcluith language asalcluith much ſay rocke cluith ſtandeth floud fame name britaines thus afflicted ſaid nation ſent embaſſadors letter vnto rome lamentable ſupplications requiring ayd ſuccour promiſing continuall fealtie ſo would reſcue thē againſt ye oppreſſion enimies wherevpon ſent vnto legiō armed ſouldiers rome comming iland encountring enimies ouerthrew great number draue reſt frontier countrey ſo ſetting liberty frée miſerie ſo gréeuouſly ouercharged counſelled make wall betwéene two sea might force kéep euill neyghbours yt done returned home great triumph britaines building y• wall bid make ſtone willed turffe hauing none amōg thē ſkil therin made ſo ſlender y• ſerued thē little purpoſe wall made betwene ye two ſaid armes créekes sea many mile long fence water lacked help ye trench might kéepe country y• breaking enimies péece worke remayneth euen vnto day moſt aſſured token yet ſéene trench themalmesberie ſéege saxon planted lincolne ſlewe great number thus hauing abated rage saxon reduced countrey quietneſſe conſtituted order theround table round table order receyued ſuch nobilitie moſt renowmed vertue chiualrie round table kept diuers place eſpecially cairleon winchester camalet somerſetſhire yet ſéene denbigh ſhire pariſh ofleyland llanſanan ſide ſtonie hill place compaſſe wherein foure twentie ſeates men ſit ſome leſſe ſome bigger cut maine rocke man hand child yong men comming ſéeke cattell vſe ſitte play commonly call arthures round table hauing eſtabliſhed thing well home nobilitie made expedition norway atchieued norway ſubdued ſundry notable maruellous exploytes ſubdued ſame region thereabout ruſſia leges edwardi placing limite empire lapland cauſed people thoſe countreys baptiſed receyne chriſtian religion alſo obtayned pope haue norway confirmed crowne realme calling chamber britaine norway chamber britaine ſayling france forced frolo gouernoure romaynes flighte afterward combate manfully ſlew shortly addreſſed deadlye warre againſtegaufridus lucius hiberus claymed tribute arthure britaine aſſembled greate power ouercome arthure arthure encountring long bloudye fighte diſcomfited armie killed ſente body senate rome tribute arthure thus valiantly occupyed warres beyond sea conquered thirtie kingdomesflores hiſtoriar ſuch thoſe day mordred whome committed gouernement britaine confederating himſelfe cerdicus firſt king weaſt saxon trayterouſly vſurped kingdome treaſon whenbattayle douer relation came arthure ſpéedily returned britaine richborow néere sandwich gaue battell wanne fielde anguiſell scotland gawin cador ſlayne purſuing cornewall gaue battell agayne riuer alaune ſome hiſtories called cablan mordred ſlayne wal conu •• ordeyned king britayne and542 b •• te booke raigned thrée yeares thys man two ſonnes mordred gréenouſlye vexed claymed lande righte theyr father many battayles fledde one london wincheſter whyche city obteyned tooke conſtantine mordreds child ſlayne followed ſubdued tooke foreſayde city one yong men hée founde abbey london ſlewe hym néere aulter cruelly buried hym nigh vter pendragon stonehinge fired corne tying fire wing sparrowes men fledde thence wale whiche meanes lefte great part dominion ended life raigned thrée yearessea cro gurmund burned vp land britaine sea sea part ile called walſhmen whiche name giuen engliſhmen saxon vſed call men walſhmen ſtraungers vnto come ye time wherin god ye ſins people tranſlateth kingdomes diſpoſſeſſed brytaines theyr auntient habitation rule againſt ceauline king weſte saxon cuthe ſon forced make flighte kent hauing two duke oſlaue c • eb • ano ſlayne place called vuibbadune▪ came age cunning warre ſhort ſpace ouercame kingdomes saxon little regarding ſtormes paſte theyr father dayes hauing reſpect onely preſent proſperous éſtate liued ſo ſet breake good order truth iuſtice ſcante anye token remembraunce thereof remayned onelye raigne706 went rome became monke celred ſonne ethelred maruellous710 prowes againſt ina west saxon ſo miſerable vntimely death rained paſt viij yeres buried lichfielde ethelbalde raigned continuall peace many yeares and718 chronicle holande ro mai epiſtle boniface ethelbald procurement beruredus ſlaine hys ſubiects unto ethelbald boniface ye ſecōd biſhop verche holland archbiſhop men vpon rijne english māborn afterward martyred ſent epiſtle whiche ſette downe péece ſéene ſheweth partlye ſtate time ſerueth example time come moſt deare lorde preferred loue chriſt aboue king england edbaldus boniface archbiſhoppe germaine legate perpetual helth charitie loue chriſt acknowledge god reioyce heare proſperitie faith good workes ſory heare thing goeth againſt eyther ſucceſſe warre danger ſoule haue heard forbid thefte robbery loue peace defende widowe poore giue god thanks refuſe lawfull marriage preferring chaſtitie cōmendable ſith wallow leacherie adultery uirgins conſecrate god ſhamefull damnable doth confounde renowme bothe god man placing among idolators bicauſe violate temple god wherfore deare ſonne repent remember filthy thing thou gifte god raygneſt ouer ſo many nation ſhouldeſt great diſpleaſure god make thy ſelfe bonde ſlaue thyne owne fleſhly luſt wée haue hearde alſo parte noble men people mercians thyne euill example haue left theyr lawfull wiues haue defiled wiues alſo uirgins whiche howe farre differeth good order honeſtie let lawes ſtraunge nation touche auntient countrey saxon knowledge god eyther mayde hyr father houſe married huſband become aduoutreſſe ſhe ſhoulde ſtrangled hir hande cloſed hyr mouth corrupter ſhoulde hangedaduoutry amōg infidel pushed death vpon pitte aduoutreſſe buryed ſhée ſo vſed hyr garmentes cutte awaye downe gyrdleſtéede chaſte matrones dyd ſcourge whip hyr pricke hyr wyth kniues ſo ſent towne towne freſhe newe ſcourgers whipper méete whippe hir vntyll hadde killed hyr likewiſe womedeans moſte vncleane kinde people hadde thys manner vſage wyth huſbande beyng deade woman togyther wyth deade bodye ſhoulde caſte hyr ſelfe headlong fiered ſtacke pile woodde prepared burning theyr bodyes therefore gentile knowing god hadde ſo greate zeale chaſtitie howe muche deare ſonne required thy handes arte chriſtian king haue therefore compaſſion thyne owne ſoule ſpare greate number people thy fatherlye▪ example yet may beware offende god whoſe ſoules thou ſhalt giue accompte conſider alſo englſhe nation deſpiſing lawfull matrimonye doe encreaſe aduoutrye frenche men italian alſo verye pagan caſte téeth vpbrayde v withall ſuche coniunctions copulation ſhall ſpring vppe peakiſhe daſterdely people ſhall deſpiſe god wyth theyr wicked quality vndoe countrey came paſſe burgundians people prouance spaniardes sarazen haue many yeares aſſaulted theyr ſinnes whiche time paſt committed beſides told v take away priuileges church thereby giue euill example noble men like praye remember howe terrible vengeaunce god toke vppon king predeceſſours whiche committed ſuche offence rebuke wicked ſpirit came vpon colredus predeceſſoure whiche defiler uirgins breaker eccleſiaſticall priuileges ſitting royally among barrons dinner diuell plucked away ſoule without confeſſion ſinnes diuell alſo drewe ſuche rage oſredus king northumbers whiche guiltie ſame crime vile death loſte kingdome life luſty yong age alſo charles king fraunce whiche ouerthrewe church altered churche money hys owne vſe conſumed long tormēt fearefull death followeth therefore deare beloued ſonne fatherlye earneſt prayer beſéeche deſpiſe counſel father diligently admoniſhe highneſſe nothing commodious good king willinglye amend ſuch faultes warned salomō ſayth ſo loueth diſcipline loueth wiſdome therfore déere ſon declaring aduice beſéech liuing god ſonne jeſus chriſt lord hys holy ſpirit remember tranſitorie preſent life howe ſhorte momentane pleaſure filthie fleſhe vile ſhamefull thing man ſhall leaue euill example vnto poſteritie euer beginne therefore frame life better wayes amend error youth may obtayne prayſe men life eternall glorie life come wiſh highneſſe well fare encreaſe goodneſſe ethelbald ſlayne secgeſwald buryed hrependune beraredus murtherer ethelbald nothing worthy749 remembred ſtraightway ſlayne offa end méete traytour offa nephew ethelbald ſuccéeded ioyned battayle749 kineulfus king weast saxon gote victorie ſent ethelbert king eaſt angle promiſing great thing flatterie got palace cauſed beheaded vniuſtly inuaded kingdome eaſt angle cauſed reliques albon taken vp vita alboni s▪ albons builded put shrine aborned golde precious ſtones builded princely monaſterie founded abbey bathe tranſlated archbiſhops sea lichfield made dike betwéene wale kingdome offa dike mercy ditch extendeth south part bristow ouer mountaynes wale ſo north toward flint vnder hill coale euen mouth dee north sea raigned xxxix yeares dyed oflay buryed chappell ſtoode onofflay bancke riuer ouſe ¶ aethelfride two yeares life bernitianus aethelrike ſonne ida raigned prouinces of582 wil malme deirie bernicia fiue yeares ethelfride brother ethelricus made greater ſpoyle ofmarianus floriacenſis britaines king angle vnpeopled ſubdued countreys made ſame tributarie habitable engliſhmen wherefore aadan king scottes greately moued happie ſucceſſe came againſt mighty army ouercome put flight saxon whiche battell fought ethelfreth place called degſaſtan eleuenth yeare raigne firſt yeare phoca emperoure king alſo long time leuyed newe power according auguſtine archbiſhop canterbury ſpoken marched toward citie legious britaines called cairlegion firſt ſlew 1200 monckes aſſembled make prayer vnto god1200 monkes ſlayne good ſucceſſe souldioures battell afterward ouerthrewe whole power northumberland marianus floriacen wi king ethelfride anno 626 paulinus thirde biſhop rochester conſtituted iuſtus archbiſhop canterburie biſhop ouer northumbers ſente eadbald edwine king nation wife daughter king ethelbert ſiſter ſayde king eadbald certayne deſperate fellowe named eomer ſente vnto king edwine guicheline king weaſt saxon came vnto eaſter day hauing naked weapen vnder garment throughe brytaine whiche way ſoeuer king edwines dominion lay weake woman mighte haue walked hir newe borne babe ouer without domage moreouer refreſhing wayfaring men ordained cuppes yroncuppes braſſe high vvayes braſſe faſtned ſuch cleare wels fountaines runne wayes ſide whych cuppes man durſt touch owne preſent vſe neceſſity loue good wil bare prince ye time raigne ſo honored loued triumphant banner borne war peace whereſoeuer went abroad death edwine kingdome northumberland againe diuided osriche ſonne elfrike edwin vnckle ſuccéeded633 gouernance deira eanfride ſonne ethelfride ruled ye bernicians theſe forſaking chriſtian profeſſion wherein inſtructed yéelded themſelues defiled filth idolatry thys apoſtacie reuenged cedwall king ye brytans ſlewe bothe tragicall ſlaughter ſpoyled northumberland oswald brother eanfride gouerned kingdom634 ſmall army ouercame brytans ſlewe cedwall theyr king deniſeburne ſent aidan scot aduance ye chriſtian religion among people aſſigning iſle lindisfarne holy iland sea hée greatly enlarged kingdome reconciled deirians bernitians whych deadly hate one raigned viij yeres ſlaine cruel battel maſerfielde penda king mercia canonized sainct ſonne oſwald hée murthered oſwy ſonne oſrike ruled deira béeing traiterouſly deliuered vnto ingethling whereliber lichfield • rudbern • afterwarde monaſterie erected length deliuered country forraine egfride lawfull ſonne inherited northumberland 670 depoſed wilfride biſhoprike appoynted two biſhops ouer northumbers mildred otherwiſe called etheldred wife would meanes accompany hir huſband continued uirgine ſhe bin maried twelue yeares tooke handes wilfride vaile habite nunne builte monaſterie eely ſhe abbeſſe egfride hir huſband fought battell edilfride king mercia reconciled theodore
