kinegilſus ſuccéeded fought a67 • battell againſt wulfere king mercia place called bidanheafod raigned two yeares kenewinus ſonne kinnegilſus chaſed britaines euen676 sea ſhore raigned nine yeares cadwalla nephew ceauline ſuccéeded kingdome685 ſlew berthune duke south saxon broughtmarianus prouince vnder gréeuous bondage brother mull waſted kent ſubdued ile wight till time giuē idolatrie wherof purged giuing fourth part therof biſhop wilfride appoynted preacher conuerte people ile chriſtianitie ceadwalla agayne ſpoyling countrey kent brother moll xij knightes ſlaine fire caſt vpon tune euen baptiſed gaue tithe tenth god pray ſpoyles gotten hiswil malme owne vſe whome ſaith malmeſburie although prayſe affection allow example written ſo offereth ſacrifice poore folkes good doth ſacrifice ſonne ſight father done went rome baptiſed raigned two yeares ouer weſt saxon ine raigned among weſt saxon noble man great687 aſſer power wiſedome therewith valiant hardie feates armes expert mainteined ſuch warre againſt kentiſh saxon conſtrayned ſéeke intreate meanes peace giuing ſame great giftes 30000 mancas péeces gold ſo named ine ſonne kenred ſonne ceadwolde brother keadwold ſonne chenling ſonnemarian kenri ſonne cerdic firſt king weaſt saxon man builded firſt colledge welles colledge vvelles abbey glaſtenbury builded alſo builded abbey glastenburie payde peter penny firſt rome gouerned weaſt saxon ſpace ſeauen thirtie yeares earneſt laboure hys wife etheldreda abbeſſe barking eſſex gaue vp royall dignitie went rome ethelard kinſman father ſide ine ſuccéeded in726 kingdome notwithſtanding oſwald yong man king bloud diſturbe beginning raignewil malme ſtirred vp rebellion among inhabitant long died ethelard raigned quietly fouretéene yeares enthrede kinſman made warre ethelwald king mercia againſt britaines victorie hys tyme appeared two blaſing starres raſting burning brand towards north heblaſing starres raigned ſixtéene yeares engliſhmen buryed bodyes dead antiqui britan eccleſi buriall churchyardes city vntill time cuthbert archbiſhop canterburie procured pope city ſhould poynted churchyardes sigebert made king weaſt saxon cruell757 w malme scal cro •• tirannous towards ſubiects chāged antient lawes cuſtomes owne luſt pleaſure bycauſe certayne noble man ſome deale ſharply aduertiſed change manner put cruell death ſo muche continued malice would amend depriued al kingly authoritiea tirant came miſerable end shamefull death laſtly perſon forlorne wandring wood hiding himſelfe caues wilde beaſtes ſlayne andreds walde swineheard whoſe lorde mayſter called cumbra wrongfully put death whē raigned one yeare kenulphus bloud cerdicus appeaſed certayne757 murmours grudge amongſt people depoſing predeceſſor sigebert founded thebishops ſea vvelles founded cathedrall churche welles haunted woman kept merton ſlayne treaſon one olio kinſman sigebert late king raigned nine twentie yeares buryed winchester brithricus bloud cerdicus made king of786 weaſt saxon maryed eadburga daughter offa king mercia whoſe power expelled egbert vnder king lordſhip weaſt saxon tyme rayned blond whiche falling mensbloud rayned clothes appeared like croſſes anno 800 dane arriued ile called portland dane firſt ariued land puiſſance brithricus king saxon ouercome donmouth driuen backe compelled auoyde land marianus king poyfoned vvife brithricus poyſoned wife ethelburga raigned ſeauētéene yeares buryed warham déede noble ordeyned thenceforth king wiues ſhould called quéenes ſuffered ſitte place eſtate eadburge infinite treaſure fled france offering greate portion hir golde king charles france ſayd vnto hir chooſe eadburge whome thou wilte haue thy huſband ſonne ſhe anſwered choyſe granted chooſe ſonne bycauſe younger quoth charles thou hadſt choſenafter vvicked life follovved miſerable end queene eadburge thou ſhouldeſt haue ſonne bycauſe thou haſt choſen ſonne thou ſhalt haue neyther gaue hir monaſterie wherein ſhe profeſſed hirſelfe nunne became abbeſſe yeares afterwards committing adulterie lay man caſt monaſterie ſhe ended hir life pouertie miſeriehoueden many haue ſéene hir heard ſayth mine author aſſerius aſſer egbrichus obtayned gouernement weaſt saxon 802 tamed welchmen vanquiſhed bertulphus king mercians hellendune ſubdued obeyſancew malme kentiſh saxon eaſt saxon northumbers cauſed braſen image cadwaline king britaines béescal croni throwen downe lande called britaine anglia england crowned wincheſter britaine firſt named england 33 yeare raigne dane ariued lindisferne dane arriued heere sca cro foughte engliſhmen carham two biſhops two earles greate number engliſh people ſlayne two yeares y• dane ariued weſt wale egbright ouercame hengiſtendon raigned ouer moſt part england ſpace ſeauen thirtie yeares ſeauen monethes buryed winchester adelnulfus ſonne egbrichus beganne raigne ouer8 • 9 wil malme parte englande tooke wife iudith daughter king france hir four ſonnes king time came great armie pagan dane alredus riusall 350 ship mouth thamis ſo london ſpoyled put flight beorthulfe king mercia dane ſpoyle london power came bid battel dane went armie southerie adhelnulfus ſonne adhelbald great army came againſt foreſayd dane place called aolea fought cruell battell wherein moſt parte dane ſlayne ſame yeare adhelſtane ſonne adhelfus andsca cro calchere y• earle ſlew great armie paganes sandwich kent tooke nine shippes adhelnulfus ſent ſonne alfride rome great number noble men time pope leo confirmed ſaid alfride tooke ſonne adoption alſo conſecrated king adhelnulfus make tenth part kingdometenth giuen church king adelnulfus frée tribute ſeruice king gaue ſerue chriſt churche ſame yeare wente rome repaired engliſheenglish schoole rome repayred schole firſt founded offa king mercy meane ſeaſon ſonne adhelbald rebelling vſurped kingdome ſo adhelnulfus returned forced deuide kingdome take worſe part raigned eightéene yeares buryed winchester ſayth aſſer aſſer adhelbald raigned father againſt god the857 worthineſſe chriſtianitie yea cōtrarie cuſtome paganes preſumed hys father marriage bedde greate infamie married iudith french king daughter raigned fatherflori wigor two yeares buryed shirborne athelbrict brother athelbald tooke vnder dominion860 kent southery suſſex time greate armie paganes inuadeddanes inuade ſpoyle vvincheſter ſpoyled citie wincheſter returned great pray towards ship oſrike earle hampton folke adhelnulfus earle barkeſhire men met farre towne ioyned battell paganes ſlayne euery corner chriſtians kept field norman dane made firme league etheldred brother adhelbrict receyued kingdome866 weaſt saxon firſte yeare raigne great nauie paganes came england remayned winter kingdome eaſt england anno 871▪ paganes came reading barkeſhire caſt great ditch wall betwixt two riuers thames kynetan right ſide ſaid towne adhelnulfus earle barkeſhire armie mette paganes place called englefield paganes worſt many ſlaine reſt put flight etheldred king weaſt saxon aelfrede brother came reading foughten fierce cruell battell laſt christian fled paganes victorie chriſtians within four dayes fought battell paganes aſſendune paganes deuided themſeluesbattayle aſſendune two battels two king chriſtians ſawe likewiſe deuided armie two companyes determined king ethelred battell ſhoulde goe againſte two pagan king battell brother aelfrede ſette enemiessca cron brother come ſtraight way ſet vpon though place battel vnequall pagan gotten higher grounde chriſtians brought battel valley place one onely thorne trée ſhort trée battels met ioyned wher long time fought hubba one king fiue earles many thouſandes moe pagan ſlaine chaſed great heape ſtones layd copped vp hubba buried place called hubbeſlow hubbeſlovv done king etheldred brother aelfrede sca cro ſhortly gathered power againe fight wyth pagan baſing long ſore battayle pagan victorie battayle came another armye pagan frompagans vanquished beyonde ſeas ioyned firſt king burgoredus death pagan ſubduing ye whole kingdome mercy whiche committed ceonulfus next yeare one part pagan wintered northumberlande neare riuer tyne ſubdued whole countrey parte went guthram ſhippes drowned • anauing kyng aelfrede purſuing armie went lande excester toke pledge alſo othe depart ſpéede yeare following dane • ame chipingham manner king ſcituate left ſide wiltſhire wintred compelling many weast saxon leaue countrey goe beyonde ſeas reſt remayned subdued▪ king aelfrede himſelfe ofttimes brought ſuch miſerie yt none people knew become time forced hide hymwithaſſer spe histo ri ciren cowhearde somerſetſhire ſatte fire preparing bowes ſhaftes cowherdes wife baking breade coales threw king bowes ſhaftes aſide ſaid thou fellow doſt thou turn bread thou ſéeſt burne thou art glad eate ere halfe baked woman thought bin k aelfred made ſo many battels againſt dane gottē ſo manye victory god onely vouchſafe giue victorie ouer enemy alſo wearied thē ſight owne people ende ſhould knowe one god knées ſhall bow whoſe hand heart king conſiſteth brotherhinguar ſlayne deuonshire hinguar healfden wintered mercia made great ſlaughter chriſtians ſayled with▪ 23 ſhippes deuonſhire great miſchief thethe enſigne dane vvas rauen alredus riual moſt part people ſlain reſt eſcaped fléeing theyr ſhippes battayle among many rich ſpoyles taken banner enſigne called reafan among dane greate eſtimation imbrodered thrée ſiſters hinguar hubba ye daughter lodbroke king aelfrede made caſtel aethelingei ethelyngey noble ilande egbrights ſtore▪ thence went petram egebrichti eaſtſide chace called sal nudum latine silua magna y• great wood met al inhabitant hāpſhire whiche ſawe king reioyced though bene riſen death life king army wente ethandune fought againſt pagan made great ſlaughter purſued reſte caſtell xiiij dayes deſired peace gaue pledge toke othe depart realme gythram king receiued baptiſme harde ethelingſey place called alre whome aelfrede receyued bée hysgythram king dane chriſtened chicheſter godſonne yeare 879 pagan went chipnan cirenceaster remayned one yeare ſame yeare great armye pagan came beyonde sea andfulham wintered fullanham harde riuer banniſhing dunstane became odible hys ſubiectes northumbers people middle englande roſe againſt depriued raignedthe king depriued four yeres dyed buried new abbey winchester edgar peaceable brother edwyne crowned at959 king crovvned bathe bathe ſo excellent iuſtice ſharpe correction vice wel magiſtrates ſubiects neuer dayes vſed leſſe fellonie robber extortion briberie falſe officer chaſtiſed ye affirmeth edwarde elder brother doe better beléeue bycauſe like ſéeing thing wyth eye ſhoulde miſtake matter eſpeciallye writing quéene mother swanus meane time ſubdued al englande people feare yelded vnto hym euery ſide ouer whome moſt cruelly tryumphed long departed life geyneſburge left canutus ſonne ſucceſſour kingdome etheldrede hearing swanus dead leauing normandie duke▪ richard ſiſters ſonne emma wife child hadde hyr returned al ſpéede englande edmunde ſonne hys firſte wife mās ſtate truſtineſſe men ayde norman moued warre againſt enimie canutus finding himſelfe vnable matche went denmarke minding returne hither immediatly againe etheldred contrarie expectation thus reſtored kingdome ſhewed great crueltie vpon dane remained england ſparing neither man woman yong old therefore canutus deſirous reuenge ſame prepared new armie came england againſt etheldred al ſpéede could raging wide ſide fire ſword etheldred meane ſeaſon whether ſickneſſe ſorrow dyed raigned • taxtor wil greate ſtrength body alwayes vſed go armour ſurnamed ironſide ſixe battels againſt canutus king dane leyland penham hard gillingham dorcetſhire put dane flight shirestone held euen hand field notwithſtanding engliſhmen firſt beganne flée policie edricus duke lincolne merce cryededrike traytor runne away wretch edmond king ſlayne king edmond came london deliuer citizen whome part enimies beſéeged ſoone gone thence made ditch alſo round citie whereditch london riuer thamis doth runne dane fléeing king followed paſſing ouer brentford vanquiſhed notable victorie reſt ye dane remayned cnute whileslondon beſeeged land vvater edmond reſted ſet matter order againe beſéege london water lande citizen ſtoutely withſtoode repulſed wherefore ſhewed anger vpon countrey mercy ſpoyling townes uillages robbery burning murther caryed pray shippes whiche gathered togither riuer medway runneth rochester whence driuen king taking foorde brentford put flight ſlew great number ſixt laſt battell eſſendone eſſex néere rochford battell edmond gote victoriecogſhal sca cro edrike agayne playing traytor greate ſlaughter engliſhmen made honor englande ouerthrowen edmonde wente almoſt alone foote gloceſter hée gathered newe force ſet vpon enimies cnute purſued fledde hauing prepared army king themſelues attempted fight hand hand right thecombate kingdome kingdome ile olania seuerne combate wéeryed fell couenant deuide ſame ſo one halfe kingdome ſhoulde beengland deuided vnder canutus halfe vnder edmond edmond long dyed oxford whereas ſaide ſlayne treaſon edrike straton buryed glastenbury leauing edmonde edwarde child yong edrike long vnrewarded according deſertes hymſelfe making vaunt thereof vnto canutus baynardes castell london ſayde wiſe thus haue done canutus loue théeedrikus traytor whome anſwered ſaying thou ſhalt dye well thou art woorthy bycauſe thou art giltie treaſon againſt god thou haſt ſlayne thine owne lord king ioyned league brother bloud vpon thine england anno 1051 euſtace earle bullogne wifefloriacen goda ſiſter king edward arriued douer one men quarelling aboute lodging ſlewe one towneſmen reuenge whereof quareller company many towne ſlayne whiche ſo muche offended godwine earle kent aſſembled great power wherewith marched toward gloceſter king lay vnto whome ſent meſſengers denounce warre except would deliuer euſtace fellow norman bolognians held caſtell dominion kent godwins armie entered gloceſter agréed day appoynted king earle godwine ſhould méete london thus departing time king increaſing armie ledde ſame london godwine power came southwarke ſide riuer thamis bycauſe armie little little ſtipped fledde king forthwith pronounced fiue ſonnes baniſhed ſtraightwayes wife two ſonnes came thorney shippe laden golde siluer precious thing ſayled towarde flanders ſonnes tooke shippe bristow ſayled ireland next yeare harold leofwine ſonnes earle godwine returning ireland entred seuerne arriued many shippes somerſet dorſetſhires ſpoyled many townes countrey ſlew many people returned pray ſayle porteſmouth c earle godwine landed kent gathered power ſayled ile wight waſting along sea coaſtes till ſonnes harold leofwine came nauy come togither take courſe vp riuer thamis came southwarke ſtayed tide weyed vp anchor finding none offered reſiſt bridge ſayled vp south ſide riuer armie land placing ſelfe vppon banckes ſide made ſhew thicke terrible battayle nauie turned toward north ſhore though would haue compaſſed king nauie king godwine abhorred fight againſte owne kindred countreymen wherefore peace made godwine ſonnes reſtored former honor norman baniſhed land william malmeſbury writeth certayne yong woman w malme king euill healed king terribly diſeaſed reaſon humor gathered hir necke great ſwelling kernel came king edward right hand dipped water handled hir necke forthwith ye hardneſſe breake wormes matter ranne noyſome dwelling aſſwaged ſo ſhe perfectly hole faire ſkinned ere wéeke ended knewe life ſayd oft cured plague normandy edward raigned thrée twentie yeres ſixe monethest rudborn odde dayes buryed day epiphanie abbey saint peeter westminster newly builded ſame day harold eldeſt ſonne godwine earle kent brother edgitha quéene hauing obteyned fayth nobilitie tooke crowne leofrike earle mercia hereford founded monaſterie couentrie anno 1044 alſo granted great priuiledges towne harold might ſome behalfe ſéeme make the1066 yeare lord beginneth heere chriſtmas yong edgar amendes wrong done gaue earledome oxford ſo king made earle meane ſeaſon england began toſſed turmoyled warres within without diſheriting right heire alwayes wont beginning ciuill warres 24 day aprill comete appeared people land alſo part world ſeauen dayes toftus enuying men ſaid proſperitie • og houed simon • nel gualter couen brother ſtirred vp trouble realme ioyning himſelfe harold king norway aſſaulted england warlike ſort ſea land whoſe attempt while harold england prepared withſtand william duke normandy notwithſtāding baſtardvvilliam conquerour couſyn king edvvard mother ſide kinne saint edward thirde fourth degrée conſanguinitie ſéeing conuenient time occaſion offered take kingdome gathered nauie 896 shippes came england well appoynted armie alledging right title due gift king edward kinſman alſo couenant made othe eſtabliſhed betwixt harold landed pemſey nine milesgualter couen hastings 28 september harold notwithſtanding bare men reaſon battel fought againſt toftus men norway yet hearing williams comming wente ſtraightwayes againſte army broughte aray battell fought wherin great ſlaughter engliſhmen made andengland conquered vvoden bovves arovves norman gote victorie eſpecially meanes wodden bowes arrowes engliſhmen vſe duke william commanded men thatio rouſe ſome ſhould ſhoote directly forwarde ſome vpward reaſon whereof arrow ſhot vpward deſtroyed engliſh ſtouped arrow ſhot directly afore hand wounded ſtoode vpright king harold himſelfe valiantly fighting ſhotte theharold ſlayne braynes whereof dyed raigned nine monethes buryed priorie waltham sigebertus gemla • en w gemi •• cenſis gualterus couen hen hunting regiſter wodbridge chronicle normandy deſcription saxon mathew paris w malme flores hiſtoriarū founded battell fought haſtings suſſex vppon fourtéenth day october saterday yeare oure lord 1066 ſlayne engliſhmen 67974 norman 6013 ſaith mathew paris dolefull deſtruction ſwéete pleaſant land king whereof meaning saxon firſte comming barbarous countenance geſture warlike ſort prouoked men malice hatred towards ouercame al men warre ſubtiltie receyued chriſtian faith little little applyed diligence vnto religion neglected exerciſe armour king change habite ſome rome ſome owne countrey ſought change temporall kingdomes euerlaſting kingdomes many life time embraced worldly thing yet diſtribute treaſures vnto workes mercy afterwards charitie waxed colde ſtudie trauaile religion ſlaked came deſtruction inhabitant firſt comming dane expulſing engliſhmen norman noble men giuing themſelues gluttonie lecherie goe church morning chriſtian men vſe doe lying chamber dalying woman heare prieſt haſtilie rattle vp diuine ſeruice clerkes alſo taken order one learned grammer euery one wondered men generally gaue themſelues drinking gulling ſpent day night ſuch exerciſes till vomited saxon ware garmentes midde knée heare rounded beardes ſhauen ſaue ouerlip armes adorned golden bracelet andw malme ſkinne paynted printed c ¶ thus endeth reigne saxon firſt ſent vortiger yeare lord 450 nowe continued ſometimes warres britaines dane norman ſpace ſixe hundred yeares verſes thouſand ſixe ſixtie yeare vvas vve reade comete appeare engliſhmen lay dead normandie duke william englandvvard ſayle conquerde harold vvith men brought land bale ¶ king vvilliam conquerour william duke norman dieanno reg 1 ſurnamed conquerour baſtarde ſonne robert ſixte duke duchie cooſin germane vnto king edward mother ſide beganne dominion ouer realme england fourtéenth day october saterday yeare lord 1066 battayle hastings duke william came london great ioy receyued cleargie people proclaymed king citie london thus yéelded vnto tooke iourney towardes caſtell douer ſubdue reſt kent alſo archbiſhop stigand egelſin abbot saint auguſtines chiefeſt lord gouernours kent perceyue conſider whole realme euill ſtate whereas realme england comming foreſayd duke william bondman well noble men common people without reſpect made ſubiecte vnto perpetuall bondage norman taking occaſion perill danger neighbor prouide ſafegard themſelues countrey cauſed aſſemble canterbury people countie kent declared peril danger imminent miſerie neighbour come pride inſolencie norman hardneſſe griefe bondage ſeruile eſtate wherevpon people rather chooſing end vnfortunate life ſubmit themſelues vnaccuſtomed yoke ſeruitude bondage common conſent determined méete duke william fight law countrey y• foreſayd stigand archbiſhop abbot egelſin chooſing rather die battell ſée nation ſo euill eſtate encouraged example holy machabees became captayne armie day appoynted people met swaneſcombe two mile weſt graueſend hidden wood lay priuily wayte comming foreſayd duke william bycauſe hurt wary ſuch caſes agréed hande duke come paſſages euery ſide ſtopped end ſhould way able eſcape euery one well horſemen footemen ſhould beare boughes hand next day whē duke come field territory néere vnto swaneſcombe ſaw countrey ſet placed round bin ſtirring mouing wood meane pace approched drewe néere vnto great diſcomfiture mind wondered ſight ſoone captaynes kentiſhmen ſawe duke william encloſed middeſt armie cauſed trumpet ſounded banner diſplayed threw downe boughes bowes bent ſwords drawne ſpeares kinde weapon ſtretched forthe ſhewed themſelues readie fight duke william ſtoode maruell ſore aſtonied amazed thought already england faſt fiſt diſpaire owne life therefore behalfe kentiſhmen ſent vnto duke william archbiſhop stigand egelſin abbot saint augustine told meſſage ſort lord duke behold people kent commeth forth méete receiue liege lord requiring hand thing pertayne peace vnder condition people kent may enioy euer antient liberty may euermore vſe lawes cuſtomes countrey otherwiſe ready preſently bidde battell minded rather die héere altogither departe lawes cuſtomes countrey ſubmit themſelues bondage whereof yet neuer experience duke ſéeing himſelf driuen ſuch ſtraight narrow pinch conſulted came prudently conſidering ſhould take repulſe diſpleaſure hand people key england euer done ſhould vndone againe effect hope ſafetie ſhoulde ſtande danger ieopardy ſo willingly wiſely granted people kent requeſt couenant eſtabliſhed pledge giuen ſides kentiſhmen ioyfull conducted norman alſo glad vnto rochester yéelded vp duke earledome kent noble caſtell douer thus antiente liberty englande lawes cuſtomes countrey whiche comming duke william normandy equally kept throughout england induſtrie earneſt trauell archbiſhopthe antient liberty lavves england remayne kent thomas sprot wil thorne stigand egelſin abbot saint auguſtines remayne inuiolably obſerued vntill day onely countie kent thus farre thomas sprot william thorne duke william waſted suſſex hampſhire southery marianus floriacen wigor middleſex hertfortſhire ceaſſing burne townes ſley people till came barkehamſteed archbiſhop alredus wolſtan biſhop worceſter wilferus biſhop hereford clito edgar earles edwine morcare euery one noble men london came giuing pledge ſubmitted themſelues ſware fealtie whome alſo made league neuertheleſſe permitted army ſtill burne townes take ſpoyleschro albani time abbot saint albons calledfrederike abbot albons policie againſt duke vvilliam fretherike hearing comming duke william hartfordſhire cauſed wood betwixt london saint albons felled man could eyther ride go way thus abbot kept monaſterie duke william might come fayne coaſt ouer caſtell barkehamſteede vnder ſuretie ſent frederike abbot saint albons demanded ſuch felling wood made place frederike anſwered ſaide spirituall men land done indeuour ſhoulde haue bin thy power haue entred land ſo farre spiritualtie great power duke william anſwered may liue reioyce ſhall looſe power make leſſe ſpecially beginne thée abbot thought ſaid farre ſoone might departed home called chapiter bréethrē tolde duke william tooke leaue went eely neuer returned duke william toke much liuelode saint albons chriſtmaſſe would crowned glocester whitſontide westminster eaſter winchester theſe feaſtes kept great royaltie made cōmons bare himſelfe riche proude port great belly balde heade bigge man part body good archer right fewe might bende bowe brought iewes rhone inhabite whē chriſtmaſſe approched marched al armyduke vvilliam crovvned london mighte crowned king done chriſtmaſſe daye aldred archbiſhoppe yorke stigande canturburie bycauſe came lawfully dignitie receyued homage othe fidelitie anno 1070 sedit epiſcopus annos 20 ſame engliſh william man famous wiſedome holyneſſe life firſt saint edward king confeſſour familiar late preferred byſhoppe london long hys prudencie ſincere fidelitie admitted counſel moſte victorious prince william king englande name firſt obteyned ſame great large priuiledges famous citie senate citizen lō hauing well deſerued haue made continued biſhop xx yeares died yere chriſt natiuitie 1070 theſe marble monument thee thy citizen aſsigne rewardes father far vnfit thoſe deſerts thine thee vnto faithfull friend thy london people founde thys towne ſmall weyght ſtay ſure ſounde liberty reſtorde mean thee haue publike weale meanes thee large gift haue felte ſeen thy rich ſtocke beautie braue one houre hathe ſuppreſt yet theſe thy vertues good deedes v euer reſte king william leauing brother odo byſhop bayon marianus ypodigm • neuſtri • william fitz osberne made earle hereforde warden england retourned normandie time bent ſhrink hée countrey biſhoppes palace thatsea cro himſelfe receyued honourablye king william came afterward vpon ſlewe euery one agelricus biſhop durham accuſed treaſon was1069 impriſoned westminster brother egelwine made biſhop ſoone baniſhed engliſhmen fledde englande hauyng edgar captaine returned scotlande ſodainely ſet vpon gariſons king william ſette yorke put flighte ſlewe poſſeſſed citie pronounced edgar king long king william came great armye recouered thr citie conſtrayning edgar retourne scollande edgar ſeeing coulde make partye good king william adioyned vnto hym canutus king dane promiſing hym halfe kingdome thus entred englande came yorke normaines left defende citie ſetteyorke brent ſuburbes fire enimies ſhoulde haue commoditie winde droue fire high ſet cittie fire ſo gariſons forced flée enimies hand • kirmiſh ſlaine 3000▪ norman wherevppon north parte england fell william edgar william word ſlaughter men hée great trauel came yorke fought hys enimies put flighte canutus dane got ſhippes edgar engliſhmen eſcaped retourned scotland king william ſpoyled countrey beyonde humber dearth england men eate horſſes anno reg 4 man flesh good meate ioh taxtor 1070 monaſteries rifled cattes dogges man fleſh king william bereaued monaſteries abbayes englande theyr golde ſiluer ſparing neyther chalice ſhrine appropriating ſayd monaſteries abbayes himſelfe alſo brought vnder knightes ſeruice thoſe biſhoprickes abbayes held barony bin frée ſecular bondage appointing howe many ſouldiours ſhould finde ſucceſſours time warre counſel winchester stigand depoſed biſhop durham many cleargie laitie kéeping thenoble men fled wooddes able abyde king diſpleaſure laſt came ile elie herewarde captaine ſore afflicted countrey king william beſieging ile ſauing herewarde ſubmitted pleſure committed ſome perpetual priſon ſome put death ſome ranſomed hereward ſtrong hande broughte men ile eſcaped caſtell lede kent builded creueken anno reg 6 ex libro • caſtel woltheopus roger trauelled expel k williā kingdome cōſpiracie concluded mariage y• conſpiracie citie norwich forthwith ſente king denmarke deſiring ayde hauing confederated walchmen euerye one came robbed kyngs townes king william came ſodainly normandie toke earles committing priſon walchmen cauſed haue theyr eye put ſome hanged kanut ſonne swayne hacon earle cameanno reg 9 denmarke 200 ſaile town pontfrait land lying hilbert lacy norman caſtel town lāds pontfraite longed y• cōqueſt one richard aſhnalde iſſue ailricke swane adam came two daughter one maried gaulfride neuile thomas burgh afore ſhewed ſucceſſors thoſe knightes wéete radulphus fitz algede winiard le douerſhe c gaue foreſayde land called knighten gild ſame church othowerus accolinillus otto gefferey earle estſex william archbiſhop legate romiſh churche biſhops engliſh nation nobilitie tooke othe defend againſt men kingdome daughter ſhe ſuruiued hir father except deceaſſe begate ſome ſonne ſuccéede king alſo pacified commanded brother biſhoppe winchester bring empreſſe vnto bristowe himſelf followed earle robert army empreſſe ſtayed bristow till october went glocester hir comming thither knowen mile high coneſtable many noble toke part hyr againſt king stephen king beſieged wallingforde caſtell profited notvvalingford caſtel beſieged floriacenſis therefore rayſing tower woodde ſtuffed men warre went win caſtell malmeſburie armye earle robert wanne citie worcester▪ brent moſte part laden ſpoyle departed thence▪ shirife citie reuenge hereof deſtroyed towne sudley ſpoyle thereof retourned worcester king great army came oxford worcester gaue honour high coneſtableſhipanno reg 5 taken mile glocester vnto william ſonne walter beauchampe shirife worcester retourned oxforde ſo saliſburie king went townes men taken ſlaine brent church wherevnto fled one rich others taken led anno reg 6 notinghā brent▪ owne houſe taker ſhewe hys treaſure lay bringing low ſeller whileſt buſie break open locke coffer conueyed ſelf away ſhutting doores ſet ſire ye houſe ſoothe théeues number thirtie brent reaſon fire towne ſet fire brent kyng stephen beſieged lincolne againſte ranulph earle chester roberte earle glocester came great1141 lincolne beſieged king stephen taken power reſcued ſame chaſed kyngs armye tooke pryſoner candlemas day firſte glocester bristowe committed priſon empreſſe reioycing hir good happe departed glocester came cicester byſhops baron greate number thence ſhe went winchester mette hir lordes ſpirituall temporall great number citie tower crowne realme deliuered hir hand biſhop winchester king stephen brotherthe empreſſe obtayneth thè crovvne accurſed al ſtoode againſt empreſſe bleſſed thoſe tooke hir part thence ſhe departed wilton archbiſhoppe canturburie came ſaluted hyr eaſter paſte ſhe went reding▪ ſhe receiued honour mighte thence ſhe went oxforde caſtell deliuered vnto hyr robert de olly went ſhe saint albons receyued honour citizen london came yéelded citie hir wherevpon ſhe went london ſo westminster ſhe receyued proceſſion remained certain dayes taking order ſtate realme king steuens wife many péeres realm madeypodigma geruaſius floriacenſis ſuite empreſſe haue king reſtored libertye kingdome promiſing perſwade hym become monke ſhe woulde heare biſhop winchester requeſted hir giue vnto euſtace nephew king steuens ſonne father earledome woulde citizen london required hir reſtore kyng edwardes lawes ſhe puffed vp pride would graunte theyr requeſte wherevppon conſpired take hir priſoner ſhe aduertiſed hereof fled ſhamethe empreſſe fledde leauing behinde hir hir furniture houſholde apparell henrie biſhop winchester caſting way deliuer brother perſwaded londoner ayde empreſſe got hir oxforde frō thence gloucester andypodigma floriacences geruaſius thē hir aſſured friend mile oxforde bycauſe ſhe truſted moſt ſhe honour gaue earledome heneforde hauing got great army lammes wente againe winchester lodged caſtel biſhop abaſhed hir ſodayn cōming departed one gate ſhe came another getting great army help londoner beſieged citie ſeconde auguſt committed citie thevvincheſter brent geruaſius floriacenſis fire whiche nunry houſes office twentie church ſome write xl greate part citie monaſterie saint grimbald houſes thereto belonging brought aſhes exaltation croſſe empreſſe wearied long ſiege got hir horſſebacke hir brother reginalde earle cornewal many earle robert followed great number lord knight biſhops men ſetting ſlewe tooke great number empreſſe fled caſtel lutegerſhal heauy andthe empreſſe fled almoſt deade feare thence ſhe brought caſtell vies thence glocester bound horſelitter like deade carcaſſe earle robert purſued taken stobbridge earle gloſter taken erle waren many preſented quéene new entred warwel c bookes ornament nun taken borne away men ſlaine euen altar theſe thing thus done biſhops wroth ſomewhat appeaſed couetouſneſſe encreaſed ſo prompted therto prior newe monaſterie winchester aniowe ſent foure noble men furniture1146 warriours erle robert requeſting ſend ouer ſonne henrie néede required would ſende backe againe ſpéede earle agréeing requeſt brought yong henrie warham tooke thence erle chester came recouer y• towne could bring purpoſe paſſe anno reg 13 empreſſe vvent normandie citizen ſhewed ſuch defence empreſſe weried diſcorde engliſh nation went ouer normandie choſing choſen menne armes came englande takyng wyth hym ranulph earle chester roger earle hereford diuerſe went dauid king scottes ioy fully receiued made knight king stephen heard dauid kyng scottes ſtrength henne ſonne empreſſe weſtern lord togither carlile came yorke greate army feare ſhould attempt thing againſt citie ſo lay moneth auguſt length one partye wel departed euſtacius king ſonne béeing made knighte exerciſed manye cruelty landes earles tooke parte wyth henrie empreſſe ſonne henrie empreſſe ſon ſailed normandie al englād anno reg 15 1150 anno reg 16 ex charta regia 1151 ypodigma geruaſiu • ful trouble noyſe warre ſet forth fire rapyne diſcorde betwixt king stephen certaine earles toke part henrie ſon empreſſe robert earle ferrers founded abbay meriual geffrey plantagenet earle aniow duke normandie deceaſed left ſonne henrie heire king stephen beſieged caſtell worcester hevvorceſter beſieged anno reg 17 coulde winne laſt yeare ſawe alſo coulde obtaine purpoſe builded two caſtels ſame ſtuffing garriſons wēt thence counſel roberte earle leicester king caſtels ouerthrowen caſtel beſieged deliuered daunger diuorcement made betwéen lewes king france 1152 mathew paris geruaſius doro elianor hys quéene bycauſe kinne fourth degrée moreouer ſhe defamed adulterie infidel c henrie duke normandie maried elianor whō lewes king fraunce deuorced hir ſon named william kyng stephen called parliamente london declaryng theobalde archebyſhoppe canturburie byſhoppes howe woulde vtterly diſherite henrie duke normandie confirme owne ſonne euſtace ſucceſſour crowning king pope ſent commaundement archbiſhoppe prohibiting crowne king stephen ſonne bycauſe father vſurped kingdome contrarie othe whiche thing thought brought paſſe ſubtile policie thomas becket chaplaine borne london king stephen ſonne little offended therewith cauſed biſhops primate cloſed vp houſe threatning terror extort prayer price could obtain archbiſhop ſtiffely ſtanding purpoſe ſome biſhops fear went length archbiſhop maruellous hap eſcaping got ouer thamis ſo douer thence tranſporting ouer ſeas eſcaped threates king ſonne depriued ſon coueted honour quéene mawde deceaſed buried feuerſham anno reg 18 norvvich increaſed chronicle brom▪ holma people norwich obtained king haue coroner baylifes yt time officer ſergeant king kept court ſay 37 yeare hemie third licence incloſe towne ditch got ſundry hundreds▪ c henrie duke normandie furniſhed army came1153 englande firſt comming wan caſtell towne malmeſburie thenceforth roberte noble earle leicester began take duke part furniſh thing neceſſarie thirtie caſtels moe counſel kept ſubmitted themſelues duke length decréed y• king ſhould talke duke touching peace ſo met place wher y• thamis moſt narrow one ſtanding one ſide long talke returned duke men king ſo laying weapon euery man departed peace euſtace king ſonne angry hys father agréeing peace therefore rage departed frompolicraticon iohn sarisburien iohn number flemmings aſſembled witſa •• e innumerable multitude flemmings readye come ouer theyr meſſengers taken treaſon bewrayed elianor olde quéene cauſed sea coaſtes bée watched ouer againſt flaunders notwithſtanding erle iohn came ſecréetely englande rayſe walchmen scottes king scottes woulde ayde hym walchmen partes kingstone windſore toke prayes abrode frenche king entred normandie founde ſmall reſiſtaunce wanne diuerſe townes giſors deliuered haſted towards roane beſieged great induſtrie robert earle leicester profited little ſo returned fraunce▪ earle iohn perceiuing treaſon diſcouered fortifyed hys caſtels paſſed ouer fraunce ioyned frenche king sherifes roger duke richard fitz alwyne maior henrie fitz alwyne king richard ſent mother archebiſhop rhoane come vnto hym almayne nowe enimies ſufficient ynoughconſuetud de lō phillip king fraunce quarrell arthur ſon geffrey iohns eldeſt brother duke brytaine made war vppon king iohn normandie toke diuerſe caſtels townes king iohn granted shirifewike london midleſex sherife vvike london let ferme citizen thereof 300 pound yerely paid auntient time bene ſo accuſtomed fermed king henrie firſt graunted ſame citizen 300 pounde yearely alſo gaue full aucthoritie choſe depriue sherifes theyr pleaſure sherifes arnolde fitz arnolde richard fitz barthelmew maior henrie fitz alwyne king iohn made lawe tunne wine poiters 1200 price vvines gual couen ſhould ſolde dearer twentie ſhillings anioye foure twentie ſhillings french wine fiue twentie ſhillings vnleſſe ſame french wine ſo good ſome woulde giue ſixe twentie ſhillings eyghte penny aboue ſexter wine poiters dearer twelue penny white wine aboue ſixe penny king iohn hauing made peace beyonde ſea required annoreg 2 taske aide realme xxx markes wherefore edict made euery plow land ſhould pay thrée ſhillings troubled lande ſore conſidering eſcuage went afore euery knight fée two markes whiche neuer payde aboue twentie ſhilling king deuorced wife iſabel earleking iohn deuorſed mathew paris ypodigma radul cogſhal glocesters daughter paſſed ouer ſea paide thirtie markes french king vanquiſhed enimies returned englande iſabel wife daughter earle angoleſme crowned hir quéene westminster eight october sherifes roger dorſet iames bartelmew maior henrie fitz alwyne king iohn went lincolne met william king scottes homage king scottes rotland lorde galloway many noble men homage one twētith day nouember noble man aquitaine named hugh brune rebelling1201 hugh brune rebelled againſt king iohn inuaded diuers part prouince bicauſe king maried daughter earle angoleſme ſayd brune affied cuſtodie wherefore paſſed ouer reſtrained rebel attemptes 25 june aroſe cruell tempeſt thunder ypodigma annoreg 3 tempeſtes lightning hayle vehemente raine deſtroyed corne cattell menne houſes brenning c 10 july another tempeſt much like former hapned ſo medowes could mowed hay downe carried away outragious courſe water ouerflowed grounde greate number fiſhes corruption water dyed many bridge borne downe corne hay caried away many men drowned ſo al men thought new deluge bene come sherifes walter fitz ali simon de adermanbury maior henrie fitz alwyne king iohn ſharplye warred vppon earle march 1202 radulphu • cog hugh brune earle eue hys brother béeing able reſiſt complayned phillip king france ſoueraigne chiefe lorde ſent ofttimes king iohn mouing ceaſe vexing woulde ſerue wherefore ſommoned ▪ annoreg 4 noble fraunce duke earle aquitaine anioy come vnto courte frenche king ſtande iudgement hys péeres kyng iohn denyedk iohn ſōmoned french king court wherevpon ſame courte adiudged hym depriued landes predeceſſours helde king fraunce c king phillip forth aſſembled armye inuaded caſtel buteuant normandie king richard buylded raſed ground tooke land hugh gorney caſtels tooke caſtell albomarle county eue land arch none reſiſting alſo arthure earle britayne made knight french king whoſearthure earle britayne taken yonger daughter fianced ſixtéene yeres olde wente hugh brune geffrey lucingnam 250 knightes beſéeged caſtell mirable quéene eleanor aunte encloſed king iohn came power deliuered mother daunger tooke nephew arthure william de brawſa diſpatched life ſome ſay hand uncle iohn king france inuaded caſtels normandy tooke liſle dandely caſtell vale de ruell whiche robert fitz water sayer de quincy many toke ſtrong caſtell vpon seyne builded king richard bin valiantly kept conneſtable chester sherifes walter browne william chamberlayne maior henry fitz alwyne king iohn doubting treaſon owne men december retourned englande gathered treate peace king france bycauſe worlde wente woulde agrée wiſe except arthure mighte deliuered aliue dead woulde haue siſter mariage land ſide sea shortly tooke falaiſe caen ſo forth countrey barflot de quincy father simon mountford marryed ſiſters ſayd robert sherifes thomas hauerell hamond bronde maior henry fitz alwyne fourtenth day january beganne froſt whiche continued till two twentith day marche ſogreat froſt 1205 grounde coulde bée tilled whereof came paſſe sommer folowing quarter wheate ſolde marke siluer many place englande dearth corne whiche parte dayes king henry ſeconde ſolde twelue penny quarter beanes peaſe halfe marke quarter otes forty penny wont ſolde foure penny alſo thenno reg 7 money ſo ſore clipped remedie haue renued king iohn gathered greate armyes menne haue gone ouer sea béeing ſayled onwarde voyage hée returned againe tooke eſcuage two markes halfe euery knightes fée englande pretending quarrell agaynſte hys baron bycauſe theyiohn taxtor would follow hym partes beyond sea sherifes iohn walgraue richard wincheſter maior henry fitz alwyne earle saliſburie king brother geffrey king ſonne begot concubine many other1206 ralph cogſhall anno reg 8 knightes gone ouer vayne charge ineſtimable bin layde aboute preparation made iourney greate thunder lightning bruſting thegreat thunder lightning hayle cloudes ſéene ſo men thought day dome bin come london except earles warren arundell chester penbroke ferrers saliſburie baron william brewer wente thoſe baron agaynſte king called themſelues armie god whereby ſuche feare came king durſt péepe windſore caſtell length appoynted méete baron meddowe betwixte stanes windſore mathew pari • king meeteth baron whiche appoyntemente hée obſerued graunted liberty withoute anye difficultie charter whereof dated giuen oure hand runningmede betwixt stanes windſore xvj june xvij raigne vnto whole realme ſworne while baron returned home king béeing left almoſt alone ſente pandolph legate rome ende apoſtolicke authoritie mighte make fruſtrate purpoſe baron alſo ſente walter biſhop winchester iohn biſhop norwich vnto realmes next adioyning procure souldioures promiſing landsthe pope excommunicateth baron large poſſeſſions meanes pandolph pope diſanulled foreſayde charter liberty graunted alſo excommunicated baron meſſengers procured great number men warrerocheſter beſeeged whiche landing douer king forthwith beſéeged rochester coneting brenne bridge ayde ſhould come beſéeged robert fitz walter defended bridge quenched fire neuertheleſſe long aſſaulte caſtell yéelded greate number straungers sea minding haue landed douer haue aydedstrangers drovv • ed mathew paris king againſte baron ſuddayne tempeſt drowned ſo aboute coaſt sea caſt vp ſuche multitude men woman child aire ſore infected putrified bodyes ſayde fortie thouſande eſcaped one aliue king promiſed people countreys norffolke suffolke iohn trauers andrew newland 28 septembersherifes mator ralph cogſhall william hardell 28 october king iohn deuided armie one halfe whereof hée put vnder leading sauarike de maulion poictouin fulco norman earle saliſburie baſtard brother gerard de sotingham fleming walter buca brabander himſelfe went againſt northernmen sauarike beſéeged caſtell plaſhy belonged geffrey maundeuill gaue themſelues waſte countrey chriſtmas day ſpoyled abbey tiltey radul cogſhal liber bernwel caryed away muche treaſure layde vp truſt diuers countrey newyeares day like cogſhall abbey thence wente saint edmondſburie ſo ile ely whiche ile beſéeged bycauſe dyuersile eely beſeeged knightes ladyes fledde thither ſubſtance thoſe robber entring iſle ſpared neyther ſexe ſtate tormentes compelled tell treaſure lay epiphany sayre de quincy earle winchester returned beyonde sea bringing one fortie shippes laden souldioures aboute feaſt purification lady beſéeged colchester caſtell hearingcolcheſter beſeeged baron london made haſt come ſuccour caſtell went backe saint edmondſburie king armie long time scottiſh sea ofttimes inuaded land baron thoſe coaſtes burning caſtels ſpoyling good whiche expedition went ſo farre well knowen become ſo much noyſed dead ſecretely buryed reding geffrey mandeuill dyed london wound receyued juſting buryed priorie trinitie london pope excommunicated baron peculiarthe baron excommunicate name canon paule london many eccleſiaſticall perſons baron remayned london appealed againſt ſentence taking exception againſt pronounced falſe ſuggeſtion baron ſent sayre de quincy philip baron ſent lodovvike king france earneſtly requeſting ſend ſonne lewes realme promiſing make king thereof french king refuſed till baron ſente 24 pledge beſt men ſonnes kingdome ſent ayde gwalo legate1216 ſent pope france forbid lewes go englande perſuaſions nothing preuayled wherefore excommunicated alſo abbot abbingdon renued excommunication againſt baron citizen london french came ayde midlent king beſéeged caſtell colcheſter dayes deliuered thecolcheſter taken frenchman kept cōdition might depart frée belonged engliſhmen ſhould ſuffered depart vpon reaſonable ranſome notwithſtanding ye engliſhmen put ſtraight priſon king taken hidingham caſtell belōging robert de vere earle oxford made haſt beſéege londō ye londoner ſet open theyr gate readie méet king tenne mile citie king vnderſtanding theyr boldneſſe multitude withdrewe himſelfe sauari • de malione ſodainely ſet vpon londoner looſing many men ſore beaten wounded almoſt death northren lordes recouering ſtrength beſiegedyorke beſ • eged yorke length receiuing aboue thouſand markes grā ted truce citizen till octaues pentecoſt londoner alſo toke lxv ſhips pirate beſids innumerable drowned beſieged theanno reg 18 riuer thamis meane time king hauing knowledge y• lewes ment come england ſent ouer french king y• biſhop winchester william marſhal elder trie could perſwade french king ſtay hys ſon iourney returned without audience king therefore marching along ſea coaſt fortified caſtels getting pledge fiue port gathered gret multitude ſhippes yarmouth linne dunwich hauens fraught men warre determined encounter frenchman ſea came arriue englande tempeſt aroſe north thoſe ſhips bruſed drowned driuen south partslevves arriued england ſea lewes hauing power readie cala • graueling whitſande northeaſt winde comming aboute ſet forward toward england ſome difficultie bycauſe ſide winde lāded stona ile thanet xix day may king iohn douer bycauſe ſouldiours ſtraungers durſt go againſte lewes fled towards gilforde lewes went ſtraight cā turburie receiued caſtell citie hys ſubiection caſtels kent douer onlyking iohn flect •• excepted came london honorablye receyued noble citizen altogither ſware fealtie homage westminster taking caſtels rygate guldforde ferneham haſted forward take king heard winchester raiſed vp ſtandarde dragon meant giue battel lewes came offer king iohn heard lewes approched layd dragon ſet fire foure part citie fled thedouer caſtel beſieged w • l packington citizen quickly quenched fire wente forth méete lewes receiuing ioyfully theyr cittie ſware fealtie came maner al erles baron realm taking caſtel odiham ye tower london returned kent xxij july beſieged caſtel douer continued ſame till xiiij october hubert de brugh gerard de scoting able longer abide aſſaultes obtained truce might ſend king iohn ſuccor whileſt thys ſiege remained king iohn went land conſuming fire ſword poſſeſſions baron alexander king scot baron northe came canturburie vnto lewes king marched norffolke suffolke til came lin appointing sauericeradulphur niger ralphe cogſhall de maulion captaine began fortify town ſayd filling belly much thereto greatly giuen got ſurfeyt therwithal fel laſke laſke left let bloud towne lindſey called lafforde belonging biſhop oftho r • dborne lincolne alſo meſſengers beſieged douer come declared caſe diſeaſe griefe conceyued thereat encreaſed moreouerthe king treaſure drovvned great ſorrow oppreſſed iourney hadde loſt ornamentes chapel treaſure cariages paſſage welstreame manye hys houſholde ſeruauntes drowned water quicke ſandes reaſon hadde vnaduiſedlye entred liber bernewell k fearing excommunicatiō came king northampton yéelding caſtels honor appertayned crowne king layed ſiege ral cogſhall bedford caſtel beſieged caſtel bedforde falcatius long kepte ſtrength ſiege september sherifes maior 1227 richard renger 28 october king blaming citizen london bycauſe hadde giuen lewes frenche king nowe deceaſed departure england 500 markes compelled pay like ſumme beſide xv parte theyr moueables burgeſes northampton hée toke 1200 markes counſell oxforde king proclaymed thatcharters canceled much nowe lawfull age woulde rule hymſelfe hys pleaſure forthwith made ye charter ye liberty forreſts fruſtrate alledging graunted while vnder warde power owne bodie ſo followed yt ſo woulde enioy liberty afore graunted muſte renewe charter king new ſeale ſuch price juſticiar awarded richard king brother returned englande made earle cornewal westminster hubert de burgo made earle kent shortly baron declared vnto king except would reſtore charter liberty foreſt lately canceled oxford would compel ſworde anno reg 12 sherifes maior 1228 anno reg 13 stephen bokerel henrie cocham 28 september roger duke 28 october king corrected meaſures weyghtes made bigger sommer king help proſecuted building newe churche saliſbuburie predeceſſour richard tranſlate william wincheſter robert fitz iohn 28 septem sherifes maior 1230 mathew paris darkeneſſe paules churche roger duke 28 october upon day saint paules conuerſition roger niger biſhop london maſſe cathedrall church saint paule greate multitude people ſodainely weather waxed darke one coulde ſcantly ſée another churche ſodainely horrible thunder clappe lighted churche ſame ſhaken though ſhoulde haue fallen darke cloude came ſuch lightning churche ſéemed fire ſuch ſtincke men thought ſhoulde haue died thouſandes men womenne ran churche aſtonied fell vppon grounde voyde al vnderſtanding none al multitude taried churche ſaue biſhoppe one deacon ſtoode ſtil high alter awayting wil godanno reg 15 king biſhops erles baron ſent pictauians whome retained ſeruice committed kéeping caſtels treaſures vij april appeared foure ſunnes beſide naturall ſunne red colour great circle criſtal colour ſides whereof went halfe cyrcles deuiſions whereof foure sun wente forthe followed yeare greate warre cruell bloudeſheds generally great diſturbance throughout england wale ireland moneth june south part englande bydragons sea coſt ſéene two great dragon ayre flying fighting togither whole daye one chaſing déepe sea ſéene king oxforde robert bacon openly preachedrobert roger bacon againſt peter byſhoppe winchester euilly counſelled king ſpoyle realme pictauians alſo roger bacon brother earneſtlye pithelye perſwaded king leaue counſell ſayde peter alſo baron ſent meſſengers king requeſting y• baron threat king woulde put peter biſhop winchester pictauians elſe wold depoſe kingdome create newe king builded faire church many houſes adioyninghouſe conuerts therevnto citie london farre olde temple whiche houſe jewes infidel conuert faith chriſte might haue vnder honeſt rule life ſufficiente lyuing whereby came paſſe ſhorte tyme gathered great number conuertes whiche baptiſed inſtructed lawes chriſt liue laudably vnder learned man appointed gouerne alſo buildedhoſpitall oxford hiſto aurea anno reg 18 io rouſe hoſpitall saint iohn without eaſt gate oxforde ſicke folke ſtraungers relieued simon fitz marie roger blunt 28 september sherifes maior andrew bokerell peperer 28 october richard marſhal leolyne prince northwales great force inuaded king landes deſtroyed the1234 salisburie brent ſame wyth fire ſword coaſtes wale saliſburie town alſo ſet fire perſwaſion edmunde archbiſhop canturburie king commaunded peter biſhop winchester go biſhopricke alſo expulſed pictauians theyr owne countrey andthe pictaulans expelled making peace richarde marſhall lewyn prince walles called againe naturall ſubiectes ſubmitted himſelfe counſel richard marſhal ireland raiſing warre geffreynicholas triuet de mariſco ſlaine buried kilkeny gilbert brother ſuccéeded earledome yere great dearth peſtilence ſo many mathew paris couetous archbishop poore folke dyed want victual rich menne ſtricken couetouſneſſe y• would reticue amongſt noted walter gray archebiſhop yorke whoſe corne fiue yeares olde doubtyng ſame deſtroyed vermine commanded deliuer huſbande men dwelte hys manor vppon condition paye muche newe corne harueſt would giue none poore god ſake fortuned men came greate ſtacke corne neygh towne ripon belonging ſayde archbiſhoppe therecorne ful vermine appeared ſheues ouer heades wormes serpentes toades voyce hearde corne mowe ſaying laye handes corne archebyſhoppe hée hathe diuelles ſhorte baylifes forced builde highe wall rounde aboute corne ſette fire leaſte venomous wormes ſhoulde haue gonne poyſoned corne otheranno reg 19 place ralph aſhwe iohn norman 28 september sherifes maior 1235 andrew bokerell peperer 28 october jewes norwich ſtale boy ſodeinely vpon drew ground ſo caſtel caſt priſon whereof whē baron vnderſtoode ſent roger clifford sir iohn gifford great power glocester beſéeging caſtellcloceſter caſtell taken baron brent bridge tooke kéeping caſtell vpon ſente macy march sir iohn gifford tooke macies goodes sherestone elſewhere peter de egblonuch frenchman biſhop hereford bishop hereford french man drawne cathedrall churche thomas turberuill ſent caſtel erdeſley sir macy committed ſafe ward treaſure ſpoyled chanons ſent priſon thus frenchman ſerued land mought founde baron part simon de mountfort baron pitched theyr tent istleworth parke manor istleworth belō gingtho wikes richard king almayne burnt y• londoner alſo burned another houſe néere westminster meane king quéene remainedthe queene chaſed nicho triuet tower london y• quéene would haue gone water vnto windeſore londoner getting bridge great number vnder ſhe muſt paſſe cried hir vſing many vile reprochful word threw durt ſtones hir ſhe conſtreyned returne againe tower citizen fortified citie iron chaynes drawne ouerthwart theirstreetes lō chayned annales hyde ſtréetes munited citie maruellous thing peace concluded betwixte king baron theſe condition henry ſonne kyng almayne tooke baron parte priſon ſhoulde deliuered king caſtels england ſhould put baron hand prouiſions oxford ſhoulde kept stranger within certaine time ſhould depart land thoſe except whoſe abode faithfull perſons realme one aſſent ſhoulde accept laſtly engliſhmen borne ſuch faithfull men kingdome ſhoulde order rule buſineſſe land vnder king notwithſtanding certayne knightes king part fortified caſtel windeſore vittayles armour edward king ſonne came bristow diſcorde roſe betwixte knightes towneſmen ſo towneſmen minded haue beſéeged caſtell whiche edward vnderſtoode ſent walter biſhop winchester tooke baron part company might go court father promiſing perſwade father peace héerevpō going forth y• biſhop til came windſore entred caſtell great miſliking biſhop edward ſhortly returned wente méete simon earle leicester adherent cō ming beſéege windeſore caſtell edward king ſonne met y• ſayd simon kingston offered meanes peace simon truſting biſhop walter counſell deteyned edward woulde ſuffer depart till caſtell yéelded within hauing libertie departe whither woulde stranger minded paſſe sea ſafeconducts granted lewlin prince wale confederate earle simon meane time waſted countrey chester march ſame ouerthrew grounde caſtles diffard gannoke parliament holden london many held earle went king part henry almaine ſonne richard king romaynes king partie encreaſed wente douer endeuoured haue gotte caſtell earlesanno reg 48 hand trauelled vayne robert mountpiler osbert suffolk 28 september sherifes maior 1264 thomas fitz thomas fitz richard 28 october lewes king fraunce throughe procuring boniface archbiſhop canturburie politicke sermon paris well frier prechers minor declared doings betwixt king englande earle leicester toke vpon make peace betwixte wherevpon king englande ſonne edwarde diuerſe engliſh nobilitie came paris aboute xxij januarie earle leicester fearing ye french king diſpleaſure mother ſake ſome cauſe knowen ſtayed home england procéeded hys buſineſſe wherefore roger mortimer began deſtroye poſſeſſions earle uf leicester helde againſte whō prince wale went beſieged caſtel radnore brought yéelde edward king ſonne returne paris lent toke iourney toward march paſſingthe schollers burgeſſes oxforde one ſpoyle oxford burgeſſes ſhut vp gate againſte hym whereby forced lye king hall without towne till next morrowe departed ſchollers oxford ſhut within towne brake vppe gate leadeth toward bea • monte déede maior ſent ſome priſon long whyle schollers dinner maior common wyth banner diſplayde thoughte haue ſpoyled clearkes ere bin aware eſpied schollers ran togither bowes weapon ſlewe wounded burgeſſes common brake vp manye houſes ſpoyling good ſet houſes portriues william spicer geffrey hencley fier south ſide towne moreouer bycauſe maior nicholas kingſtone uintener brake vp uintryclarkes oxforde banished dranke wine ſpoyled facte king cauſed clearkes schollers baniſhed uniuerſitie edward king ſonne toke caſtels hay huntington belonging earle hereforde caſtel brecon alſo rendered deliuered roger mortimer kéepe teritorie adiacent robert ferrers earle darbie toke part erle simon beſiegedvvorceſter beſieged worcester entring olde caſtel ſpoyled citizen good compelled jewes chriſtenedgloceſter beſieged towne glocester taken barōs aſſailed edward king ſon entred ye caſtel great force next morning meanes biſhop worcester reignald abbot glocester truce taken betwixt baron town king ſonne caſtell ſhortly baron fled burgeſſes ſubmitting themſelues ſome hanged reſidue caſt priſon grieuouſly raunſomed towne deſtroyed whence king ſonne departed ſpoyling waſting country contrarie othe made baron till came oxforde lodged houſe frier prēchers ioyned power king father lately come thyther make offering saint friſwide fearing ſuperſtitious opinion yt king entred ye town uirgin would auenged kyng hauing brother richard king almaine ſonne edward william de valence brother mother ſidē iohn cumyn scotland multitude scottiſhmen iohn de bailliol lord galoway robert le bruſe lord anandale roger de clifford phillip de marmiō iohn de vallibus roger de laborne henrie percy phillip baſſet roger de mortimer army went beſieged northampton nothamton beſieged fourth aprill breaking wall toke ye towne fiftéene knightes bearing banner simon mountfort yonger william de ferrers peter de mountfort baldwine wake adam de newmarche roger bartrandi simon fitz simon berengario de wateruile hughe cubion thomas maunſell roger bonteuileyne nicholas wake robert de newenton phillip de derby grimbald de paunſevent simon yonger ſent winchester reſidue place ſafely kepte knightes meaner degrée taken number xl fewe eſquires thence king wente towardes notingham waſting fire ſworde maner place baron gathered lordes great men earle simon went london thence rochester rocheſter beſieged whiche iohn earle warren defended bridge firſt gate wherof wonne informed king comming towards london lefte ſiege went backe méete hym king turning waye london toke caſtel kenington kingston wascaſtel kingſtone taken erle glocesters going rochester chaſed away ſome remayned ſiege ſlewe many moe thence went tonbridge caſtel whereof toke county glocester within leauing garriſon therecaſtel tonbridge taken went winchester receiued thē v porte peace▪ paſſing lewes receiued ye priory ſon caſtel wher while remained baron writ letter ye may read mathew paris nicholas triuet taking effect ye baron armes approched towards lewes inuading ye king peoplebattel levves y• wer gone forth forrage wherof king warned goeth forth méete thē army deuided thrée ſorts firſt led edward king ſon hauing william de valence erle penbroke iohn de waren earle surrey suſſex ſeconde guided richard k almain wt ſon henrie third k himſelf gouerning baron army deuided four wardes firſt led henrie de mountfort wt erle hereford ſeconde led gilbert de clare wyth iohn fitz iohn williā de moūtchance third londoner nicholas segraue fourth erle simō himſelf led thomas de pelueſton edwarde king ſonne hys battayle brake enimies made giue backe many drowned londoner put flyghte whileſt king ſonne purſued ſpace foure mile made great ſlaughter ſeparate frō reſt army weakened part ſore meane time manye king battayle ſlaine king almaine taken windmil syrthe king almaine taken iohn de beuis ſo robert le bruis iohn commyne brought scottes king henrie alſo hauing hys horſſe ſlaine vnder yéelded earle gloucester king henrie taken ſent priſoner priory edward returning receyued ſharpe battayle earle waren william de valence grey de leſmute king halfe brother hugh bigod mē armes nūber 400 haberions gotte caſtel pemſey many ſlayne eyther ſide lorde edwarde ryding aboute towne ſound father priorie meane time aſſault giuen caſtle valiauntly defended baron withdrew thē wherevpon lord edward greatly incouraged hauing gathered people woulde haue made new battayle ſo baron ſued peace whiche ye meanes frier preacher minor brought paſſe friday following lord edwarde henrie theyr father england almayne king deliuered themſelues earle simon vpon hope quietneſſeedvvard king ſon taken peace might concluded saterdaye king licenced aboute depart theyr houſes writ vnto thē tonbridge caſtel ſhoulde moleſt baron returned homewardes notwithſtanding armes heard londoner fled battaile receiued croydon haſted 〈…〉 〈…〉 〈…〉 king ſonne deliuered ſlain battayle lewes fought xij may aboute robert gloceſt vveſtchepe london brent 4500 men time gret part westcheape london brent treaſon erle simon led k ſon edward himw pakenton chro glaſton till gotte ſtrong caſtels lande hys hand put richard king almaine ye tower london edwarde king ſonne douer caſtle mean time roger mortimer iames audeley roger leyborne roger clifforde haymo leſtrange hugh de turberuile many roſe againſt simō reſtrayne theyr boldneſſe aſſociating prince wale entred caſtell hereforde cauſed edward king ſonne brought thyther douer thys wanne caſtell hey whiche belonged earle hereforde toke caſtel ludlow waſtyng ye caſtel ludlovv taken landes roger mortimer goeth towardes mountgomerie taking pledge peace ye ſayd noble turneth ſouth part méete thē power ſayd come fraunce king ayde pope vrbane ſent legate cardinall biſhop sabrine englande might enter realm fiue port prohibiting wherevpon called certain engliſh biſhops firſt amience bulloigne committed ſentence excomunication pronounced againſt citie london fiue porte al thoſe troubled king englāds peace byſhops diſſembled matter yeare 20 june notable blaſing ſtarre appeared ſuch one ben gloncester departing ioyned league noble knight march whō erle simond commanded auoyde realme iohn de waren earle surrey suſſex william de valēce erle penbroke brought great power ſea weaſt part wale arriuing penbroke earle simon leading king went hereforde gathered great power oppreſſe ſayd knight prelate laboured peace edward king ſon ye caſtel hereford permitted exerciſe himſelfe horſſebackeedvvard king ſon taken keeper medowe without citie kéepers wearied diuerſe horſſes mounting freſh appointed purpoſe rode quite away paſſing riuer wey two knight foure eſquires folowed hard kéepers aduiſed ſtandarts roger mortimere roger clifford comming reliefe returned eſcaped wigmore chaunced whitſon wéeke lord edward thus eſcaped gathereth army confederateth ſubmitteth countreys hereford worcester salop chester townes city caſtelles alſo winneth force citie glocester whiche earle simon lately fortifyed townes men • led caſtel xv dayes yéelded departed earle leicester wan caſtle monmouth layde flat grounde entring lande earle glocester called glomorgan méeting prince wale caſtel monmouth raced comming ayde deſtroyed al fire ſword edwarde king ſonne hearing manye earle simonds partaker come caſtel kenilworthe takyng erle glocester departed worcester came vpon ſodaine toke earle oxford ſir william mountchalſie ſir adam newmarch ſir walter de solenle simon ſonne earle simon hardly eſcaped caſtell earle leicester hauing king returned southwales lammas daye came kemſey place biſhop worcester tarried next day edwarde king ſon returned kenelworth worcester whoſe returne knowne erle simon departing kemſey vnhappy chaunce ſtayed towne eueſham ye morrow ij auguſt edward king ſon departed worcester paſſing riuer neare towne called cliue cloſed vp paſſage betwixt earle simon simon ſon killingworth next mornyng lord edward approched néere eueſham one ſide andbattaile euesham gilbert earle glocester ſide roger mortimer two ſides whereby earle simon ſo encloſed muſt eyther fight yéelde friday therfore fifth daye auguſte theyr army encountred ech large fielde without towne earles part hadde worſte earle killed fielde henrie ſonne earle simon peter de fitz pierce many parliament holden winchester thea parliament vvincheſter ſtatutes made oxforde diſanulled good againſte king ſeaſed london great danger haue bin deſtroyed king diſpleaſure conceyued againſt ye citizen citizen wholly ſubmitted liues good vnto eight perſons carrying ſame ſubmiſſion toward windſor met sir roger leyborne knight colbrooke turned backe againe diſcourſed whole matter willed deliuer ſubmiſſion woulde moue king whiche thing ſixe dayes thys knight returned citie ſayde king receyued writing willing firſt take away chaines ſtréetes citie pull poſtes grounde ſame fixed bring chaynes poſtes tower london maior fortie citizen ſhould nexte day following attende vpon king windſor confirme theyr wryting ſhoulde goe come ſafe witneſſe whereof deliuered king letter ſeale september thomas fitz thomas fitz richard 28 october king henrie came westminster gaue vnto diuerſe houſholde ſeruauntes aboute number thrée ſcore houſholdes houſes within citie ſo owner compelled agrée redéeme theyr houſes good elſe auoyde made cuſtos citie ſir othon coneſtable tower choſe baylifes accomptable iohn adrian walter haruy king toke pledge beſt men ſonnes citie whiche put tower london kept coſtes parent great labour ſute made al foreſayde perſons whiche windſor caſtell eight except deliuered king agréed citizen twentie thouſand markes payd leauying fine taxed wel ſeruauntes houſholders many refuſed liberty citie quit charge caſtell douer yéelded edward king ſonne put guy de mountfort kepte counteſſe leicester wife simond mountfort yéelded caſtel pemſey k henrie hir brother forthwith baniſhed hir realm england euer alhalowntide quéene england returned beyonde sea hir came legate named othobone ſhortly comming counſel holden northampton accurſed al biſhoppes prieſts ayded earle simon againſt king eſpecially curſed name walter worcester henrie london stephen chichester biſhop lincolne worcester ſhortly deceaſed • gloceſt ther thrée went rome aſſoyled legate alſo publiſhed pope bull tenthes church bée payde king next yeare sir simond yonger fled kenilworth caſtel diſherited knightes ile oxholme wher remayned lōg meſſengers faire promiſes hoſtages giuen edward king ſonne forſaking went london king nobilitie priuily warned guile made eſcape got ouer fraunce kéeper guy mountfort eaſter brybed let go went fraunce guy wēt tuſcane ſerued earle rufus whoſe war waxing famous obtained haue daughter mariage robert ferters earle darby henrie haſtings baudewinde battaile cheſterfielde wake▪ iohn der •• le theyr power towne chesterfielde darbiſhire came againſt iohn earle waren ſir henrie almaine ſir waren baſingborne manye knightes whitſon euen met without town hunting ſir baudwyn wake▪ ſir hen • haſtings ſir gregory caldwel ſir iohn clynton ſir roger maundeuil ſir richard caldwel y• number xxij knightes al vnder one ſpeare al chaſed put flight wherof ſir iohn danuil towne vnderſtanding ſmall companye rode pierced hoſte wounding many eſcaped erle waren entring towne ſlew many man toke erle ferrers ſicke goute day bene letten bloud ſente tower london whence lately bin deliuered henrie haſtings company comming kenilworth founde ſir iohn de eynuile many valiant knight sir william de la knowe ſir iohn de la ware well ſtored ye caſtel thing neceſſarie king henrie haſtyngkenilvvorth caſtel beſieged thyther beganne ſiege morrowe midſommer daye whiche ſiege continued til chriſtmaſſe within caſtell fearing force great ſet open theyr gate neuer cloſed daye night come ſo would came theyr coſt ſo many man ſlaine ſides manye taken raunſomed length legate archbiſhop two biſhops came make accorde betwéene king diſherited alſo caſtle diſherits caſtel would grant king wherfore legate courſed theyr accord caſtell regarding legate curſing mockage therof clothed prieſt ſurgeon phillip porpeis cope white ſetting caſtel wal white legate againſt red made accurſe ye k legate al partaker while buſineſſe laſted kenilworth diſherites toke ye ile ely ſtrengthned ſuch wiſe helde long robbed norffolk suffolke cambridgeſhire ſpoyled ye citie norwich ranſomed ye rich men pleaſure bartholmewtide y• k held parliament killingworth wherein baron choſen vj perſons whiche ſworne choſe thē vj theſe xij make accord betwéen k diſherits ye firſt vj walter gefford biſhop bath nicholas ely bi worcester walter b excester roger de sumerey roberte walronde alayne de la souch barōs theſe vj choſe gilbert e glocester humfry erle hereford b dauids ſir iohn bailiol ſir phillip baſſet ſir warayn de baſingborne theſe xij could agrée legate mountfort ferrers y• ſhould redéeme land wt money hand thē y• ſame poſſeſſion king gift ſo y• none payde aboue vij yeres value vnder iij yeares value leſt ſhal aſſeſſed according ye quātity treſpaſſe ſiege kenilworth yet continuing within caſtel began ſore troubled ye flixe alſo wer without hope ſuccour come thē whervpō thomas day chriſtmaſſe yéeldedkenilvvorth caſtel ye elded y• caſtel k conditiō depart wt life lims wt loſſe good impriſonment diſherited y• diſherited perſons liked ye ordinaunce kenilworth whoſe captaine iohn ciuille taken citie lincoln ſpoyled iewes fled ile ely whoſe comming abroade kyng great army hadde ſtopped edwarde king ſonne bridge made hurdle bordes place conuenient inhabitaunts thereabout inſtructed entred vpon ile ſome within yéelded y• diſperſed flight while theſe thingsthe erle gloceſter toke citie london newe trouble began earle glocester taking part diſherites came army gathered wale vnto london ſeauenth april therein builded bulwarkes caſt ditch trench diuerſe place king gathered army windſor v mayeannales hyde 109 enſignes came towardes london pitched tentes stratford tarried ſpace one moneth many entreated make peace vj june earle glocester peaceable maner rendred citie vnto king againe many diſherited reconciled inſtance legate ſayde erle foure bare cogniſaunce erle darby put ſacks caſt thamis thomas fitz theobalde agni wife ſiſter thomasmercors chapel becket archbiſhop canturburie gaue maſter brother hoſpitall called saint thomas acre beyonde ſeas lande appurtenaunces ſometime gilbert becket father thomas septemb hugh fitz thomas 28 october noble england kyngs commaundementanuals hyde edmond campion aſſembled london treate dyuers matter amongeſt whiche one men ſhould juſticestho wikes 1270 ſhewe right held landes whyche matter muche moleſt people vntill iohn warren earle surrey appeared aſked right helde landes drewe ſodainely ſword ſayde holde grandfather land kéepe upon multiplying wordes earle ſlewe allen de la zouch lorde chiefe juſtice ireland juſtices bench ſhortly ſame iohn erle surrey othe 25 knight winchester affirmed commit facte vpon pretenced malice neyther contempte king ſo ſumme 1200 markes reconciled edward king ſonne hys brother edmunde andanno reg 55 many noble ſayling aſia againſt infidel hys policie manly actes ſo demeaned himſelfe oftentimes put turkes great diſworſhip placestho de wike earth ouerflowed great parte canturburie citie ſtreame wherof ſo ſwift violent bare downe building houſes drowned manye people june beganne great ryot citie norwiche 1272 w riſhanger sherifes maior sit water haruy 28 october king henrie ſicke called hym gilberte • iber trinitatis clare erle glocester cauſed ſworn kepe peace lande houſe edwarde ſonne dyed ſixtéench nouember yere 1272 raigned lvj yeares xxviij dayes buried westminster whiche church newly builded left iſſue edward eldeſt ſonne vnto hée haddei treklon giuen earledome chester ſuccéeded kingdome edmund ſeconde ſonne vnto giuen earledome lancaster alſo death simond mountfort robert ferrers erledomes leicester darbie two daughter beatrice margaret ¶ king edward ſurnamed longſhanks edvvarde firſte conqueſt ſon henrie thirdanno reg 1 ſurnamed longſhanke beganne hys raigne ſixtéenth day nouember yeare 1272 y• part beyond ſea towarde1273 ieruſalem ſtature tall mighty bodye nothing groſſe eye ſoméwhat blacke couered cloth armour vnto great weaſt dore saint paule banner diſplayed armes come ſayd dore mounted apparelled ſayde maior alderman sheriffes armed armes ſhall come ſayd church saint paule vnto ſayde dore banner hande foote whiche banner ſhall gueles image saint paule golde face hand féete ſword siluer aſſoone ſayde robert ſhall ſée maior alderman sheriffes come foote churche armed ſuch banner ſhall alight horſſe ſalute maior ſay sir maior come ſeruice owe citie maior alderman ſhall anſwere giue banerar fée citie banner citie beare gouerne honor profit citie power ſayd roberte heires ſhall receyue banner ſhall goe foote gate banner hand maior alderman sheriffes ſhall follow dore bring horſe ſayde roberte worth twentie pound horſe ſhall ſadled ſaddle armes ſaide robert ſhall couered ſendall ſaide armes alſo ſhall preſente xx • ſterling money deliuer chamberlayne ſaid robert expences day ſayde robert ſhal mount vpon horſe ye maior preſented ye banner hād aſſone vp ſhal ſay maior cauſe marſhall choſen hoſt one citie marſhal choſen y• ſayde robert ſhall commaund maior burgeſſes citie warne commoner aſſemble togither ſhal al go vnder banner saint paul ſaid robert ſhall beare himſelfe vnto aldegate ſayde robert maior ſhall deliuer ſayde banner saint paule thence ſhall aſſent thinke good muſt make iſſue forth citie ſayd robert ought choſe two forth euery warde moſt ſage perſonages forſée ſafe kéeping citie gone forth counſell ſhall taken priorie trinitie neare vnto aldegate euery towne caſtel whiche hoaſte london beſiege ſiege continue whole yeare ſayde roberte ſhall haue euery ſiege communaltie london hundred ſhillings trauell theſe right ſayd robert hath time war right belonging robert fitz walter heires citie london time peace theſe ſaye ſayd robert hath soken ward citie wal chanonrie saint paul man goeth ſtréete brewhouſe saint paul vnto thamis ſo ſide mill whiche water commeth fléete bridge goeth ſo london walles betwixt frier preacher ludgate ſo returneth backe houſe ſayd frier vnto ſayd common wall ſaid chanonry saint paule al pariſh saint andrew whiche gifte hys aunceſtours ſaide ſenioritie ſo ſayde robert hath appendant vnto ſayd soken al theſe thing vnder written ought haue soke man place sokeman ſo sokemanrie ſame ward sokemanry impleaded ye guild hall thing toucheth body maior y• time toucheth bodye sherife lawfull sokeman sokemanrie ſayd robert fitz walter demand court ſayd robert maior citizen london ought grāt haue court court ought bring iudgement aſſented agréed vppon guilde hal ſhall giuen therefore taken hys sokenry ought haue ſtockes impriſonment soken ſhal brought thēce ye guild hall maior ſhall prouide iudgement ought giuen iudgement ſhal publiſhed till come courte ſayde robert libertie iudgement ſhall ſuch haue deſerued death treaſon tyed poſt thamis woodwharfe boates faſtened two ebbing two flowing water hée bée condemned common théefe ought ledde elmes ſuffer iudgemēt théeues ſo ſaid robert heyres hath great honor holdeth gret franches within citie maior citie citizen bounde right ſay maior holde greate counſel hée ought call ſayd robert heyres hym counſell counſell citie ſayde robert ought ſworne counſel citie againſt people ſauing king heyres ſayde robert commeth huyſtings guilde hall citie maior lieuetenaunt ought ryſe againſt ſet hym néere vnto ſo long guilde hall iudgemente oughte giuen mouth according recorde recorder ſayde guilde hall ſo manye weifs come ſo long ought giue baylifes town counſell maior citie theſe franchiſes belonged roberte fitz walter london time peace whiche antiquitie haue noted old recorde william combmartin iohn burforde 28 septem baylifes custos anno reg 32 adam meri graueſend bishop londō sir iohn blound 28 october richard graueſend byſhop london deceaſed reported ſome haue purchaſed charter liberty citie london yeare lord 1 • 9 • ſixtéenth yeare king richard ſeconde vntrueth whereof haue thought good thus muche place note king edward went scotland beſieged caſtel striueline william clifford kept ſpace 1304 tho de la 90 dayes ſundry valiaunt aſſaultes able longer reſiſt put ſhoes haulters neckes came forth caſtel fel proſtrate king committing liues lims mercie king pardoned life ſent priſoners england king returning scotlande citie yorke commaunded courtes king benche exchequer remayned yorke vij yeares remoued theyr olde place london roger pares iohn de lincolne 28 september sherifes custos anno reg 33 dravv thy ſtaffe adam meri sir iohn blound 28 october king edwarde helde chriſtmaſſe lincolne ordayned juſtices traylebaſton againſte intruder men landes truce breaker extortioner murderer ſuche like offendours whyche meanes king treaſure maruellouſly encreaſed roger brabaſon robert de reuer ſatte guilde hall london heare complaintes made concerning foreſayde article traylebaſton citizen norwiche made peticion vnto thenorvvich vvalled parliament recordes 1305 king lyke hadde pleaſed hym heretofore graunte hys helpe lycence certayne yeares wallyng aboute theyr towne whiche tearme nowe expyred graunte longer tyme ſame yet finiſhed wherevppon v yeares granted parliament westminster iohn leyland writeth marchaunte norwich leyland nameth builded great part almoſt halfe wall robert fitz walter requeſted king fry offriers sacke ſinagoge ievves neare baynards caſtel londō parliament recor sacke cōmonly called de penitentia ieſu london might aſſigne ſayde robert one chappel olde time called ſinagoge iewes neare adioyning place ſame robert requeſt graunted theſe frier liued altogither begging late multiplyed number greatly vntill counſel lion wherein decréed frier beggers ſhould receyue none order except grey white frier wer alſo licenſed enter religion larger rule time forth mendicant frier began decreaſe ſhort time brought nothing except preching frier william wale ofttimes ſette scotland gretvv vvales scotland trouble taken brought london greate number men woman
