lord 1357 ſame yeare truce finall peace concluded b norwich earle northampton earle stafford richard talbot walter mayny knightes ſayled ouer sea france y• frenchman met peaceably would agrée •• nall peace vnleſſe caleis reſtored thē againe would granted truce whiche taken yeare ſo continued earle flanders would caſe receyue condition peace vnleſſe french king quite forſaken notwithſtanding ſolemne oth long entred flanders great power frenchman burning killing euer came people countrey engliſhmen withſtoode ſtoutely gaue ſore ſkirmiſh beſide many frenchman ſlayne earle himſelfe forced flie whiche worthy acte many knightes made amongſt iohn de filebert engliſh man feaſt natiuitie saint iohn quéene purified windeſore ſolemne iuſtes running tilt dauid king scottes iuſtes vvindſore preſent earle ewe lord tankeruill lord charles de valoys many stranger captiues king licence permitted runne alſo tilte paſtime price field adiudged earle ewe sommer ſeaſon theſe stranger paſſed time hunting company king noble realme claringdon wiltſhire nigh saliſburie diuers forreſtes while king thus occupyed frenchman notwithſtanding truce entred march britaine ſonnes sabater went forraging tooke thomas dagworth knight man great experience men wéete ſixtéene armed men entred woodde againſt theſe robber inuaded ſlaying number thrée hundred length ſtricken fiue time face quarelssir thomas dagvvorth ſlayne men firſt ſlayne himſelfe thruſt body ſword adam burie ralph linne 28 september sherifes maior ro auesbery adam mer • william turke fiſhmonger 28 october feaſt saint michael 120 perſons sealande hollande comming flaunders vnto london ſometime church saint paule ſometyme place citie twice day ſighte people loynes vnto héeles couered lynnena bloudy proceſſion publican clothe reſt body bare hauing theyr heades hat red croſſes behinde euery one right handes whip thrée cordes eache corde hauing knotte middeſt beat themſelues theyr bare bloudie body going proceſſion foure ſinging theyr owne language aunſwering ſame yeare earle lancaster baron stafforde greystocke alſo heires lordes percy neuel lord burniual barthelmew burwaſh diuerſe feaſt alſaintes paſſed ouer ſea gaſcoign delay furious vprore iohn de valoys ſonne french king made dukedome greatly ſpoyling waſting ſame alſo king counſel ordained none king juſtices time office ſhoulde receyue fée gift reward man except king himſelfe alſo thys yeare countie oxforde nyghe vntoa serpent vvith tvvo heades oxfordshire towne called chippingnorton founde serpent hauing two heades face like woman ſhaped newe tyre time another manner old attyre great wing manner flyndermouſe bat feaſt alſainctes kyng edwarde beyng accompanyedk edvvarde ſayled tovvards flaunders earle lancaster southfolke diuerſe others paſſed ouer ſeas flaunders thēce leading armie towardes fraunce french men made meanes vnto renewe truce nowe earle flaunders ſubmitted himſelfe thirde time vnto king mercie dominion king returning toward englande ſolemnizate tranſlation thomas confeſſour biſhoppe hereforde dyd wyth preſence nobilitye honoure ſame greate expences nicholas cantulupus baron couſin ſayde saint thomas whiche feaſte ſolemnitie ſignified king secretary emericus padua féed manne king ofcalleis like haue bin betrayed englande fourtéenth day januarie nexte comming geffrey cherney knight manye frenche men ſhoulde receyued caleis vnto ſayd towne ſolde ſayde emericus towne beyng preſentlye reſcued king edwarde ſayde emericus padua genoways cōtinued caleis beyng maintayned coſtes frenche king againſte king englande beſieged alſo yéelding king england pardoned bothe life lymme thenceforth continued dwelte féed man kyngs ſayde towne defence thereof tyme ſayde geffrey lorde matas man ſkylfull warfare anye frenche man fraunce wherefore greatelye eſtéemed euen time death craftie deuiſer indeuored letter wherin made promiſe large giftes golde ſophiſticall perſwaſitions quite ſubuert fayth loyaltie ſayde emericus finally thys craftie deuiſer agréed falſe man twentie thouſande french crownes ſhoulde lette frenche menne towne muche laye hym delyuer vppe frenche menne towne caſtell bargaine moſt traytorouſly made othe breaking ye sacrament betwixt yet notwythſtanding wrote letter vnto kyng touching ſtate whole matter verye priuilye howe hée readie ſhewe friendſhippe frenche menne yet meanyng make fruſtrate theyr purpoſe whereby ſhoulde conuicted breakyng truce alſo manye ſhoulde taken bée raunſomed wherefore kyng edwarde ſpéedilye paſſed ouer beyng accompanyed wyth hys eldeſt sonne earle marche fewe commyng tyme appoynted yéeldyng towne certayne dayes thereforeanno reg 24 hée beyng come callayes hée ſayde certayne men armes wythin uaultes whyche betwixte outter gate inner parte caſtell buyldyng thinne ſtender wall newelye ſette vppe made playſter counter • ayte matter whyche ioyned wal craftilye deuiſed made like olde worke ſo manne woulde judge anye encloſed therin alſo cauſed maynepoſtes drawe bridge bée ſawed almoſte ſunder yet ſuche ſort •• • horſſemen mighte ryde ouer purpoſe hadde greate ſtone whiche layde vppe hole made forme arche beyng foreparte tow • e hangyng ouer bridge whyche hée appoynted faythfull souldiour ſhould bée tyme throwe downe▪ ſayde ſtone vppon bridge wyth fall thereof bridge beyng halfe cutte two ſhould broken ſunder ſo hole ſtone layde ſhoulde bée wrought ſuche ſorte hée wythin ſhoulde perceiue throughe hole howe manye dyd enter •• •••• made priuie practiſe neyther many knowe king preſence prince wale wroughte thys feate ſecretely conueyed themſelues towne daye tyme delyuerie thys towne geffrey cherney ••••• fifteene faithfulleſt menne wyth g •• ••• parte golde whiche payde ſhoulde alſo •• • faythe emericus order caſtell ſearching euery euery tower corner whiche could finde open coulde perceyue nothing contrarie theyr lykyng wherevpon next day morning ſet vp french king ſtanderde higheſt towre caſtell auntientes alſo geffrey lordes vpon tower place people town kept common watch warde knowing ſecrete deuice gretly terrifyed therwith ſo muche taking weapon hande beganne giue charge againſt caſtell french men hadde entred day toke thomas kingſtone fléeing awaye quite ignoraunt whiche deuiſed forceably ſet ſtockes certaine ſent french men companion maiſters laye without ambuſhes ſhewed auntients ſtanderd ſet vp well euen woulde haue haſtning forwarde come defence caſtell againſte townes men wherfore ryſing lorking place aduaunced themſelues pride bragging came heapes gate caſtell townes men perceyuing muche adoe forebeare handes chiefe leader withdrawen leaſt ſome daunger ſhould haue happened laye hid thoſe laye hid cloſed vnder arch walles prepared themſelues breake vpon enimies like ſorte alſo great ſtone man ſhut vp hole ſée ſo many entred in▪ ••• éeming fellowes ſufficient ouerthrowe • great ſtone put cuſtodie hée brake drawe bridge whiche enemy entred coulde goe waye againe ſtone thus downe diſcharged thing layde vp french men deceiued pollicy wer encloſed ſafe ynough noyſe ſtone bridge brake theſe armed men ſpake breaking downe counterfaite wall behinde deceyte hyd preſently ſet themſelues order inuade french men bidden bitter breakfaſt conflict ſharp good ſeaſon length enimies ouercome yéelded themſelues pleſure conquerours without entred ſoone perceyued theyr companion deceyued fled whome king ſcarce ſixtéene men armes many archer followed pace runnawayes knowing company woulde followe many thys chaſe wearied many moe ſlaine ſmall time king ouercame daungerous great labour length vnderſtoode fledde howe fewe chaſed foureſcore armed men turned againſt king dare aſcribe thystho de la boldneſſe king chaſing enimies hys wiſedome ſ • outneſſe minde whiche wel knowen god grace brought good effect meanes though daunger neuer ſo gret perceyued french men turned thē ſelues withſtande caſte away ſcaberde hys ſword comforting men ſetting good order exhorted play men luſtily archer placed marche againſt ſides enimies ſtoode dry hilles compaſſed aboute quagmyers foggie place neyther horſſemen footemen might approch ſhould rather drowned mud come néere hurt theſe alſo king comfort ſaying doe well archer play men luſtily knowe edwarde windſor preſence king neceſſitie matter ſtyrred vp theyr harte doe well archer vncouering theyr heades ſtripping vp theyr ſléeues bente themſelues beſtow theyr arrowes ſuch ſort might loſte french men drewe towardes thē ſaluted thē arrowes armed men partes ſtoode order fighte vppon long narrowe cauſewaye bredth whereof able receiue ſcarce twentie men armes fronte hauing ſides thereof mariſhe whiche archer placed gauled wounded theyr enimies ſides fléeing thicke hayle kyng men wyth archer ſide ſlewe tooke greate manye manye ſtoode ſtoutlye till length comming prince wale frenche putte flighte long chaſe purſuing enimies returning backe againe caleis numbred thoſe fledde well thoſe whiche taken founde taking caſtell priſoners reported came thouſand men armes ſixe hundred armed men ſerued aboue thrée thouſand among thē taken geffrey charney ſonne edwarde1 • 50 de renty robert danquile otto de gulo baron martingham baldyne saylly henrie de prees garinus baylofe peter renel peter dargemole euſtace de riplemount manye lordes knightes baronet chaſed ranne away theyr auntientes lorde de mountmarice alſo laundas maried lady saint paule counteſſe penbroke england▪ alſo ye lord fenas lorde planckes another euſtace de replemount ſlaine ſkirmiſh lord henrie de boy lord archibalde many others whoſe name conqueror able certifie thus pollicie deuiſed treaſon aucthours therof came death deſtruction neither euſtachius himſelfe eſcaped ſcot frée frō ſnares within taken french men burned aliue hotte yron degraded frō order knighthood cutting héeles depriuing tong alſitiō afterward hā ged vp laſte beheaded quartered receyuing iuſt puniſhment treaſon falſe forſwearing yeare lord fur • uall giuing raſh enterpriſe vpon enimies taken priſoner gaſcoign long king edwarde prepared make voyage france earle lancaster returning gaſcoigne ſignied truce taken reaſon whereof paſſage prepared king layde aſide yeare saint george day kiug held great tho de la mor • great feaſt vvindſor saint george ſolemne feaſte caſtel windſor augmented chappell henrie firſte hys progenitor king england erected eight canon added thoſe eight chanons deane fiftéene chanons xxiiij poore impotent knightes miniſters ſeruauntes appeareth tho walſing ex charta regia firſt founder noble order garter lancaster 4 erle warwicke 5 captain de bouch 6 ralph erle stafforde 7 william montacute erle saliſburie 8 roger lord mortimer erle march 9 sir iohn de liſle 10 sir bartholmew burwaſh 11 sir iohn beauchampe 12 sir iohn de mahune 13 sir hugh courtney 14 sir thomas hollande 15 sir iohn grey 16 sir richard fitz simon 17 sir mile stapleton 18 sir thomas walle 19 sir hugh wrotheſley 20 sir nele lering 21 sir iohn chandos 22 sir iames de audley 23 sir othes hollande 24 sir henrie eme 25 sir sechet dabridgecourte 26 sir william panell al theſe togither king clothed gownestho de la ruſſet poudered gartiers blew wearing like garter alſo right legges mantel blewe withfirſt feaſt saint george ſcutcheons saint george ſort apparell bareheaded heard maſſe celebrat simon iſlipe archbiſhop canterburie biſhops winchester excester afterwardes went feaſte ſetting themſelues orderlye table honoure feaſt named saint george martyre choſing knightes garter sommer following variaunce ryſing betwéene fléetes englande spaine spaniardes beſette brytaine sea foure fortie great ſhips warre whiche ſonke ten engliſh ſhips comming frō gaſcoigne towardes englande taken ſpoyled thus former iniuries reuenged entred sluce flaunders king edwarde vnderſtanding hereof furniſhed nauie fiftie ſhippes pinaces forecaſting méete wyth spaniardes theyr returne hauing companye prince wale earles lancaster northampton warwicke saliſburie arundale huntington glocester baron knightes ſeruauntes archer vpon feaſt decolatiō saint iohna euenſongro de auesbery time nauies met winchelſea wher great spaniſh veſſels ſurmounting ſhippes foyſtes like caſtels cotages ſharply aſ • ayled men ye ſtone quarels flying frō top ſore cruelly wounded mē leſſe buſie fight alofe launce ſwordbattaile sea foreward manfully defende themſelues length archer perced theyr arbalisters retch thā coulde ſtrike againe thereby compelled forſake place cauſed fighting hatch ſhade themſelues table ſhips compelled threwe ſtones toppes ſo hyde thē durſt ſhew theyr head tumble men enfring ye spaniſh ueſſels ſwords halberd killed thoſe met wtin whyle make voyd y• veſſels furniſh wyth engliſh men vntil beſet darkneſſe night could decern xxvij yet remayning vntaken men caſt ancker ſtudying hoped battayle ſuppoſing nothing finiſhed whileſt thing remayned vndone dreſſing wounded throwing myſerable spaniard sea refreſhing themſelues victualles ſléepe yet committing vigilant watche armed bande night ouerpaſſed engliſhe men prepared vaine new battayle ſunne began appeare viewing ſeas coulde perceyue ſigne reſiſtaunce xxvij ſhippes fléeing away nighte lefte xvij ſpoyled euening kyngs pleaſure agaynſte theyr wil king returned england victorie triumphe king preferred 80 noble ympes order knighthoode greatlye bewayling loſſe one witte ſir richard goldesborough knight thys yeare phillippe de valoys frenche kyngphillip frēch king died deceaſed hys eldeſt sonne iohn crouned iohn notte william worceſter 28 september sherifes maior richard killingburie 28 october two hyred ſouldiours kyng armenia came englande preſence king ſhewed letter aforeſayde king armenia wherein ſignified one witte iohn de viſcount man borne cipres ſlanderou • ly charged thomas de la marche frenche man borne baſtarde ſonne phillippe late king fraunce ſaying ſayde thomas ſhoulde haue receyued turkes certaine ſome golde betraying armye chriſtians vnto emperour turkes proofe ſlaunder iohn chalenged combat wyth ſayde thomas tryed iudgement edward king englande moſte worthy prince ſtrife ſhoulde ended therefore theſe two worthy ſouldiours appointed fight performed within liſtes king pallace westminster mondaye nexte following feaſte saint michael thomas declaration hys innocencie accuſed ouercame enimye yet killed could bycauſe able wounde hym beyng ſo armed▪ anye kynde piercing weapon except hys face whiche bare hadde runne tilte foughte foote ſtriuing togither grounde wyth certaine prickes bothe ſhorte ſharpe called gadlings cloſed ioyntes hys righte gauntlet ſayde▪ thomas ſtrucke ſayde iohn face ſore wounded hym ſide iohn hadde ſuche ſhorte kinde weapon wherewyth hée myght hurte thomas face therefore cryed aloude moſte horribly whervpon king commaundemente combatte ended victorie adiudged thomas gaue ſayde iohn thus ouercome prince wale captiue offered owne armoure sainte george sainte paules churche london wyth greate deuotion theſe matter beyng thus finiſhed cipres▪ man manumitted fette libertie frée man againe thomas thinking boldely goe preſence brother frenche king toke hys iourney thyther comming founde ſayde king nobilitie fraunce greatlye offended indignation againſt agréed combat ſhoulde tried king england wherefore thomas thinking ſecretly himſelfe howe winne falſe friendſhip brother deſirous ſhewe therein hée hadde done well among thing greatelye prayſed nobilitie edwarde worthy fame ſpredde ouer al worlde alſo iuſtice whiche vſed iudging accepting perſon manne cipres yea thoughe loued kyng himſelfe verye well neyther ſuffered preferred whiche frenche manne brother friende thée lorde kyng fraunce▪ iudge ouer ſayde king edwarde aduerſarie alſo earle ewe hyghlye prayſed king england hée hadde receyued greate comforte commoditye hys handes tyme hys captiuitie englande ſhewing alſo howe farre good kyng hadde baniſhed enuie hatred hys hearte time iuſtyng beyng fielde exerciſe kyng alſo commaunded kyng hymſelfe beare awaye price pricke theſe commendation frenche kyng enuie at▪ indignation moſte wickedlye commaunded ſetters forthe thoſe prayſes beheaded colour matter better fayned earle vſed muche familiaritie quéene wife brother guiltie treaſon againſte king fraunce bycauſe committed cauſe combat tryed iudgement king englande thus murdered brother tormented wife death famine daughter noble king boheme lately ſlaine battayle geffrey william edington biſhoppe winchester treaſurergroates halfe groates anno reg 25 tho walſing hiſto au •• england wiſe man cauſed newe coyne called groate halfe groate coyned theſe leſſe wayght penny called eſterlings reaſon wherof victualles merchandice became dearer thorough whole realme octaues purification lady aparliament vveſtminſter parliament holden westminster henrie earle lancaster created earle lincolne leicester derby groſmount ferrers duke lancaster vnto whome alſo giuen great priuiledges ſuche neuer erle time alſo lionel antwerpe king ſonne made earle v • star irelande iohn gaunte brother made earle richmonde ralph baron stafforde made earle stafforde lent following walter de maine roberte herle captain caleis rod france making gret praes great domage brought away gret ſtore beaſtsa fat covv ſixteene penny 1351 ſhéepe ſwine ſo caleis fat cowe ſcarcelye ſolde ſixtéene penny ſterling eaſter duke lancaster departing caleis marched alongſt sea coaſtes artoys picardie brent ſuburbes bulloign aſſaulting town preuayled ladder ſhort therefore waſted city tirwin hauen alſo townes fauconbridge staple ſame hauens brent aboue 120 ſhips diuerſe mould brenning champion countrey rode vnto saint omers winning force manye fortreſſes great pray many priſoners returned caleis feaſt saint george thing proſpered wel gaſcoine marſhal france greate number armed men ſpoyled countrey dangel edmond roſe norffolke man captayne gariſon valiauntly encountred enimies flew many toke ſayde marſhal manye noble fraunce chaſing aboue 400 knightes ſame yeare spaniſh ſhippes treatie peace came englande laſt yeare reſtrayned nowe truce taken twentie yeares betwixt england▪ spaine truce betwixt englande fraunce one yeare whiche french men brake reaſon taking caſtel guiſnes next yeare ſhall ſhewed iohn wroth gilbert steineſhorpe 28 septem sherifes maior andrew auberie grocer 28 october ſeaſon old coine gold changed new olde noble worth muche aboue taxed rate newe therfore marchauntes boughte olde conueyed realme greate loſſe king kingdome whiche remedie prouided chaunging ſtampe beginning januarie french men béeing occupied y• repayring ye wals guiſnes town afore time deſtroyed engliſh men ſome mē armes caleis vnderſtanding doings deuiſed might ouerthrow work done ſort archer named iohn dancaſter priſon inanno reg 26 caſtel guiſnes time takē hauing wherwith pay raunſome let loſe condition ſhoulde worke amongſt french menthe getting guiſnes englishe fellow chaunced lye laundres ſtrumpet learned hir beyond principal ditch bottome a▪ wall made two foote broade ſtretching bottome brimme ditche within forthe ſo couered water coulde ſéene ſo drowned man going alofte theron ſhoulde wette paſte knées beyng made vſe fiſhers therefore middeſt diſcontinued ſpace two foote ſo archer hys harlot ſhewyng hym meaſured heygth wall wyth thréede theſe thing thus known one day ſlipping wal paſſed ditche hydden wall lying hidde mariſh till euening came night neare vnto cale •• ▪ tarrying cleare daye wente towne elſe might inſtructed gréedie praye ſcale caſtell howe might enter ſame▪ cauſed ladder made length archer appointed thirtie mē conſpyring togither clothing themſelues blacke armour without brightneſſe went caſtell guiding ſayde iohn de dancaſter clyming wall ladder ſlewe watchman threwe headlong beſide wall hall ſlew many founde vnarmed playing cheſſe hazarde brake chamber turret vpon ladyes knightes laye aſléepe ſo made maiſters within ſhutting priſoners ſtrong chamber bereft armour toke engliſh men bin taken yeare kept priſon hadde relieued well meate drinke made guardens ouer cuſtodie ſo wanne fortreſſes caſtell vnknowen towne appointed ouerſée repayring broken wals happened within caſtell morning commaunded workemen towne ceaſe theyr workes therevppon perceyuing caſtell wonne ſtreyghte wayes fledde newe castilians▪ ſuffered ladyes depart horſſebacke wyth theyr apparell writing munimentes oughte holde theyr fées ſame daye came caleis theyr ayde ſuche perſons ſente whoſe ayde kepte caſtell aboute thrée clocke came two knightes ſente earle gu • ſnes demaunding truce willed know thus entred caſtel belonged whoſe aucthoritie kept caſtell ſo taken time truce wherevnto aunſweared intruded woulde declare man theyr purpoſe til tryed longer poſſeſſion therefore saint mawrice day abbot king buſie parliamente french men ſente ſayde earle guiſnes declared preiudice truce ſayd caſtel taken therefore right mutuall fayth ought reſtored vnto king aunſwered without hys knowledge enterprice made therefore hée gaue commaundemente ſubiectes none ſhoulde deteyne caſtell guiſnes deliuer vnto lawfull lordes thereof meſſengers returned1352 home reporting done earle guiſnes commeth caſtel demanding within time whoſe name kepte conſtantly affirming kepte name iohn dancaſter required knowe ſame iohn king englandes liegeman woulde obey anſwearing knewe meſſengers hadde bin englande earle offered caſtle beſides treaſure founde many thouſands crownes poſſeſſions exchaunge perpetuall peace king france aunſweared takyng caſtel engliſh men nation theyr demerites banniſhed peace king englande wherefore place thus helde would willingly ſell exchaunge none ſooner theyr naturall king englande ſayde woulde ſell caſtel obtaine peace would buy woulde ſell king fraunce whome ſoeuer would giue moſt earle thus ſhifted king englande boughte déede ſo place whyche greatlye deſired fortreſſe wont ſtoppe vppe paſſage higher countrey gyuing ſome greate ſuertye forragers iſſue forth caleis counſell fraunce therefore wiſhing haue caſtell agayne builde another like vtilitie defence countrey thereaboutes ſente geffrey charney latelye redéemed engliſhe captiuitie aucthoritie builde fortifye followeth trauayle guiſnes caleis place lefte hande ſtrong decayed hauyng churche certaine nunnes reſident called lalbastie place ſo neare guiſnes lalbaſtie fortified engliſhe menne ſtandyng without gate theyr fortreſſe might ſhoote thys monaſterie nunnes mighte eaſilye made defenſible hadde high wals like caſtell highe towre verye large ſtéeple beyng ſcituate mariſhe grounde mighte ſmall labour compaſſed ditche place engliſhe men hadde ſpared deuotion ſake vntil forſayde geffrey breache truce wyth mightye power beſieged guiſnes remoued nunnes churche making caſtell church fenſing walles rampire ditch pentecoſte whiche ſeaſon water impeaching hym people myghte worke mariſhe wythin caſtel therefore beſieged vnneth able come abroade wyth theyr boates ditch ful water mariſh vnpaſſable alſo full water neyther caleis coulde victuall anye manner meane reaſon ſiege wardyng kepte lalbastie thus beſieged oft time ſailed fought thē lalbastie ſlue ſometime arrow ſometime wt weapon length vpon day appointed caliſians thē oye markes one part within guiſnes met ſet enimies ſlew many chaſed many away finally ſet fire brent vp lalbastie andlalbaſtie brent raſed diſmanteling walles made plaine groūd yeare duke lancaster going spruce aduiſe ordinance king daughter diſpouſate england william duke zeland eldeſt ſonne lewes duke bauire intruded vpon romane empire yeare fiftéenth auguſt walter bentley vvalter bentley robert knolles make voyage france captayne robert knolles march briteine valiantly encountered enimies fight doubtfull good ſlayne principall marſhall france alſo lord quintin cur •• noke richmont mount albon legenell launey montbech vile chastel de la march knightes number 140 bachelers number fiue hundred whoſe coatearmours brought away number commōs compted takē lord bruſebeke ſonne marſhall bertram alſo triſtram de maleis alſo lord maletret uicount comaine geffrey de graues william de la vall charles darcheſill iohn de bauſe knightes bachelers aboue 130 armie frenchman vnder conduct ſayde marſhall purpoſe deuiſed ſo beſette backehalfe ſtéepeneſſe mountayne flie could end hope flight takē courage fight might ye encreaſe many thoſe knightes ſurnamed starre whoknightes sta •• e profeſſion conſpired neuer turne fearefull backes enimies number knightes among ſlayne taken numbred xlv dangerous encounter eſcaped vnhurt among foreſayd walter bentley captayne ſore wounded commanded thirtie archer condemned greateſt heate fight fledde earle stafford alſo entered gaſcoigne encountering greate armie frenchman iſſued forth fortreſſe gagent diſcomfited tooke chaſed natiuitie lady taken valiant knight▪ • ruſe gaude ſeauen knightes starre shortly dyed iohn dediaſeles thomas wale knightes greate valor iohn pe • che iohn stotley 28 september sherifes maior adam francis mercer 28 october ſame yeare heard pirats troubled sea ſeauen shippes warre ordeyned certayne pineſſes attending vpon ouer whiche admiralles thomas cooke richard tottleſham knightes ſcoured sea coaſt picardie normandie feaſt saint george returned wiſhed whileſt theſe thing sea lande otto ſonne duke brunſwike french king féedotto brunſvvike chalengeth combate vvith duke lancaſter french king paris man ſent letter duke lancaster returned spruce tenour whereof accuſed affirming returned spruce colein malitiouſlie informed coleners ſayd otto went ſtealth haue taken priſoner haue preſented french king adding héerevnto bycauſe neuer meant ſuch taking ready declaration good name ſingular combate onely french king court proue duke lancaster lyar touching ſayd article letter ſealed therefore leaſt might haue bin thought follie haue giuen credite letter deliuered ſeruant duke ſent vnto otto two knightes learne cauſe chalenge demaund thereof letter patentes ſealed ſeale armes knightes accompliſhing effect iourney returning ſpéede duke ſent french king ſafe conduct himſelfe men much ado obteyning went paris liſtes preſence french king king nauarre duke burgoigne many péeres realme france mounted ſtéede ſéemely wiſe readie ſignes without default trie combate ſo ſtayde till aduerſarie readie voyce herault canton common othe aſſurance word obey law contrary parte ſayde otto ſcarcely ſet horſe able decently ſet helmet wéelde speare elſe fayned whoſe vnableneſſe béeing perceyued french king king nauarre kyng tooke quarrell hys handes wherevpon otto commaunded firſt departe liſtes ſo wente hys way duke abode ſtill within commandement frenche king otto ſware ſhould neuer day appeach duke lancaster article ſo thence duke returned home zeland epiphanie parliament holden westminſter anno reg 27 parliament vveſtminſter wherin ordināce made inſtance londoner knowne ſhould weare frō thenceforth hoode excepte reyed ſtriped diuers couloursapparell appoynted harlot furre garmentes reuerſed turned wrong ſyde outwarde vppon payne forfeyte ſame yeare dearth corne ireland iriſhmen brought corne ſell vnto diuers hauens realme • waged great reléefe people king edward altered chappell progenitor founded saint stephen westminster colledge twelue ſecular canon twelue uicars miniſters accordingly endewed reuenewessaint stephen chappell vveſtminſter ex carta 1353 ſumme fiue hundred pound yeare morrow saint matthies day began parliament wherein ordeined staple wooll kept flanders bridge ſhould thencefoorth holden diuers partes england wale ireland atstaples vvoll kept england newcastell yorke lincolne canterbury norwich westminster chichester winchester excester bristow carmarden earle northampton went scotland wyth great company armed men archer rode march enforced ye caſtell loghmaban fortreſſes yéeld tooke scottes layde ambuſhes alſo held treatie peace scottes gladly would haue redéemed king made perpetuall peace engliſhmen▪ yet ſo king scottes ſhould hold land king england william weld iohn little 28 september sherifes maior adam francis mercer 28 october innocent 6 deſire peace ſent cardinal bononi caleis heare treatie finall peace betwixttreatie peace kingdomes england france whome repaired counſellours realmes full authoritie treate conſtitute condition ſame peace length agréed vpon poynt king englande ſhould reſigne right realme france remitte french king ſhould haue therefore dutchie aquitayne county artoys guiſnes ſucceſſors king england without ſhould holde thecounties ſame french king manner wiſe theſe condition king england gaue conſente aſſurance couenants embaſſadoures ſente sea rome eyther realme king england anno reg 28 behalfe went biſhop norwich duke lancaster earle arundell knightes going auinion came archbiſhop rohan duke burgoigne geffrey charney french king counſell theſe receyued great honor many cardinalles biſhops met duke lancaſter brought ſpace two mile vnto auinion pope pallace length conſiſtorie pope cardinalles embaſſadoures preſent cauſes meſſage declared embaſſadoures england requeſted haue couenants cōfirmed bin concluded caleis frenchmē anſwered gladly would haue peace touching aquitaine foreſaid countreys ſayde french king could might giue aſſents ſame ſhoulde alienated entire body kingdome well king taken oth maynteyne yet could contented profitable dominion ſayd duchy countreys ſhould deliuered come king england aunceſters aquitayne ſo yet regalitie crowne france ſhould euer reſerued engliſhmen requeſted theſe ſayd dominion ſhould1354 abſolutely without condition reſtored king anſwere alſo made reaſon frenchman touching oth king themſelues whereby bound conſerue integritie honour kingdome wéete pope benefite peace might aſſoyle ſaide othe certayne article premitted ſhoulde well done yet nothing done might offorce furthering peace ſo embaſſadoures without effect returned home biſhop norwich excepted deceaſſed buried whome ſuccéeded thomas percy king nauarre brawle rayſed ſlewe charles de spayne marſhall france wherevpon auoyd diſpleaſure puniſhment french king fled owne countrey ſending unckle vnto duke lancaster letter humbly beſieching woulde come normandie ayde defence receyue oth fidelitie amitie hym againſt men duke therefore getting licence king aſſembled togither great nauie southampton duke readie haue made sayle knightes ſente normandie came backe view truth buſineſſe whome notifyed duke ſayde king nauarre hys couſin reconciled king ſo duke voyage ſtayde frier augustine church london reedified humfrey bohun earle hereford estſex whoſefrier auguſtines church london ro de auesberie diſſention oxford • iſto auria body buryed quire ſame church great diſſention fell oxford betwéene scholler uintner quart wine ſo scholler poured wine uintners head brake head potte reaſon whereof great conflict made betwixt schollers uniuerſitie lay men towne many lay men woūded twentie ſlaine theſe trouble continued ſpace two dayes religious men towne labouring make peace lay men purſued scholler wounded death yet day tumult appeaſed morrow people uillages oxford cōfederate lay men towne came great force erected blacke banner whervpon schollers fled colledges lay mē breaking vp dores ſlew many threw priuies cut rent bookes bare away liſted meanes uniuerſitie diſſolued schollers ſauing marton colledge went friend ſo continued yeare many schollers lay men enditedcitizens oxford endited y• king juſtices amōgſt y• four burgeſſes y• bin maiors oxford ſente tower london william totingham richard smelt 28 septem sherifes maior thomas leggy skinner 28 october xx nouember k edward held parliamētro auesbery westminster granted towards recouerie title france fiftie shilling euery ſacke wooll tranſported ouer sea ſpace ſixe yeares next following meanes whereof king might dayly diſpend ſaid ſixe yeares 1000 markes ſterling cōmon opinion ther thā 100000 ſackes wooll yearely foraigne land tranſported ſo thoſe ſixe yeares ſayd grant extended fiftéene hūdred thouſand pound ſterling king edward helde great juſting wodstoke honour anno reg 29 iuſting vvodſtock quéene purifyed hir ſonne thomas gaſter parliament westminster king1355 tooke quarell oxford hand ſauing euery man right forgaue schollers whole treſpaſſero de auesburie ſo sommer following uniuerſitie begannevniuerſitie oxford reſtored agayne flouriſh king gaue chancellour oxford view aſſiſe bread ale wine victualles excluding maior vtterly office communaltie towne gaue uniuerſitie 250 poundes amends ſauing vnto neuertheleſſe action vnto euery ſingular perſon towne parliament proceſſe iudgement made againſt roger mortimer earle march reuoked ſoex recordis yong roger mortimer ſonne edmond mortimer reſtored title poſſeſſions earledome march couſin heire grandfather king edward sandwich iourney towardesking edvvard • ſayled france france prince wale sutton deuonſhire hys voyage towardes aquitayne looking proſperous winde ſpace fortie dayes thing elſe readie french king armie • deuided ſundrie place hauens normandie partes empeach landing king prince ſo long lay frenchman hired souldioures fowly waſt owne countrey conſumed ſo many thouſands crownes french king coffer vaynely ende néedie payde people ſo forſaken king edward waſted france french king men encounter fledde followed brenning owne townes deſtroying victual king ſhould find neyther harborough meate moneth auguſt king england duke lancaster ſeauen thouſand armed men retinue entered france ſpace nine dayes iourney went waſting fire came way returning caleis king heard scot entred ſtealth taken towne berwike thebervvike taken scottes baron graystoke armie king whome charge towne bin committed wherevpon king haſted vnto berwike within fiftéene dayes recouered towne againe deliueredbervvike taken englishman vnto life libertie depart giuen vnto found therein paſſed scotlande vnto scottiſh sea bycauſe victual fayled armie king giuing licence returned towarde englande followed tayle armie ſpace twelue mile robert herle almerike de ſaint edmond robert de hildeſley whome scottes night ſeaſon found aſléepe reſt doubting nothing miſaduenture wherefore gaue cruell aſſault vppon hideous noyſe cry long reſiſtance robert de hildeſley iohn branceſter knightes taken priſoners robert herle almerike hauing much ado eſcape ſaid knightes perceyuing scottes ſtrong thought themſelues lord baron whome held fée would redéeme ſo wylie withdrawing deliuered scottes captiuitie duke lancaster appoynted chiefe admirall engliſh nauie landed hogges feaſt saint barthelmew thence rode towards normandie accompanied philip brother king nauarre deſired aide ſayd duke requeſted come help ſeaſon french king hauing king nauarre geffrey harecourt diuers noble men greate ſuſpection touching realme kingdome bidde feaſt tooke ſaide king nauarre caſt priſon murthered reſt noble men ſauing geffrey harecourt whome cauſed beheaded axe king nauarre thus empriſoned brother phillip ſeaſed many caſtels holdes hāds normandy ſtrongly fortifying men victualles help duke lancaster manned well engliſhmen men ſame countrey withſtande frenchman walter foreſter thomas brandon 28 septem sherifes maior simon france mercer 28 october ſame time king paſſed ouer caleis france eldeſt ſonne prince wale hauing earles warwike suffolke saliſburie oxforde tooke ſhipping beginning october sutton hauen deuonſhire luckely ſayled landed burdeaux honourably receyued biſhop cleargie accompanyed common people firſt sonday moneth monday following prince going lodged two mile burdeaux caſtell vrnoun nexte daye paſſed ſtreight woodde ſo middle towne lougan ſometimes walled nowe defaced ſo paſſing long iourney loſt many horſſes came length ſtrong caſtel dandert thurſeday came citie beſas hauing cathedrall church couent frier minor friday proclamation made armie euery man ſhould beare armes saint george ſaid enimies bare ſame alſo saterday paſſed caſtell nan ſtand thrée caſtels thrée lordes whereof one ſheweth farre friday twelfth moneth armie paſſed land wordiux whiche belonging earle flux dayes iourney long tedious loſt many horſſes waſt grounde called laundes two mile towne areule diſplayde banner deuided army diuers troupe vaward wherein thrée thouſand men armes earle warwike high conneſtable reignold cobham lord marſhall lord beawchamp somerſetſhire man lord clifford lord thomas hampton belonging auntients ſeauen baron gaſcoigne middleward wherin ſeauen thouſand men armes beſides clearkes page prince himſelfe double auntient earle oxford lord barthelmew burwaſh lorde iohn de lile lorde wilowby lord le ware ye lord maurice barkeley ſon thomas lord barkeley liuing old lorde iohn bourſers lord iohn roſe elder burdeaux captayne de la buſch lord camount lord mountferraunt auntients rerewarde foure thouſand mē armes cōmitted charge earle suffolke earle saliſburie lord nemers led bernences whole armie mē armes clearkes page archer brigants aboue 60000 men day ienken barefort diuers made knightes village aurule thrée village wherof wil lord raymond captaine deliuered vp vnto ye prince wherin lodged armie reſting two dayes many would wer ſuffered go tooke victual brenned enimies coūtrey tueſday lodged ye towne mount clere ye caſtel belonging therevnto giuē vp prince left againe frenchman reaſon fire brake vp towne wherevpon prince went field lodged tentes euer refuſing lie towne day hauing taken thrée townes brenning made knightes gilotus de straton diuers alſo iohn de lile ſtricken quarell austage died wedneſday thurſeday lay ſtil friday came ſtrōg town loegeron lodged tentes saterday came placence faire towne ſtrong inhabitant whereof fled away ye caſtell earle moleſni many knightes takē captaine de la bouch lord mountferrant de loachis y• day made knight sonday luke day ſtaid ewant taking fort galian force ſet fire brent monday caſting fire townes placence paſſed along leauing towne beal marchi right hand lodged towne archbiſhop anfer called le baſe day richard stafford brother vnto earle stafford led men antient towards ye towne next day tueſday ye town yéelded vnto bicauſe belōged ye church prince would ſuffer mā enter excepting certain perſons appointed purpoſe deliuering victual wedneſday leauing ye faire town eſcamount ye left hād came noble towne merand belonging ye earle commege ful armed ſouldiours prince lodged great monaſtery bartons ye abbey ſo much one liuing creature foūd thurſeday lay ſtill harme ſayde abbey friday went faire rich coū trey arminake entred coūtrey austerike paſſage hard hilly lodging saxaunt towne ſet fire contrarie cōmandement ye prince al day thrée dayes following paſſed alongſt high hilles aragon saterday came towne ye rereward army lodged great monaſterie blacke monkes fled away middleward vilfrankes vaward tremaine theſe village rich full victualles man thē inhabitant fledde sonday xxiiij october paſſed certaine foord entred land ye earle comenge reached vnto tolouſe theſe coūtreys wer waſted fire ſword leauing left hand towne called sannetere austrike paſſed ſtrong citie winbers pope iohn 22 remouing blacke monkes erected biſhops ſea lodged great rich towne called sotanco belōging ye earledome comenge couēt frier minor burning towne monday paſſed goodly wide countrey plaine ſo came townes foy litz tueſday reſted wedneſday feaſt simon iude armie paſſed ye riuer geroūd water fierce ſtony terrible ſame day ye riuer arage much dangerous came vnto tolouſe time neuer durſt horſemā paſſe ouer theſe water wherefore ye people coūtrey wonderfully made aferd could tell ſodeinly takē could flée night prince lodged falgard little towne one mile tolouſe tueſday came vnto faire great town called mount gistard parte inheritance lord almerike de la foſſad towne frenche king taken frō bycauſe ye king england féed man faſt ſayde towne twelue windmilles ſet fire taken two eſpies certified prince earle arminake tolouſe conneſtable france mount maban four league tolouſe friday paſſed towards auinion good towne baſige towne called franke whole armie lodged great towne called auion • middleward rereward lay one ſide ſuburbes vaward lay ſide towne towneſmen perceiuing fled euery one towne twenty windmilles ſet fire saterday laſt october lodged great towne called clastalnannar church chanons couēt frier minor another carmelite hoſpitall uillage called le mauns de pucels couent frier auguſtines al cōſumed fire sonday feaſt saincts armie reſted army certaine going take booty tooke little towne inhabitant whereof ſpared ſpoyling gaue x florens golde monday marched along townes mathele port great towne called vilkapinch frō thence entred countrey carkaſon prince lodged little uillage called alſe tueſday came carkaſon faire towne rich well built bigger london within walles betwixt towne senburge citie double walled ranne goodly water paſſed vnder faire ſtone bridge foote whereof foure couents religion ye frier ran away fled citie whole armie lodged towne abounded muſkadell delicate victual day ſonnes lord libret mayſter baſſet rowland daues many made knightes wedneſday thurſeday armie lying ſtill towne hauing made truce parlied citie concerning peace citizenscarkaſon france burned offering ſauing towne burning 250000 golden souſes prince anſwered came gold take city townes togither inhabitantes nexte day commanded towne bée brent friday towne brent army departed leauing left hand caſtell botenake vntouched paſſing champion countrey burning townes called la rustican countrey thereabout saterday trauayled great wind duſt leauing lefte hande great poole freſhe water béeing compaſſe aboute thirtie league called caſibon came towne called silony whiche yéelded prince therefore neuer touched prince lodged night good towne called canet sonday eyght nouember paſſed water sandey partly foord called chastel de terre partly ouer bridge ſo trauayled betwixt high hilles vnto great citie narbon whereof countrey taking name called gallia narbonenſis citie ſtrong well walled hauing great cathedrall church alſo notable caſtell belonging biſhop ſtrong tower earle ſame towne alſo suburbe called borough much bigger better built borough carkaſon borough foure couents religious perſons betwixt borough citie runneth water called ande comming carkaſon runneth greekiſh sea betwixt citie borough two bridge ſtone third timber built ſtorehouſes diuers merchandiſes prince lodged houſe carmelite frier tueſday borough béeing ſet fire army paſſing water ſide wente ouer diuers place thence went lodged towne caſtell ambion wedneſday trauelled euill iourney hurtfull horſſe lacke water thurſeday theodorike dale porter prince chamber made knight thence army paſſed good towne called vlmes middleward paſſed vnto good towne earle lile called arnile lodged night prince lay frier minor greate abundance muſkadell béeing prouided counteſſe ile ſpoyled daye alſo good towne pipions deſtroyed caſtell thereof called redote friday army paſſing long ſtonie way lodged lamian saterday returning backe towarde gaſcoigne lefte right hand great poole eſbone carkaſon iourney wente rereward lodged good towne called abier middleward puch • iancies caſtell béeing defended withſtoode ſeaſon length wonne prince lay beyonde bridge faire running water ſydes whereof countrey ſpoyled fire togither good towne peſaunce vawarde lodged y• night sonday trauelled a▪ long iourney bycauſe prince ſhould lodged great abbey lady de prolion ſeuerall cloyſters liue 100▪ predicants wherevnto prince deuoutely receiued y• day army ſet fire ye towne lemeins far greater couents religion carkaſon alſo brent faire towne called falange vnto towne belonged xxj windmilles brent alſo townes vnlard serre ye whole coūtrey lying theraboutes monday middleward lodged good towne called dealpuhbon long time defended length gotten force caſtell whereof yéelded vnto towne caſtell prince cō manded harme ſhould done fire tueſday earely paſſing ouer ye riuer beſeile entred coū trey broade one aclocke came great abbey called bourgbon earle fluxens great ioy receyued prince newly eſcaped priſon paris laine ſpace two yeares ſaid earle remained time faithful prince day rode lordſhips ſeigniories ſame earle townes maſell colmon right hand paſſed greate towne saint canole high caſtel called hautripe day brent nothing reuerence foreſaid earle uineyards paſſed agayne ouer water arage leauing alſo tolous firſt one mile left hand four league right middle ward lodged great towne mermount togither caſtell brent wedneſday paſſed caſtell earle flux▪ called mounthane foote whereof horſemen paſſed ouer great water geround tooke towne caſtell north leauing riuer gerond left hand ſo paſſed vnto towne marconaw tooke returned ouer riuer againe tooke ſtrong towne carbone thurſeday ye armie reſted friday word brought prince french vp gathered great force deuided fiue great battels field far wherevpō men ſet themſelues battayle aray one mile place lodged béeing readie fight ſome one souldioures chance ſtart hare wherevpon great ſhout made enimies hearing ſente fortie light horſemen ſée cauſe thereof drawing nigh engliſh armie perceiuing ſet battayle aray returned backe againe declared ſéene wherevpon preſently whole armie frenchman fled great feare ſame day barthelmew burwaſh iohn chandos iames de audley xxiiij light horſemē appointed ſcoutes comming y• tayle y• frenchman toke priſoners xxxij knightes gentleman amongſt whome toke erle romeme alſo ſlewe many carter wagoner prince lodged ye towne muwoſe saterday marched caſtell oradrie caſtell prince lodged morning brent sonday two twentith nouember euening perceyued theyr enimies ſide ye gret hil harde great towne gemount ſo engliſh men benighted ſent lx lyghte horſſemen certaine bowman vnto righte hande towne called auremount finding 400 menne armes coneſtable fraunce chaſed towne ſlewe toke many middle warde lodged auremount uawarde colimont earelye morning wagoner commaunded remayne towne auremount reſidue deuided troupe went fielde wayting comming theyr enimies vaine prynce taking towne gamount tolde enimies fled away midnight tweſday armye lodged fielde lacke water horſſe faine drinke wyne whereof came paſſe nexte daye horſſes ſo drunke coulde goe right forth many dyed saint katherines daye wyth muche doe came water leauing towne florence theyr righte hande paſſed greate towne called silard middle warde lodged towne called realmount toke maine force therefore brent thurſday reſted fryday trauayled long iourney walled townes ſtrong caſtels middle warde lodged serde saterday paſſed ouer certaine water great difficultie wood till came good towne called meſin sondaye prince reſted toke homage othes towneſmen monday sainte andrewes daye trauelling long iourney came towne tolows thrée caſtels tweſday prince trauelled caſtel melan wher lodged wedneſday prince came regla wher horſſes wagon paſſed throughe riuer gerond thysanno reg 30 towne regla prince appointed diuerſe baron ſuche like winter diuerſe place march intente ſhoulde kéepe inland part gaſcoigne againſt french men prince wale touching theſe matter aforeſayd conſiderations alſo cauſed newe coyne golde made gaſcoigne buſied himſelfe aboute repayring ſuch thing decayed throwen downe ſeaſon ſprang vp fooliſh fantaſie french men heades king englande come normandie cauſe rumour roſe vppe duke lancaster fortifyed ſtrong place belonging king nauar whiche ile constance place direct iourney towardes brytaine whereof newly made chiefe captaine another cauſe phillippe brother to1356 king nauar came england earneſtly craued ayde king againſt frenche king kept hys brother priſon mighte force armes reſtoare ſuch land vnto wrongfully withholden wherevpon hée offeryng doe homage fealtie hadde king appoyntmente mile stapleton manne great integritie martiall affayres ſkilful ſay king appointed faithful felow theſe men two thouſande men well appoynted trauelling throughe normandie toke townes fortreſſes burning diuerſe paſſing along tyll came caſtell nine league diſtaunte citie paris neyther • lake theyr trauayle vntil hadde forced theyr enymies enter yearelye truce meanes great report leſſe fear filled heartes french men whiche report length came eares prince lying regla wherefore gathering power hys dukedome intent méete hys father whiche muſte doe trauelling fraunce came length brugetat certifyed earle armenia woulde departure haue ſpoyled countrey intent prouided greate bande men wherefore hée ſent backe gouernour gaſcoigne vnto barnarde de libret thence prince went france coaſtes barny lymon ſtil encouraging men againſt enimies ſending iohn chandos iames dawdeley complices trye ſtate enimies countrey leaſt perhappes ſome crafty ambuſhment might ſodainely aſſaulte men afore ware himſelf remouing campe euery day entred pictauia eſpies broughte worde french king gathered greate armye beyng aurelian alſo knewe prince comming ſente eſpies diſcouer armye amongſt whō griffin micco chambly petie captaine two hundered men méeting eſpies came coaſte oure eſpies toke thirtie thē ſlew reſidue ſo one lefte carrye worde become theyr fellowes eſpies procéeded towardes romerentine méeting lord crone lord briſgande ſette vppon ſlew chief captaines forced flée caſtle hauing taken lodging town prince commanded morning great aſſault ſhould giuen thē ye caſtell day folowing men al armed paſſed ditch came vnto ye wals caſtel ſome applied ſcale ye wall ladder ſome burne gate entring ſlew gret many chief men ye lord named fled vnto principal tower ye caſtel ye prince determined depart til beſieged eyther taken yéelded length caſtell vndermyned men beſieged humilitie yéelded vp caſtell ſpies declared frenche king come downe turon prouide army go againſt prince tydings prince gladde pighte tentes againſte frenche king could paſſe riuer leger reaſon greate floudes frenche king hadde broken bridge intent ſhoulde paſſage betwixte prince duke lancaster whoſe armyes might wel euerye nyght perceyue eache others fiers campes prince folowing alongſt riuer leger eaſtwarde pyghte hys tentes neare vnto turon loking frenche kyng foure dayes hoping fighte hée diſtaunte one league vnderſtoode frenche king retyred backe blamia ten league paſſing ouer bridge riuer leger place vſed betwixt two ſtrong townes ſo towarde poyters retyring frenche king certifyed prince returned backe intending haue mette waye whych coulde doe yet croſſing ouer imagined nerer way ſette vpon tayle enymies cut frō earles inyni winter alſo marſhall burgonie theſe takē died thought great toyle taken night drawing men gaue themſelues reſte wood intending next day take theyr iourney towarde poiters waye certifyed frenche king greate prouiſion prepared himſelfe battayle drew nigh tentsthe batayle poyters prince therefore committed vawarde armye earles warwick oxford middle ward guided prince rerewarde led earles saliſburie suffolke whole armye prince aboue foure thouſande menne armes one thouſande armed ſouldiours two thouſand archer pompous nobilitie french men drewe nygh greatly diſdayning ſmall company engliſhe men number eight thouſande fighting ſouldiours alſo ſeuen auntients matter gret many men murmured bycauſe late great part army ſent defende gaſcoigne among french men certaine scotte called william douglas man great force practiſe warres manne french king make knight bycauſe knewe woulde deadly enimie engliſh men gladlye hearkned aduices william captain ouer two hundred scottes theſe men vnderſtoode wel cuſtome engliſhe men thoſe dayes fighte foote point followed scottes scot alſo prouoked french king french men fight like maner french king obeying fooliſh counſel gladly agréed vnto ſayings wherevpon ſente lighte horſſemen cittie ſhoulde ſuffer man make chaſe 500 horſſemen well appointed come againſte archer beginning conflict runne ouer treade vnder theyr horſſe féete theſe performed whiche commaunded appeared ſequele thereof army ſet readineſſe ſides fighte early sonday morning notable fayre beholde came cardinall petragoren charged prince name god crucified mighte pleaſe deferre warre tyme eccleſiaſticall peace alſo ſparing chriſtian bloud ende might treatie peace whiche promiſed ſhoulde performed wyth great honour ſides prince neyther feared refuſed peace modeſtly agréed requeſt father day nowe appointed obtaynyng peace army french men encreaſed number thouſande men armes alſo morrowe cardinall came againe frenche king behalfe requeſt truce ſhould endure one whole yeare whiche prince denyed yet importunate ſute cardinal graunted truce continue till chriſtmaſſe next comming therefore cardinall returning frenche king requeſted pledge truce marſhall dawdenam geffrey de charney douglas scot perſwaded common reaſon coulde come paſſe engliſh men ſhoulde time preuayle eſpecially bycauſe fewe ſtraunge countrey wearyed miſerably toyle trauel therefore ableto indure ſo great number french men fraunce ſtood defence theyr lande prince wale certified captaines french wold haue kind peace ſuch could get force armes calling men togither made oration firſt generall archer followeth mā hoode ſaith hath bin alwayes known great dā gers ſheweth yt degenerate frō true ſons engliſh men deſcended bloude heretofore vnder father dukedome predeceſſors king englande vnto whome labour paineful place inuincible ground vnpaſſable hil wer neuer ſo high inacceſſible tower vnſcaleable army inpenitrable armed ſouldiour whole hoſtes men formidable liuely couragiouſneſſe tamed french men ciprians siracuſians galabrians plestinis brought vnder ſtiffe necked scottes vnruely iriſh men yea walſh men alſo could wel indure labour occaſion time daungers maketh feareful verye ſtrong ſtoute doeth manye time dull witted men make wittie honour alſo loue countrey deſire rich ſpoyle french men doth ſtirre vp follow father ſteps▪ wherefore follow auntients wholy intentiue follow commaundement captaines well minde body victorie come life may ſtill continue firme friendſhip togither hauing alwayes one one minde enuious fortune whych god forbidde ſhoulde let v preſente runne race fleſhe ende life labour togither ſure name ſhall want eternall fame heauenly ioy alſo theſe gentleman companion wyll drinke ſame cuppe ſhal doe vnto ſhal eternal glorie name haue wonne nobilitie fraunce ouercome god forbid aſcribed vnto daunger time courage men hauing ſpoken theſe word perceyued hill harde whiche planted toppe hedge ditch inſide whereof playne paſture fielde one ſide thereof manye roughe buſhes ſide planted vine reſidue playne top wherof imagine armye french lye betwixt men hil gret lowe vallyes péece mariſh ground one company prince finding narrowe paſſage entred valley toke hyll among buſhes hidde themſelues taking aduantage place fielde wherein men laye witte vawarde middle warde deuided playne frenche armye laye long hedge ditche one ende whereof dyd reache downe mariſhe aforeſayde hyll nexte mariſhe earle warwicke kept captaine vawarde vpper part hedge toward hanging hil gret gap whiche ſtones caſt ſtoode rereward ouer whiche earle saliſburie captayne oure enymies perceyuyng oure prince auntiente bée diſplayed ofttymes bée remoued place place reaſon hill ſome time quite ſighte iudged prince fledde yet douglas scotte marſhal de clarimount ſayde ſo marſhal dawdenam deceiued owne opinion thought otherwiſe cry ſtill followe chaſe prince fléeing alſo douglas intēt get preferment worthy name new warfare clarimount waſhe awaye euill opinion whiche conceyued touching fidelitie vehement perſwade forwarde vnto charge vawarde deputed theſe went faſhion certaine chaſe iuſte againſte certain wer vnder hill vaward came méete marſhal dawdenam ſtaying ſée end iuſting kept himſelfe encountring meane time clearimount thinking come gap hedge ſo come backe vawarde compaſſe met earle saliſburie perceyuing comming purpoſe ſuſpected whole intent ſo whiche gouerned rereward making haſte take gap kéepe enimie paſſing way ſuſtayned firſt charge battayle began terrible méeting betwixte armed menne laide loade ſwordes ſpeares neyther dyd archer ſlacke theyr duetie lying ſafe trench ſtart vp aboue ditche ſhot ouer hedge preuayling arrowes fought armes thus rerewarde ſlaying enimies came ſtragling gap vawarde lay hanging hil towarde mariſh gouerned earle warwicke alwayes readye met french men beating downe archer vawarde placed mariſhe daunger horſſemen yet al preuaile ſomewhat ye horſemen appointed purpoſe ouerrunne archer earle oxforde conſidering diſcommodity might enſue therof departed prince ward leading archer ſette one ſide french men commaunding ſhoote yt hinder partes horſſes meanes whereof horſſes gauld wounded fel tumbling ſat backes elſe turned backe ran vpon followed making great ſlaughter vpon maiſters horſſemen thus beaten backe archer retyred towardes place whence came ſhooting gauling ſides french men fought right ouer againſt time force heate battayle beganne prime earles warwicke saliſburie like fierce lion endeuored purpoſe ſhold dung land poyters moſt french men bloud nether wiſe counſeller thomas daſſord suffolke ydle ſeaſon righte worthylie actes behaued himſelfe experte ſkilfull actiuitie continually running ward warde troupe company comforted ſtyrred vp good word doe well hauing gret regarde youthfull ſorte luſtie ſouldiours beyng bolde vppon good heartes courage ſhoulde without regarde go farre placed archer ſundry time great aduantages oftentimes leaſure would ſuffer woulde encorage vp mind ſouldiours clarimount ſlaine william dowglas alſo wounded fledde hauing fewe scot hys bande archebald dowglas hys brother men retiring put themſelues good array vaward midlewarde ioyned themſelues togither marcheth forth newe armye french men whiche eldeſt ſon french king dolphin vienna brought forth order array army terrible fierce ſhewe laſt oppreſſed yet al coulde make men afrayde ſharp ſet deſirous honor alſo reuenge themſelues fellowes whiche little ſlayne wounded therefore boldely goe ſides makyng ſhowts noyſes cry saint george borrow saint denis v within come fight man man euery man readye dy fight ſaue theyr lyues neither doth ye lion make wolf afraid tegre terrible ſimple beaſt luſty gentleman enimies chaced ſlew like wolues chace kil shéepe though battel withſtood men firſte yet loſt great many men ſuche deuiſe ſaued manye yet running away faire retreate whiche frenchman accuſtomed vſe men conſidering victorie field doubtful long french king mighte preſence wyth armye lay halfe hid ualley woulde afterward chaced fled go field worthy man maurice barkley ſon thomas barkley regard vnto ye ſpace two houres togither men neuer ſpared wold ſtil forefront battayle inuading enimies wt firſte maurice ye midſt y• dolphens guard ſowed blowes among firſt ſpeare ſword length al alone compaſſed wt multitude forely wounded taken priſoner meane time mē carryed thoſe wounded camp laide thē vnder buſhes hedge y• way hauing ſpent weapon toke y• ſpeares ſwords frō whō ouercome archer lacking arrowes made haſt draw frō pore wretch y• halfe dead one thē eyther wounded quite wearied gret labor except 400 mē kéeping yt chief ſtandart wer appointed méete y• french king dolphin thus put flight one came y• frenche k ſayd lord k field fallen engliſh men eldeſt ſon hath withdrawen himſelf vnto whō y• frēch king anſwered othe y• would y• day forſake y• field vnleſſe taken ſlain ſo y• mean carried away force wherfore auntiente bearer cōmā ded march forward whō followed two gret cōpanyes armed mē wide fielde ſhewing themſelues men ſtruck gret feare heartes ſo much y• hope conquire whyche thing mā great wiſedome ſtanding ye prince ſignified wt howling voyce ſaying ala poore wretch ouercome prince hauing great truſt ſaith chriſt checked ſaying thou lieſt thou daſtardly fellow thou canſt ſay yt ouercome lōg liue captain de la buche noble man al affayres ſoone perceyued armes french king marching forth tentes aſking licence prince departed awaye lx ſouldiours hundred archer many men thought haue fled away wherfore ſouldiors excepting chiefe captaines quite hope victorie committed thēſelues wholy mercie god prince cōmanded auntient bearer ſir walter woodland march foreward toward enimies wt • ew freſh men ioyned battayle ye gret army french king ſounde trumpet one giuing anſwere another made ſuche noyſe y• wals poyters ſoūded wt eccho therof like wood ſuch ſort y• man would haue thought y• hils bellowed ye valley ye cloud giuē forth moſt terrible thū der ye ther wāted cruel lightning whyleſt ayre ſhone ye bright armour ſpears daſhing againſt ſhining harneis thē came cruel cōpany croſbowmē making darkneſſe y• ſ • y yt multitude quarels ſhot againſt whō came worthy cōpany engliſh bowman flyes alſo dart aſhe met wt enimy afar ye frēch army ful diuers troups many armed mē defēding breſts ſhields procéede forwarde againſte enimies wherefore oure archer hauing emptied quiuers vain armed ſwords target fayn encounter laden armour beſtirreth hymſelfe worthye prince wale cutting hewing french men ſharp ſword mean time captain de la buch marcheth compaſſe vnder hangyng hil prince little forſoke priuily compaſſing fielde length commeth cloſe vnder place frenche campe laye thence aſcended toppe hill waye whiche french men beaten theyr trauayle ſo ſodainely breaking forth vnloked ſhewing enſigne saint george friend prince great courage giueth freſhe charge french armye deſirous breake ranckes captaine aforeſayde ſhoulde ſet ſide battayle prince luſtilye encountring enimies goeth middle throng ſéeth moſt companye hée layeth aboute hym euerye ſide meane time ſide friend ſerued captaine de la buche backes enimies beating killing without pittie archer alſo placed purpoſe ſhot ſo thick wounding backes ſides french men ſuche ſorte forme battayle quite ſpoyled neyther could put themſelues order array courage prince lenghth thruſteth thorough throng guarded frenche kyng ſhoulde ſée auntient beginne nod ſtumble bearer fall downe bloud flaues prince ran mingled togither water whiche nigh like ſort bore cornwal rageth ſéeketh haue none way french king ſtandard thā bloud came met wt • ōpany ſtout men withſtand engliſh mē fight frenche men alſo lay length fortune making haſt turne hir whéele prince preaceth forewarde enimies like fierce lion beating proud came yéelding vp french kyng french men ſcattered abroade fieldes poycers perceyuing ſtandard flouerdeluce beaten fledde ſpéede towards towne farre engliſhe menne perceyuing fléeing though themſelues eyther ſore wounded wearied followed chaſe euen gate poyters wher great ſkirmiſhe verie daungerous ſlewe great number french men laſt mē called back retreate ye ſound trumpet aſſembling togither diuerſe pauilians tentes ſet vp fieldes whole company throughlye comforted wyth victorie gaue theyr whole endeauour prouide wounded quiet reſt wer wearied ſafe kéeping wer taken priſoners refreſhing almoſte famiſhed vntill ful vnderſtanding many wanting among founde halfe dead founde lord iames dawdeley reaſon broade bucklet caried armes ſouldiours brought prince lodging prince hymſelfe riſe ſupper came cauſed ſtripped layd ſoft bedde ſomewhat better come remembraunce prince comforted ſwearing vnto frenche king yéelded vnto whiche newes languiſhing noble man hearde ſtreight wayes reuiued prince returning french king willed deny bée vnworthy déede roſe ſupper comfort almoſt deade ſpared hys owne bloude purchaſe victorie hauing ſome talke concerning warres whiche iames dawdeley made frenche king ſayde amongſt ſtoute champion valiauntly day behaued themſelues gretly wonder noble déeds knight ſpake muche ſupper ſpake prince comforted noble praye like wordes ſayde french king ſpake although chaunce fall euerlaſting ſorrowe yet thoughte good refrayne ſame kinde meaſure though vnder ſubiection law righte war vnder noble couſin yet raſcals faint harted runneawayes taken lying hidde cloſe corner maner fielde end ſucceſſe warre readie dye liue iuſtice ſake ſame fielde many richmen taken whoſe liues reſerued raunſome fainte harted lewde chaſed away worthyeſt ſtouteſt ſpoyled theyr liues battayle poyters fought ninetéenth day september returning englande wyth iohn french king phillip ſon many pryſoners arriued plymouth▪ fifth may 24 maye entred london receyued greate honour citizen ſo conuayed king pallaice westminster king ſitting eſtate westminster hall receyued conueyed french king lodging lay ſeaſon ſayde french king lodged sauoy pleaſant place belonging duke lancaſter winter following gret royal iuſtes holden smithfielde london many knightly ſights armes wer done gret honour king realm preſent king england fraunce scotlande many noble eſtates thoſe kingdomes wherof part ſtrangers priſoners henrie picarde uintener maior london one day dyd ſumptuouſlye feaſte edwarde king englande iohn king fraunce king cipres arriued england dauid king scottes edward prince wale wyth many noble men ſayde henrie picarde kepte hall againſt commers ſoeuer willing play dice hazard like maner lady margaret wife alſo kéepe hir chamber ſame intente king cipres playing wyth henrie picarde hys hall dyd wynne hym 50 markes henrie verye ſkilfull arte altering hys hande win ſame king ſame 50 markes 50 markes ſame king began take ill parte although diſſembled ſame henrye ſaide vnto lord king agrieued couet golde play haue bid hyther might grieue amongſt thing might trie playe gaue hym money agayne plentifully beſtowing owne amongſt retinue beſides gaue many riche giftes king noble knightes whiche dyned wyth hym greate glorie citizen london theſe dayes stephen candiſh barthelmew froſtling 28 sep sherifes maior sir iohn stody vintener 28 october ſir iohn stody gaue vnto uinteners london quadrant wherein uinteners hal ſtandeth tenement round lane yet called studis lane founded thirtéene houſes xiij poore people whiche kept charitie rent frée halowntide dauid le bruce king scot deliuered long impriſonmēt xj yeres caſtel oldiham raunſome ſet 100000 markes payde next ten yeares following normandie brytaine ſoare ſpoyled waſted tho walſing anno reg 32 rob knovvles phillippe king nauers brother iacob de la pipe roberte knowles wyth manye engliſhe menne whyche captaynes companye raged warlike ſorte theſe countryes ſpace thrée yeares contrarye kyng englandes pleaſure thys roberte knowles béeyng meane man birth became captaine many ſouldiours manye maruellous actes iſabel daughter phillippe fayre king fraunce 1358 wife king edward ſecond deceaſed apnd riſinges regiſtrum fratrum minorum iuxta london xxij auguſt buried grey frier quire london tombe aliblaſter iohn barnes iohn buris 28 september sherifes maior anno reg 33 iohn louekinſtoke fiſhmonger 28 october iohn gaunt king ſonne diſpenſation tooke wife blaunch dauhter henry duke lancaſter kinſwoman french king vnder coulour peace offered king edward flanders picardie aquitayne land engliſhmen ranged ſpoyled perfourmāce wherof meſſengers ſent france frenchman would perfourme offer wherfore king edward angrie nauie shippes paſſed sea caleis wherefore deuiding armie thrée partes committed one companie vnto henry dukeking edvvarde inuaded burgundie lancaster another prince edward third reſerued himſelfe ſo paſſed burgundie meane ſeaſon norman ſmall nauie1359 frenchman arriued vvinchelſea arriued winchelſey partly brent towne ſlew ſuch withſtand wherefore prelate england aſſembled partes armour withſtande prepared themſelues battayle french gone simon benington iohn chicheſter 28 sept sherifes maior anno reg 34 1360 simon dolſeby grocer 28 october king edward power rode france picardie artois roan champaine ſo briteine deſtroying countrey héere noted fourtéenth day aprill morrow eaſter day king edward hoſt lay citie paris day full darke miſt hayle ſo bitter colde many men died horſſe backes cold wherefore vnto day hath bin called blacke monday king nauarre vexed ſore march normandie thus realme france miſerably beſet ſides laſt finall peace concluded onpeace vvith france condition king edward ſhould haue poſſeſſion countreys gaſcoine gwyen poytiers limoſin baleuile exantes caleis gwiſnes diuers lordſhips caſtels townes landes belongingtho walſ without knowledge ſoueraigntie ſubiection ſame peace confirmed writing oth king edward came england ſo ſtreight tower ſée french king appoynted raunſome thrée million florence ſo deliueredfrench king releaſſed impriſonment brought great honor sea then▪ſayled ouer france iohn denis walter berney 28 september sherifes maior iohn wroth fiſhmonger 28 october king edward 24 januarie beganne parliament westminster forme agréement redde allowed eſtates king laſt januarie cauſed noble ſweare holde andanno reg 35 1361 kéepe ſayde agréement eſpecially thoſe well prelats caleis ſware great dearth peſtilence hapned england called ſecond peſtilence died henry lancaster ſeconde mortalitie march london buryed leycester colegiate church founded deane twelue chanons prebendary many uickers miniſters accordingly dyed alſo reginald lord cobham walter lib lichfield fitz waren valiant famous knightes fiue biſhops wéete reginald worcester michael london thomas e • lie wife earle saliſburie diuorſed route great company engliſhmen cō manded depart france diſcomfited anuerne frenchman tooke diuers priſoners noble france bin afore takē engliſhmen ſlayn iaques de september sherifes maior sore rempeſt vvinde iohn peche fiſhmonger 28 october king helde chriſtmas windſore xv day folowing ſore vehemēt southweaſt wind brake forth ſo hideous ouerthrew high houſes tower stéeples trées ſo bowed reſidue fell remayned ſtanding weaker firſt fiue dayes may london smithfield anno reg 36 iuſting smithfield juſtes holden king quéene preſent moſt part chiualrie england france nation came spanyards cipriets armenian knightly requeſting king england ayde againſte pagan inuaded confines the1362 firſt staple vvool caleis ſtaple wool notwithſtāding oth receiued king england great men land ſent caleis feaſt apoſtles peter paule king edward westminster charter gaue abbot westminster couent two stagges ueniſon yearely taken foreſt windſore edward prince wale feaſt saint margaret edvvard king eldeſt ſonne prince aquitayne westminster preſence great men ye realme receyued father principalitie aquitayne fealtie homage firſt made yet left principalitie wale duchie cornewall county chester kent simon iſlip archbiſhop canterburie ordeyne thatprieſtes became theeues lacke liuing • ſhould giuen prieſtes yearely ſtipend thrée pound ſixe ſhillings eyght penny whiche cauſed many ſteale iohn saint albons iames andrew 28 sept sherifes maior stephen candiſh draper 28 october ſixtéenth day october began parliamente london continued till feaſt saint brice thirtéenththo walſing nouember day king borne hauing accompliſhed 50 yeare age wherevppon pardoned ſuch giltie treaſon perſon releaſſed priſoners reuoked outlawes petition common commanded plea vſed engliſh french continued ſince conqueſt made leonell ſonne earle hulster ireland duke clarence ſon iohn earle richmond made duke lancaster edmond ſonne made earle cambridge ſaide parliamente granted king forsubſedie vvoolles thrée yeares following ſixe twentie ſhillings eyght penny euery sacke wooll tranſported beyond sea ioane quéene scottes wife dauid bruſe ſiſter king edward third dyed buried grey frier church 37 1363 three king came england french king dieth cobham kent french king king cipres king scottes came england ſpeake king edwarde receiued great honor gaue great giftes king cipres scotland returned maior adam bury skinner 28 october ingram lord cowſie married lady iſabell king daughter windſore iohn bukulſworth thomas ireland 28 septemb iohn loukin fiſhmonger adam bury skinner 28 january iohn 28 september sherifes maior iohn louekin fiſhmonger 28 october iohn louekin stockfiſhmonger four time maior london twice election twice king appointmentiohn leyland borne towne kingston hoſpitall kingſton vpon thamis vpon thamis builded chappel called magdalenes • ioyned hoſpitall wherein mayſter two prieſtes certayne poore men thesaint michael • church crooked lane builded pariſh church saint michaell crooked lane london whiche pariſh dwelled ſmall homely thing ſtanding part ground late perſonage houſe builded groūd therabout filthie plot reaſon butcher eastcheape made ſame leſt haw ſame grounde builded faire new pariſh church saint michaell ſtanding buried middle quire vnder faire tombe stone image wife grauen allablaſter vpon ſame tombe alſo writeth iohn leyland founded colledge ſame church néere therevnto adioyning ſayde pariſh churche saint michaell hath bin ſince encreaſed eaſtwarde new quier ſide chappels sir william walworth fiſhmonger maior london ſhall ſhewed fourth yeare king richard ſecond alſo tombe iohn louekin remoued • lat ſtone grey marble garniſhed plate latin epitaph layde vpon yet remayneth edward prince wale taking compaſſion vpon peter tho wall anno reg 41 baſtard brother disheriteth lavvful 1367 king spayne driuen kingdome henry baſtard brother entred spayne great puiſſance battell nazers third aprill put flight foreſayde baſtard ouercame power ſlew ſixe thouſande men taken thréeſcore perſons name two thouſande common souldioures whiche done reſtored ſayde peter former dignitie returned home greate triumph victorie long henry baſtardethe baſtard brother murthereth lavvfull while king peter ſate table ſodeinly thruſt thorough speare inuaded lande treaſon open warre could iohn tornegold william dikeman 28 septem sherifes maior iames andrew draper 28 october frenchmen▪ tooke diuers townes caſtels poytow belonged king england endeanno reg 42 mighte effectually deceyue king england french king ſent word readie pay reſidue father raunſome perfourme condition peace alſo ſente wine of1368 boheme preſents token loue fortuned while embaſſadors king preſence lamentable newes brought forcible inuaſion frenchman poytow whiche king hearde hesutteltie frenchman commaunded embaſſadors gette home deceiptfull preſents deceiptfull lord whoſe mockes woulde long leaue vnreuenged embaſſadoures returning home mette menne caleis tooke wine goodes robert girdler adam wimondham 28 sept sherifes maior anno reg 43 third peſtilence dearth corne 1369 simon mordin stockfiſhmonger 28 october thirde mortalitie peſtilence yeare whereof dyed blaunch duches lancaster buried paules church london yeare great dearth corne ſo buſhell wheate london ſolde two ſhillings ſixe penny barlie twentie penny otes twelue penny xv auguſt died quéene philip wife edwarde third buried westminster queneſborough kingston vpon hull saint botolphes alias bostowne made staple parliament king ſonne iohn duke lancaster humfrey bohan earle hereford greate armie wente france little preuayled bycauſe huge armie frenchman pitched tentes vppon toppe chalke hill néere vnto caleis ſo ſtrongly coulde ſette withoute greate loſſe dammage ſhortlye thomas beawchampe earle warwike arriued caleis wyth number choſen souldiers whoſe comming frenchmenne leauing tentes victualles fledde away neuertheleſſe paſſed forth ſpoyling waſting iſle caw fire ſword returned towarde caleis fell ſicke whereof dyed captaynes returned without honor iohn piel hugh holditch 28 september sherifes maior anno reg 44 king borovved great ſummes 1370 iohn chicheſter goldſmith 28 october king edward borowed prelate many great ſummes money ſaying would beſtow ſame defence church realme midſomer ſente greate armie france whereof sir roberte knowles generall man time fortunately handled beyond ſea warres ſo long ruled counſell toward winter yong lord ſayde ought ſubiect ſo noble birth ſo diuiding themſelues diuers company sir robert knowles departed briteine owne caſtels conquered lord ſo diuided frenchman ſet vpon tooke priſoners whome liſted ſlew reſidue great part gaſcoigne fell prince bycauſe ſtrange exaction layde vpon alſo ſickneſſe encreaſing vpon returned england wife ſonne richard reſigning father hāds gouernement gaſcoigne monaſterie abingdon fiue mile oxforde ſpoyled oxford togither artificersmathew parker abingdon william walworth robert gayton 28 septem sherifes maior iohn barnes mercer 28 october iohn barnes gaue cheſt thrée locke thouſand markes lent yong men vpon ſufficientea cheſt vvith three locke neuer penie anno reg 45 1371 gage ſo paſſed one hundred markes occupying thereof learned ſay pleaſure deprofundis ſoule iohn barnes learned ſay pater noster ſo euer money lent day cheſt ſtandeth chamber london without money pledge parliament london king demaunded thegreat ſubſedie adam meri cleargie communaltie ſubſedie 50000 pound leuying whereof chauntrie prieſtes ſmall benefited taxed alſo biſhops remoued office returning gaſcoigne brought two daughter peter late king spayne whome afterwards tooke wiues duke maried elder time wrote himſelfe king castile engliſhmen fought battaile sea thebattayle sea fleming tooke fiue twenty ſhips laden ſalt frenchman beſéeged rochell remouing whereof ſent earle penbroke number men armes vpon whome fell spaniſh nauie hauen rochell ſlew tooke engliſhmen burnt nauie earle many noble men caried spayne togither king money king edwarde great nauie entred sea towardes rochell haue reſcued ſame winde contrary heauie chéere returned agayne hauing ſpente thys preparation ſayde nine hundred thouſande pound iohn philpot nicholas brember 28 september sherifes maior anno reg 47 1373 iohn piel mercer 28 october iohn duke lancaster entred france ſtrong power paſſed realme without battayle deſerts mountaynes aluerne lacke victualles many armie dyed thence went burdeaux brought ſcantly fortie horſſes backe commonly talked loſt thirtie thouſande horſſes vnluckie voyage great miſerie • bo walſing ſée poore ſtate men warre ſuche knightes great wealth countrey hauing loſt men horſſes glad begge dore dore found reliefe countrey deſtroyed manured reaſon whereof ſuch dearth countrey victualles could ſcant gotten money duke yet wintered tenth aprill following day battayle appoynted betwixte duke aniow tholouſe meane time truce taken till twentith may next following king england knew nothing day came great power armed men french appeared duke aniow aſſembled yet daye paſſed without battayle great ſhame reproch engliſh frenchman ſayd ready fielde day appoynted looke comming came wherefore ſpake many reprochfull wordes againſt engliſhmen calling falſe coward ha •• leſſe ſuch end iourney iohn northwold mercer london ſlayne blacke heath whoſe ſake began great debate among craftes london white frier fléeteſtréete sir william windſore lib maior vic lon cleargie granted king tenthes th • laytie fiftéenth iohn awbrey iohn fiſhed 28 september sherifes maior
