money leuied whole realme yeare ſore ſharpe winter ſuche aboundance snow continued december januarie februarie march ſo almoſte ſmall byrdes dyed hunger colde while king helde great counſell london noble realme henrie earle northumberlande thomas lorde bardolfe came againe england long iournying came towne thriske cauſed bée proclaymed ſo woulde haue libertie ſhoulde take vp armour weapon follow whervpon much people reſorted ſir thomas rockley sherife yorkeſhire knightes countrey went againſt bramham moore nere haſewold fought great battayle ſlew earle whoſe head ſtreyght wayes cutte lord bardolph ſore wounded taken aliue dyed ſhortly battayle fought xviij day february erles head put ſtake caryed openly citie1408 london ſet london bridge biſhop bangor taken lordes pardoned lyfe bycauſe founde armour king wente yorke condemned ſuch tranſgreſſed confiſcated good pacified countrey hanged abbot hayle bin armour returned south partes againe upon ſeuenth september ſuche flouds rayne olde men age neuer ſéene edmunde hollande earle kent whileſt beſieged caſtell briake brytaine wounded arrowe croſſebowe heade notwithſtanding toke caſtel deſtroied ground long braines rotted diedanno reg 10 sherifes maior thomas ducke william norton 28 september sir drew barentine goldſmith 28 october aboute feaſte al saintes cardinall burges came englande ſente colledge cardinalles informe king cleargie vnconſtaunte dealing pope gregorie alſo informed frenche king cleargie realme end thoſe two king might ſette theyr helping handes induce ſayde gregorie obſerue othe hadde made magnificence thoſe two king cō corde mighte made church vnto whiche buſineſſe frenche kyng hadde gladlye graunted ſente meſſengers vnto pope gregorie notwythſtandyng1409 obſtinate kyng englande hée vnderſtoode cardinalles meſſage hée commaunded curteſie gentle entertaymente ſhoulde gyuen hym offered beare hys charge ſo long hée woulde abyde englande feaſte epyphanye archebyſhoppe canterburie cauſed aſſemble london cleargye realme choſe perſonages méete go general counſel holdē piſa vnto choſen roberte holam biſhop saliſburie henrie chiſeley biſhop saint dauids thomas chillingdon prior christes churche canterburie kyng ſente iohn coluile knighte mayſter nicholas rixton clearkes wyth letter giuen thē ye letter pope writtē moſt holy father c ye prouidēce ye apoſtolike ſea wold vouchſafe conſider gret harme danger ſprong vp whole worlde vnder pretence sciſme chiefly deſtruction chriſtian people whiche aboue nū ber men ſay 200000 periſhed raging dyuerſe warres haue riſen ſundry partes world euen late number thirtie thouſande reaſon diſſention vpon biſhoprick leon betwixte two ſtriue contende one aucthoritie true pope aucthoritie antipope ſlaughter fielde lamentable thing ſpoken ſlaine diſtroyed truely apoſtolike ſea woulde greate heauineſſe heart woulde rather forſake honor apoſtolicall ſea thā ſée henceforth ſuch wicked ſlaughter committed woulde take example true mother king salomon rather choſe giue place childe ſhoulde cutte péeces c thus muche epiſtle ſente kyng englande foreſayde gregorie yeare great play ſkinners wel nere vnto clearkenwel beſids londō laſted viij day matter creation world bethe ſame moſt part noble gentles englād forthwith beganne royall iuſting smithfielde betwéene earle somerſet seneſhall henalt ſir iohn cornewall ſir richard arundale ſonne ſir iohn cheyne againſt frenchman anno reg 11 sherifes maior iohn lawe william chicheley 28 september sir richard marlow ironmonger 28 october thomas beuforte erle surrey made chanceller henrie scrope made treaſurer parliament holden london lent ſeaſon1410 knight burgeſſes preſented king bill forme moſt excellent lord king al noble preſent parliament aſſembled faithfull common humbly ſhewe ſoueraigne lord king may haue temporall poſſeſſions landes whych byth walſ biſhoppes abbot prior proudely ſpent waſted realme woulde ſuffiſe finde 150 earles 1500 knightes 6200 eſquiers 100 hoſpytals c went declare place thoſe great ſummes leuied wherby forſayde ſtates ſhould endued wā ted theyr accompte wherefore king commanded thē thenceforth ſhoulde preſume moue ſuch matter upon euen saint iohn baptiſt king ſonne eastcheap ſupper midnight betwixt two thrée clocke great debate hapned betwéene men men courte laſting houre til maior sherifes citizen ceaſed ſame afterward ſayde maior sherifes alderman ſent appeare kyng aunſweare whych king ſonnes diuerſe lordes highly moued againſte citie william gaſcoigne chiefe juſtice enquired maior alderman citizen whether woulde put ye king grace wherevnto aunſwered offē ded kyng ſonnes according law ſtanched debate king ſeeing woulde none otherwyſe forgaue altogither departed king henrie founded colledge battelfielde shropſhire ouercame anno reg 12 battelfield founded sherifes maior 1411 guilde hal londō builded ſir henrie percie iohn penne thomas pike 28 september sir thomas knowles grocer 28 october eaſter guilde hall london begun bée made newe forſayde maior alderman cuſtos gardian brethrē grocer londō purchaſed hall cunihope lane 320 markes thē • aide foundation therof tenth may iohn prendergeſt knight william long kept ſeas pirate rouers ſo paſſage sea quiet ill willers accuſed theft robberie themſelues whervpon knight toke sanctuarie westminster could haue houſe cotage hide heade ſame forbidden king ſo forced lye tente whiche ſet vp church porch haue men watch nighte ſeaſon feare enimie fellowe william remayned ſea vntill admirall prepared ſhippes readie went perſon fetch whiche coulde doe till promiſed fidelitie ſhoulde haue harme promiſe notwithſtā ding william impriſoned tower london earle arundale earle kime ſir robert vmfreuile ſir iohn oldecaſtle lord cobham ſir iohn gray warlike power greate number archer ſent france ayde duke burgoine againſt duke orleaunce saint elo beſide paris incoū tred enimyes vpon noble victorie wherfore bountifully rewarded duke burgoine returned englande squire wale named rice ap dee long time rebelled againſt king brought london drawen hanged quarteredanno reg 13 iohn raynwel william cotton 28 september sherifes maior sir robert chicheley grocer 28 october feaſt saintes parliamente begun london king cauſed newe kinde noble made1412 whiche leſſe value olde foure penny noble king henrie foūded colledge fodringhey northamptonſhire henrie fifth gaue lande priory monkes aliantes ſupreſſed goldſmith man fleete london bothe murdered night duke yorkes place without temple barre caſt riuer thamis fiftéenth auguſt king determination counſel appoynting ſend help duke orleaunce ſent ſecond ſonne thomas duke clarence edwarde duke yorke thomas earle dorſet many valiant men wyth ſtrong power helpe duke orleaunce againſt duke burgonie euer al y• returned whiche agoe went ouer ye erle arundale ayde duke burgonie ſo many men maruelled ſodaine chaunge ſo ſmall tyme engliſhmen dyd ayde aſſiſte two contrarie part notwythſtandyng foreſayde noble wente forewardes arriued normandie duke orleaunce méete tyme appointed brent hys townes ſpoyled countrey tooke manye holdes length thoughe late duke clarence orleance mette talked togither matter ſo entreated betwéene menne ſhoulde deſyſte raungyng throughe countrey refrayne robberie men hadde graunted departed aquitaine wynter duke orleaunce wente home hys countreyanno reg 14 ralph leuenhynd william seuenocke 28 sep sherifes maior sir william waldren mercer 28 october tyme lorde herle marſhall fraunce manye noble men men armes number foure thouſande beſieged certayne holde aquitaine whyche kéepyng iohn blunte knight thrée hundered ayded hym putte flight whole army frenchman toke twelue men name gentleman number 120 kyng henrie kept chriſtmaſſe manour eltham ſo ſore ſick ſometime men thought bin dead notwithſtanding pleaſed god recouered ſtrength againe little chriſtmaſſe called noble ye realm togither parliament london liued end therof great fortunate chaunces hapnedtitus liuius deliuered ciuill diuiſion hée taken ſickneſſe languiſhed til appointed houre ſickeneſſe ſome euil diſpoſed people laboured make diſſention betwéene king prince ſonne reaſon wherof acte youth exerciſed meanely great recourſe people vnto court time aboundant king father king ſuſpected would preſume vſurpe crown aliue ſuſpitious iealouſie occaſion part withdrewe affection ſingular loue prince noble prince aduertiſed father iealouſie diſguiſed himſelf gown blew • atten made full ſmall oylet hole euery oylet néeble wherwith made hanging ſtil thréede ſilke arme ware dogges coller ſet ful golde tirets ſame alſo fine gold thus apparelled great companye lordes noble men court came king father time laye westminster cōming owne commaundement one hi 〈…〉 panye auaunced himſelfe thā fire hall notwithſtanding greatly ofte deſired contrarie lordes great eſtates king court prince commanded giue leſſe occaſion miſtruſt king father himſelfe accompanyed king houſe paſſed forth king father due ſalutation deſired ſhewe intent minde ſecrete manner kyng cauſed himſelfe borne chayre ſecrete chamber bycauſe deſeaſed might goe wher preſence thrée foure perſons king moſt confidence commaunded prince ſhewe effect minde prince knéeling father ſaide theſe wordes moſt redoubted lord father time come preſence liegman ſonne naturall thyngs obay grace ſoueraigne lord father whereas vnderſtand yée haue ſuſpect behauiour againſt grace yée feare would vſurpe crowne againſte pleaſure highneſſe cō uerſation youre grace knoweth yée feare man eſtate ſoeuer duetie endaungering life puniſhe perſon therby race ſore hearte howe muche rather oughte ſuffer death bring grace feare yée haue naturall ſonne liegeman intente haue thys daye confeſſion receyuing sacramente prepared ſelfe therefore moſte redoubted lorde father beſéeche honour god eaſing youre harte heretofore knées ſlea dagger worde wyth reuerence deliuered king hys dagger ſaying lorde father lyfe ſo deſirous mée woulde liue one daye ſhoulde diſpleaſure▪ couet ſo much life doe pleaſure welfare thus preſence theſe lordes tofore god daye iudgemente clearelye forgiue deathe theſe wordes prince king taken compaſſion hearte caſt dagger imbracing prince kiſſed effuſion teares ſaide vnto right deare hartily beloued ſonne trueth partly ſuſpecte perceyue vndeſerued partie ſéeing humilitie faithfulneſſe ſhall neyther ſlay henceforth haue miſtruſt report ſhall made vnto thereof aſſure vpon mine honor thus great wiſedome wrongfull imagination father hate vtterly auoyded hymſelfe reſtored king former grace fauour thys reported earle ormonde tranſlatour myne author titus liuius king gaue ſonne prince diuerſe notable doctrine inſignments among eruditiōs one king lying grieuouſly diſeaſed called prince ſonne ſayd vnto ſonne feare ſor • departure life ſome diſcord ſhal grow ariſe betwéene thée thy brother thomas duke cla • ence whereby realme may brought deſtruction miſerie knowe greate ſtomacke courage▪ wherefore feare throughe high mynde wyll make ſome enterpriſe againſt thée intending vſurpe vpon thée whiche knowe thy ſtomacke maye abyde taſily dreade hereof ofte remembraunce ſoare repente euer charged ſelfe wyth crowne realme theſe wordes king prince aunſweared thus righte redoubted lorde father pleaſure god grace ſhall long continue v rule v god haue ſo prouided euer ſhall ſuccéede thys realme ſhall honour loue brethre▪ aboue menne long true faythfull obediente theyr ſoueraigne lord anye fortune conſpyre rebell againſte mée aſſure ſhall ſoone execute iuſtice vppon one ſhall vpon worſt moſt ſimpleſt perſon within realme kyng hearing thys aunſweare therewith maruellouſlye reioyced hys mynde ſayde deare wel beloued sonne wyth thys aunſwere thou haſte deliuered greate ponderous agonye beſéeche thée vppon bleſſing charge thée like thou haſte ſayde ſo thou miniſter iuſtice equally wiſe ſuffer oppreſſed long call vpon thée juſtice redreſſe oppreſſions indifferently wythout delay perſwaſion flatterer bée partiall ſuche vſe haue handes repleniſhed wyth gyftes deferre juſtice vntill morrowe thou mayſte doe iuſtice thys daye leaſte peraduenture god doe juſtice thée meane tyme take thée thyne authoritye remember wealth thy body thy ſoule thy realme reſteth execution juſtice doe thy juſtice ſo thou called tyraunte vſe thy ſelfe meanely betwixte juſtice mercie thoſe thing belong thée betwéen party iuſtice truely extreamely cō ſolation thy poore ſubiects ſuffer iniuries punition extortioner doer oppreſſiōs therby may take example thus thou ſhalt obtayne fauour god loue fear thy ſubiectes therefore alſo thou ſhalte haue thy realme tranquillitye reſte whiche ſhal bée occaſion greate proſperitie wythin thy realme whyche engliſhmen naturally deſyre ſo long haue wealthe ryches ſo long ſhalte thou haue obeyſaunce bée poore bée alwayes readye euerye motion make inſurrections cauſeth rebel agaynſt theyr ſoueraygne lorde nature ſuche rather feare loſing theyr good worldly ſubſtaunce ieoparding theyr liues thou thus kéepe ſubiection mixed loue feare thou ſhalte haue moſte peaceable fertyle countrey moſte louyng faythfull manlye people worlde whyche ſhall becauſe ſmall feare thyne aduerſaries ſonne ſhall pleaſe god call waye decrede euerye worldely creature thée ſonne heyre muſte leaue crowne realme whyche aduiſe thée take vaynelye▪ manne elate pryde reioyced worldlye honour thinke thou arte oppreſſed wyth charge puruie euerie perſon wythin realme exalted vaine honoure worlde thou ſhalt exalted crowne wealthe conſeruation realme thy ſingular commoditie auaile sonne thou ſhalte miniſter thy realme kéepe tranquilitie defende like harte myddeſt bodye principall chiefe thyng bodye ſerueſh couet deſire thyng moſte neceſſarie euerye thy member ſo sonne thou ſhalte amongſt thy people chiefe principall miniſter imagine acquire thoſe thyngs maye moſte beneficiall thy people ſhall obediente thée ayde ſuccoure thée al thing accompliſhe thy commaundemēts like thy member laboure euerye one theyr office acquire get thing hearte deſireth thy hearte force impotent without ayde thy member ſo without thy people thy raygne nothing ſonne thou ſhalt feare dread god aboue thing thou ſhalt loue honour worſhip wt thy hearte thou ſhalte attribute aſcribe hym thing wherein thou ſéeſt thy ſelfe well fortunate • ée victorye thyne enymies loue thy friendes obedience thy ſubiectes ſtrength actiueneſſe body honor rich fruitefull generation thing whatſoeuer chanceth thy pleaſure thou ſhalt imagine ſuch thing ſhoulde fortune thée thyne acte thy deſert thou ſhalte thinke cōmeth goodneſſe lord thus yu ſhalt thine heart prayſe honour thanke god hys benefit giueth vnto thée thy ſelfe eſchew al vaineglorie elation heart following holeſome counſell pſalmiſt ſayeth non nobis domine non nobis ſed nominituo dagloriā ſay vnto v lord vnto v thy holy name giuen laude praiſe theſe many admoniſhments doctrine victorious king gaue vnto noble prince ſonne effect followed ſame death father whereby obtained grace lorde attaine gret victory many glorious incredible conqueſts helpe ſuccour lord whereof neuer deſtitute king father drawing end due thankes giuen ſupplications made god gaue benediction prince ſonne ſo yéelded god ſpirit xx day march anno 1412 raigned xiij yeares ſixe moneths odde dayes conueyed water feuerſham thence lande canterburie buryed ⸪ ¶ king henry monmouth henrie fifth began raigne yt xx day marchanno reg 1 titus liuius y• yere 1412 prince excéeded mean ſtature men beautiful viſage necke long bodye ſlender leane hys bone ſmal neuer leſſe maruellous greate ſtrength paſſing ſwifte running ſo much two lord without bow engine would take wilde buck doe large park delighted ſōgs muſical inſtrumēts ſo much y• chappel amōgſt priuate prayer vſed certaine pſalmes dauid tranſlated heroycall engliſh méeter iohn lydgate monke bury whilſt father liued beyng accōpanyed wt ſome yong lord gentleman wold waite diſguiſed araye owne receyuers diſtreſſe theyr money ſometimes ſuche enterprices company wer ſurely beaten receiuers made complaint robbed comming vnto wold giue diſcharge ſo much mony loſt beſides ſhould depart without great reward trouble vexation eſpecially ſhould rewarded beſt hadde reſiſted hym company hadde receyued greateſt moſt ſtrokes deceaſe father neuer youth wildnes might haue place actes ſodainely chaunged grauitie diſcreation noble prince aſſent parliamente all1413 eſtates realme thrée dayes offered fealtie crowned ſolemnized othe wel iuſtly gouerne common weale offer béefore neuer found made prince england king gaue generallye thankes theyr good mindes towardes hym therewyth exhorted zeale publike proſperitie honoure realme anye man hadde offended hym pardoned theyr treſpaſſe deſyred heartily god hée ſhoulde rule doe thing well honoure god proſperous commoditie realme god woulde ſuffer crowned hys fortune ſhoulde bée doe otherwyſe god ſhoulde take hym hys mercye ſuffer hym rather buried enterpriſe charge realme ninth day april crowned westminster thomas arundell archebyſhoppe canterburie whyche coronation called vnto hym thoſe young lord gentleman folowers yong actes euerye one whome gaue rich bounte •• giftes commanded many would chāge maners intended doe ſhould abide courte woulde perſeuer theyr former light conuerſation gaue expreſſe commaundemente vpon paine heades neuer day come preſence time thomas duke clarence king brother came coaſtes aquitaine ſaid ſent ayde duke orleaunce againſte sayle enguerant ſaythking henry ſayled normandy tho w •• ſ titus liuius enguerant 1600 sayles third night arriued kedeca • x normandy whiche betwixte hereflete • imflete whoſe comming city state th ••• partes aduertiſed ſtriken great feare king duke clarence glocester bréethren duke yorke unkle earles▪ baron knightes gentleman souldiours 〈◊◊〉 •••• ▪ • tooke land without reſiſtance king forthwith falling ground vpon knées deuoutely prayde god honor would giue iuſtice enimies landing hoſt▪ ſixe thouſande speares xxiiij thouſand footemen beſides gunner enginars artificer labourer whome king great abundance king gaue diuers gentleman order oftitus liuius knighthoode aſſigned bearing standarts banner ſuch mē knew great ſtrength proweſſe thing ſet good order array king hoſt aſcended toppe high hill nigh reſted next day ſixtéenth day auguſt duke clarence leader foreward good ordinance entred iourney towarde towne called herefleete diſtant kedecamp ſcarcely thrée league lodged hoſt field towne king comming lodged himſelfe nigh firſt warde farre towne earle suffolke michaell poole chiefetayne rereward lodged ſide towne noble men conduct two wing lodged one right hād left forthwith ſent towne men armes great number ſée ſcituation thereof ſhortly returned great pray cattell enformed king demaundes hereflete key ſée normandy ſcituate enguerant deſcription herefleete vpon sea ſide riuer seene betwixte two hilles middle thereof runneth riuer whiche farre ſame towne entreth seane thence thoſe riuers one deſcende sea great goodly hauen belonging ſame towne hauen garniſhed defence two faire ſtrong tower ſame hauen right great nauie shippes may ride ſafetie inhabitant towne encloſe képe within towne courſe foreſayd riuer ſluces may right well riuer riſeth without towne ſo high forecloſeth entry walles ſo man may approch towne part towne alſo defended high thicke walles tower alſo enuironed broade déepe ditch towne alſo belongeth two gate entry one called calturances mostrouillier towne beſides inhabitant thereof defence ſame foure hundred men armes deputed garriſon amongſt whome theſe lord lord diſcouteuile chiefe captayne towne lord blanuile lord haqueuile lord harmanuile lord eancourt lord gaillard bos diuers lord men expert warre king commanding duke clarence aſſéege towne endeuouredtitus liuius conuey people ouer riuer paſſage whereof great ſkirmiſh inhabitant towne laſt aduerſaries put flight recoyled within walles duke conuayde ouer riuer ward company bycauſe riuer deuided king camp duke ordeyned ready ſure paſſage ouer ſame riuer betwixt campes kéeping whereof certayne gentleman appoynted ſo theyr enimies myghte endomage neyther water lande meane time befell great miſaduenture theenguerant frenchman beſéeged gonnepouder ſhotte ſent vnto french king encountred vpon sea engliſhmen taken great diſpleaſure domage king gaue charge fielde brothertitus liuius humfrey duke glocester ſame ſide riuer king lay ye duke yorke high conneſtable england lodged band euery man placed ye towne ſo ſtreightly aſſéeged entry iſſues towne ſtopped ſo y• ye towne diſpaire haue ſuccour realme france many engins reyſed engliſh ſhort time ſhould haue bin deſtruction walles towne ſooner ſtopped riuer ſame towne within wherby water gathered reiſed without towne betwixt king clarence ſemblance little sea cauſed engliſhmen withdraw gonne engins whereby time walles ſaued king cauſed toenguerant made vnder water thrée great mine vnto walles towne like maner bin cauſe ruine inhabitant countermined letted purpoſe inhabitant town perceyuingtitus liuius themſelues thus ſtreightly aſſéeged well land sea conuayde shippes within hauē bound togither cheynes two tower made defence hauen put certaine garriſons armed men oftentimes attempted inuade king nauie time shippes beaten conſtreyned recule ſtill within hauen laſt captaynes inhabitant conſidering ſuch ſkirmiſhes well vpon land vpon sea gained nothing tooke appointment king reſcued frenchman within certayne dayes limited ſhoulde delyuer hys handes towne thirtie perſons greateſt moſt noble within towne ſuche king woulde deſire bée ordered king pleaſure reſidue well menne warre inhabitantes ſame towne without armoure leauing behynde theyr goodes ſhoulde fréely goe woulde ſuretie whyche appoyntemente bée kepte deliuered vnto king twelue greateſt perſonages pledge captaynes inhabitant towne ſéeing day appoyntment approch themſelues vtterly deſperate ſuccours people ordeyned perfourme couenant day prefixed whiche xxij september day came sir lionell braquemont gouernour towne vnto king knéeling ſayd moſt victorious prince beholde héere keyes towne promis yéeld vnto towne ſelfe companie brought king lord coteuile lord gangcourt number thirtie reſidue well ſouldioures inhabitant ſuffered vnarmed depart king conſtitute captayne towne sir thomas beawford earle dorſet hys unkle whome alſo committed two thouſand ſouldiers choſen men hoſt conſidering winter drew alſo loſſe men reaſon flix reigning amongſt infirmitie died michaell poole earle suffolke biſhop norwich theenguerat lord beawmont others common number two thouſand aboue king henry created ſonne michaell poole earle suffolke liued long king henry remayned harefleete fiftéene dayes ye deliuerie towne tower departed thence towards caleis whereof histitus liuius enimies aduertiſed alſo way intended paſſe people countrey city townes maruellouſlie oppreſſed feare wherefore haſted defenſible place apt warre tooke horſſes aſſembled togither great number ſmall companie footemen might oppreſſed engliſhmen king hoſt kept eaſie pace without making haſt approched towne ewe enimies aſſayled fieldes great force noyſe party foughten ſore vigorouſlyenguerant frenchman reculed towne good ſuretie thence king departed came paſſage riuer frenchman call blankhestoke blanch▪ tache paſſage attitus liuius comming vnto fixed ſharp ſtakes enimies ſo could paſſe conſtreyned go farther ſéeking paſſage vntill came directly haue citie amiens caſtell gorby left ſide ſayde citie began new fight ſoone forced engliſh returne citie agayne xix october king paſſed riuer paſſage vienna bethewcourt wente lodge mouchelegach frō whence aduanced towardes riuer miramont meane time french king duke guyen ſonne dolphin purpoſing reſiſt engliſhmen came roane whence ſent thrée heraults king england giue vnderſtanding ſhould eſcape without battayle vnto whome ſayde king anſwered thing done pleaſure god kéepe right way towardes caleis aduerſaries attempt diſturbe v oure iourney thinke ſhall without owne great danger perill thence king henry remouedenguerant uillage called forceuile aduancing hoſt towardes riuer miramont next day paſſed cheue king lodged night bonyers lestaillon next day king remoued vnto bangy thetitus liuius next day late night king came uillage named agencourt enguerant ſayeth maſencelles lodged diſtant french hoſt ſpace two hundred fiftie ſpaces frenchman fixed bannersenguerant standerts banner royall whereof conneſtable conduct field deuiſed choſen countie paule y• groūd agencourt whiche day following engliſhmen battell agencourt titus liuius ſhould paſſe go caleis xxv day october king england morning earely ſet forth hoſt array commanded horſſes carriage ſhoulde left uillage lodged order field thus middle battell whereof king conductor ſet midſt field directly againſt middle battell aduerſaries right ſide firſt battell therewith right wing left ſide laſt battell left wing theſe battayles ioyning nigh togither prouidence god proued vnto king defenſible place hoſt uillage wherein lodged defended hoſt inuaſions backe field wherein defended ſides two ſmall riuers noble king armed ſure right beautifull armour head bright helmet wherevpon ſet crowne golde repleate pearle pretious ſtones maruellous rich shield bare armes england france thus armed mounted vpon goodly great horſſe hym ledde certayne noble horſſes bridle trapper goldſmithes worke vpon alſo beaten armes england france thus victorious king prepared battell encouraged people field approached hand night cruell battell aduiſe counſell ſaid duke yorke king giuen commandemēt hoſt euery mā ſhould puruey ſtake ſharp end engliſhmen fixed ground field defend oppreſſion horſſemen frenchman ſuch confidence great multitude people great horſſes many great prince lordes leauing behinde souldiers standerts enſignes came towards engliſhmen right great haſt bin aſſured victory battayles engliſhmen large theenguerant field wherein fought would ſuffer greatly aduantage meanes enimies letted come vpon ſides backes hoſt frenchman ordeyned battels two ſharpe front like vnto two horne alwayes backward broader broader theſe ſharp battels ſet vpon engliſhmens middle ward intending haue runne thorough whole fielde frenchman ſlayne wounded engliſh archer helpe ſtakes engliſhmen fixed grounde whereby horſſemen conſtreyned returne elſe runne vpon ſtakes many ouerthrowne wounded many horſſes men ſlayne battell fight encreaſed maruellouſly ſpace thrée houres whych time man taken priſoner innumerable ſlaine vpon whoſe dead bodyes followed ouerthrowne ſlayne thus long cruell battell approched man battell death whome innumerable company ſlayne victorie remayned engliſhmen ſpared ſley take priſoners frenchman mortall battell noble king england fought enimies famiſhed lion pray receyuing helmet armour many greate ſtrokes laſt victorie obteyned greate hoſt frenchman ſlayne taken wounded vanquiſhed forthwith another hoſt frenchman leſſe firſte ſuppoſing engliſhmen wéeried prepared themſelues begin agayne newe battayle king england ſéeing ſecond aſſemble aduerſariestitus liuius ſente heraults vnto commaunding eyther forthwith come battayle elſe immediately depart delayed departe came battell thoſe already taken priſoners alſo thoſe ſhould taken without redemption ſhould put death meſſage frenchman heard fearing ſtrength engliſhmen alſo death themſelues priſoners taken heauineſſe departed forthwith king england aſſured victory gaue greateſt laude prayſe god might battayle ſlayne french parte duke alaunſon barry braban lord helly enguerant lord labret chiefe conneſtable france archbiſhop saunce eyght earles hundred mo baron fiftéene hundred knightes aboue tenne thouſand eſtates whereof ſcarcely fiftéene hundred souldiers labourer reſt cote armour battayle taken priſoners frenchman titus liuius duke orleaunce burbon arthure brother duke briteine earles vandiſme ewe andenguerant richmount sir boumeycault marſhall france andtitus liuius many number fiftéene hundred knightes eſquiers engliſh partie ſlayne duke yorke earle suffolke number c perſons vantgard eſtates ye engliſhenguerant partie found dead aboue vj c field night approched k england returned hoſt uillage wherein harbored night found horſſes baggage cariages ye left field ſtolne caried away frenchman day next enſuing king people entred iourney towarde caleis titus liuius william cambridge allin euerard 28 septemb sherifes maior sir nicholas wotton draper 28 october morrow saint simon iude earely theregiſt maiors morning came tidings london victorie ioy whereof te deum ſong church nine clocke order religious men citie went proceſſion saint paules vnto westminster new maior alderman craftes quéene hir lord hir trayne offered saint edward shrine maior tooke charge euery man returned great ioy xxiij nouember king henry arriued douer king henry returned maior london alderman craft riding red hood red white mette king blacke heath comming eliam ſo brought thorough londō westminster priſoners france next morrow maior alderman 200 commoner preſented king thouſand pound two baſens gold worth 500 pound feaſt purification ſeuen dolphin ſea came vp riuer thamis playd while four kilde parliament begun fiftéenth march westminster halfepens ianua cōmonly called galey halfepenshalfepens ianua forbiddē forbid vſed lawfull payment among engliſh people firſt may emperour landed douer theanno reg 4 1416 ſeauenth may maior alderman craftes london receiue blacke heath king lord met saint thomas watering ſo brought thorough london westminster emperour returned england ſixtéenth auguſt laboured could make peace betwéene england france iohn benet woolmā lōdō ſcattered ſcedules tho walſ vvoolman beheaded ful ſedition drawne hanged beheaded michaelmas day vineſburie hanged tiborne ſhortly bayly vineſburie himſelfe alſo hanged tiborne eaſter day noone sermon saint dunstons eaſt london great fray happened the1417 fray saint dunſtons church church wherethrough many people ſore wounded one thomas petwarden fiſhmonger dwelling sprots key ſlayne hande wherefore churche ſuſpended beginner fray lord strange sir iohn tuſſell knight quarell two wiues brought counter pultry archbiſhop canterbury cauſed excommunicate record caunt l strange vvife doth penance well paules croſſe al pariſh church citie xxi aprill ſayd archbiſhop ſate magnus enquire author diſorder foūd fault lord strange wife vpon firſt may following paules church archbiſhop maior london ſubmitted themſelues penance ſware ſame enioyned immediately al ſeruants ſhould ſhirtes goe parſon dunstons paules dunstons▪ church lorde bare headed lady bare footed reignold kenwood archdeacon london following halowing church lady ſhould fill veſſels water alſo offer ornament alter tenne pound lord straunge ſhould offer pixe siluer fiue pound xxix june earle huntington retinue fought nine carikes iene tooke foure patron admirall called baſtard burbon treaſure ſhould haue bin waged quarter yeare thirtith july king henry hoſt ſayled normandy tooke caſtell tonke ſhortly gat cane beyonx many townes caſtels henry reade iohn gedney 28 september sherifes maior richard marlow ironmonger 28 october sir iohn oldcaſtell ſent vnto london lordetho walſ powes wale sir iohn conuict parliament drawne saint giles field hanged bytho walſ necke chayne iron conſumed fire 14 december king henry continuing hysanno reg 6 warres france held chriſtmas normādy bayaux time caſtell falaſe yéelded vnto1418 citie aueraunce alſo yéelded eaſter thomas duke clarence ſent king beſéege monaſterie becke helowin humfrey duke glocester ſent beſéege towne cherburghe richard earle warwike ſent beſéege caſtell daunfrount earle kime ſent beſéege caſtell milly leuiſque feaſt holy trinitie king ſent thomas duke excester▪ unkle normandy fiftéene thouſand men armes moneth june king henry beſéeged noble towne louens compelled within yéelde vpon condition euen saint iohn baptiſt king xxij june remoued armietitus liuius towards pount large layde ſéege one ſide y• towne middle whereof riuer seene hath courſe could haue paſſage ouer riuer lay ſéege ye ſide ye bridge without ye town defended ſtrong tower garriſon king henry commanded make boates wicker thoſe cloſed beaſtes skinnes boates fifth july duke clarence hys companie paſſed ouer ſecretly great number beſéeged ſide towne bycauſe riuer seene diuided hoſt whereby eyther part ſhould haue néede could come togither riuer king cauſed made ſo many ſmall ſquare boates wicker aforeſayd tyed togither caſt riuer made bridge inhabitant garriſons perceyued thus enuironed partes agréed king within fiftéene dayes deliuered thys ſéege ſhould deliuer king towne caſtell day come perfourmed promiſe firſt bridge ouer riuer seene king ſubdued power king thus obteyned bridge ouer riuer seene none riuer floud mighte lette iourney haſt might entred hys iourney towardes roane citizen hearing approche enimies fearing leaſt ſhoulde bée lodged suburbes whiche muche larger citie within walles alſo muche repleniſhed monaſteries church tower burned ſame made euen grounde citie thirtith day julye thys victorious king approched agaynſte whome came citizen theyr garriſons men warre parte day continued battell fought ſore partes frenche forced ſéeke ſuccour within walles citie whome theyr recoyle king purſued ſtill citie hée ordered ſéege maner firſt king noble company yong hardy men lodged himſelfe gate saint hillarie duke clarence power lodged gate caulx duke excester c • king lodged people gate ye caſtel called beanuice erle marſhal lodged ye gate called markeuile earle warwicke come caſtle donfrounte lodged vpon hil ſtrong monaſterie saint katherie erles saliſburie huntingdon lodging ther vpon ſide riuer seene vpon enimies made many aſſaults bycauſe riuer seene diuided engliſh hoaſte two partes king cauſed made ſtrong bridge tymber ouer ſame riuer néede ſhoulde require might haue frée paſſage foote horſſe bycauſe enimies ſhoulde approch vnto wt ſhips galley k cauſed made great cheyne drawen ouer riuer betwixt citie bridge tyme king portingale co •• king england ſent nauie ſhippes wel manne • king ayde king commaunded lye betwixte citie ſea encloſe citie ſuccours water towne caudbeke fearing daunger time couenaunted king england citie roane taken deliuered king obeyſaunte like manner woulde yéelde without aſſaulte vnder ſame appointed according king xiiij defenſible townes caſtels nigh borderer vnto roane many cruell battayles aſſaultes citizen fearing lēgth famiſhed dayly put citie gret number poore people hunger encreaſing forced eate horſſes dogges cattes rattes miſe theſe like thing conſumed eaten plague famine entred citie ſo people defaulte reliefe dyed liuing might ſcarcely burie deade whereby noble citie brought ſo muche miſerie leſſe maruayle pitiful heare mean time ſiege roane duke excester beſieged citie eneroys alſo xx auguſt king henrie thrée maruellous victory normandie firſt one hundered engliſhmen take iij great lord place called kilbuife put flight thrée hundred foureſcoure perſons beſides ſecond foure hundered enimies entred within ſuburbes towne ebroicens eleauen engliſhmen chaſed away toke foure ſlew twelue tooke 40 horſſes thirde enimies would indéede haue taken town called leuers captaine ſame hundered men wente againſt thouſand ouercame toke 180 gentleman enimies aboute thys tyme alſo captaine de la bouche toke towne pontoys paris parſon wrotham norffolke whiche haunted new market heath robbed ſpoyled many concubine brought newgate london dyed priſon iohn brian ralphe barton 28 sep iohn parneſſe sherifes 28 october iohn brian sherife came one time wapping wooſe thinking haue eaſed himſelfe beyond saint katherines mill fell thamis dragged vp againe men miller dyed therof within ſeauennight whoſe place choſen iohn parneſſe william seuenoke grocer▪ 28 october maior william seuenoke newe borne babe founde town called seuenoke kent charitable people chriſtened name william hys father mother could known gaue ſurname seuenoke thē broughte vp till able ſerue bounde prentiſe citizen london good ſeruice god indued ſuch wiſedome wealthe came maior citie vnthankefull god common wealth among charitable workes founded towne seuenoke hadde bin nouriſhed frée ſchole thirtéene almes houſes citizen roane perceyued themſelues maruellouſly afflicted famine ſhewed alſo diſpaire ſuccour frenchman nowe halfe yeares ſiege vpon certaine condition deliuered king england citie caſtle tower abbayes church houſes citizen captaynes gariſons generallye thing within citie whatſoeuer wer xix day januarie dyed within citie ſayde defalt victual ſiege mo xxx thouſand people thisanno reg 7 1419 noble king rather relieue oppreſſed citie ordayned ſame chiefe chamber normandie ordayned hys exchequer hys treaſurie hys coynage kepte ſame alſo • dified ſtrong tower behinde caſtle whileſt king ordered buſineſſe roane ſente diuerſe lordes ſtrong puiſſaunce people receyue caſtelles townes borderyng vppon roane amongſt duke clarence ſhort tyme reduſed king mightie caſtell galiarde towne vernon towne naunte caſtall tower falling wordes quéene ioane deliuered kyng henry ſente brother humfrey duke gloucester accompanyed wyth earle marſhall greate power armed men laye ſiege afore towne caſtell yuory town many aſſa •• t battayles duke tooke force caſtel thereof yelded til thirtéenth may king alſo ſent earle huntington wyth power maunt towne pontois taken might haue ſure eaſie paſſage paris thoſe whyche ſent entry night come nygh vnto pontois wood lefte horſes done darkeneſſe night went foote ditch towne whych drye parte lay bank ditch ladder handes ready ſcale walles time ſhoulde ſerue reſidue hyd uines might ready enter town opening gate breake daye towne changed watche whych change •••• e lefte without watch time engliſhmen ſéeyng time accompliſhe intent • ayſed ladder ſcaled walles meanes entred towne ſome forthwyth brake gate made entry reſte company whiche garriſons town perceyued mē amazed turned themſelues flight long armed aſſayled enimies engliſhmens great auayle earle huntingdon wt company ſet ſpurres theyr horſſes haſted ſuccour firſt company whereby frenchman al diſcouraged diſpaire ſaue towne ſight theſe newe reſcues came engliſhmen leauing behinde rich ſubſtaunce endeanoured themſelues eſcape flighte ſo towne pointois auoyded frenchmenne lefte frée engliſh theſe enterpriſes thus atchieued king company came towne pointois aboade certaine time whence ſent duke clarence wt choſen power men paris view ye ſcituation ſtrength thereof citie tarried certaine dayes ſéene liked none frenche men woulde iſſue citie fight returned king aſſertayned al ſéene xviij auguſt king henrie hoſte departed pointois bycauſe caſtell bokinvillers bokinvillers yeelded done certaine inhumane cruelty king landes bordered thereabout intente repreſſe theyr malice king lodged himſelf far thence ſent certaine aſſault ſame caſtle inhabitant garriſons feared ſo much king men deſperate ſuccours yéelded caſtel good townes caſtels holdes within great circuite without abyding battaile yéelded king ſtrong mightie town gyſors wherof caſtel much defenſible town would ſubmit king wherefore laſt day auguſt king hoſt toke iourney thyther encloſed towne pauilions tentes betwyxt towne many ſharpe battayles cruell aſſaultes time engliſhmen put frenchman flight wherfore inhabitantes gariſons towne caſtel deliuered ſame king xxiiij september richard whitingham iohn butler 28 september sherifes maior richard whitington mercer 28 october king henrie returned army maunt deuided hoſt thrée battayles whereof deliuered one duke glocester whome ſente ſubdue towne saint germaines manye battayles aſſaultes ſhort time yéelded ſeconde battayle ſent caſtell mount oye like manner yéelded thirde battayle king hys owne perfom went beſiege mewlance aboue al moſt ſtrong ſituation town plenteous ile betwixte two armes ſea c notwithſtanding inhabitauntes gariſons ſawe great prouiſion king yéelded town laſt day october thence kyng returned againe maunt ſente duke excester beſiege caſtle g ••• arde whiche yéelded xx▪ december king henrie kept chriſtmaſſe citie roane ſent earle saliſburie take towne freſvey▪ ſhorte time toke earle marſhal earle huntington ſente kyng ſubdue prouince shenon▪ dolphin deputed captaine ſtrong power whiche captaine mette two earles gaue battayle engliſhmen remayned conqueror thus thoſe two earles ſubdued prouince shenon▪ without great reſiſtaunce whileſt theſe many victory wer atchieued king continuing citie roane ambaſſadors charles french king duke burgoigne came king treate peace king right honourably recoyued ſent french king duke burgoigne▪ hys ambaſſadours wyth full aucthority conclude long ſoughte peace principall ambaſſadour earle warwicke company certaine biſhops diſcrete men accompanyed ſtrong power armed men theſe gaue aucthoritie power iſabel wife quéene phillip duke burgoigne certaine counſell plenarily conclude peace king henrie hym realme france vnder ſuch condition ſhold decréed alſo proue ratify cōfirme ſame oth ſolemnized parſō k charles without fraude al thing obſerued vnto ſayd k henrie heyres ▪ ſucceſſours ſayde king charles heyres ſucceſſors c xxj may xl yere reigne king charles cathedral article part ſhall follow wherevpon writing wer made ſealed brao • e ſeale ſayde king charles immediately iſabel quéene duke burgoigne name king charles made ſolemne oth vpon holy euangeliſtes y• ſame charles heyres ſucceſſours ſhoulde obſerue kéepe without fraude peace made betwixt two realmes ſame othe quéene duke burgoigne theyr owne name themſelues theyr heyres ſucceſſours made vnto king heyres ſucceſſours many preſent king counſel alſo parliament biſhoppes lord knightes common made ſame othe kyng xxiij xxiiij daye may chauncellour fraunce many lordes biſhops prelate noble men gaue like fayth othe thirde june preſent counſell k charles iſabel quéene fraunce duke burgoigne parliament fraunce alſo duke clarence many biſhops lord knightes england king henrie matrimonie ſolemnized betwixt moſt victorious king henrie england excellent glorious lady katherin daughter charles fraunce iſabel quéene peace confirmed betwixte ſayd two king realmes red foloweth king henrie nowforth life kyng charles ſhall name write himſelfe king fraunce ſhall ſuffer himſelfe people ſo named written death king charles king henry ſhal king fraunce peaceably hys heyres ſucceſſours bicauſe king charles reaſon infirmitie vnable gouerne common weale king henrie ye life charles ſhal rule gouerne realme fraunce profit honor ſame king charles king charles al writing ſhal name ſame king henrie ſon heyre france life ſaid king charles king henrie ſhall written henrie king englande heyre regent fraunce like maner hée ſhal write himſelfe thing ſhall aucthorized vnder owne ſeale king henrie ſhall call king charles hys father quéene iſabel hys mother ſhall honoure king henrie ſhal prohibite holde defraude king charles father crowne france iſſues reuenues thereof quéene mother time hi • life ſhall kéepe due eſtate belongeth hi • maieſtie c diuerſe article libertie ſet downe place final end accompliſhing marriage couenants condition ratifyed partes king henrie accompanyed king charles counſel two quéenes iſabel katherin duke burgoigne departed troy toke iourney paris paris many dayes went laye ſiege citie sen whiche contrarie whole hoſte ſetled place captaine citizen gariſons ſubmitted bodyes citie king haſted monstrean towne toke force xv july went citie melune inuironed ſame ſtrong ſiege king englande france scotlande duke burgoigne tho walſ bauier clarence bedforde excester earles march warwicke huntington somerſet▪ c ſiege cō tinued xiiij wéekes odde dayes feaſt mary magdalen▪ feaſte saintes without maner euery day conflict ſore ſkirmiſhe length wante victualles beſieged yéelded themſelues kyngs englande fraunce whence forſayde kyngs greate parte theyr armye wente paris iohn butler iohn wels 28 september sherifes maior william cambridge grocer 28 october king henrie kept hys chriſtmaſſe citie paris caſtle saint anthony holden parliamente went roane therewith hystitus liuius norman engliſhmen helde parliament thē eſtabliſhed ſure guarde realme fraunce dutchie normandie paſſed throughe picardie caleis ſo douer quéene landed candlemaſſe day fourtéenth februarie quéene katherin crowned westminster vnto king aſſigned hir dowrie 10000 markes alſo conſented deliuerie king scot bin long priſoner englande condition departure englande ſhall take wi • e duke somerſets ſiſter niece cardinal winchester anno reg 9 1421 xxij▪ march duke clarence▪ enuironeth bothe ſame place thys citie beſieged winter wherein ſo manye ſo greate ſtormes flouds raine king hoſt often annoyed hūger colde ſixth december lady katherine quéen englande broughte forth moneth may king ſore beaten forſayd market meaulx conſtrayned frenchman beſieged condeſcende vnto certaine couenauntes deliuer place vnto ſhortly deliuered king towne orepy valois caſtle pier pountmeralaw offemoūt many others rendering theſe townes caſtles king returned paris moneth aprill katherin quéene englande ſhipped hampton ſayled ouer fraunce ſtrong power vnder conducte iohn duke bedforde y• king brother humfrey duke glocester appointed warden england duke bedfordes place whē comming quéene katherin knowne kyng henry hir huſband charles king france theſe king quéene fraunce accompanyed many great lordes eſtates well englande fraunce went méete hir boy de viſcenne wher ſhe ioyfully receyued ſhe bin angell ſente god xxx day may two king englande fraunce theyr quéenes departed bois de viſcenne went paris king england quéen lodged caſtell lowre king france quéene lodged pallace saint paule king henrie hearing dolphen great power beſieged towne guiſney determined goe himſelfe rayſing ſiege ſo came town corbeil ſo senlis waxed ſo ſicke hée conſtrayned tarry ſend brother duke bedforde reſcue thē coſney dolphin rayſed hys ſiege departed thence king henrie diſeaſe increaſing departed life caſtell called boyes de viſceme far paris laſt auguſt yeare 1422 raigned nine yeares fiue monethes odde dayes preſent death king charles fraunce two quéenes death moſt prudent king diſpoſed guarde yong prince ſonne defence realme englande hys brother humfrey duke glocester cuſtodie body yong prince king committed vncle duke excester reuenues dutchie normandie bequethed brother iohn duke bedforde gouernaunce ſame dutchy realme france life time reedified royall manour called shine nowe richmount hée founded two monaſteries vpon thamis farre richmount one carthuſians whiche named bethlem religious men woman saint bridget named sion founded gartar principal kyng armes engliſhmen alſo brotherheade sainte gyles without creple gate london shortlye hys departing bowel enterred church sainte de foſſes corp well enbaulmed ſeared cloſed leade accompanyed lordsenguerant eſtates common england preſente alſo many lord great eſtates well france normandie burgondie picardie brought greate honour paris ſet churche ladie done right ſolemne exequies diſtributiō mony great almes poore thence broughte roane aboade long thing neceſſarie prepared conueyaunce deade king englande hys body layde chariot whiche drawen foure great horſſes aboue dead corpes layde figure made boyled hydes leather repreſenting perſon nyghe ſemblaunce could deuiſed painted curiouſly ſimilitude liuing creature vpon whoſe heade ſet emperiall diadem golde precious ſtones right hand helde scepter royall lefte hand ball gold manner adorned figure layde bedde ſayde chariot hys vnſage vncouered toward heauens couerture hys bedde red ſilke beaten golde beſides body ſhoulde paſſe anye good town canapie maruaylous great value borne ouer chariot men great worſhippe manner accompanyed king scottes prince lordes knightes hys houſe broughte roane abeuile corpſe ſet churche sainte offr • ne abuile broughte hedin thence menstreull ſo bulloigne caleis thys iourney many men chariot clothed al white bare theyr handes torch burning followed al houſholde ſeruauntes blacke came prince lordes eſtates kyngs bloud adorned veſtures mourning thys ſayde corpſe diſtaunce two engliſhe myles followed quéene englande righte honourably accompanyed thys manner entred caleis whence fewe dayes departed continued theyr iourneys water lande vntyll came london arriued tenth nouember ſo conuaied london bridge cheap cathedrall churche saint paule vppon couering moſte foure horſſes conuayed chariot wer imbrodered auntient armes englād vpon couerture ſeconde horſſe armes england fraunce one ſhielde quarterly vppon couerture thirde horſſe imbrodered armes fraunce without maner difference fourth horſſe armes king arthur exequies ſolemnized saint paules church london hée brought thēce enterred abbay saint peter westminster amongſt hys noble aunceſtoures thus thys moſt victorious renoumed kyng entred way decréed euery creature floure moſt luſtie time hys age witte ſixe thirtie glocester gard perſon duke excester duke bedford giuen regiment france right wiſely nobly ruled ſame ſo long liued henry witte nature ſimple gentle méeke loued better peace warre quietneſſe mind buſineſſe world honeſtie profite reſt • aſe trouble care iniuries euer happened many ſuffered patiently reputed worthely ſent god offence william gaſtfield robert tatarſale 28 septem sherifes maior william walderne mercer 28 october xxj october charles king france paſſed world buried denis france ha • hiſtory loys duke orleance charles le bievv king france dyed bin crowned king 46 yeares greatly beloued people life time therefore called le roy charle le biew ame yet ſickneſſe part raigne witte woulde ſtrike came néere tooke firſt citie man ſhortly bin flanders reduce fleming obedience reaſon héereof great trouble france bycauſe thoſe néere lignage ſought euery one haue chiefe gouernement theyr hand thus dyed realme left miſerable ſtate people ſtrange nation gouernoures realme firſt engliſhmen conquered great parte ſought haue reſt duke burgoigne many great lordes alied hym ſought conquere yong king henry englande claymed king france likewiſe allhenry king england france money coyned axmes realmes quartered crownes ſtamped tyme charles money forbidden currant called minte king henry cauſed péece ſtamped called salus worth two twentie shilling blans eyghtpence péece ſo place france king henry obeyed money receyued ſuche armes france england ſtamped charles duke tourayne dolphin ſonne king charles le biew ame clayming right inheritor thedolphin france proclaymed king france realme france auntient edictes cuſtomes ſayde realme alledged proclaymed himſelfe king deceaſſe hys father notwithſtanding agréement made marriage siſter king england otherwiſe concluded recited ſo two king france henry charles ſtriuing crowne realmetvvo king france henry charles way perdition parliament london began ninth nouemberparliament london wherin granted king ſubſedie thrée yeares fiue noble euery ſacke wooll ſhould paſſe land yeare weaſt gate london ſometime callednevvgate london nevv builded • paul lon 1423 chamberlaine gate begon new builded executor sir richard whitington late maior london king charles france began aduance himſelfe burgoignes land conneſtable scotland accompanied many lord men war k charles ſide layd ſéege towne carnens marſhall burgoigne aſſembled men warre raiſe ſéege whome went earle saliſburie valiant mā andthe earle salisburie vvan diuers hold france raſed come togither fought enimies wan field tooke conneſtable whoſe ſonne ſlayne field many k charles men ſlayne taken number tenne twelue hundred good men warre whiche victorie earle saliſburie layde ſéege montaguillon champeigne continued eyght monethes could haue rendred cauſed ſame raſed throwne downe earle saliſburie beſéeged caſtell monnes lengthanno reg 2 yéelded caſtell alſo raſed bet downe ſtrongeſt place champaigne repaired king charles nicholas iames thomas wanford 28 septemb▪ sherifes maior duke bedford married duke burgoignes daughter william crowmar draper 28 october ſame time duke burgoigne gaue ſiſter lady anne marriage duke bedford ſo alliance made ſtrong betwixt engliſh burgonians phillip de comines writeth iohn bedford wasphi comi▪ regent france engliſhmen monethly allowāce office amounting 20000 crownes leaſt alſo y• duke burgoigne bedford britein met ye town amiens alſo earle richmont brother duke briteine many great lordes whiche earle richmont married duke briteines eldeſt ſiſter margaret ſometime wife duke guyen dolphin france theſe thrée duke fiue ſixe dayes togither amiens great friendſhip reuerence promiſing perpetuall amitie continue duke briteine returned countrey duke bedford regent france paris burgoigne arras within earle richmont reuolted king charles vpon ſome miſliking conceyued againſt duke bedford king charles receyued ioyfully made conneſtable france ſame time duke bedford cauſed crotoy beſéeged water land foure fiue monethes ſéege towne caſtell deliuered duke ordeyned ralph butler bée captayne time duke bedford obeyed regent place vimeu pontieu picardy paris rein chalons troyes vp water loyre feaſt saint andrew captaynes king charles aſſembled force le fere nelle tooke night towne campeigne ſpoyled inhabitant goodes shortly came duke bedford mondidier twelue hundreth fighting mē requeſted lord sanenſes lay ſéege campeigne woulde finde men money wage wherevnto graunted fiftéene dayes ſéege ſame deliuered moneth february iames steward yong king scottes taken engliſhmen theking scottes releaſſed impriſonment eyght yeare king henry fourth remayned england priſoner till time deliuered married saint mary oueryes church southwarke lady iane daughter iohn earle somerſet couſin king henry sir iohn mortimer knight drawne tiborne hanged quartered body buryed saint iohns church clarkenwell king henryes people beſéeging caſtell dinry in1424 march normandy within compounded yéeld day aſſigned engliſhmen fought withall ſame day frenchman wherevpon well king charles duke bedford made great leuies men kéepe day appoynted héerewith drew towards yury king charles heard thethe battell vernole perche duke bedford comming towardes ſuch puiſſance counſelled draw backe ſo towards vernole perche whome duke bedford followed ſo found armie néere vernole eyther armie ſight put themſelues order battell engliſhmen made hedge horſſe behind battell bycauſe french ſhoulde ſtrike among backes frenchman ordered themſelues battell array making great battell footemen put floure chiefeſt men appoynted horſſemen ſet engliſhmen trauerſe battayles foote came vpon ioyned ſore fight betwixt continuing two houres togither man might iudge way victorie would encline length men king charles began breake engliſhmen began thruſt among ſo much diſcom •• ted enimies ſlayne earle dowglas duke turon iames dowglas earle wighton iohn earle boughan uicount nerbon many number tenne thouſand ſayth fabian fourerobert fabian▪ thouſande ſayeth mine author frenchman ſayeth duke bedford bare himſelfe moſt valiantly fighting axe ſo fiercely prayſe earles saliſburie suffolke gouerned themſelues alſo right valiantly lord torſy lord normandy taken part engliſhmen day turned french hoping engliſhmen ſhoulde haue loſt battell true frenchman would neuer ſuffer king charles preſent perſon battayle thought pitch fielde ſent ſome ſtrong towne loſſe battayle fought ſeauentéenth auguſt vernole inanno reg 3 perche king charles put great hinderance ſo able puiſſance giue engliſhmen battayle hauing ynough defende kéepe townes fortreſſes againſt duke bedford returned normandy puniſhed many fledde day battayle went paris found duke burgoigne receyued dutch bedforde duke burgoigne enamored vvith counteſſe salisburie vvhere came great diſpleaſure loſſe england breach amity betvvixt english burgonions wife ſayde duke burgoignes siſter right ioyfully made great feaſt whiche feaſt alſo earles saliſburie suffolke olde quéene france mother king charles many greate eſtates diuers nation amongſt whiche duches bedford holden moſt gallanteſt lady hir counteſſe saliſburie faire lady duke bedford neuer iuſted iuſted duke burgoigne goodly amiable mā perſonage excellently well whatſoeuer tooke hand eſpecially danſing iuſting excéeded countrey feaſt became deſirous counteſſe saliſburie ſome meſſages paſſed betwixt came earle saliſburies eare whereof nothing contented duke therfore ſought diſpleaſure afterward feaſt ended duke burgoigne went countrey burgoigne tooke wife duches neuers bin wife unkle duke neuers▪ hir two child halfe ſiſter duke burbon ſhe liued long burgoigne alſo gaue ſiſter yongeſt named agnes ſecond cauſe breach amitle betvvixt england burgoigne marriage vnto charles de barbon earle cleremont duke bedford engliſhm • wroth made ſuche alliance enimies without accord yeare frenchman repaired caſtell mouns champaigne bin little deſtroyd engliſhmen well ſtuffed victual men began make ſore war countrey ſhortly earle saliſburie beſéeged thē meſsire iohn de luxenburg ſo much caſtell yéelded bedford wife duches lay moſt parte paris leading pleaſant life lady greatly loued lodged ye houſe tournels • éere caſtel saint anthony made faire building men ſtill made ſore warres againſte french towards riuer loyre place vpon baſe normandy toward duchie alanſon yeare englande edmond mortimere earle march many lord great retinue ſentearle march ſent irelād ireland ſayd earle march ended life simon seman bythewater 28 september sherifes maior iohn michaell stockfiſh monger 28 october yeare 1424 warres began henault reaſon iaqueline duches henault daughter duke william iaqueline duches henault henault unkle phillip duke burgoigne alſo daughter duke iohn burgoignes ſiſter wife •• renamed william ſo double couſin german phil •• p duke phillip liuing iaqueline married •• iohn duke brabant hir couſin german couſin ger •• n alſo duke philip burgoigne ſhe •• married earle pontioue ſon king charles le ••• n aime eldeſt brother king charles liuing •• notwithſtanding ſhe thus married duke brabant yet ſhe conuayed sir roberſart knight brought england duke glocester married ſayd duke glocester ſo ſheiaqueline married gloceſter two huſbandes aliue brabant glocester • thing thought vnreaſonable againſt god world church ſhe bin four fiue yeares companie duke brabant fallen ſome variance betwixt ſo ſhe come henault laſt aprill began parliament weſtminſter wherein graunted subſedie twelue robert fabian parliament london firſt subſedie payde pound manner merchandize comming paſſing realme thrée shilling tunne wine tearme thrée yeares holden furthermore enacted merchant ſtrangers ſhould ſet engliſh hoſt within fiftéene dayes comming port ſale make ſale merchandize ereall stranger lodged vvithin english hoſtes ſo lodged within fortie dayes following make ſale brought remayned vnſold ſayd fortie dayes end ſuch merchandize vnſold forfeyted alſo stranger caried woolles land ſhould pay xliij ſhillings four penny ſacke cuſtome engliſh merchant deniſons payde fiue noble c marriage bin ſolemnized betwéene duke glocester iaqueline duches holland aforeſaydethe duke gloceſter goeth holland within moneth duke glocester aſſembled armie twelue hundred fighting men leaſt engliſhmen taking duches cō panie paſſed ouer caleis ſtreight thence l ••• artois ſo henault making outrage paſſed duke phillips countreys comming henault many townes obeyed thē refuſed •• likewiſe y• noble diuided burgoigne hearing ſore offended iniurie done couſin brabant diſhonor couſin duch •• iaqueline euill dealing duke glocester third cauſe amitie broken betvvixt england burgoigne loſſe many tovvnes france therefore ayde duke brabant appoynted many captaynes xij c fighting mē pickards go againſt duke glocester duke brabant man weake complexion therefore counſell brabant ordeyned yonger brother philip earle saint pol ſhould chiefe captayne warre againſt duke glocester great armye part noble brabant henalt burgoigne 50000 piere de luxenburge earle conuarſon néere kinſman leading armie himſelfe yong duke burgoigne put men garriſon within towne braine countie henault made ſore warre countrey earle saint pol conuarſon come beſéege braine continuing afore twelue dayes within yéelded compounding departe bodyes goodes ſaued theſe hauing wonne braine deſtroyde vtterly done tooke field puiſſance great duke glocester likewiſe came fielde ſo approched néere togither vauntcurrers ſkirmiſhed battayle ioyned duke glocester ſent heraulte andhumfrey duke gloceſter chalengeth combate vvith phillip duke burgoigne written duke burgoigne calling traytor diſloyall king england france ſente men ayde againſt offered combate wherevnto duke burgoine aunſwered hée would accept combate denying euer fayled promiſe duke glocester done great wrong duke brabant haue bereft wife contrarye ordinance god holye church wordes duke vttered againſt duke burgoignes honor gaue lye ſo farre matter went word betwixt day appoynted combate duke burgoigne choſe iudge combate emperour almayne duke burgoigne ſent duke gloceſter ſafeconduct departe ſafely england prepare himſelfe thing neceſſarie combate wherevpon campes brake vp duke glocester wente mon henalt duches wife ſo tearmed gaue hir vnderſtand deſirous trie combate duke burgoigne many thing told hir performed within four dayes tooke power returned englād left duches mon ſmally accōpanyed ye people countrey shortly departure duke burgoigne ſent lord lilladam towne men receyue iaqueline duches deliuered vnto conueyed hir gaunt duke ſhe made great ſemblance ioy togither ſhe promiſing bée gouerned alwayes aduiſe goe hir olde huſband duke brabant ſhe would ſhe eſpied hir time ſhe ſtale away hir countrey holland ſhe well receyued many lordes began forthwith mainteyne warre againſt duke philip burgoigne ſent duke glocester ayd ſente hir thouſand fighting men vnder conduct lorde fitzwaters duke burgoigne fearing leaſt iaqueline would deliuer countrey holland poſſeſſiō glocester aſſembled power wente holland put coūtrey obeyſance comming thither iaqueline accompanyed many noble countrey lord fitzwaters woulde haue defended landing notwithſtanding al defence could make entred vpō thē néere ye towne bruſſeils ioyned battaile burgoigne people againſt engliſhmen hollander taking ye duches iaquelines part fierce battayle ſides end hollander engliſhmen diſcomfited dyed place aboue ſeauen eight hundred beſides thoſe taken priſoners lord fitzwater hardly eſcaped battell gote duke burgoigne 1425 diuers townes countrey reuolted againſt iaqueline duches dordrecht sericzee many shortly duke burgoigne leauing garriſons thoſe townes obeyed make reſiſtāce againſt duches lay towne gaunt hée returned countrey flanders artoyes prepare ſuch abiliments neceſſary vſe combate appoynted betwixt duke glocester duke glocester likewiſe england made proniſion habilimentes furniture duke bedforde brother duke glocester tooke greate paynes make friend alſo counſell yong king england nothing content variance doubting leaſt might occaſion duke burgoigne mighte withdrawe himſelfe amitie whereby buſineſſe france ſhould hindered duke bedford therefore tooke hys iourney paris caleis ſo englande ende agrée ſaydeanno reg 4 duke tooke duches wife paſt four fiue hundred men michaelmaſſe prince portugale came england honorably receyued feaſted king uncle william mildred iohn brokell 28 september sherifes maior rob fabian iohn couentry mercer 28 october morrow simon iudes day maior london bin westminster take hys charge asdebate betvveene duke gloceſter bishop vvincheſter cuſtome ſuche tyme hée holding hys greate dinner hée duke glocester lord protector ſent ſpéedie manner hée came hys preſence gaue hym commaundement ſée citie ſurely watched night following ſo done ye next morrow ix clock certain ſeruāts y• biſhop winchester brother ye ſaid protector would haue entred citie bridge warder kéepers thereof kept force commanded wherwith gréeuouſly diſcontented gathered greater number archer men armes aſſaulted gate ſhot meanes warre ſo much common citie ſhut ſhoppes ſpedde thither great number ſo greate bloudſhed woulde haue followed wiſedome maior alderman ſtayde matter time archbiſhop canterbury prince portugale tooke great labour vpon pacifie variance betwixt two bréethren protector biſhop ſo muche rode betwéene eyght time ere might bring reaſonable conformitie laſtly agréed ſtande rule duke bedford regent france ſuch would aſſigne wherevpon citie ſet quiet biſhop winchester wrote letter duke bedford lord regent followeth right high mighty prince right noble one leueſt earthly lorde recommende vnto grace heart ye deſire welfare king ſoueraigne lorde realies england france owne weale haſt hither troth ye tarrie long ſhall put land ieoperdy field ſuch brother yée haue héere god make good man wiſedome knoweth well profite france ſtandeth welfare england written london laſt october tenth day january next enſuing ſayde duke bedford wyth hys wife came vnto london alſo came ſaid biſhop wincheſter maior citizen receyued merton • • ayde hym citie vnto westminster lodged king pallace biſhop winchester lodged within abbot lodging morrow following maior preſented regente paire baſins siluer ouergilt thouſande marke gold xxj february began great counſayle saint albons reiorned northampton due concluſion mighte made the1426 parliament leyceſter xxv march called parliamente leycester endured till xv day june called parliamente battes bycauſe men forbidden bring sword weapon brought great battes ſtaues neckes whē thoſe weapon inhibited thē tooke ſtones plomets leade parliament variance betwixt two lord debated ſo much duke glocester put bill complaynt againſt biſhop conteyning ſixe article article biſhop ſufficiently aunſwered finally counſell lord regent matter variance betwéene ſayd two lordes put examination iudgemente aſſiſtance lordes parliamente henry archbiſhop canterburie thomas duke excester iohn duke norffolke thomas biſhop durham philip biſhop worcester iohn biſhop bath humfrey earle stafford raulph lord cornewell maiſter william alnewike kéeper priuie seale lordes made decrée awarde ſo eyther party tooke hande friendly louing word none hauing amends upon whitſonday following ſolemne feaſt holden leycester aforeſayde regente dubbed king henry knight forthwith king dubbed richard duke yorke father king edward fourth number fortie parliamente kyng wente killingworth caſtell henry chicheley archbiſhop canterbury founded colledge higham ferrers northamptonſhire eyghtcolledge hoſpitall higham ferrers fellowes foure clearkes ſixe choriſters alſo founded hoſpitall poore folke many morning day betwixte houres one two clocke began terrible earthquake lightning thunder whiche continued ſpace two houres vniuerſall world ſo men thought world ſhould haue ended generall dome haue followed vnreaſonable beaſts rored drew townes hideous noyſe alſo foules ayre likewiſe cryed ſuche worke god time call people repentance iohn arnold iohn higham 28 september sherifes maior vvardes london diſcharged fifteenes iohn reynwell fiſhmonger 28 october iohn reynwell maior london gaue certayne land tenement citie london whiche ſame citie bound pay euer ſuch fiftéenes ſhall graunted king ſo paſſe thrée fiftéenes one yeare thrée wardes london wéetereignwels teſtament downegate warde billingſgate warde aldgate warde yeare tower draw bridge london tovver lō bridge begun ſame maior london newyeares daye thomas beawford duke excester deceaſſed greenewich buryed sainte edmonds burie suffolke purification lady duke bedford regent france wife familie paſſed ſeas vnto caleis ſo picardy france ere departed caleis wéete vpon feaſt day annuntiation1427 lady biſhop winchester within church lady caleis created cardinall ſolemnitie done regente tooke hys righte hande ſo conuayed hym vnto hys lodging yeare vnſeaſonable weathering reyned moſt part continually eaſter michaelmaſſe yeare duke alanſon taken priſoner battayle vernole perch deliuered raunſome 200000 scuttes golde whiche wasrob gagwin 50000 markes ſterling yeare alſo earle saliſburie accompanyed earle suffolke lord talbot layderob fabian ſtrong ſéege vnto citie orleance hilde citiezens ſtreight maugre duke orleance marſhall france engliſhmen wanne diuers ſtrong holdes adioyning citie forced bren great part ſuburbes one day ye ſaydanno reg 6 earle saliſburie thomas mountagew reſted bay window gunne leuelled citie toſquaſhed face whereof dyed miſhappe engliſhmen loſt rather wanne ſo little little loſt poſſeſſions france yeare humfrey duke glocester tooke wifeduke gloceſter married elianor cobham elianor cobham whome hée hadde wantonlye kept henry frowike robert otley 28 september sherifes maior parliament subſedy iohn gidney draper 28 october parliament westminster graunted king subſedie euery tunne wine thrée ſhillings merchandiſe excepte wooll fell cloth xij1418 penny pound alſo euery pariſh ye realme excepted city boroughes benefice value x marke tenne pariſh ſhould pay vj ſ viij euery man viij euery benefice x pound x pariſhners pay xiij ſ iiij ſo rate rate like euery benefice loweſt higheſt inhabitant city boroughes euery mā value xx ſ aboue houſhold ſtuffe apparell wife ſhould pay foure penny ſo rate vnto richeſt corpus christi day briton good widdow honeſt woman cheriſhed brought vp almesmurther quitte vvith murther dwelling white chappell pariſh without aldgate murthered ſayd woman night ſléeping hir bedde conuayde ſuch iewels ſtuffe might carrie ſo purſued vpon feare tooke churche foreſware king land conneſtables cauſed brought london ſo intended haue conuayde weſtward ſo ſoone come pariſh committed murther wiues caſt vpon ſo much filth ordure ſtréeteanno reg 7 notwithſtanding reſiſtance made conneſtables ſlew hand firſt september cardinall winchester cardinall vvincheſter returned beyonde sea mette maior bréethren certaine citizen london horſebacke without citie ſo brought pallace southwarke yeare great fire baynards castell london fire baynards caſtell sherifes maior thomas duffehouſe iohn abbot 28 september henry barton skinner 28 october viij nouember duke norffolke like haue bin drowned paſſing london bridge hysduke norffolke eſcaped drovvning barge ſet vpon pile ouerwhelmed ſo number thirtie perſons drowned duke eſcaped drawne vp rope xxj february ri neuill made earle saliſb 1429 fifth day june frier randolph mayſter diuinitie bin long priſoner tower london 1 treuiſe ſlayne parſon tower moneth june cardinall wincheſter warlike companye paſſed sea intending haue made warre vppon inhabited countrey prage néede men regente fraunce cardinall chaunged purpoſe taryed ſeaſon regent william ruffe ralph holland 28 september sherifes maior william caſtfielde mercer 28 october ſixth nouember king henrie age nintéene yeares ſolempnely crowned saincte peter churche westminster whoſe coronation made xxxvj knightes bath ſolemnization churche finiſhed honorable feaſte greate hall westminster kept wherof yée may reade large diſcourſe robert fabian whiche feaſte great preparation made king iourney france xxiiij januarie battayle done smithfielde 1430 within liſtes king betwéene two men feuerſham kent iohn vpton appellaunte iohn downe defendaunt long fought kyng toke vp matter forgaue party xxvij day april king toke ſhipping douer landed ſame day caleis hauing company duke yorke norffolke biſhops bath ely rochester earles huntington stafforde warwicke oxforde deuonſhire mortaine ewe ormonde barrons lorde boucher beaumond typtoft fitz water roos arundale audley faucōbridge gray codner scrop welles whileſt kyng remayned caleis manye ſkirmiſhes fought betwéene engliſhmen frenche diuerſe partes france frenchman preuayled greatly helpe woman named mayden god laſtlye ſhe hir companye came towne champaigne end remoue ſiege layde therevnto duke burgoigne engliſhe captaines xxiij maye ſhe gaue battaile engliſhmen fought long time ende manhoode burgonian knight named ſir iohn luxemborough ſhe taken aliue hir company diſtreſſed ſhe conuayed citie roane kept ſeaſon ſhe fained hir ſelfe child ye contrarie known ſhe condēned brent king henrie ſmall iorneyes fraunce came paris wher honorably receiued ye citizēs taken theyr ſoueraigne lord king while héerobert gagwine remayned ſayeth gagwine frenchman wan many hold engliſhmen burgonians country bry third auguſt dyed counteſſe vrmonde buried saint thomas acre london anno reg 9 sherifes maior walter cherteſey robert large 28 september nicholas wotton draper 28 october soone eaſter lord protector warned aſſembly certaine lewde perſons aſſembled abington wherefore ſent thyther certaine perſons alſo rode thyther himſelfe arreſted baylye towne named william mandeuil weauer whiche appointed captain named himſelf iack sharpe wigmers lande wale examined confeſſed ment haue done many miſchiefes eſpecially againſt prieſts ſo would haue made head cheape shéeps head ſay thrée peny ſome write ten penny manye complyces taken ſent dyuarſe priſons captaine drawne hanged headed abingdon head ſent london ſet bridge fautors executed diuerſe place countreys terror xiij julye richarde ruſſel woollman drawn hanged quartered wold haue made duke earles pleaſure richard robſert lord bourcher deceaſed buried westminster king henrie remayning ſtill fraunce earle arundale accompanyed two thouſand engliſhmen ſente certaine company vnto towne called bealmount prouoke ſhe frenchman iſſue towne ſmal cōpany boyſſycant sentrales thē captain behelde ſouldiours ſped forth take ſayd engliſhmen y• little little gaue backe till tolled frenchman good ſpace towne ſette vpon ſtoute courage helde hand tyll earle company reſcued betwixt cruell fighte end frenchman chaſed ſayd sentrayle many footman ſayde town ſlaine iohn aderle▪ stephen browne 28 september sherifes maior iohn wels grocer 28 october thys iohn welles maior london cauſed conduite commonlye called standarde cheape bée builded ſeauenth day december kyng henrie crowned paris cardinall winchester coronation preſente duke burgoigne duke bedforde regente diuerſe noble france ſolemnitie thys feaſte ended king departed paris ſo came roane helde hys chriſtmaſſe done returned caleis hadde ſoiourned ſeaſon tooke ſhipping returned england landed douer eleauenth februarie rydyng towarde london mette barham downe betwixte douer canterburie greate companye gentles common kent cladde liuerie wyth redde hood whiche accompanyed hym tyll came blacke heath one twentith day february mette maior london rode gowne crimſon ueluet alderman scarlet citizen al white gownes red hoodes diuerſe work cogniſances brodered vpō ſléeues ye facultie miſteries craft due obeyſāce ſaluting king rode towards ye city king come bridge deuiſed mightie giaunt ſtanding ſworde drawen hande hauing written certaine ſpéeches metre great reioycing welcōming king citie middeſt bridge diuerſe place citie diuerſe faire ſumptuous pageant repleniſhed goodly beautifull perſonages order ſpéeches whereof ſette downe robert fabian hys cronicle thus cōueyed pallace westminster maior citizen returned london xxiitj day februarie maior alderman yode king preſented hampire golde and1433 therin thouſand pound noble yeare reaſon ſouldiours caleis reſtraynte made woolles content wage wherefore regente fraunce came downe thyther eaſter wéeke time many ſouldiours wer arreſted rode tirwine hauing long buried lady anne late wife ſiſter duke burgoigne married earles daughter saint paule ſhortly returned caleis cauſed foure thoſe ſouldiours beheaded xj june 110 ſouldiours baniſhed towne beſides 120 baniſhed tyme vpon midſommer euen lord regent new wedded ſpouſe came london remayned till theanno reg 11 sherifes maior latter end auguſt iohn olney iohn peddeſley 28 september iohn perneis fiſhmonger 28 october xxv day nouember lord fitz water drowned ſea much harmes done tempeſt1433 parliament eight day july king henrie began parliament westminster continued till lammas adiourned vntil saint edward tide yere southweaſt appeared blaſyng ſtar raigne king henrie ſixth lieutenaunts ouer realme irelande edmond earle march iames earle ormond deputie iohn sutton knight lorde dudley ſir thomas straunge hys deputie ſir thomas stanley ſir chriſtopher planket deputie lyon lorde welles earle ormonde deputie iames earle ormonde king lieuetenaunt himſelfe iohn erle church london parte • eſtates realme preſent ninth marche lorde talbot goodlye companye paſſed throughe citie london towardes fraunce wrought much woe frenchman the1434 towne saint denis within two engliſh myles paris gotten practiſe one iohn notice knight orleance matthew gouglye thomas kiriel captaines ſlewe many engliſhmen toke many priſoners ſoone ſayde captaines ſtrength taken paris layde ſuch ſtrong ſiege aboute saint denis finally agréed deliuer town engliſhmen thys ſeaſon alſo earle arundale normandie manly born hearing one hirus • fr • ch captaine fortifyed ſtrong caſtell named gerborym deſtroyed engliſhmen toke certaine number ſouldiours belaied caſtel ſtrong ſiege aſſaulted ſundry time manfully gagwine ſayeth ſaide hirus companye iſſued caſtell gaue vnto ſayde earle cruel ſkirmiſh ſayde earle receiued deadly wound dyed ſhortly afteranno reg 13 sherifes maior thomas barnewel simon eyre 28 september roger otley grocer 28 october great froſte laſted fiue andgreat froſt twentith nouēber vnto tenth februarie thamis ſo frozen merchandice came thamis mouth landed carried kent london pope eugeny fourth cardinalles14 • 5 long laboure coulde make peace betwixte king henry england france charles alſo named king fraunce length made peace betwixte ſaid charles philip duke burgoigne whereby ſaid duke burgoigne became vtter enimy king england ſoone ſaid duke beganne order lillie golden fléece ordayned certaine knightes order made thervnto many statuts wherof ſome like vnto statute garter fourtéenth daye september roan normandy dyed noble prince iohn duke bedforde regent fraunce great ſolemnitie •• ryed within churche • ir dame ſame • itieanno reg 14 sherifes maior thomas catworth robert clopton 28 septemb henry frowike▪ mercer 28 october king charles fraunce recouered citie paris▪ newyeares tide wanne towne harflewe and1436 sainct denis manye townes holdes expellyng murdering engliſhe people greate number nintéenth daye julye duke burgoigne wyth great multitude burgonians flemmings appearedcaleis beſieged caleis pight pauilions tentes ſeaſon lieutenaunt caleis sir iohn ratclife knight caſtell lieutenant baron dudley ſiege endured thrée wéekes whiche ſeaſon many knightlye actes done exerciſed partes ſecond day auguſt duke glocester protectourrobert fub ••• englande 500 ſayles ſome write landed caleis entended vppon thirde day following haue iſſued towne▪ haue gyuen battel flemmings teſtifyeth engliſhe writer ſo ſoone duke burgoigne ware great power lorde protector toke ordinaunce might lightly carrye cumberous left behind duke hoſt thus fledde lorde protectour people followed hym countrey ſpace eleauen dayes whiche ſeaſon brente two townes popering bell returned caleis ſo england yeare caſtel towne rokeſborough scotlande beſieged kyng scottes héeanno reg •• hearde syr ralph graye knyghte commyng thyther competente number remoue ſiege anone departed leauyng ſome parte hys ordinaunce behynde hym hys greate ſhame diſhonour thomas norſtede william gregory 28 sep sherifes maior iohn michel fiſhmonger 28 october ſecond januarie quéene katherin late wife henrie fifth mother king henrie ſixth dyed bermondſey buried westminster takē part london bridge fel vp againe raigne henrie ſeauenth layde foundation new chappel ſhe neuer buried ſince lyeth ſtill aboue ground▪ coffin bordes behinde eaſt end frier xiiij januarie noone put downe maior norwich ſente alderman ſome linne ſome canterburie toke frā chiſes hande appointed iohn wels alderman ſometime maior london warden norwich ſo continued eight moneths haue red monument hurting hys kéeper brake newgate againe taken afterwarde thys owen priuilye ſayde maryed quéene katherin late wife henrie fifth foure child hir whiche knowen tyll ſhe dead buried uigil mary magdalen
