september stephen browne grocer 28 october fiue twentith nouember great winde dydgreat vv • n • e muche harme manye place london bare muche leade gray frier churche almoſt blewe downe one ſide ſtréete called olde change ſo ſame faine vnderſet timber new yeres day ſtacke woodde fell downe baynardes caſtell killed thrée men manye moe ſore hurte fall staire bedforde ſhire daye kepte eightéene perſons colledge lady church founded noble aunceſtours wheate ſold london thrée ſhillings ye buſhel malt thirtéen ſhillings y• quarter otes eight penny buſhel cauſed men eate bean peaſe barley hundred yeares anno reg 18 strūpets vvare raye hoodes manye stumpets ſette pyllerye banyſhed cytye excepte ware theyr raye hoodes phillip malpas robert marſhal 28 september sherifes •• ior robert large mercer 28 october parliament reading ordayned marchaunt ſtraungers ſhoulde goe hoſt engliſhmen make ſale theyr merchaundiſes buy woulde wythin ſpace ſixe monethes geuing theyr hoſte euerye twentye ſhillings worth two penny except esterlings euery houſholder thatorder ſtraungers alien ſhould pay king xuj penny yeare euery ſeruant alien vj penny syr richard wich uicar hermetſworth eſſex who1440 abiured brēt towre hil xvij june whoſe deathe greate murmur among people ſome ſaide good man holy put death malice ſome ſayde contrarie ſo manye men woman wente nighte place brente offered theyr money image waxe thing making theyr prayer knéeling kiſſing ground bare away aſhes hys body holy reliques c thys endured eyght day tyll maior alderman ordayned men armes reſtraine people apprehended manye ſente priſon among whome taken uicar berking churche beſide tower whoſe pariſhe al thys done receyued offering ſimple people excite offer feruentlye fulfilling hys falſe couetouſneſſe hadde medled aſhes wyth poulder ſpices ſtrewed place prieſt brente ſo ſimple people deceyued wéenyng ſwéete ſauour come aſhes deade prieſt whiche ſayd uicar barking churche confeſſed priſon thys haue noted large bycauſe ſome haue writen uicare berking bée brente whiche falſe hée brente thoughe better deſerued eightéenth day july poſterne gate london eaſt smithfielde againſte tower london ſancke night ſeauen foote earth twelfth auguſte starre breadstreet inne london fiered lightning aboute fiftye loade hey burnte eagle cheape alſo burntanno reg 19 firſt september iohn knighte ſouldiour priſoner newgate london led one sherifes officer thence towarde guilde hall fiue hys fellow ſouldiours dagger drawn came ſodainly pannier alley berefte officer thruſting saint martin lane ſo yt church claymed priuiledge sanctuarie thinking haue remained ſame daye phillip malpas richard marſhal sherifes came nū ber force toke thēce fettered faſt counter thence chayned neckes two togither ſente newgate remayned till thirde nouember following whiche tyme king juſtice reſtored agayn ſame sanctuarie saint martin iohn sutton william wetinhall 28 septemb sherifes maior iohn paddeſley goldſmith 28 october duke yorke made regente fraunce 1441 ſixtéenth daye maye ſayde duke wyth earle oxforde earle ewe ſir richarde wooduile syr iames ormonde lorde clynton manye ſhipped porteſmouth sayled thence normandie ſixe twentith daye nouember challenge armes done kyng henrie within liſtes smithfielde betwéene sir richarde woduile knighte englande knighte spaine kyng tooke matter hand thirde ſtroke alſo combat foughte totehil betwéene two théeues apealer defendāt apealer field defendant within thrée ſtrokes roger bolingbroke greate aſtronomer thomas southwell chanon sainte stephen chappell westminster wer taken conſpiratours king deth ſaid ſame roger ſhoulde laboure conſume kyngs perſon waye negromancie ſayde thomas ſhoulde ſaye maſſes lodge harneſey parke beſide london vpon certaine inſtruments whiche ſayde roger ſhoulde vſe hys crafte negromancye againſte faythe aſſen • yng ſayde roger hys workes fiue twentith daye julye beyng sondaye roger bolingbroke wyth hys inſtrumentes negromancye ſaye chayre paynted wherein hée wonte ſitte vpon foure corner chayre ſtoode foure ſwordes vppon euerye ſworde image copper hangyng wyth manye inſtrumentes hée ſtoode highe scaffolde paules churchyarde béefore croſſe holding sworde hys righte hande scepter hys lefte arrayed maruellous attyre sermon ended mayſter low byſhoppe rochester abiured article longing crafte negromancye miſſownyng faythe tweſday next following dame elianor cobham elianor cobhā apprehended dutcheſſe glocester fledde nighte sanctuarie westminster whiche cauſed hir ſuſpected treaſon meane tyme roger bolyngbroke examined kyngs counſayle confeſſed hée wroughte ſayde negromancye ſtyrryng procurement ſayd dame elianor know ſhoulde fall hyr eſtate ſhée ſhoulde wherevppon ſhée cyted appeare béefore▪ henrye chicheley archebyſhoppe caunterburie henrie beauforte biſhoppe winchester cardinall iohn kempe archbiſhop yorke cardinal william aſcothe biſhoppe saliſburie saint stephen chappell westminster aunſweare certaine article negromancie witchcrafte sorcery hereſie treaſon ſhe appeared foreſaid roger brought forth witneſſe againſt hir ſayde ſhe cauſe firſt ſtyrred labour ſayde arte ſhée committed warde ſir iohn steward knight iohn stanley eſquire conueyed caſtell lede remayne tyll thrée wéekes michaelmaſſe shortly commiſſion directed earles huntington stafforde suffolke certayne iudges bothe bench enquire manner treaſons sorcery thyngs myghte bée hurtefull kyngs perſon whome ſayde roger thomas southwel principalles dame elianor acceſſarie indicted treaſon guild anno reg 20 hall london taken alſo margerie gurdemaine witchthe vvitch eye brent eye suffolke whoſe sorcerie witchcrafte ſaid elianor hadde long tyme vſed hyr medicine drinkes enforced duke glocester loue hyr wedde hyr wherfore cauſe relapſe ſame witch brent smithfield ye ſeuen twentith october one twentith october chappel beforeſayde biſhoppes london robert gylbart lincolne william alnewike norwich thomas brouns ſayde elianor appeared adam molins clearke kyngs counſell redde certayne article obiected againſte hyr sorcerye negromancie whereof ſome ſhe denyed ſome ſhe graunted thrée twentith october dame elianor appeared againe witneſſes broughte forth examined ſhe conuicte ſayde article aſked ſhe woulde ſaye anye thing agaynſte witneſſes wherevnto ſhe aunſweared nay ſubmitted hyr ſelfe ſeauen twentith daye october ſhe abiured article adioyned appeare ninth nouember meane time thomas southwel dyed tower london himſelfe propheſied hée ſhoulde neuer dye juſtice law william combis richarde riche 28 september sherifes maior elianor cobhā penaunce robert clopton draper 28 october ninth nouember dame elianor appeared béefore archbiſhoppe ſayde chappel receyued hyr penaunce ſhe perfourmed monday xiij nouember ſhe came frō westminster water landed temple bridge whence taper waxe two pounde hir hande ſhe went throughe fleetestreete hoodleſſe ſaue kerchefe paules ſhe offered hyr taper high aulter ye wedneſday next ſhe landed ye swan thamis ſtréete went bridgestreet grace church streete ſtreight leaden hall ſo christ church aldegate fryday ſhe landed queene hiue ſo went cheape saint michels cornehil fourme aforeſayd time maior sherifes craftes london receyued hir accompanyed hir done ſhe committed ward ſir thomas stanley wherein ſhe remayned duryng hyr life caſtel chester hauing yerely hundred mark aſſigned hyr finding whoſe pride falſe couetiſe lecherie cauſe hir confuſion xviij nouēber roger bolingbroke ſir iohn hum prieſt william woodham eſquire arraigned guild hall london ſayde iohn william charter roger bolingbroke condemned iudgemēt ſir iohn hody chief juſtice king bench ſame day drawen frō tower tiborne hanged quartered ye ſaid roger ſhold ſuffer ſaid yt neuer guilty treaſon againſt king perſon hadde preſumed far cunning whereof cryed god mercie juſtice gaue iudgemente liued long henrie beauchampe ſuccéeded hys father inheritāce kept two yeares king hand reſtored al liuings greate glory crowned king wight kyngs owne handes nominated chiefe earle england challenge done smithfield within liſtes before1442 combat smithfielde king lorde beawfe aragon iohn anſley eſquire king houſe whiche anſley hadde fielde king hande made knight theanno reg 21 lord aragon offered harneis windſor moneth auguſt great fray fleetstreete betwéene yong studentes innes courte inhabitauntes ſame ſtréete whiche fray began night ſo continued aſſaultes bickeryngs till next day whiche ſeaſon muche people cytie thyther gathered diuerſe men partes ſlaine many hurte laſtly preſence maior sherifes fray appeaſed whiche chiefe occaſioner one cliffords inne named herbotel thomas beaumount richard norden 28 sept sherifes maior iohn athirle ironmonger 28 october iohn beaufort reuenues crown hath cauſed pouertie excellencie great paymentes people nowe late king graunted parliament 3 item lordes royall bloud béen put dayly preſence meane perſons lower nature exalted made endaungered conuict canſeth receyuers thereof enforge labour meanes applyed death ſuch people ſo appeached indited ſubtyl meanes couetyſe ſayde grauntes people ſo empeached indited though vntrue may committed lawe deliueraunce helde ſtil priſon vttermoſt vndoyng deſtruction couetyſe good 6 item though diuers poore people common realme haue neuer ſo great right trueth perfite tytle theyr lande yet •• anioy mayne deliuered loſt meanes ſayd traytors true lord knight eſquiers many good yoman loſt ſold ere wēt ye great pitie heare great gréeuous loſſe soueraigne lorde realme item deſireth ſayd captayne common extortion vſed dayly among common people might layde downe ſay gréene waxe falſely vſed perpetuall deſtruction king true common kent alſo king bench gréefefull ſhire kent without prouiſion soueraigne lord true counſell alſo taking wheate graynes béefe mutton victual importable ſayde common without briefe prouiſion ſaide soueraigne lorde true counſell may longer beare alſo vnto ſtatute laborer great extortioner ſay falſe traytors slegge crowmer iſle robert eſte theſe bylles counſell well peruſed onely diſalowe condemne author proude preſumptuons alſo perſwaded king rather ſuppreſſe thoſe rebel force fayre promiſes whervpon king remoued westminster vnto greenewiche whence woulde haue ſent certayne lordes powre haue deſtreſſed kentiſhmen men ſayde lordes would fight againſt labour amend common weale wherevppon lordes driuen leaue purpoſe becauſe kentiſhmen cryed againſt lorde say king chamberlayne king committed towre london went king agayne london king henrie vvent againſt kentishmen vvith great povver within ij dayes went againſt kentiſhmen xv thouſand men well prepared warre ſayd kentiſhmen fled night comming wood countrey néere vnto senocke wherevpon king returned againe london ſent ſir humfrey stafforde▪ knight william stafford brother gentleman follow kentiſhmē finding senock ſet vppon rebel fought long time ende staffordes ſlaine many otherking henry povver ouercome people iacke cade thus ouercome staffordes forthwith apparelled himſelf knightes apparell refreſhed people returned blackeheath pight agayne fielde lay xxix daye june tyll firſt day july ſeaſon came vnto archbyſhop caunterburie duke buckingham long communication founde ryght diſcrete aunſweres howbeit coulde cauſe ſubmit himſelfe lay downe people meane king quéene hearing increaſing rebel alſo lordes fearingking henrie vvent killingvvorth owne ſeruaunts leaſt would take captaines part remoued london killingworth leauing citie without ayde except onely lorde scale left kéepe towre manly warly man named mathewe gowghe captaine kent thus houering blackeheath bring himſelfe fame kept good juſtice beheaded petie captayne named paris ſo muche offended agaynſt ſuch ordinaunces eſtabliſhed incaptaine kent k • ttishmen entred citie london hoſte hearing king lordes thus departed drewe néere vnto cittie ſo vppon firſt july entred borough southwarke beyng wedneſday lodged harte myght bée ſuffered enter cittie vpon ſame day common eſſex greatrobert fabian number pight fielde vppon playne myles ende vppon ſeconde day ſayde moneth therebels eſſex pight field myles end maior called common counſell guild hall pur • ey withſtanding theſe rebel aſſembly diuers men ſundrye opinion ſo ſome thought good ſayde rebel ſhould receyued cittie ſome otherwiſe among robert horne stockefiſhe monger alderman ſpake ſore agaynſt woulde haue enter common ſo moued agaynſt ceaſſed till committed ward ſame afternoone v clocke ye captaine people entred bridge cutte rope draw bridge ſunder ſworde paſſed citie made ſundrye place thereof proclamation king name man payne death ſhoulde robbe take thing without paying therefore reaſon whereof wanne harte common done beguile came london stone ſtrake ſword ſaid mortimer lorde citie ſhewing minde maior ordering people returned southwarke abode done people comming going lawfull houres would morrowe ye third july ſayd captaine agayne entred citie cauſed lorde say fette tower guild hall araygned maior king juſtices robert horne alderman named ſhould haue bene likewiſe araygned wife friendes v hundred markes gat reſtored libertie lord say deſiring might tried péeres rebel forceably taken officer brought ye standard cheape ſtrake head pight pole bare body cauſed drawne naked horſe tayle vpon pauement cheape southwarke ſayd captaines inne alſo squier called crowmer sherife kent wedded ye ſaid lord sayes daughter commaundement captaine brought flete committed thither certaine extortion done office led mile end without london without iudgement head ſmit lord sayes head borne vpon tj long pole vnto london bridge ſet vp lorde sayes body quartered ſame daye captaine went vnto y• houſe philip malpas draper aldermā robbed ſpo • led houſe taking thence great ſubſtance returned southwarke next morowe againe entred y• citie dyned day pariſhe saint margaret patyns one cherſtis houſe dyned like vncourteous gueſt robbed day malpas two robbery althoughe poore people drewe hym parteners ſpoyle yet honeſt wealthy commoner caſt mynds ſequele matter feared leaſt ſhould delt lyke manner maior alderman aſſiſtaunce worſhipful commoner ſafegarde themſelues cittie toke counſell might driue captaine adherent citie performaunce whereof maior ſent vnto lorde scale mathew gowghe hauing tower gouernment requiring ayde aſſiſtaunce promyſed v july captayne southwarke cauſed manne beheaded day entred cittie night come maior citizen mathew gowghe kept paſſage bridge defended kentiſhmen made great force reenter cittie captayne ſéeyng bickering went harneys aſſembled people ſet ſo fiercely vppon citizen draue backe ſtoupes southwarke bridgefoote vnto drawbridge defending wherof many man drowned ſlaine among iohn sutton alderman mathewe gowghe squire wale roger hóyſand citizen ſkirmiſh continued night tyll nyne clocke morrowe ſo ſometyme citizen better ſometymes euer kept vpon bridge ſo citizen paſſed neuer much bulwarke bridge foote kentiſhmen farther drawe bridge thus continuing cruell fighte deſtruction much people ſydes laſtly kentiſhmen putte worſt truce agréede certayne houres truce archbyſhoppe caunterburie chauncellor england ſonte generallcaptaine rebel pardoned pardon captayne ſelfe people reaſon wherof company withdrewe little little captayne put pillage good robbed barge ſent rochester water himſelfe went land woulde haue entred caſtle quinborow fewe men lefte let purpoſe wherefore fled wood countrey beſide lewes suſſex captayne people thus departed long proclamation made diuers place kent suſſex southerey might take foreſaid captaine aliue dead▪ ſhould haue thouſand markes trauaile copie writ proclamation king taking ſayd cade felowſhip henricus dei gratia rex angliae franciae dominus hibernia vniuerſis ſingulis custodibus▪ c much one iohn cade borne ireland calleth himſelfe iohn mortimer ſome writing calleth himſelfe captayne kent iohn cade laſt yeare tofore dwelling suſſex knight called ſir thomas dagre ſlewe woman childe cauſe tooke gréeth churche cauſe ſware king lande iohn cade alſo ſworne frenche parte dwelled hath nowe late time intent enrich ſelfe robbyng diſpoyling king liege men is▪ nowe openly knowne bring himſelfe great high eſtate falſely vntruely deceyued many king people vnder colour holy good intentes made aſſemble againſt king regalitie lawes nought ſetting king grace pardon graūted onely al king ſubiectes deceyt haue aſſembled great reuerence receiued munday laſt paſſed ſo aſſembled withſtanding al laboureth newe aſſemble king people againe intent beareth hand king letter pardon graunted auaileable none effect without authoritie parliament wheras contrarie true openly knowen king grauntes tyme tyme charter pardon ſuch lyſt manner crime offence generall ſpeciall king therfore willeth commaundeth none ſubiectes giue fayth credence ſaid falſ • information ſayde falſe • raylor accompany wiſe comfort ſuſtaine victuall thing whoſoeuer king ſubiectes may take ſhall take ſo euer taketh bringeth quicke dead king coūſel ſhal haue thouſand markes labour truely payde without faile delaye prouiſion king counſell ſo euer taketh thoſe day forth accompany ſhal haue v marke reward truely paide maner forme aboue ſaide ouer commaunding conſtables miniſters officer ſaid shire none paine death take vpō execute cōmandement word writing ſent or▪ made vnto ſaid cade calling himſelfe mortimer captaine rere people intent areſt make areſted ſuch take vpō bring ſuch cōmaundemēt writing word et hoc nullatenus omittatis teste ipſo apud weſtminster▪ x die iulij anno regni 28 proclamationcaptaine kent taken beheaded thus publiſhed gentleman kent named alexander eden awayted ſo time tooke ſayde cade garden snſſex ſlaine hothfield▪ brought londō cart quartered head ſet londō bridge quarter ſent diuers place kent done y• king ſent cōmiſſioners kent rode himſelf cauſed inquiry made riot caū terbury y• ſame vitj mē iudged executed townes kent suſſex dane y• like execution yeare common alſo diuers partes england suſſox saliſbury wilſhire place didde much harme many perſons among xxix june william aſcoth biſhop saliſburie ſayde maſſe edington owne tenauntes drawen ye altar albe stole necke toppe hill ſhamefully murthered ſpoyled naked ſkynne rentingbishop saliſburie murdered bloudy ſhirt tooke euery man souldiours made fraye againſt maior london ſame day tooke charge westminster nyght comming saint thomas acre bene paules vj nouember began parliament westminſter firſt december duke somerſet newly come normandie put vnder areſt1451 good common foulely deſpoyled borne away blacke eryers ryot nexte morrowe proclamation made cittie man ſhould ſpoyle robbe vpon paine death ſame day standard cheape man beheaded doyng contrarie proclamation thus beganne malice ſpring lordes lande ſpecially againſt duke somerſet quéenes counſell léeſing normandie whereof chiefe cittie roane loſt giuen vp appoyntment yeare procéeding witneſſeth gagwyne vpon condition duke somerſet robert gagwyne wife engliſh ſouldiours ſhoulde ſuch good might carrie dep • rte fréely cittie frée paſſage ſhoulde paye vnto french king lvj scu • amount fourtèene thouſand mark ſterling alſo bounde deliuer french king poſſeſſion townes caſtels day poſſeſſion engliſhmen wythin dutchie normandie performaunce whiche couenauntes lord talbot ſent one pledge ſo one floquet townes caſtelles frenche kyngs vſe receyued harfleete onely excepted whereof captaine named curſon aſſiſtance ſir thomas auringham deſpight al french king power laide sea lande helde ſame full moneth lacke reſcue gaue vppe appoyntmentan reg 30 matthew phillip chriſtopher warton 28 sep sherifes maior william gregorie skinner 28 october ſixtéenth februarie king henrie accompanyed duke somerſet many lord tooke towardes march wale muche credibly informed duke yorke aſſiſted wyth diuerſe lordes men name thoſe partes gathered ſtrong power people entring land ſo helde iourney towarde whē duke witting king greate power returned way taken king hoſte haſted towardes london▪ receyued knowledge citie might receyued went ouer kingstone bridge ſo kent vpon brent heath neare vnto dertforde pight fielde wherof king hauing knowledge ſped laſtly came vnto blacke heath pighte hys fielde hoſtes thus embattelled mediation peace made betwéene furtheraunce whereof duke ſente biſhops winchester ely earles saliſburie warwicke anſwered duke none company entended hurt king perſon hys coū ſayle beyng louers common wealth▪ hys land intent purpoſe remoue king fewe euill diſpoſed perſons whoſe meanes common people gréeuouſly oppreſſed communaltie greatlye impoueriſhed whome named duke somerſet principal c vnderſtande duke meaning forcible entring realme himſelfe pretended may appeare certaine letter written king alſo king aunſweares ſame whiche thinke good ſet downe finde recorded pleaſe highneſſe cōceiue ſith departingrichard duke yorke letter king • rie realm commandement ſeruice land ireland haue bin informed diuerſe language hath bene ſayde moſte excellente eſtate whiche ſhoulde ſounde diſhonour reproch charge perſon howe aye haue bene euer true liegeman ſeruaunt man wyll dare ſay contrarie charge otherwiſe beſéech rightwiſeneſſe call high preſence wyll declare diſcharge true knighte ought doe doubt ſhall beſéech puniſhe pooreſt man lande hée bée founde vntrue ſuggeſtion information béeſéech highneſſe puniſhed deſert example pleaſe youre excellence knowe well departyng thys realme goe lande irelande full noble ſeruice ſith certaine perſons haue lyne awayte hearken vppon syr iohn talbot knighte caſtell holte syr thomas stanley knighte cheſhire pulforde chester elton worcester brooke gloucester richarde grome chamber beaumarres whyche hadde charge enformed take putte youre caſtell conway ſtrike heade syr william oldehall knighte haue put priſon sir william deuereux knight sir edmond malſo knyghte withouten enlarging vntyl time highneſſe appointed theyr deliueraunce item ſuch tyme purpoſed haue arriued youre hauen beaumarres haue come youre noble preſence declare true man ſubiecte duetie landing ſtopped forbarred henrie norres thomas norres william bulkeley william gruſt bartholmew boulde officer northwales ſhould lande haue victuall refreſhing mée fellowſhippe haue written excellence ſo farre henrie norres deputye chamberlayne northwales ſayde vnto hée hadde commaundemente ſhoulde wiſe haue landing refreſhing lodging men horſſe thyng myghte turne worſhippe eaſe puttyng blame vppon william saye uſher chamber ſaying affyrmyng againſt youre intente traytoure informed moreouer certaine letter made delyuered vnto chester shreweſburie place lette myne entrye ſame item aboue wrong iniuries aboueſayde done vnto malice wythout cauſe beyng lande irelande youre honourable ſeruice certayne commiſſions made dyrecte vnto diuerſe perſons whiche execution ſame ſatte certayne place jury empaneled charged whiche iniuries certayne perſons laboured inſtauntlye haue endited treaſon intente haue vndone myne iſſue corrupted bloude openlye publyſhed beſéeching maieſtie royall ryghteouſneſſe doe examyne theſe matter therevppon doe ſuche iuſtice behalfe cauſe requyreth mine intēt fully purſue highneſſe concluſiō theſe matter cooſin haue ſéene byll yée tooke v late andanſvvere king henric duke yorke alſo vnderſtand y• good hūble obedience yée ſelfe ſhewe vnto v well worde déede wherfore intente haſtily eaſe ſuche thing ſayde bil leyſure might aunſwere ſayde byll yet let wit cauſes aforeſayde declare intent theſe matter ſith long time among people hath bene vpon many ſtraunge language eſpecial anone diſordinate vnlawfull ſlaying biſhoppe chester diuerſe manye vntrue ſhipmen other▪ ſayde maner word againſt eſtate making manace perſon yourſayings yée ſhoulde fetched many thouſandes yée ſhould take vpon whiche yée neyther oughte doubt yée attempt ſo farre forth ſayde perſon diuerſe • eſpeciallye remember one waſnes whyche hadde like word v alſo ther diuerſe ſuch falſe people went like language diuerſe townes lande whiche ſubiectes taken duely executed wherefore ſente diuerſe courtes place hearken take héede ſuch manner cō myng bin reſiſt comming lande true ſubiecte yée intente ye leſſe eſtate ſubiectes none youre ſeruauntes ſhoulde haue bin letted nor▪ warned goodly wiſe receyued howe peraduenture ſodaine comming without certayne warnyng cauſed oure ſeruauntes dyd conſidering cauſes aboue ſayde enditement yée ſpoke thinke verily holde certaine warning cauſed ſeruaunts doe conſidering cauſes aboue ſayde enditemente yée ſpoke thinke verylye holde certaine none ſuche ye maye truely proue perſon thereaboutes matter ſhall demeaned caſe ſhall require ſo ſhall know greate diſpleaſure upon thys eaſing hearte ſuch matter declare repute adn • tte true aud faythful ſubiecte faythfull cooſin pleaſe highneſſe tenderly conſider greaterichard duke yorke k henrie againe murmur grudging vniuerſally realm iuſtice duely ininiſtred ſuche treſpaſſe offende againſt lawes eſpecial endited treaſon openly noiſed y• ſame whereby greate inconueniences haue fallen greate like fall hereafter ſayde realme god defende highneſſe prouiſion couenable made due reformation puniſhment behalfe wherfore humble ſubiect true leigeman richard duke yorke willing effectuallye deſiring ſuretie proſperitye moſte royall perſon welfare thys noble realme counſell aduertiſe excellency conuerſation good tranquility peaceable rule among ſubiectes ordain prouide true iuſtice againſt ſuch ſo bée endited openly named wherin offer ſelfe wil put endeuour execute youre commaundemente premiſſes puniſhing ſuche offendours redreſſe ſayde miſrules might power haſtie execution hereof like highneſſe addreſſe theſe letter priuie ſeale writ officer miniſters doe take arreſt ſuche perſons ſo noyſed endited eſtate degrée condition ſoeuer committe tower london priſons abyde without bayle mayne priſe vntil tyme vtterly tryed determined termined courſe lawes cooſin touching bill laſt put vp v vnderſtandeaunſvvere k henrie duke yorke well yée good harte counſayle aduertice v y• ſetting vp juſtice ſpéedy puniſhing ſome perſons endited noyſed offering ſeruiſe bée readie commaundemente ſame ſithe manye cauſes mouing v haue determyned ſoule ſtabliſhe ſadde ſubſtancial counſell giuing ample aucthoritie power euer afore whiche haue appointed one ſithe accuſtomed ſure expedient take concluſion conduct aduiſe counſell one perſon hymſelfe conſeruation obſerued greateſt beſte riche poore libertye uertue effect voyces equall haue therefore determyned wythin ſelfe ſende chauncellour england lord counſel yea al togither within ſhort time ripelye common theſe greate matter whiche communication ſuche concluſion grace god ſhal takē ſhal ſound pleaſure weale v land well theſe matter length agréed king duke somerſet ſhoulde committed warde abyde anſwere ſuche article duke yorke would laye againſt vpon promiſes ſo made kyng duke ſawe people kent place came promiſed ſtrong ynough king part much brake vp fielde firſt marche yéelded himſelfe king dertforde contrarie promiſe made founde duke somerſet chiefe king duke yorke ſent london holden partly priſoner ſtreighter ſhoulde haue bene kepte noyſed ſir edward earle march ſonne ſayde duke yorke comming towarde london ſtrong power welchmen whych feared ſo quéene counſell duke ſet full libertie tenth march ſaide richarde duke yorke made ſubmiſſion toke hys othe true faythfull obedient ſubiect king henrie ſixth king england saint paules church london preſent king moſt nobilitye ſaye duke buckingham northampton somerſet earles warwicke arundale saliſburie shropſhire deuonſhire wiltſhire northumberlande stafford dorſet viconnts beaumount welles baron fitz warren sainmounde cobham douglas others biſhoppes cardinall archbyſhoppe yorke canterburie wincheſter ely london theſe wordes following richard duke yorke confeſſe beknowe oughte bée humble ſubiecte liegeman ſoueraigne lorde king henrie ſixth owe therefore beare fayth trueth ſoueraigne liege lorde ſhall doe dayes vnto liues ende ſhall time wyll aſſente thing attempted done againſte moſte noble perſon ſo euer ſhall haue knowledge anye ſuche thing imagined purpoſed ſhall ſpéede diligence poſſible mée make youre hygheneſſe ſhall haue knowledge thereof ouer doe ſhall poſſible withſtanding lette thereof vttermoſte lyfe ſhall anye thing take vppon agaynſte youre royall eſtate obeyſaunce due thereto ſuffer anye man doe farre forthe ſhal power let alſo ſhall come youre commaundemente whenſoeuer ſhall called ſame humble obeyſaunte wiſe letted ſickneſſe impotence perſon ſuch cauſe ſhal bée thoughte ſoueraigne lord reaſonable ſhall neuer hereafter take vpon gather row • e make aſſembly people without cō maundement licence lawfull defence interpretation declaration lawfull defence ſhall reporte time highneſſe caſe require péeres thing attempt againſte ſubiects eſtate▪ degrée condition ye ſoeuer finde ſelfe wronged agréeued ſhal ſue humblye remedie highneſſe procéede courſe lawes none otherwiſe ſauing mine owne lawfull defence manner aboue ſaide otherwiſe haue highneſſe hū ble true ſubiecte oughte haue ſoueraigne lorde theſe thing aboue ſayde promiſe truely obſerue kéepe holy euangeliſtes contayned booke laye hande vpon holye croſſe touch bleſſed sacrament oure lordes bodye ſhall nowe hys mercye receiue ouer agrée wil▪ tyme hereafter▪ grace lord god neuer ſhall thing attempt waye feate otherwyſe againſte royall maieſtie obeyſaunce owe thereto thyng take vppon otherwiſe aboue expreſſed tyme forth vnabled helde taken vntrue openly foreſworne man vnable manner worſhip eſtate degrée ſuch occupye might wiſe grow vnto hereafter haue promiſed ſworne procéedeth myne owne deſire frée volunte conſtraynyng coaction witneſſe thing aboue written richarde duke yorke aboue writ ſubſcribe mine owne hand ſeale oth alſo toke westminster couentrey ſundry timesanno reg 31 sherifes maior richard lee richard alley 28 september godfrey filding mercer 28 october twelfth day chriſtmas king holding arobert fabian 1453 ſolempne feaſte westminster made two bretherne mother ſide knightes alſo made edmunde elder earle richemonde iaſper yonger earle penbrooke moneth marche witneſſeth gagwine towne harflewe wonne frenchman ſoone citie bayons giuen vppe appointment ſouldioures ſhoulde leaue theyr armoure behinde one twentith july iohn talbot earle shrewſburie wyth ſonne lorde liſle syr edwarde hull knight ſlaine beſides burdeaux lorde molins taken priſoner deliuered greate raunſome bartholmewe daye wreſtling neare vnto clearken well gentleman belonging prior saint iohns made rumour tumulte whiche commaundement maior arreſted richard alley one sherifes deliuered paris sergeant ſuche reſiſtance made partes taking sherife faine craue help maior brother alderman aroſe game ſtrengthned sherifes reſcue ſaid gentleman one named calleis came saint iohns greate ſtrength archer reſiſte maior fray yeoman saint iohns • laine many ſore hurte maior himſelfe eſcaped hardly cap ſmitten head arrowe maior citizen putte flight ſente principall newgate toke place til ye game ended time citizen gathèred ſelues greate nūber fetched home neuer maior ſo ſtrongly ſo honorably anno reg 32▪ yeare king lay longſicke claringdon greate daunger haue ended life thirtéenth daye october quéene westminster deliuered hir firſte ſonne named edwarde iohn waldren thomas cocke 28 september sherifes maior 1454 iohn norman draper 28 october thys time maiors alderman commoner cytie london wonte ride westminster maior ſhoulde take hys charge maior rowed thyther water whiche waterman made hym ſong rowe boate norman c ninth marche nighte greate fire nexte wythout ludgate cordwayners houſe whyche cordwayner wyth hys wife thrée yong men mayde burnte priſoners ludgate remoued newgate bycauſe almoſte ſmoulderedan reg 35 sherifes maior iohn fielde william tayler 28 september stephen foſter fiſhmonger 28 october greate fray london sanctuarie men saint martin le graunde iſſued forth hurte dyuerſe citizen appeaſed maior hys brother one twentith may king hēry taking iorney1455 westminster toward saint albons mete duke yorke earles warwicke salisburie lodged nighte wateforde wadeforde thys ſide sainte albons morning earely came saint albons wyth hym aſſembled hys partye duke somerſet buckingham earles penbroke northumberlande deuonſhire stafforde dorſet wiltſhire lordes clifforde sudley baron roos wyth diuerſe knight eſquiers gentleman yeoman nūber 2000 ſame time aſſembled richard duke yorke richarde earle warwicke richarde earle salisburie diuerſe knightes eſquiers fielde called keyfielde beſide saint albons king hearing duke comming lord aforeſaid pight banner place called goſelowe place ſometimes called sandforth saint peter ſtréete commaunded ſtrong manner kéepe wardes barrier ſame towne duke yorke knowing ſtrength made againſte abyding fielde afore ſayde ſeuen clocke morning vntill almoſt ten clocke without ſtroke ſmitten eyther parte aduiſe hys counſell ſente vnto king vnder theſe wordes following wordes writing duke yorke king pleaſe vnto excellente grace richarde duke yorke take hym true liege manne humble ſubiecte conſider tender reuerence god way charitie true intent commyng good gratious soueraigne vnto true liege menne whych power mighte readye lyue dye right al thing ſhal like maieſtie royal commande v worſhip crowne england welfare noble realme moreouer gratious lorde pleaſe vnto youre maieſtye royall youre greate goodneſſe rightewiſeneſſe encline youre heare féele rightwiſe parte v youre true subiects liege men fyrſte praying beſéeching oure soueraigne chriſte jeſus hys hyghe aod mightye power giue vertue prudence throughe prayer glorious martyre sainct albon gyue verye knowledge oure trothes knowe intent aſſembling time god heauen knoweth oure intent rightfull true therefore praye vnto mighty lorde theſe woordes domine ſis clypeus defenſionis nostrae wherefore gracious lorde pleaſe maieſtie royal deliuer ſuch accuſe haue like haue deſerued done honorably worſhipped moſte rightfull king true gouernour ſhoulde nowe tyme promiſed afore thys time vnknown haue bin promiſes broken whiche haue bin full faithfully promiſed therevpon greate othes ſworne nowe ceaſe ſuche promiſes othe tyl haue haue deſerued death elſe dye therefore aunſwere king duke yorke king henrie charge commaunde manner perſon degrée eſtate condition ſoeuer abyde auoyde field ſo hardie make reſiſtaunce againſt owne realm ſhall knowe traytour dare ſo bolde ariſe anye people mine owne lande great diſeaſe heauyneſſe faith owe vnto saint edwarde vnto crown england ſhal deſtroy euery mother ſon eke hanged drawn quartered may taken afterward example make ſuche traytours beware make anye riſing people within mine owne land ſo trayterouſly abyde theyr king gouernour concluſion rather ſhall haue lorde time ſhall day ſake quarrell ſelfe liue dye wordes duke yorke gentleman aſſembled hym sir king ſoueraign lord wil reformed beſéeching ne prayer wil wiſe vnderſtād intente wherfore aſſēbled gathered time ful purpoſe deſtroy v al vpon great othe hath made none waye power purſue v taken giue v ſhamefull death léeſing liuelodeand good alſo heyres ſhamed euer therfore ſirs ſith none otherwiſe yt ſhall vtterly die better v die field cowardly put vtter rebuke ſhamefull death right england ſtandeth v conſidering alſo perill ſtandeth time redreſſe miſchiefe thereof let euery man helpe power daye quarrell quite v like men crowne england praying beſéeching vnto lord eternal raigneth glorious kingdome celeſtial kéepe ſaue v thys day right throughe giftes holy grace may made ſtrong withſtād greate abhominable horrible malice purpoſe deſtroy v realme england put v ſhamefull death praye therefore vnto lord comfort defendour ſaying theſe wordes domine ſis clipeus defenſionis nostri theſe wordes ſayde duke yorke earles warwicke saliſburie hoſte betwéene eleauen twelue noone breake thrée ſeueral place ſayd ſtréete king thē place edmond weſtby hundreder ſayde towne saint albons hearing ſaide duke comming commaunded hoſte ſlaye manner lordes knightes squiers gentleman yeoman might taken party foreſayd duke yorke thys done lorde clifforde kepte ſo ſtrongly barriours ſame towne forſayde duke yorke might wiſe power hée hadde enter breake ſayde towne earle warwicke knowyng thereof tooke gathered hys menne togyther wyth hym brake garden ſide ſayde towne betwéene ſigne keye exchequere holywel ſtréete anone within fayde towne blew vppethe trumpet cryed high voyce warwicke warwicke maruayle heare tyll tyme duke yorke might neuer haue entry town ſtrong hande brake vp barrier foughte fierce▪ cruell battayle whiche ſlayne lordes name edmonde duke somerſet earle northumberlande lorde clifforde ſir barton entewſell knighte william souche iohn botreaux ralphe balithorpe ſonne william coruin williā cotton receyuer dutchie lancaster gilbert faldinger reignalde griffin iohn dawes elli wood iohn cyt • e robert woodwarde gilbert scarlocke ralph willowby eſquires gentleman courte roger mercraft quéenes meſſanger hawbin king porter malener padington william butler yeoman fiue twentie moe whoſe name knowne ſlayne bene buryed saint albons eighte fourtie perſons battayle wounded lordes name king ſhotte necke wyth arrowe duke buckingham lord sudley viſages wyth arrowes earle stafforde right hande arrowe earle dorſet ſo ſore hurte might goe fayne carried home carte syr iohn wenloke knighte likewiſe hurt carried thence chayre diuerſe knightes eſquiers ſore hurt ſubſtaunce kyngs hoſte diſpoyled theyr harneis owne requeſte made deliuerye duke hoſte ſauation theyr liues fled earle wiltſhire thorpe many fled caſt away harneis ditch wood done duke yorke erles warwicke saliſburie came vnto king hée beſoughte hym theyr knées grace forgiueneſſe done preſence beſoughte highneſſe take thē grace true liege men king deſired ceaſe people ſhoulde hurte done obey hys commaundemēt cauſe proclaymed king name maner people ſhoulde ceaſe theyr malice ſmite one ſtroke ſo ceaſed battayle vpon day next king duke yorke earles warwicke saliſburie came london lodged biſhoppes pallaice london kepte theyr whitſontide great ioye ſolemnitye concluding holde parliament ſame begin ninth july next following yeare moneth june appeared comet ſtarre called stella cometa betwixt north eaſt extending beames towards south parliament begun ninth july afore ſaide richarde duke yorke made protectour realme earle salisburie made lord chauncellour englande richarde earle warwicke made captaine caleis iohn yong thomas owlgraue 28 september anno reg 34▪ sherifes maior william marrow grocer 28 october yeare meanes quéene lordes hir counſell duke yorke diſcharged protectourſhip earle salisburie chauncellourſhip called priuie ſeale couentrie like haue bene intrapped hardlye eſcaped moneth maye italian ſeruaunte walkyng1456 robert fabian throughe cheape london wyth dagger hangyng hys gyrdle merchauntes ſeruaunt tyme bin italy blamed wearing like weapon chalenged ſtraunger howe hée durſt ſo bolde beare weapon conſydering hys natiue countrey knowyng countrey ſtraunger ſuffered wear y• like queſtiō ſuch anſwere made ſtraunger merter toke hys dagger brake vpon heade wherevpon ſtranger complayned maior morrow ſent yong man ye guilde hall wherfore aunſwere made vnto complaynt agréemente full courte aldermē ſent ward court finiſhed maior sherifes walking homewarde thoroughe cheape mette ſuche number mercer ſeruauntes mighte paſſe ought coulde ſpeake doe till hadde deliuered yonug manne ſente priſon ſame daye afternoone ſodainely aſſembled multitude lewde pore people city without heade guide ranne vnto certaine italian houſes eſpecially florentine lukeſſes venetian toke ſpoyled founde dyd great hurt ſundry place moſte foure houſes ſtanding breadſtreete warde whereof thrée ſtoode saint bartholmewes pariſhe little one pariſh saint beni • finke maior alderman worſhipful commoner citie theyr diligence reſiſted coulde ſente diuerſe newegate fynallye wythout ſhedding bloude mayming diuerſe citizen rumour appeaſed yong manne beginner thys buſineſſe tooke sanctuarie westminster long duke buckingham noble menne ſente kyng cytie charged maior uertue commiſſion inquirie ſhoulde hée made thys ryot ſo called oyer determyner guilde hall ſatte judge maior kyngs lieuetenaunte duke buckingham hys ryghte hande chiefe juſtice lefte hande manye men name whyle enpanelyng theyr inqueſtes common citie manye ſecretly putte armour ment haue roong common bell ſo haue rayſed whole force citie ſo haue deliuered ſuch perſons robberie committed toward matter diſcretely handled counſel labour ſome diſcrete commoner appeaſed neighbour ſuch wiſe furie quenched worde brought duke buckingham commonaltie harneſſe lordes tooke leaue maior departed ſo ceaſed inquirie day upon morrow maior commaunded common counſell warden fellowſhips appeare guild hall recorder king name maiors commaunded euery 〈…〉 den wonderfull fiſhes whereof one called mors marina ſecond sworde fiſhe two whale xxvitj day auguſt peter brice steward normandie iohn maior flete frenchman landed sandwiche fyre ſword waſted towne aſhes obeying whoſe commaundement duke yorke came vnto london xxvj day januarie lodged baynards castle afore wit xv januarie came earle saliſburie lodged place called erber ſhortly came duke somerſet excester lodged without temple barre lykewiſe earle northumberland lord egremond yong lord clyfford lodged ye suburbes xiiij day februarie came earle warwike calleis great band men arrayed red jaquets white ragged ſtaues vppon lodged grey frier xvij day marche king quéene great retinue came london lodged biſhop london pallace ye ſhall vnderſtand theſe lordes came great company men ſome 600 ſome 500 leaſt 400 wherefore maior dayly harneſſe 5000 citizen rode dayly citie suburbes ſame ſée king peace kept nightly 2000 men harneſſe gyue attendance vpon iij alderman kept night watch tyll vij clocke lyttle towne bedfordſhire fell bloudieit raigned bloud rayne whereof red drop appeared ſhéetes woman hanged dry tyme realme englande good order bene long tyme king béeyng ſymple pitifull ledde couetous counſell king grewe debte dayly payment made poſſeſſions lordſhippes pertayned crowne king giuen ſome lordes ſome others ſuch would begge ſo himſelfe almoſt nothing lefte lyue ſuch impoſitions put common people tax tallages quinzimes ſpent vayne helde houſhold maintayned warres miſgouernaunce heartes people turned land gouernaunce quéene ſuch hir affinitie ruled realme hir lyked prince hir ſonne baſtard gotten adulterie wherefore ſhe dreading ſhoulde ſuccéede father crowne englande allyed vnto hir knightes eſquiers chesterſhire haue theyr fauour ſhe helde open houſholde among made hir ſonne prince giue liuerie swannes gentilmen countrey many land truſting ſtrength make hir ſonne king making priuie meanes ſome lordes england ſtirre king ſhould reſigne crowne ſonne ſhe could bring purpoſe xxj day september richard earle saliſburie hauingan reg 38 gathered well appoynted armie dread enemy eſpecially quéene tooke way towarde ludlowe time duke yorke lay intent together would haue rydden king colſhull staffordſhire haue excuſed certaine article layd againſt malice enemy ſayd wherevpon thoſe king alſo quéene laye egliſhall moued aſſemble great powre whereof iames twichet diuinitie miniſtred vnto v ſeuerally bleſſed sacrament body jeſus wherevppon euery v depoſed ſayde trueth duetie accordyng tenor ſayde indenture ſith time haue certified large writing mouth garter king armes onely ſaid highneſſe alſo good worthie lordes beyng moſt noble preſence largeneſſe ſayde trueth duetie intent diſpoſition ſerche motion might ſerue conueniently affirmation thereof perfect ſuerties ſuche inconuenient vnreuerent ieopardies wée haue béene put diuers tymes whereof haue cauſe make ought make ſuche exclamation complaint without reaſon vnknowen ſayde worthie lordes land wil offer v high preſence ſame intent myght ſo doe without ſayd ſuertie onely cauſeth v kéepe ſuche fellowſhippe doe léefull manner hereto haue forborne auoyded thinges might ſerue effuſion chriſtian bloud dreade haue god royall maieſtie haue alſo eſchued approche ſayde moſt noble preſence humble obeyſaunce reuerence wherein haue lyfe haue ſame yet neuertheleſſe heare proclaimed defamed name vnrightfully vnlawfully ſauing high reuerence vntruely otherwiſe god knoweth haue giuen cauſe knowing certainely bleſſed noble intent ſaid good grace righteouſneſſe thereof take repute accept true lawfull ſubiectes accordeth neyther ſayd intent wyll pleaſure ſhoulde otherwiſe taken reputed ouer lordſhippes tenantes bene high violence robbed ſpoyled agaynſt peace lawes ryghteouſneſſe wée therefore ſuffice beſéeche ſayde good grace take repute receyne therevnto ſayde trueth intent god knowne wée ſhewe ſayde tenor ſame indenture apply ſayde bleſſedneſſe ne great righteouſneſſe equitie wherewith god hath euer endued high nobilitie ye importune impacience violence ſuch perſons intende extreme malice procéede vnder ſhadowe high might preſence deſtructiō ſuche inordinate couetiſe wherof god pleaſed haue landes office good letting ſparing therefore put ſuche thing lamentable ſorrowfull ieoperdie might wyſe take effecte myſterie god power hauing regarde effuſion chriſtian bloud ne tenderneſſe noble bloud land ſuch ſerue tuition defence thereof ne waying loſſe true liege men ſaydo realme god defend knoweth intent wée haue auoyded farre may ſuerties dreade wée haue ſayde perſons onely dreade god ſaid highneſſe vſe ſayde defence vntil time wée prouoked neceſſitie whereof wée call heauen earth vnto witneſſe recorde therein beſéeche god judge delyuer v according ſayde intent ſayde trueth duetie ſaid highneſſe ſayde common weale moſt chriſtian king right high mightie prince moſt dread soueraigne lorde wée beſéeche bleſſed lorde preſerue honour eſtate ioye felicitie written ludlowe x day october r yorke r warwike r salisburie excuſation contayned letter ſent king withdrewe went diuers partes beyond sea ſuertie perſons duke yorke went ireland honorably receyued earle marche saliſburie warwike without great ieoperdie perill well lande ſea went calleis abode parliament holden couentrie whereinparliament couentrie attaint treaſon richard duke yorke edward erle vaughan iohn roger richard grey walter deuorux walter hopton roger kynderton william bowes foulke stafforde lorde powys alice counteſſe saliſburie good poſſeſſions eſcheted heires diſherited vnto 9 degrée tenauntes ſpoyled good bemaymedludlovv ſpoyled ſlayne towne ludlowe longing duke yorke robbed bare walles dutch yorke ſpoyled hir good earle warwike hauing great nauie kepte theearle vvarvvike fought vvith spa ••• ardes narrow ſeas ſought spanyards kylled many tooke great veſſels one carrake iene got great rich iohn plummer iohn stocker 28 september sherifes maior william hulin fiſhmonger 28 october moneth october henrie yong duke somerſet henry lorde roos lorde audley men armes ſailed toward calleis intent duke ſhoulde haue bene captaine came lande theyduke somerſet fled gvvynes lord audley taken calleis lord roos fled flaunders calleis would haue taken ſo hardly eſcaped caſtle gwines ſouldiors ſtripped harneſſe let go lord audley taken calleis lord roos fled flaunders returned england long richard lord riuers ſent sādwich kéepe towne certaine great ſhips lay anker earle warwike ſawe time conuenientthe lord riuers lord vvoodvile force caried sandvvicke ſent ſome men sandwich night ye tooke lorde riuers antonie wooduile ſonne bed led ouer calleis al great ſhips ſaue one called grace de dieu might away bicauſe ſhe broke bottome sir baudwyne fulford vndertooke paine looſing head yt woulde1460 sir baudvvin fulford enterpriſe deſtroy yt earle warwike ſpent ye king thouſand markes money returned againe duke excester admirall ſent ſea greatthe duke exceſter ſent sea nauie diſtreſſe earle warwike nauie ſailing sandwiche dertmouth lacke victual money souldiours forſoke betwéene sandwiche dertmouth met earle warwike comming ireland bin ſpeake duke yorke brought mother ſled thither dread led hir calleis duke excester durſt ſet vppon earle warwike earle woulde diſtreſſe becauſe admirall king bloud let paſſe ye moneth june 500 men ſent conduct duke somerſet frō gwynes england abiding ye wind ye port sandwich ye earle warwikes men ſpoyled harnes killed captain moūford many earles calleis ſent archbiſhop caunterburie captaine moūt ſort ſlaine large common england certaine article writing beginning thus worſhipful ſirs duke ofarticles ſent frō duke yorke barles archbishop caunterburie common yorke earles march warwike saliſburie ſewed offered haue come vnto king soueraigne lord moſt noble preſence haue declared aſore dutie god highneſſe proſperitie welfare noble eſtate common weale lande true liege men matter following ſay primis great oppreſſion extortion robberie murther violence done god church miniſters thereof againſt god man law 2 item pouertie miſerie great heauineſſe soueraigne lord ſtādeth hauing liuelode crowne england whereof may kéepe honorable houſholde cauſeth ſpoyling ſayde liege men taker ſayde houſholde lyuelode hand haue bene deſtroyers ſayd eſtate ſayde common weale 3 item lawes partially vnrightfully guided ſhould moſt loue tender ſaid lawes ſaid oppreſſion extortion moſt fauored ſupported generally al righteouſneſſe juſtice exiled ſayde land man dreadeth offend againſt ſaid lawes 4 item pleaſe ſaide good grace liue vpon owne liuelode wherevpon noble progenitor haue dayes heretofore lyued honorably worthily chriſtian prince ſuffer deſtroyers ſayde land true ſubiectes lyue thervpon therfore lacke ſuſtenances ſhould belonging ſayd eſtate finde ſayd houſhold vpon poore common without payment neyther accordeth god man lawe 5 item oft ſaid common haue bene greatly maruellouſly charged tax tallages great empoueriſhing whereof little good hath eyther growne king ſaid land moſt ſubſtance thereof king hath left part half ſo much lordes perſons enimies ſayd common weale haue owne vſe ſuffering old poſſeſſions king fraunce normandy aniow maine gaſcoyn gwiene gotten father moſt noble memory noble progenitor ſhamefully loſt ſold 6 item ceaſe therwith begin new charge impoſition tallages vpon ſaid people neuer afore ſéen ſay euery towne ſhip finde men ye king gard taking enſample therof enimies aduerſaries fraunce impoſition tallage continued heire heires ſucceſſors heauieſt charge worſt enſample euer grewe englande foreſayde ſubiectes ſayde heires ſucceſſors ſuch bondage auncetors neuer charged 7 item king hath liuelode realme englande onely lande ireland towne calleis king chriſtened hath ſuch lande towne without realme diuers lordes haue cauſed highneſſe write letter vnder priuie seale vnto iriſhe enemy neuer king englande fore whereby may haue comfort enter conqueſt ſayde lande letter ſame iriſhe enemy ſent vnto ſayde duke yorke maruelled greatly ſuch letter ſhoulde ſent ſpeaking therein great ſhame villanie ſayd realme 8 item like wiſe king excitation labour ſame lordes wrote letter enemy aduerſaries land wiſe ſhould ſhew fauour good towne calleis whereby comforte ynough procéede wynning thereof conſidered alſo ordayned labour ſayd lord victuall thing refreſhing defence ſhould come englande ſuccour reliefe ſayde towne intent woulde haue loſt may openly appeare 9 item déemed ought greatly déemed ſame lordes would put ſame rule england might haue purpoſe intent handes gouernaunce ſayd enemy 10 item howe continually ſithe piteous ſhamefull ſorrowfull murther englande noble worthie chriſtian prince humfrey duke glocester king true vncle burie hath bene laboured ſtudyed conſpired haue deſtroyed murthered ſayde duke yorke yſſue pleaſed god ſende royall bloud alſo v ſaide earles warwike saliſburie none cauſe true hart god knoweth euer haue born beare profite king eſtate common weale ſame realme defence thereof 11 item howe earles shrewſburie wilſhire lord beaumount mortall extréeme enemyes nowe long tyme paſt hauing guiding aboute moſt noble perſon ſayde soueraigne lorde whoſe highneſſe haue reſtrayned kepte libertie fréedome belongeth ſayde eſtate ſupporters fauourers premyſſes woulde ſuffer king ſayde good grace receyue accepte v would haue done might haue owne ſayde preſence dreading charge woulde haue bene layde vppon miſerie deſtruction wretchedneſſe ſayde realme whereof becauſes king himſelfe noble vertuous rightuous bleſſed diſpoſition prince earthly 12 item earles wilſhire shrewſburie lorde beaumount ſatyſfyed content king poſſeſſions good ſtirred excited ſayd highneſſe holde parliament couentrie acte made prouocation labour agaynſt v ſayde duke yorke ſonnes marche rutlande earles warwike salisburie sonnes ſayde earle saliſburie many knightes eſquiers diuers matter falſely vntruely imagined anſwere afore almighty god day dome ſayde earles salisburie wilſhire lorde beaumount prouoked made intent deſtruction yſſue myght haue lyuelode good haue openly robbed diſpoyled place tenementes manye true men nowe procéede hangyng drawing men tyrannie therein ſhewe largeneſſe violence malice vengeably remedie prouided king highneſſe whoſe bleſſedneſſe neither aſſenting knowing thereof therefore ſéeyng ſayde miſchiefes hearing alſo frenche king maketh lande great aſſembly people greatly bée dreade many cauſes purpoſe yet agayne god grace offer v come agayne ſayde preſence ſayde soueraygne lorde open declare vnto hym miſchiefes aboue declared name land ſue reuerent lowely wiſe wée ſayde good grace haue pittie compaſſion vppon ſayde true ſubiectes ſuffer ſame miſchiefes raygne vppon requiring god behalfe praying owne therein aſſiſt v doyng alway duetie liege men perſons ſayd soueraigne lord eſtate prerogatiue preheminence ſuertie moſt noble perſon wherevnto haue euer bene true ſubiectes aliue wherof call god lady marie saintes heauen vnto witneſſe record meane time earle wilſhire treaſurer england earle vvilshire ſpoyled nevvbery lorde scale lorde hungerforde went newberie whiche longed vvilshire ſtale ouer sea colour take earle warwicke armed fiue gret caraks iene ſouldioures taking victual king price without payment put great part hys treaſure ſayde caraks ſayled ſea laſte ſtale dutchlande ſending backe againe hys ſouldiours englande kingspriuie ſeales money priuie ſeales directed biſhops abbot priours ſtates lende kyng money therewith wage ſouldiours kéepe sea coaſts common kēt dreading like vengeance taken vpon done vpon newberie ſent priuily meſſangers caleis men kent ſent galeis earles foreſayde earles beſéeching haſte poſſible come theyr ſuccour whervpon ſaid erles ſent ouer kent lord fawconbridge know déedes woulde accorde theyr wordes anone people kent ſhires adioyning reſorted ſayde lorde fawconbridge greate number earles knewe wylling heartes thoſe people hoſtages ſafe comming going might heard thirde time erle warwicke ſent worde king two houres noone would ſpeake dye y• field biſhop hereford white frier king confeſſour incouraged king parte fight confuſion come y• intent vnquiet ne grieue ſayde highneſſe pleaſe noble perſon deſiring tenderly high welfare proſperitie therof al realme true liegeman liues ſhall endure king theſe word greatlye recomforted anone led northampton proceſſion reſted thrée dayes came london ſixtéenth july lodged byſhops pallaice nintéenth julye tower london lacke victualles yéelded came forth afterward ſome drawn headed lorde scale late euening entred wherry thrée perſons rowing towarde westminster haue taken sanctuarie deſcried woman anone wherry men fel killed caſt hym lande beſide saint marie oueries quéene margaret heard king takē ſhe wyth hir ſonne eight perſons fled caſtel hardlagh wale robbed way lancaſhire hir goodes valewe ten thouſande markes thence ſhe went scotland tenth auguſt iames king scottes beſieging caſtle rockeſborough ſlaine gun brake campe one twentith september duke somerſet came gwines england anno reg 39 sherifes maior richard flemming iohn lambert 28 september richard lee grocer 28 october vitj october parliamēt begun westminster vnto came ri duke yorke little beforeparliament come irelande lodged pallaice kyng brake vp dores kyngs chamber ſo king giuing hym place tooke chamber ſayde duke right heyre lyneall deſcent richard ſeconde chalenged realme purpoſing haue bin crowned alhallown day next following herevppon ſente parliament wryting hys ſayde clayme title pedigrée whych clayme diligent deliberation approued ſayde parliamente peace concorde betwéene king duke uigil alhalow eſtabliſhed cō cluded article followeth bleſſed iohn whoſe handes bountie refieththe article betvvixt king henrie duke yorke peace vnitie betwixte prince weale euerye realme knowe whoſe direction agréed appointed accorded followeth betwixte moſte high moſte mightis prince king henrie ſixth king england fraunce lord irelande y• one party right high mightie prince richard plātagenet duke yorke party vpon certain matter variaunce moued betwixt eſpecially vpon clayme title vnto crownes england fraunce royall power eſtate dignitie appertayning ſame lordſhip irelande opened ſhewed declared ſayde duke afore lordes ſpirituall temporall preſent parliament firſt ſaide begotten ſonne called deceaſe father kyng edward ſeconde whiche iſſue edward thirde edward third iſſue edward prince wales▪ william hatfield hys ſeconde ſonne leonel thirde duke clarence iohn gaun • matrimony vnto edmond mortimer earle marche iſſue roger mortimer earle marche hyr sonne heyre roger iſſue edmond erle march roger mortimer anne elianor edmonde roger alianor dyed without iſſue ſayde earle march ſonne heyre ſaide phillippe daughter heyre ſayde leonel thirde ſonne ſayde king edward thirde whiche edmonde right title ſayde crownes lordſhip lawe cuſtome belonged whiche richard duke yorke ſonne anne daughter roger mortimer earle march ſonne heyre ſayd phillip daughter heyre ſayde leonell third ſonne kyng edwarde thirde righte title dignitie royall eſtate crownes realmes england frāce lordſhippe irelande pertayneth belongeth fore anye iſſue ſaide iohn gaunt fourth ſonne ſame king edwarde ſayde title notwithſtanding without preiudice ſayde richarde duke yorke tenderly deſiring wealth reſte proſperitie land ſet apart might trouble ſame conſyderyng poſſeſſion ſayde kyng henne ſixth hathe hys tyme bene named taken reputed kyng englande fraunce lorde irelande contented agréede conſenteth hée bée hadde reputed taken kyng englande fraunce wyth royall eſtate dignitye preheminence belonging therevnto lorde irelande hys naturall lyfe time ſaide duke without hurte preiudice ſaide righte title ſhall take worſhippe honor ſoueraigne lorde item ſaide richard duke yorke ſhall promiſ binde ſolempne othe maner forme foloweth name god amen richarde duke yorke othe richard duke yorke promiſe ſweare faith truth owe almightie god ſhal neuer conſent procure ſtirre directly indirectly priuie aperte neyther much ſhall ſuffer done conſented procured ſtirred thing may ſound abridgement natural life king henry ſixth y• hurt diminiſhing raigne dignitie royall violence anye otherwiſe againſte fréedome libertie anye perſon perſons wold preſume thing y• contrary ſhal might power withſtande make withſtoode farre power wil ſtretche • herevnto ſo helpe mée god holie euangeliſtes item edward earle march edmund earle rutlande ſonnes ſaide duke yorke ſhall make like othe item accorded appointed agréed ſaid richard duke yorke ſhal called reputed hence forth rightfull heire crownes royall eſtate dignitie lordſhippe aboue ſaide deceaſe ſaide king henry lay ſaide crownes eſtate dignitie lordſhippe ſayde duke heyres ſhal immediately ſuccéed ſaide crownes royal eſtate dignitie lordſhip item ſaide richard duke yorke ſhall haue authoritie preſent parliament caſtels manor land tenementes wyth wardes marriage relief ſeruices fine amercementes office anowſions fées appurtenaunces belonging ſoeuer yearely valewe tenne thouſande markes ouer al charge repriſes fiue thouſand markes ſhall owne ſtate thrée thouſande fiue hundred markes edward firſt begotten ſonne earle march eſtate one thouſande pounde edmond earle rutland ſeconde ſonne yearely ſuſtentation ſuche conſiderations ſuche intent ſhall declared lord king counſell item perſon perſons imagine compaſſe death ſayde duke thereof probably attaynte open déede done folkes condition déemed adiudged high treaſon item eſtabliſhing ſayde accorde appointed conſented lordes ſpirituall temporall thys preſent parliament ſhal make othes accepte take worſhip repute ſaid richard duke yorke hys heires aboue rehearſed kéepe obſerue ſtrength muche apperteyneth vnto thing aboueſayd reſiſt power woulde preſume contrarie according eſtates degrées item ſayde richard duke yorke erles march rutland ſhall permitte make helpe ayde defende ſayde lord euery againſt althoſe wyll quarrell thing attempt againſt ſayde lordes anye occaſion agréemente conſenting ſayde accorde aſſiſtaunce giuing duke earles item agréed appointed accorde euery article thereof opened notifyed king letter patent otherwiſe ſuch time place maner ſhall thought expedient ſayde rycharde duke yorke aduiſe lordes king counſel king vnderſtandeth certainely ſayde title ſayde richarde duke yorke iuſt lawfull ſufficient aduiſe aſſent lordes ſpirituall temporall common parliament aſſembled aucthoritie y• ſame parliament declareth approueth ratifyeth confirmeth accepteth ſayde title iuſt good lawfull true therevnto giueth aſſent agréemente frée libertie ouer ſayd aduice aucthoritie declareth entitleth calleth ſtabliſheth affirmeth reputeth ſayde richarde duke yorke true rightfull heire corones royal eſtate dignitie y• realm england fraunce lordſhip irelande aforeſaid according y• worſhip reuerence therto belongeth taken accepted reputed worſhip reuerence ſtates ſayde realme englande hys ſubiectes thereof fauyng ordayning ſame aucthoritie king haue y• ſaide corones realme royal eſtate dignity preheminence ofthe ſame ſayde lordſhippe ireland life naturall furthermore ſame aduice authoritie conſenteth agréeth deceaſe ſhall pleaſe highneſſe laye hym ſayde corones eſtate dignitie lordſhippe ſayde richarde duke yorke hys heyres ſhal immediatelye ſuccéede ſayde corones royall eſtate dignitye worſhippe haue inioye acte parliament ſtatute ordinance thing contrarie made interruption diſcontinuaunce poſſeſſion notwithſtanding moreouer ſaide aduiſe aucthoritie ſtabliſheth graunteth confirmeth approueth ratifieth accepteth ſaid accorde al thing therein contayned therevnto fréely abſolutely aſſenteth agréeth ſame aduice authoritie ordayneth eſtabliſheth anye perſon perſons ymagine compaſſe deathe ſayde duke probably attaynt open déede done folkes condition déemed adiudged highe treaſon furthermore ordayneth eſtabliſheth ſayde aduice aucthoritie ſtatutes ordinaunces actes parliament made time ſaid king hē rie fourth whiche heyres bodye comming henrie late king england fifth ſonne heyre ſayd king henrie fourth heires king henrie fifth inheritable ſaide crownes realmes heritage ſame bée adnulled repelled dampned cancelled voyde none effect ouer king ſaide aduice aſſent authoritie ordayneth eſtabliſheth actes ſtatutes made afore thys time acte parliamente repelled adnulled like authoritie otherwiſe voyde ſuch force effecte vertue afore making theſe ordinaunces letter pattents royalx record actes judicial made done afore tyme repelled reuerſed ne otherwiſe voyde lawe preiudiced hurte preſent acte alſo ordayned ſame parliamente ſayde richarde duke yorke ſhoulde called prince wale duke cornewall earle chester protectour englande moneth december duke somerſet earle deuonſhire wente northe countrey eighte hundered men anone ſaide duke yorke earle rutlande ſonne earles saliſburie little chriſtmaſſe fewe perſons wente northe alſo repreſſe malice northerne men whiche loued duke yorke ne earle saliſburie lodged caſtell sandale wakefielde lorde neuill brother earle westmerlande vnder colour friendſhippe came duke yorke requyring hym commiſſion hym rayſe people chaſtice rebelles ſayde hadde rayſed number eighte thouſande menne hée broughte lordes countrey ſaye earle northumberlande lorde clifforde duke somerſet aduerſaries duke yorke laſte december fell ſayde duke richarde killed hym sonne earle rutland many knight eſquiers witte lorde harington thomas harington knighte sir thomas neuil ſonne earle saliſburie syr henrie ratforde knight number 2200 earle saliſburie taken aliue ledde duke somerſet caſtell pomfraite graunte hys life greate ſumme money common people countrey whyche loued hym toke hym caſtel violence ſmote hys heade death theſe lordes knowen •• king commaunded writ commiſſions ſent ſhires people goe againſte rebelles northe ſuppreſſe northe came ſodainelye downe town dunstaple robbing countrey people came ſpoyling abbayes priory pariſh church bearing awaye chaliſſes bookes ornamentes whatſoeuer worth carriage thoughe bin sariſens chriſtians againſte twelfth februarie duke norffolke suffolke erles warwicke arundale lord bonuile king wente london towarde saint albons heard northe ſo nyghe tooke fielde beſide little towne called sandriage farre sainte albons barnarde heathe place called man lande kyng ſtoode ſawe hys menne ſlayne bothe ſydes tyll laſte throughe wythdrawyng manye kentiſhmen captaine louelace vaward king henry parte loſt fielde lord fled king wente quéene margaret come wt northerne men hyr ſonne edwarde earle warwicke wente towarde earle marche comming towarde london wale lord bonuile woulde haue withdrawen king aſſured hym haue bodylye harme neuertheleſſe inſtance quéene duke excester earle deuonſhire beheaded saint albons wyth hym syr thomas kyriell kente battayle fought shroue tweſday ſeauentéenth februaryexlibre norwicenſis whiche ſlain 1916 perſons ſame day thomas thorpe baron exchequer beheaded high gate common kent citizen london dreading malice quéene duke somerſet ſente vnto dutcheſſe buckingham treate beneuolent citie ſumme money promiſed ſhoulde come citie wyth certayne number perſons vpon certayne ſpeares men armes ſente haue entred citie duke commyng whereof ſome ſlayne ſome ſore hurte remnaunte putte flighte common tooke keyes gate manfully defended citie vntill comming edwarde earle marche wherethroughe king henrie wyth quéene margaret northerne men forced return northwarde thirde februarie edwarde earle marche foughte wyth welchmen beſide wigmore wale neare vnto mortimer croſſe whoſe captaynes earle penbroke earle wilſhire put flight ſlewe welchemen aboute foure thouſande owen tewther whome iohn leylande ſayeth ſhoulde called •• dicke father ſayde earle penbroke whiche owen hadde married katherin mother king henrie ſixth taken beheaded afterward buried chapel gray frier church hereforde day battayle tenne clocke noone ſéene thrée sun firmamēt ſhyning like cleare cloſed togither one eight twentith februarie edward earle march accompanied erle warwicke mightie power marchmen came vp london ioyfully receyued ſeconde day march sonday hys hoſte muſtered saint iohns fielde redde among people certaine article pointes king henrie offended demanded whether ſaid henrie worthy raigne ſtill people cryed nay naye aſked would haue erle march theyr king ſayde yea yea certaine captaynes ſente toerle march elected king earle march baynardes caſtel tolde erle people choſen king whereof thanked god aduiſe archbyſhoppe canterburie byſhoppe excester earle warwicke wyth hée tooke vpon hym dutch yorke mother edwarde earle marche fearing fortune worlde ſente hyr two yonger ſonnes george richarde ouer ſeas citie vtricke almaine remayned tyll elder brother got crown alſo phillip malpas alderman london thomas citizen lō fled vaghan eſquire maiſter william atclife many fearing quéenes comming london ſhypped ſhippe antwerpe purpoſing haue ſayled thyther way taken french ſhippe named colmapne length delyuered greate raunſome edwarde earle march elected aboueſaidedvvard erle march toke kingdome next morrowe went proceſſion paules offered te deum beyng ſung gret royaltie conueyed westminster hall ſette king ſeate saint edward scepter hand aſked people would haue king cryed yea yea certaine homage hym receyued proceſſion conuayed abbay ſette quire king whyle te deum ſinging done offered saint edwardes shryne returned water vnto saint paules lodged wythin biſhops pallaice thus tooke poſſeſſion realme vpon tuiſday fourth marche proclaymed king england name edward fourthe king henrie hadde raigned thirtie yeares vnderſtande lawes executed william hampton barthelmew iames 28 sep sherifes maior thomas coke draper 28 october quéene margaret wyfe henrie ſixt landed north hauing ſmall ſuccour euill fortune ſhe faine take sea againe tempeſt weather driuen barwicke ſhe landed loſt hir ſhippes good december king edwarde laide ſiege caſtels bambrugh dunstonbrugh alnewike henrie bowfort duke somerſet ſir ralph twelfe euen peirs • e braſile great warrior normandie came helpe quéene margaret frenchman xx thouſande scot remoue king edwardes men alnewike ſiege reſidue caſtels whoſe comming king edwardes men afearde scottes reculing ſiege scottes afearde edwardes men leaſt reculed bring trap henry mē iſſuing much boldneſſe gaue edward mē opportunitie enter caſtle morow twelfe day earle warwike made xv knightsanno reg 3 theſe iij caſtels committed▪ ye kéeping ſir ralph grey againe king henrie quéene and1463 felowſhip entred kept midſomer scot many french engliſhmen laid ſiege caſtle norham forced parliament westminster graunted two fiftenes demy xviij june margaret ſyſter king edward thelady margaret king ſiſter married duke burgoigne fourth beganne hir iourney wardrobe london toward hir mariage charles duke burgoigne firſt ſhe offred church paule rode citie earle warwike riding hir earles baron great number dutch norfolke ladyes gentlewoman great number hir entrie cheape maior london brother alderman preſented hir payre riche baſons • 100 • golde night ſhe lodged abbey stratford king lay thence ſhe tooke hir iourney caūterbury king riding ſée hir ſhipping ye firſt july ſhe tooke ye ſea margate toke leaue ye king hir brother departed returned backe againe ye king duke clarence duke glocester ye earles warwike shrewſburie northūberland abode hir ſhip lorde scale lorde dacres hir chamberlaine ſir iohn wodvile ſir iohn heyward many famous knightes eſquiers ſhe ſhipped new ellen londō hir nauie iohn newcastle marie saliſburie many royall ſhips morrowe landed sluce flaūders ſoone hir ſhip cōpany ſhips entred ye hauen receiued hir ſir simō de leleyn water bailie diuers boates bark apparelled redie hir lāding firſt eſtate y• receiued hir ye biſhop v • right well accompanyed counteſſe shorne baſtard daughter duke phillip burgoygne hir many ladyes gentlewomē ſo procéeding gate towne ſame towne preſented hir ſhe soueraigne ladie thereof alſo gaue hir xij mark gold troy waight 200 • engliſh money ſo ſhe procéeded towne hir lodging euery houſholder ſtanding ſtréete torche hand burning morrow olde dutch burgoygne came hir accompanyed many great eſtates iij july came the▪ duke borgoigne sluce xx perſons ſecretly openly affianced ladie margaret byſhop saliſburie lorde scale preſence lord dacre duches norfolke ladie scale knightes eſquiers gentlewoman olde duches burgoigne lord scale lord dacre knightes eſquiers ladyes gentlewomē came england great triumph feaſtings ſhewes pageant ſtraunge deuiſes juſtings ſuch haue read like would ouer long place ſet downe sir thomas cooke late maior londō one named robert fabian sir thomas cooke hawkins appeached treaſon ſent towre place within london ſeaſed lorde ryuers wife ſeruauntes clearely put therof cauſe forenamed hawkins came vpon ſeaſon vnto ſayd ſir thomas requeſting lend thouſand markes vpon good ſuertie wherevnto anſwered firſt would know ſhould intent length vnderſtanding ſhoulde vſe quéene margaret anſwered currant ware whereof ſhiftes might made without much loſſe therfore required hawkins moue farther matter intended deale withall yet ſayde hawkins exhorted remember benefites receiued hir ſhe proſperitie making hir wardrober cuſtomer hampton c meanes ſayde cooke woulde graunt good money although laſt ſayd hawkins required hundreth poūd fayne depart without value pennie neuer came againe moue ſo reſted two thrée yeares tyll ſayde hawkins caſt towre length brought brake called duke excesters daughter meane payne ſhewed many thing amongſt ye motion one made ſir thomas coke accuſed himſelfe ſo farre put death meane confeſſion ſayde ſir thomas troubled ſhewed ſaide ſir thomas lyen towre whitſontide fyll michaelmas ſeaſō many enquiry made finde guiltie euer quit till one iurie meanes ſir iohn fogge endited treaſon determine ſet guildhall ſat ye maior duke clarence earle warwike ye lorde riuers ſir iohn fogge ye king counſell place ſaide thomas brought arraygned vpō life death acquited ye ſaid inditement counter bredſtreete thence king bench certaine time thus acquited wife gat againe poſſeſſiō hir houſe ye ſhe found euill plight ſuch ſeruants y• lord riuers ſir iohn fogge aſſigned kéepe made hauoke liſted alſo place eſſex named guydy hall ſet ſort kéepe place deſtroyed deare parke connies fiſhe without reaſon ſpared braſſe pewter bedding might carie might neuer one pennie gottē recompence yet could ſir tho cooke deliuered til paid 8000 • ye ▪ k 800 • ye quéene ende auguſt caſtle harlowe wonneharlovv caſ • l • vvonne aſſaulte lorde herberd ſoiourned lay whenearle vvarvvike houſe keeping came london held ſuch houſe vj ox eaten breakefaſt euery tauerne full meate acquaintance houſe ſhould haue much ſoden roſt might carrie vpon long dagger penbroke▪ richard earle warwike earle oxford baſtard fawconbridge many ariued plymmouth▪ ſort dartmouth whome earle penbroke went wale toward excester proclaiming name king henry men betwixt age xvj lx ſhould ready aſſiſt ſaide lordes behalfe king henrie againſt king edward alſo sonday next feaſt saint michael archangell doctor godard preaching atdoctor godard preached paules croſſe againſte king edvvarde paules▪ croſſe declared reading byls diuers argument proofes henrie true lawfull king england king edward moreouer marque mountacute gathered vj thouſand men king edwardes name come néere vnto ſaid edward told king edward ſerued firſt making him▪ earle northumberland giuing ſame erledome percie made marque mountacute allowing pie neſte maintayne it▪ wherefore would leaue ſerue take part earle warwike brother whereof king edwarde vnderſtoode fled hoſt beſides notingham king edvvarde fled beyond sea iij day october lorde riuers lorde haſtings chamberlaine lord say ye number vij viij earles tooke ſhipping lynne phil kom • •• ſayled toward duke burgoigne brother lawe quéene wit y• firſt octoberthe queene tooke ſanctuary at▪ vveſtm • ſter ſtolne ſecretly ye night towre london water westminster taken sanctuary time great watch kept ye citie london▪ kentiſhmen hadkentishmen robbed fleming chaſed • hem oute london aſſembled themſelues great company ſo come outer part citie iohns number 2000 men armes morrow following came duke clarence earle warwike baſtard fawconbridge number foure thouſand men vj day octoberiohn forteſcue duke clarence earle warwike archbiſhop yorke lorde saint iohns entred towre london king henrie priſonerk h reſtored nigh ſpace nine yéeres elected lawfull king forthwith rode london biſhops pallace reſted til xiij october day went proceſſion crowned paules church earle warwike bare traine ye earle oxforde ſworde c king edward proclaimed vſurper crowne iohn tiptoft earle worcester founde top high trée foreſt▪ wabridge countie huntington brought london beheaded ye towre hill buried blacke frier iohn crosby iohn ward 28 september sherifes maior sir iohn stockton mercer 28 october sir iohn crosby knight one late named sherifes london yeare▪ deceaſed anno domini 1475sir iohn croſby giftes citie buryed pariſhe churche saint helen byſhoppes gate ſtréete vnto repayring pariſhe churche gaue fiue hundred markes xxx pounde diſtributed poore houſholders warde byſhops gate repayring pariſh church heneworth myddleſex fortie pounde the▪ repayring london wall one hundred pounde toward making new towre ſtone south ende london bridge ſame begun maior commonaltie within x yéeres next deceaſſe one hundred pounde reparation rochester bridge x pound euerie priſoners london liberally alſo gaue warden commonaltie grocer london two large pottes siluer chaced halfe guilte waying xitj pounde v ounce troy weyght occupyed common hall elſe diſcretions quéene elizabeth wyfe edward fourth sanctuarie westminster prince ed born sāctuarie deliuered prince iitj nouember king edward fifth king edward lord haſtings lorde say ix hundred engliſhmen iij hundred fleming would haue landed eſſex erle oxfordes brother put themanno reg 11 landed ſore weather beaten raueneſporne within humber holderneſſe roſe holderneſſe 1471 men whoſe captayne ſir iohn weſterdale prieſt caſt marſhalſea london k edward paſſed countrey ſhewed ye erle northumberlandes letter seale ſent ſaying came claime tytle crowne dukedome yorke would haue done afore ye exciting erle warwike cryed euery place k henrie prince edwarde wearing eſtriche feather prince edwardes lyuerie king edward came notingham ſir william stanley ſyr william norres diuers broughte men ſo 4000 edward marched towarde lecester earle warwike marque mountacute 4000 men would haue fought king edwarde receyued letter duke clarence ſhould fight vntill came whervpon kéeping lecester ſtill ſuffered edwarde marche towarde london 〈…〉 clarence ſeuen thouſand 〈…〉 edward agréed brake promiſes made fraunce king edwarde comming london maſter vrſwike recorder meanes others entred byſhoppe london palaice aking henry againe ſent tovver poſterne tooke king henrie archbyſhop yorke ſent towre maū dye thurſday earle warwike duke excester marquesbarnet field mountacute earle oxford many knight came hoſt towarde barnet wherefore king edward tooke king henrie preoccupied ye town barnet night earle warwike retinue remained plaine without towne ſhooting gūnes one ye morning eaſter day ye xiitj aprill fought thick miſt iitj ye clock morning till x diuers time earle warwikes men ſuppoſed gotte victorie fielde happened ye earle oxford men ſtarre ſtreames behinde liueries king edward men ſunne ſtreames lyuery whervpon earle warwikes men reaſon myſt well decerning badge ſo lyke ſhot earle oxfordes men owne parte earle oxforde men cryed treaſon fled eight hundred men marque mountacute priuily agréed wyth king edwarde gotten hys lyuerie one brother earle warwikes men eſpying fell vppon killed earle warwike ſéeing lepte horſe flye comming woodde paſſage one kyng edwardes men came hym kylled hym ſpoyled hym naked ſkynne sir william tirrell knyghte kylled earle warwikes •• rt duke excester fought manfully diſſ •• yled wounded lefte deade ſeuen morning tyll 4 clocke afternoone beyng brought ſeruauntes houſe called ruthland chirurgion conueyed westminster sanctuarie lorde cromwell ſonne heire earle eſſex lord barnes ſonne heire lord say ſlaine king edwardes partie partes number foure thouſande buryed ſame playne chappell builded morow easter day ye bodyes earleiob raſtall warwike marque mountacute layde naked paules churche london men might ſée king henrie archbyſhop yorke ſent towre london time quéene margaret prince edwarde hir ſonne lyne ye ſea xvtj dayes letted foule weather easter day euen landed frenche battell tevvkesburie nauie weymouth ſo came excester thence tewkeſburie pitched fielde seuerne edwarde fourth come london fought prince edward liber tewx tewkeſburie fourth may tooke quéene margaret priſoner prince edward hir ſonne cruelly ſmote face gawntlet ſeruants ſlew edmond duke somerſet ſir hugh courteney fledde prince edward loſte fielde
