geffreythomas baſtarde gate knightes gouernours caleis ſente ſir george broke knight caleis 300 ſouldiours thomas baſtarde fauconbridge captaine earle warwickes nauie willing raiſe countrey kente goe london take king henrie tower goe againſt king edwarde fourtéenth day may thomas baſtarde wyth ryotous company ſhipmen eſſex kent came london denyed paſſage throughe citie ſet vpon biſhops gate aldegate london bridge c along thamis ſide ſhooting arrow gunnes citie fiered suburb brent 60 houſes wanne bulwarkes aldegate entred citie ye parcoliſe let downe ſuche entred ſlaine citizen purſued reſt farre stratforde blacke wall ſlaying many tooke manye priſoners thomas baſtarde went london weaſtwarde farre kingstone vppon thamis proſecute king edwarde lorde scale nicholas faunte maior canterburie fayre wordes cauſed fawconbridge returne blacke heath kent whence night ſtale hoſte ſixe hundred horſſemenne rochester ſo sandwiche abode kyngs comming one twentith may king edwarde came toking henrie murdered london thirtie thouſand men ſame nyght king henrie murdered tower london morrowe brought saint paules church london open cophen bare faced bled thēce carried blacke frier bled thence cherſey abbay boate buryed ſince remoued windſor reſteth thus ended king tranſitorie life hauing inioyed great proſperity fauourable fortune coulde aforde greate trouble ſide ſhe frownyng coulde poure yet ſtates patiente vertuous maye patterne moſte perfect vertue worthy example fortune inconſtancie plaine vpright far fraude wholye giuen prayer reading scripture almesdéedes ſuch integritie lyfe biſhoppe whyche hadde bene hys confeſſour tenne yeares auowched hée tyme committed anye mortall cryme continente ſuſpition vnchaſte life neuer touched hym hauyng chriſtmaſſe ſhewe yong womenne wyth theyr bare breaſtes layde preſented hym immediately departed wyth theſe wordes fie fie ſhame forſooth blame marryage liked woman ſhoulde enter hys courte thys reſpect committed hys two brother mother ſide iaſper edmonde moſte honeſt vertuous prelate bée broughte vppe ſo farre couetouſneſſe executor hys vncle biſhoppe winchester ſurnamed rich cardinall would haue giuen 2000 pounde playnelye refuſed willing diſcharge departed woulde ſcarcely condeſcend length accept ſame ſome money towarde endowing colledges cambridge eaton religiouſly affected tyme principall holydayes would ſackeclothe next ſkinne othe vſed none moſte earneſt matter theſe wordes forſoothe forſooth ſo pityfull hée ſawe quarter traytour agaynſte hys crowne ouer criple gate hée willed taken awaye wyth theſe wordes wyll haue anye chriſtian ſo cruellye handeled ſake manye greate offence hée willinglye pardoned receyuing tyme greate blowe wicked manne whyche compaſſed hys deathe onelye ſayde forſooth forſooth yée doe fowelye ſmite kyng annoynted ſo another alſo thruſte ſide wyth ſworde hée reſtoared hys ſtate kyngdome long hys death beyng demaunded hée hadde ſo long helde crowne englande vniuſtlye replyed father kyng englande quietlye enioying crowne hys raigne grandſire kyng englande euen chylde cradle proclaymed crowned king without anye interruption ſo helde fortye yeares well neare ſtates homage vnto anteceſſors wherefore may ſaye king dauid lotte fallen vnto faire grounde yea haue goodlye heritage helpe lorde whyche ſaueth vprighte hearte good king hymſelfe alwayes naturally enclinedthe king colledge cambridge doe good fearing leſte might ſéeme vnthankfull almyghtye god hys greate benefittes beſtowed vppon hym ſince tyme firſte tooke vppon hym regimente realme determyned aboute ſixe twentith yeare hys raygne hys primer notable worke wordes hys wyll finde expreſſed erecte founde two famous colledges honoure worſhippe hys holy name encreaſe vertue dilation cunning eſtabliſhmente chriſtian fayth whereof one cambridge bée called hys colledge royall oure ladye saint nicholas eaton beſide windſor bée called hys colledge oure bleſſed ladye performaunce thys hys deuoute purpoſe hee enfeffed certayne byſhoppes wyth noble worſhipfull perſonages hys letter patent wyth land poſſeſſions parcel enheritance dutchie lācaster cleare value wel neare xxxiiij hundred pound yere whych letter patent confirmed acte parliament declaring alſo wil vnto ſayde feoffées intent meaning howe ſame ſhould imployed vpon edification ſaide two colledges wherof iudgemente deuice ſo excellent building ſo princely apt purpoſe omitte ſet forth vnto plat whole colledge cambridge euen finde mentioned almoſt verbatim ſaid wil ſuppoſing reſt houſe procéeded according chappel alreadie finiſhed full intent meaning lyke colledge coulde ſkant haue bin found againe chriſtian land word thus touchingthe chappel dimenſions church ſayde colledge lady saint nicholas cambridge haue gréece called gradus chori 90 foote 36 ſtals either ſide ſame quyre aunſcoering lxx fellowes ten prieſts conduit whiche muſt de prima forma ſayd ſtalles vnto ye eaſt end ſayde church lxij foote aſſiſe alſo reredoſſe bearing roodelofte departing quire bodye churche contayning length xl foote breadth xiiij foote walles ſame church height 90 foote imbattelled vawted charerooffed ſufficiently tower manye ſhall bée thought conuenient therevnto ſayde colledge edified moſte ſubſtantiall beſt abyding ſtuffe ſtone leade glaſſe iron maye beſte hadde prouided thereto thus much haue enlarged occaſion reading good king cunning deuiſe wherof leaue conſidered ſuch experte architecture hartily deſiring almightie god putte hearte ſome notable prince one day make perfecte thys princely worke ſo charitably begonne nowe returne agayne kyng edwarde hys commyng london biſhoppes gate hée made theſe knyghtes alderman syr iohn stocton syr ralphe verney ſir richard blee ſir iohn yong ſir william nouember ladye anne king ſiſter deuorſed duke excester hyr owne ſute kyng ed chriſtmaſſe day crowned westminster quéene alſo likewiſe twelfth day kyng agayne crowned wente proceſſion crownedanno reg 12 1472 quéene time crowned bycauſe ſhe great childe thys yeare ſente ambaſſadours king edwarde duke burgoigne landed bridge ſeconde aprill honorablye receyued wythout towne lorde grantehuſe name ambaſſadors ſir iohn scot knight marſhall caleis mayſter william hatclofe secretarie kyng mayſter iohn ruſſel doctour archdeacon maſter richarde marten archdeacon london ſir iohn yong knighte merchaunte london fourth april conueyed horſſebacke duke lodging c george neuill archebiſhoppe yorke windſor kyng edwarde hunting king promiſed archebiſhoppe come place hartfordeſhire whiche archebiſhoppe hadde purchaſed buylded commodiouſlye hunte make merry hym wherevppon archebiſhoppe made greate prouiſion kyng ſente muche plate hée hadde hydde • tyme barnet tewkeſburie field beſides borrowed muche hys friendes thys beyng done king ſodaynely ſente archbiſhoppe come windſor arreſted treaſon ſhoulde helpe earle oxforde ſo ſente caleis hame continued long priſoner thys meane whyle ſir william parre knight ſir thomas vahan eſquire ſente ceaſe hys good kyng came ſamme twentie thouſande pounde kyng edward thys time brake biſhops miter many riche ſtones made therof crowne himſelfe alſo earle oxforde withdrawen hymſelfe barnet fielde firſt scotland france getting muche good sea landed weaſt countrey entred saint michael mounte 397 men laſt september wheron king appointmēt beſieged bodrigan wyth ſuch fauour earle reuictualled mount forteſcue ſente thyther continue ſiege king edwarde ſending pardon erles men ſo long practiſed laſt earle ſubmitted himſelfe king edward bin taken mē ſo forteſtue entring y• mount fiftéenth februarie found victuall ynough haue ſerued till mydſommer after▪ iohn vere earle oxforde lord beaumonde two brother ſayde earle thomas clifforde brought priſoners king earle oxforde ſente priſoner gwines remayned ſo long thys kyng raygned whyche tyme ladye hys wife myghte neuer come hym anye thyng liue vppon people theyr charityes woulde giue hyr ſhée gotte hyr néedle moneth september lewes de bruges lorde grantehuſe came englande charles duke burgoigne thirtéenth october created earle winchester openly parliament chamber iohn broune thomas bledlow 28 september sherifes maior sir william hampton fiſhmonger 28 october maior aboue al hys predeceſſours corrected strumpet cauſed ride citie wyth rey hoodes vppon heades baniſhed citie euer alſo cauſed paire ſtockes ſet euery ward london ſixth october beganne parliamente westminster authoritie wherby ayde graunted king towards charge war whiche leuied men land well lordes duke burgo • gne hauing greate warres wythanno reg 13 1473 french king ſente ambaſſadours englande require king edwarde hys brother lawe make warre frenche kyng vnto whiche requeſte kyng edwarde eaſily graunted bycauſe hée wiſhed reuenged frenche king hys enymie ayding erle warwicke quéene margaret hyr ſonne prince edwarde complices wherevpon promiſed alſo determyned beginning next yeare bring greate armye ouer caleis inuade kingdome fraunce forthwith diligence prepared thing readie hys iourney makyng manye ſhiftes prouiſion money ſerus hys turne william stocker robert balliſdon 28 september sherifes maior iohn tate mercer 28 october thys yeare duke excester founde deade sea betwéene douer caleis howe came certaintie coulde knowne king edwarde hauing prepared hys armye ledde theanno reg 14 1474 ſame douer thence croſſe ſeas caleis force paſſed wyth hym thys preſente greateſt euer came fraunce moſte beyng horſſemenne verye good order well armed noble realme fewe excepted fiftéene hundered menne armes well mounted moſte barded richly trapped manner frenche warres well accompanyed horſſemenne theyr retinue leaſte fiftéene thouſande archer horſſebacke greate number f •• temenne others well pitche theyr tentes whereof well furnyſhed alſo attende vppon theyr artyl • erye incloſe theyr campe theyr armye hadde one pledge beſides thys thr • e thouſande engliſhe menne appoynted lande brytaine king edwarde came douer duke burgoigne helpe paſſage ſent 500 boates hollande seland called cuttes whiche flatte lowe builte verye commodiouſly tranſporting horſſes notwithſtanding thys helpe hadde duke kyng englande coulde commaunde hymſelfe hée aboue thrée wéekes paſſing betwéene douer caleis one ſhippe ewe tooke two thrée ſmall paſſengers kyng edwarde embarqued hée ſente douer kyng fraunce one heralte alone called gartera norman borne broughte letter defiaunce king englande verye good language ſo excellently well penned myne aucthour perſwaded neuer engliſhe man doyng contentes whereof kyng ſhoulde yéelde vnto hym realme fraunce beyng hys inheritaunce ende might reſtore cleargye nobilitie theyr auntient libertye eaſe greate charge ſuſtayned deliuer miſeries whyche hée refuſed doe proteſted greate miſchiefe ſhoulde enſue thereof manner forme ſuche caſes accuſtomed kyng read letter ſoftlye himſelfe afterwarde alone withdrewe hymſelfe wardrobe commaunded heralte brought hyepreſence hée made thys aunſwere fyrſt knewe well king englande paſſed ſeas hys owne frée motion perſwaſion duke burgondie comminaltie england secondelye sommer nowe almoſte paſte du •• burgoigne returned nunz man diſcomifited vtterlye vnfurniſhed thing thirdlye touching coneſtable fraunce knew wel ſayde yt intelligence wyth ye k england bycauſe hadde married hys niece would deceyue kyng mayſter • ad notwithſtandyng great benefit receiued rehearſed adding therevnto ſaide coneſtable ment liue continuall diſſimulation entertaine euerye man make profit laſt alleaged heralte diuerſe reaſons perſwade kyng hys maſtor peace gaue hym hys owne hand 300 crownes promiſing 1000 peace were▪ cōcluded opēly gaue preſent goodly péece crimſon ueluet thyrtie elles heralte aunſweared woulde trauayle beſte coulde peace thoughte kyng hys mayſter woulde eaſilye wonne therevnto willed kyng fraunce ſende haraulte engliſhe campe demaunde ſafeconduite certaine ambaſſadours woulde ſende kyng englande directe hys letter lorde hawarde lorde stanley hymſelfe alſo conuene hys haralte one tyme • oure bothe king englande landed caleis duke burgoigne departed nunz greate haſte rydde ſtreyghte caleis ſayde kyng wyth verye ſmall trayne hadde ſente armye ſpoyle countrey barroys loraine kyng englande departed caleis companye duke paſſed bolloigne thence marched peronne duke gaue engliſhe men colde entertaynemente cauſed gate bée ſtreightly kepte woulde ſuffer fewe enter ſo greateſt parte lodged fieldes come peronne coneſtable france ſēt ye duke burgoigndie one ſeruants hée ••• uſed himſelfe wythholdyng quintins alleaging hée reſtored could haue ſtoode hym •• ſtée • e realme fraunce ſhoulde vtterly haue loſte hys credite intelligence nowe ſéeyng kyng englande come ouer perſon promyſed doe hereafter duke ſhoulde commaunde hym whereof better aſſure hym hée ſente hym letter credite declaration duke hée gaue duke hys faythe wryting ſerue ſuc •• ure hym hys friendes confederate well king englande others againſt men none excepted duke deliuered kyng englande hys letter matter credite adding ſomewhat thereto hys owne heade aſſured king coneſtable woulde deliuer handes saint quintines place whiche kyng eaſilye beléeued partly bycauſe hée hadde marryed coneſtables nie • e partlye bycauſe hée ſawe hym ſo greate feare kyng fraunce hée thoughte hée durſte fayle hys promiſe made duke hym duke beléeued • alſo coneſtable meante nothing leſſe feare frenche kyng ſo greate coulde force hym thus 〈…〉 vſed ſ • yl • onted diſſimulation king englande reioycyng thys meſſage ſente coneſtable departed peronn • wyth duke burgoigne towarde saint quintins wherevnto hée approched greate bande engliſhe menne ranne thynkyng belle ſhoulde haue bene rong theyr commyng citizen woulde haue receyued wyth croſſe holye water drewe néere towne artill ••• e ſhotte souldi • ur ••• ed 〈…〉 〈…〉 ſhe bothe horſ • e backe foote ſo two three engliſhe menne ſlayne ſome taken • thys ſtate returned great rage theyr campe 〈…〉 againſte coneſtable nexte morning duke 〈…〉 woulde haue taken hys leaue king englande departe hys armye barrays promiſing maruayles hys fauour frenche kyng ſente ſeruaunte lord halle lykeneſſe herraulte wyth coate made trumpet banner engliſhe campe hée came hée broughte tente dynner talked wyth kyng hys meſſage chielely grounded vppon greate deſire kyng hadde long time bée peace wyth kyng englande ſaying ſince hée crowned kyng fraunce neuer hadde attempted anye thyng againſte king england realme secondly excuſed himſelfe receiuing time paſte earle warwicke dominion ſaying hée dyd onely • agaynſte duke burgoigne declared ſayd duke burgoigne none cauſe called hym fraunce occaſion hys comming hée mighte conclude bett • r peace hymſelfe wyth kyng happily anye furthered matter onely amende broken eſtate theyr owne affaire owne priuate commoditie touching kyng englandes good ſucceſſe altogither careleſſe thereof hée putte hym alſo mynde tyme yeare alleaging winter approched likewiſe great charge ſuſtained laſtlye ſayde notwithſtanding great number englande deſyred warre fraunce yet kyng • englande inclyne peace kyng hys parte would condeſcende ſuche condition doubted hée hys realme woulde allowe finally demaunded ſa • e conduite certaine ambaſſadours come well enformed maiſters pleaſure king england part noble liking theſe ouertures well graunted harrault fraunce large ſafe conducte demaunded gaue foure noble golde rewarde alſo ſente engliſhe harrault bring like ſafe conducte nexte morning uillage neare amience commiſſioners prince met theſe king france baſtard bourdon adm • ral france lord saint pierre biſhop eureux called heberge king englande lord howard one chalenger doctor morton many article peace treated laſte reſolutions
