vvheate corne ſmith citizen london borne pariſh saint clements wythoute temple barre • yall workemanſhippe made one hanging locke yron stéele braſſe eleauen ſeuerall péeces pipe kay fyled thrée ſquare wyth potte vpon ſhotte bowe wyth two eſſes cleane wrought whyche weighed one graine gold wheat corne alſo ſame time made chaine golde 43 linckes whyche chaine locke kay faſtened put aboute flyes necke foreſaide thomas appletree hadde caly • er harquebuze whych hadde thrée foure time diſcharged bullet ſhooting randone raſhly greate miſfortune ſhot one waterman ſeconde man nexte vnto bale ſaide barge labouring hys oare whyche ſate wythin ſixe foote hir highneſſe cleane throughe bothe hys armes blow ſo greate gréenous moued place forced hym crye ſcrit • oute piteouſlye ſuppoſing hymſelfe ſlaine ſaying ſhot thorough body man bléeding abundantly though 100 dagger thruſt quéenes maieſtie ſhewed ſuch noble courage moſte wonderfull heard ſpoken beholding ſo maimed bléeding ſuche ſorte ſhe neuer baſhed thereat ſhewed effectually prudent magnanimous heart moſte curteouſlye comforting pore man ſhe good chéere ſaide ſhoulde want nothing mighte hys eaſe commaunding couered till ſuche time came ſhoare till whyche time laye bathing owne bloude whiche might haue bin occaſion haue terrified eye beholder ſuche ſo greate courage magnanimitie oure dread ſoueraigne ladye neuer quayled ſhort thomas appletree reſt apprehended broughte hir honorable counſel great grauitie wiſedome employed time carefully greate diligence examined ſaide appletree companion finding caſe moſte hainous wicked iuſtlye pronounced againſte hym ſentence death committhomas appletree haue ſuffered death 21 iuly marſhalſea southwarke whence tuiſday following brought throughe citie knight marſhalles men ledde vp tower hill ſo radcliffe vppe blacke wall ſo downe water ſide gibet ſet vppe directly placed béetwixte dertforde greenewiche execution male factour déede pitifully bewayled offence hée committed well priſon way prepared himſelfe penitently willingly offer body death thus verye godlye purpoſed finiſhe miſerable wretched life ſo prepared himſelf aſcend goe vppe ladder ſame turned himſelfe ſpake people followeth good people come hither die god iudge neuer life intended hurte quéenes moſt excellent maieſtie meant harme anye creature praye god heart long proſper kéepe hir highneſſe health bleſſe defende hir perilles daungers proſper hir hir affaire bleſſe hir moſte honorable counſell gyuing grace doe thing glory god benefite thys realme thing moſte ſorie offence wofully bewaile ſame penitent ſorie good maiſter maiſter henrie carie hathe béene ſo gréeued fault ſuffering rebuke ſame woulde god neuer bin borne haue ſo gréeuouſlye offended wyth teares guſht oute eye verye faſte ſaide perſwaded men ſerue god take example hym euerye night morning moued deuoutly ſay lord prayer executioner put roape necke people cryed ſtay ſtay ſtay came righte honorable ſir chriſtopher hatton uizchamberlaine hir highneſſe enquired confeſſed certified expreſſed vayled bonet declared quéenes maieſtie ſente thither bothe make cauſe open haynous gréeuous offence ſaid thomas appletree ſignifie hir gratious pleaſure ſo continued meſſage ye may reade printed ſelf annexed diſcourſe whyche declared hangman commanded take roape necke appletree come downe ladder receiued pardon gaue god prince praiſe ſo greate benefite hir moſt gratious bountie receiued done maiſter uizchamberlaine ſaid good people pray quéenes maieſtie prayer ſaide whyche vſually read preſeruation hir maieſtie church almightie euerliuing god lord lordes king king whyche doeſt thy throne beholde dweller earth moſte hartily beſeeche thee thy fauour beholde moſte gratious soueraigne lady queene elizabeth c wherevnto people ioyfully accorded ſaye amen trying god ſaue quéene caſting vp cappes thus dead man reſtored life broughte backe marſhalſea againe euen led thence place execution way moſte ioyfullye prayed ſecuritie quéenes maieſtie mercifull meſſage quenes maieſtie ſent right honorable sir christopher hatton place thomas appletree ſhoulde haue ſuffered hys traytourlike action ſet downe worde worde ſo neare coulde gathered maiſter carie hir moſte excellent maieſtie pleaſed ſend deliuer hir commandmentthe people doubted pardon firſte ſpeach touching man nowe héere preſently dye firſt thinke oute purpoſe notifie offence theſe good people whereby onely worthy puniſhment iudgement forraine nation cenſure forraine lawes ſhould delyuered tormentor endure ſuche torture qualitie hys offence ſo high caſe good pollieie ſhoulde condignely deſerue ſpeake facte ſuche ſo fearefullthe people maruellous attē • tiue heare heart quaketh eye refraine teares repeate againe amongeſt god hys mercy ſake ſhielde defende hir moſte excellent maieſtie moſte mightily hathe digeſted notable daunger ſo tel tragedie courſe fell liked hir highneſſe reſpecte greate heate take ayre water graue waightie negotiation ſhe paſſed time diſcourſe french embaſſador y• ſpace houre two hir returne itthe cauſe declared vvhy hir maieſtie tooke vvater pleaſed hir take dyuers pauſes rather bicauſe ſhe earneſtly read booke wherein ſéemed recreation ſake ſhe tooke ſome delight meanes whereof euen pleaſed god wth holy hande directe hir ſafetie ſhe commaunded bargeman ſlacke labouronly god prouidēce ſauing hir maieſtie frō shotte ſlowly paſſe hadde haſted two ſtrokes brought hir royal perſon ſhotte ſelfe theſe wordes ſcarcely ſpoken hir maieſtie caitiue moſte vnhappily muſte ſaye moſte diueliſhly diſcharged arquebuze ſtrōgly charged bullet barge hir maieſtie god hath defended hir thou moſt mightie god euer vouchſafe kéep hir blowe ſeconde man bayles thea ſtrange horrible terrour neuer heard ſeene like england barge wythin ſixe foote hir royall perſon ſtricken ſeate woūded armes whiche hir maieſtie beheld kingly handled cauſe euen ſtraight tell lordes hir maieſties counſel diſperſed abroadethe ſodaine greate feare lord counſel hearing theſe • errible nevves affaire hearing moſte perilous aceidente returned courte wyth ſuche ſpéede waight ſuch cauſe might moue feareful louyng applauſure towarde hir maieſtie moſte holily thanke god ſingular help preſeruation oure moſte deare righteous soueraigne done according loues dueties ſeruice god hir maieſtie whole eſtate deliberate moſte graue conſultation cauſe al moſte humbly knées beſoughte quéene thatthe counſell moſt deſious punishe fact ſlaue mighte ſuffer death tenne thouſande death ſo poſſible nature doe ſo raſh fearefull offence suche déede mighte offence haue bin whiche god mercy ſake hathe moſte fauourably forbidden mighte hane rought vp heauen ſhoulde moſte miſerably onely haue plagued hir owne lande true ſeruants god dyſperſedit vvas ſtraunge ſee people ſtaring vischamberlaines face ſome vveeping ſome trembling ſpeaking theſe vvordes chriſtendome religion true faith jeſus chriſte whyche wée enioye wyth vnſpeakable comforte frée conſcience mighte hereby haue ſuffred confuſion perſecution bloude vengeance amongſt v peace ſecure eſtates encreaſed excéeding wealthes nouriſhed moſt ſwéete quietneſſe life thys hir moſte happy gouernement raygne twentie yeares might hereby haue bin turned blouty warres fruites whereof burning ſpoyling houſes good rauiſhing deſtroying wiues chyldren vengeance ſoeuer worlde bring forth ſame ſhoulde haue fallen v ſaye v moſt miſerable men worlde therefore heare praye you▪ let v acknowledge god wyth humblehere lyfte vp handes eye heauen ſaying god bleſſe hir maieſtie god bleſſe hir maieſty c thankefulneſſe theſe vnſpeakable benefites whych haue enioyed ſtill ſhall doe god vpholdeth hir bleſſed life ſtate amongeſt v loſſe lacke whome bring v theſe calamity ten thouſande moe whyche cannot foreſée theſe al benefites whyche poſſeſſe féele taſte youhere people vvith tear shevved themſeſues moſt ſorrovvful theſe tragicall ſpeaches finde ineſtimable pretious jewell thys déere soueraigne v amongeſt v plague forment puniſhment could ſuffiſe reuenge anye meanes ſhoulde depriue ſuche heauenly worldly felicity dayly hir holy hande miniſtred amongeſt meddle wyth theſe matter knowe thanke god wyth true faithfull obedient heartes wyll euer ſerue hir moſte excellent maieſtie whome hathe made hys miniſter diſtribute al theſe bleſſyngs boſomes pleaſe may wyth maruell hearethis ſodaine ſtraunge pardon amazed people meſſage come bryng mercie thys manne gratious pardon oure moſt deare soneraigne hir mercifull eye beholdyng cleareneſſe mannes heart frée euill thought conſequentlye prepenſion malicious fact againſt hir perſtō vouchſaſeththe greatneſſe hir maieſties mercie ſeemed ſuch people betvveene ioyes ſorrovves vvere ••• ſed put gall • wes notable action compaſſion procéeding heauenlye minde ſo farre different common nature man forced fearefull iealouſie liſſe life hath neuer bene read hearde caſually man ſuffer hurte field arrowe ſhot chance rouing markes reuengefully y• partya true deſcription man fraile nature ſeeking reuenge confirmed vvith example offended follow proceſſe felonie haue oft ſéene law doth well allow court meaneſt ſ • ruing man ſtrike felow fiſt ſo bléede looſe ſame hande many example may giuen touching caſualitie man fact touching place preſence wherein chaunced bée done quéene looketh neyther hir prerogatiue th • power hir lawes perill hir perſon buthere noteth heauenly diſpoſition hir maieſtie far different nature man pardoning ſo great offence againſt lavve nature nobilitie hir hearte daunger onely done hir ſelf doth heare fréely pardon ſacred word hir kingly eſtate proteſt vnto ſhe hath firmly auowed ſhe rather haue ſuffered woūds bargeman hath ten folde meaneſt v ſubiectes ſhould ſuffer ſlaunder ſo tyranous trayterous fact yea▪ prepenſion forethought ſo horrible treaſon toward hit thoughe factesee exceeding loue prince tovvarde hir ſubiectes excuſing accident vvithout ſuſpition ill meaning al hir maieſtie troubled y• ſorrow noble yong gentleman henrie carie hath ſuffered continuall grieft hart offence man vaine iealouſie ſome euill diſpoſed perſons hath likewiſe borne ſome ſlaunder cauſe ſuffiſeth cleare intente malice forethought fact▪ found partie himſelfem caries commendation conuerſation beſides excéeding faith diligence hir highneſſe ſeruice euer deliuer moſt acceptable gentleman frée al euil ſight hir maieſtie worlde ſhall néede therefore ſpeake hys cauſe néedeth none excuſe may behold rare goodneſſe great andhe reciteth queenes vertues moſt vvorthſly commendeth hir rare courage ſuch perilous chance gracious miſtreſſe full religion pietie juſtice mercie temperance magnanimitie cannot tell moſt conſtant noble courage euer liued proofe wherof cauſe heard whereat preſent leaue iudgements hir maieſtie taking proſpecte vale hyrbehold hir princely ſtoutneſſe nothing diſmayed thir ſodaine terror vvith ſuch care pore vvounded man vvith ſuche countenaunce embaſſador ſeemed mother one queen barge inſtant ſée man ſtricken behelde fall hearde deadly ſcr • tch whō ſhe immediately commaunded taken vp beholding embrued bloude commaunded hys woundes lapped vp ſcarffe hir owne ſo hir moſt conſtante amiable countenaunce continued hir entertaynement ambaſſadoure thoughe bene ſuch matter afterwardes man began fainte hir highneſſe commaunded cloke put bodye ſuche neceſſarie reliefes as̄ preſentlye hadde without alteration countenaunce beholde kinglye hearte courage rar • magnanimitiehir highneſſe magnanimitie mingled vvith mercie one moſt comfortable hir ſubiectes moſt terrible hir foes▪ ſéeing preſente death next hir neyther feared hir owne life diſmayed treaſonable chaunce action maruellous hir ſexe hereof howe muche wée maye reioyce want witte tell one worde hir highneſſe hir ſingular wiſedome policie hath preſerued hir empire theſe twentie yeares moſte ioyfull peace wyth thys courage magnanimitie doubt mightily defende v moſte cruell war god therefore euer bleſſe hir let v oure handes ſtretched vp heauen oure eye fixed ſeate god praye hir long life moſte proſperous raigne ouer v thomasan earneſt exhortation pray appletree▪ receiue thy life hir moſt excellent maieſtie pray god thy knées hir thy dayes comehere maiſter vizchāberlaine kneeled hys knee vvith al people pray ſing god hir maieſties ſafe deliuerie ſo people moued prayer hir maieſties moſte happy eſcape bleſſing god lengthen hir dayes many many yeares fell hys knées great deuotion amongeſt ſo departed excéeding ioy people thouſand bleſſings ſelfe shippe called thrée halfe moones manned xxxviij men well fenced munition ſette fromiohn fox delyuered 269 chriſtians ou • e captiuitie turkes porteſmouth towarde ciuill citie spaine falling ſtreightes taken turkes putte galley clothes torne backes ſet ores▪ fare ſcant bread vnholeſome water plentie ſtripes nigh citie alexandr • a▪ hauen towne vnder dominion turkes ro •• e fencible turkes doe cuſtomably bring galleis ſhoare euery yere winter trimme againſt spring time whyche roade priſon wherein captiues ſuche priſoners ſerue galleis putte time vntill sea calme paſſable galleis euery priſoner laden yrons leg whiche priſon theſe chriſtians putte faſte warded winter ſeaſon ere long maiſter owner meanes offriendes redéemed reſte abyding whyle throughe yll vſage worſe fare myſerablye ſtarued ſauing one iohn fox ſomewhat ſkilfull crafte barber reaſon thereof made great ſhift helping fare good meale till laſt god ſente fauour ſight kéeper priſon ſo leaue go roade pleaſure paying tertayne ſtipend vnto kéeper wearing locke legge libertie likewiſe ſixe vpon like ſufferance ſuſpected ſtart aſide libertie go ſayd roade returne agayne night yere lord 1577 winter ſeaſon galleis comming accuſtomed harborough diſcharged maſtes sayles ſuch furniture mayſters marriners lodged owne home remayned priſon ſayd roade 268 chriſtian priſoners bin taken turkes force ſixtéene ſundry nation among thrée engliſhmen whereof one named iohn fox wodbridge another william wickney porteſmouth third robert moore harwich iohn foxe hauing bin thirtéene fourtéene yeares vnder gentle intreatance minding eſcape tooke good heart vnto farre roade one ſide citie ther certain victualling houſe one peter vnticaro spanyard hired peter bene priſoner aboue 30 yeres neuer practiſed mean eſcape kepte himſelfe quiet vntill iohn fox vſing much thether brake one another mind concerning reſtreynt libertie ſo iohn fox opening vnto vnticaro deuice minded practiſe made priuie one intent thrée debated matter ſuche time coulde méete togither ſo much ſeauen wéekes ende concluded matter ſhould done making fiue priuie deuiſe determined thrée nightes accompliſh purpoſe wherevpon ſame iohn fox peter vnticaro ſixe appoynted met altogither priſon laſte day decēber fox certified reſt priſoners intent deliuered vnto ſort file whiche gathered purpoſe charging readie diſcharged prons eight clocke next day nighte next day night fox ſixe companion came al houſe peter vnticaro time put practiſe deuice ſent ſayd peter maiſter roade▪ name one maiſters ye citie deſired méete promiſing could bring backe againe wherevppon kéeper agréed go willing warder bar gate ſaying would turne agayne ſpéede meane ſeaſon ſeuē prouided ſuche weapon could kéeper nowe come vnto houſe perceyuing light hearing noyſe ſuſpected matter returned backwarde fox ſtā ding behind corner houſe ſtepped forth perceyuing fox ſayde • fox haue deſerued thée thou ſhouldeſt ſéeke death thou villaine quoth fox haſt bin ſuccour many chriſtians bloude therewith lift vp ſword ſtroke ſo mayne blowe therewithall claue heade ſo fell deade grounde peter reſt came forth went toward roade wherinto entred ſoftly ſixe warder • one aſked ther quoth fox company friendes wythin fel ſixe men diſpatched thē quickly fox barred gate planted canon againſt entring gaylers lodge founde keyes priſon bed ſide better wepons chamber cheſt wherein muche treaſure duckets whiche peter two opening ſtuffed themſelues ſo full coulde betwéene ſhirts theyr ſkinne fox would touche ſaid ſought libertie mony theſe eight armed wt ſuch weapon liked comming priſon fox opened gate dores called forth priſoners ſet ſome ramming vp gate ſome dreſſing vp galley beſt roade called captain alexandria▪ wher ſome carried maſtes sayles ore furniture priſon certaine warder whō fox cō pany ſlew killing eight turkes got thē top priſon vnto fox company fain aſcende ladder found hote ſkirmiſhe ſome ſlayn ſome woū ded peter vnticaro two armed thē duckets ſlaine able welde themſelues peſtered weight treaſure amongſt turkes one thruſt fell top ye priſon wall made ſuch noyſe yt inhabitantes came dawed ſo yt vnderſtood y• caſe priſoners occupied wherewith rayſed bothe alexandrîa whiche laye weſt ſide roade caſtle whiche city ende nexte roade alſo one fortreſſe whiche laye north ſide ſo y• way eſcape one▪ man reſon might ſéeme impoſſible way bée ſhort ſaid galley trimmed vp whereinto euerye man leaped hoyſte vp ſayles yéelde themſelues ye mercie god whoſe hande wind weather flote y• ſafetie y• roade two caſtels haue ful power vpon ſame ſuche worke god deliueraunce y• one touched xlv ſhot came thūdring ear thus ſayling ſoone canon reach turkes hauing gallyes trimmed make whē chriſtians ſafe enemy coaſt iohn fox willed thankefull vnto almightie god theyr deliuerie moſt humblye fall vppon knées • éeching ayde vnto friendes lande c prayer made god felt labour oare ſtriuing come ſome chriſtian land wind diuers▪ victual fayled ſo eyght dyed famin aſtoniſhment reſt fell vpon xxix day ſet alexandrî • fell il • canadie landed gallipoly well cheriſhed abbot monkes cauſed ſtay well refreſhed eaſed thought good hauing leaue depart thence ſayled along coaſt till arriued tanento ſold galley deuided price • uery man hauing part thereof turkes purſued chriſtians ſcoured sea could imagin bent courſe chriſtians departed thence one day morning whē ſeauen galleis turkes came thither night certified thoſe f • llowed fox company fearing leaſt ſhoulde haue bin met wyth came foote naples wher departed aſunder euery man taking next way home whence fox toke iourney vnto rome wel entertayned engliſheman preſented worthy déed pope rewarded liberally gaue letter king spaine well entertayned worthy enterpriſe gaue hym fée twentie penny daye whence deſirous come owne countrey came thyther ſuch time conueniently could whiche yeare lorde 1579 come england went vnto courte ſhewed trauaile vnto counſell conſidering ſpent great part youth ſhraldome gentleman worſhip good credite riding fromcaſtels ship ſeene ayre bodman cornewal towards foy appeared ſéeming y• northeaſt great miſtor fog muche like vnto ſea forme cloude faſhiō ſome gret caſtel flag ſtreames thereon ſtanding sea whiche preſentlye vaniſhed awaye whoſe ſtéede néere ſame place appeared another cloud altered likeneſſe great argoſie furniſhed maſtes neceſſaries hir ſayles ſéeming ful winde made hir way southweaſt caſtel hauing ſtreamers flag warlike two boates either ſterne incontinent appeared againe forme caſtel behinde ſame came folowing southweaſt ſide another greate argoſie furniſhed firſte paſt appeared thrée foure galeis maſtes flag warlike ſort hauing boates ſternes thereby appeared ſmall cloud number xij altered proportion ſayde caſtels one following another male female c ralph woodcocke iohn alat 28 september sheriffes blaſing starre x october ſome ſayth ye ſeuenth appeared blaſing star south buſhing toward eaſt nightlye ſéene deminiſhing brightneſſe vntill one twentith ſame moneth xvij day october made 8 serieante lawserieants feaſt▪ wit firſt william fleetewood recorder london ye ſecōd edward flowerdew third thomas snagge ye fourth w peryam fifth robert halton ye ſixth iohn clench ye ſeuēth iohn puckering ye eight thomas warmeſley maiſter snag ſicke therefore writ directed two maiſters chauncerie take othe ſo ſworne hys chamber grey iane ſeuen ſworn westminster helde feaſt new temple london quéenes maieſtie informed ſundryeproclamation againſt family loue place realme certain perſons ſecréetly teach damnable hereſies contrarie diuerſe principall article beliefe chriſtian fayth colour ſecte name themſelues family loue many ſhal allowed family electe ſaued others church ſoeuer reiected damned vpon conuenting ſome biſhops ordinary found y• ground ſect mayntayned certaine leude heritical ſeditious bookes firſt made dutche tong laſtlye tranſlated engliſh printed beyond sea ſecretly brought ouer realme authour wherof name h n c conſidering alſo founde theſe ſectaries hold opinion maye magiſtrate eccleſiaſtical temporall perſon profeſſed ſect othe otherwiſe denye thing aduātage ſo though many thē wel knowen teacher ſpreaders abroade theſe dā gerous damnable ſects yet cōfeſſion cannot condemned therfore hir maieſtie ſorie ſée ſo greate euill malice diuell brought hir realme hir biſhops ordinary ſhe vnderſtandeth requiſite onely haue theſe dāgerous heretickes ſectaries ſeuerely puniſhed alſo meanes vſed hir maieſties royall authoritie giuē hir god defēd chriſts church roote thē infecting hir realm ſhe hath thought méete conueniente ſo hir proclamation commaundeth hir officer miniſters temporall ſhall ſeuerall vocation aſſiſt biſhops hir realme perſons eccleſiaſtical ſearche perſons duely ſuſpected eyther teacher profeſſors foreſayde damnable ſectes good meanes procéede ſenerelye againſte beyng found culpable order lawes eyther eccleſiaſtical temporall alſo ſearche made place ſuſpected
